exception.name: ActionNotAllowedException
exception.description:
The action is not allowed, the UpgradePackage MO is in wrong state.
For example if you try 'upgrade()' before an 'install()' or 'forcedInstall()' has been done.

exception.name: RepairDeliveryNoteAlreadyExistsException
exception.description: Only one operator entry is allowed in the hardware log.

exception.name: NoAccessToHwLogException
exception.description: Communication with the board/unit is lost, or access to the hardware log is not possible.

exception.name: ChecksumhandlerException
exception.description: Exception thrown when the control of checksum for loadmodules has been rejected due to 'null' recieved from resource layer.

exception.name: NotUniqueFroIdException
exception.description: Exception thrown when a fro Id is not unique.

exception.name: WebServerPathConfigurationException
exception.description: This class is an exception class thrown when failed to configure the webserver root path

exception.name: InvalidIndexException
exception.description: Index specified is invalid, i.e. it is out of the range of valid indices.

exception.name: FroNotAccessibleException
exception.description: Exception that is thrown when a FRO (Facade Resource Object in the resource layer) cannot be accessed.

exception.name: FroRequestFailedException
exception.description: Exception that is thrown when the result of a request to a FRO (Facade Resource Object in the resource layer) is not ok.

exception.name: ValueOutOfRangeException
exception.description: Exception thrown when an MO attribute is requested to be set, but the requested value is not accepted.

exception.name: IllegalArgumentTypeException
exception.description: Exception thrown if the argument supplied is of the wrong type, for example in an action.

exception.name: IpAddressException
exception.description: Erroneous Ip Address Format

exception.name: RepairDeliveryNoteDoesNotExistException
exception.description: No operator entry in the hardware log has been written.

exception.name: IsReservedCanNotSetPathIdException
exception.description: Exception thrown when an attempt is made to set or change the aal2PathId of an Aal2PathVccTp while its reserved by an other Aal2PathGrp

exception.name: IsUnlockedCanNotSetPathOwnerException
exception.description: Exception thrown when an attempt is made to set or change the aal2PathOwner of an Aal2PathVccTp while its not LOCKED.

exception.name: ImpossibleCollectAtmInfoException
exception.description: Exception thrown when gathering of ATM info fails.

exception.name: DisableExistingProgramsException
exception.description: Exception thrown when disabling of existing programs for some reason fails.

exception.name: EnableExistingProgramException
exception.description: Exception thrown when enabling of existing programs fails.

exception.name: ExplicitReplacementInInformationForRPUsException
exception.description: Exception thrown when replacement of existing RPU information fails.

exception.name: FileCopyException
exception.description: Exception thrown when copying of files fails.

exception.name: FileNotExistException
exception.description: Exception thrown when the specified file does not exist.

exception.name: HeapPoolSettingsException
exception.description: Exception thrown when the heap or pool setting is incorrect.

exception.name: InstallOfLoadModulesCancelledException
exception.description: Exception thrown when the installation of Load Modules is cancelled.

exception.name: InstallOfLoadModulesPartlyExcecutedException
exception.description: Exception thrown when the installment of Load Modules is only partly executed.

exception.name: InstallOfLoadModulesRejectedException
exception.description: Exception thrown when the install of Load Modules is rejected.

exception.name: InstallRejectedFTP_ServerNotAccessibleException
exception.description: Exception thrown when the install is rejected due to FTP server is not accessible.

exception.name: InstallRejectedGetLoadModuleFileException
exception.description: Exception thrown when the install is rejected due to error when trying to retreive Load Module.

exception.name: InstallRejectedInsufficientDiskSpaceException
exception.description: Exception thrown when the install is rejected due to insufficient disk space.

exception.name: InstallRejectedIP_AddressException
exception.description: Exception thrown when install is rejected due to erronous IP address.

exception.name: InstallRequestException
exception.description: Exception thrown when the installation of a Load Module fails.

exception.name: InsufficientDiskSpaceException
exception.description: Exception thrown when the disk space is insufficient.

exception.name: LoadModuleFIlePathLengthOutOfRangeException
exception.description: Exception thrown when file path for the Load Module is out of length.

exception.name: MergeControlFileException
exception.description: Exception thrown when the merger of control files fails.

exception.name: PiuTypeDefinitionMissingInUpgradeControlFileException
exception.description: Exception thrown when PiuType definitions is missing in the UCF file.

exception.name: ProductNumberAndRevisionAlreadyInUseException
exception.description: Exception thrown when the product number and revision is already used.

exception.name: ReconfigureProgramsException
exception.description: Exception thrown when reconfiguration of programs fails.

exception.name: ReferencedElementMissingException
exception.description: Exception thrown when the referenced element is missing.

exception.name: ReserveLoadModulesException
exception.description: Exception thrown when reserving a Load Module fails.

exception.name: SelectiveInstallFailureException
exception.description: Exception thrown when a selective install fails.

exception.name: UnexpectedAttributeException
exception.description: Exception thrown when an unexpected attribute occurs at upgrade.

exception.name: UnexpectedAttributeFormatException
exception.description: Exception thrown when an unexpected format of the attribute occurs.

exception.name: UnexpectedElementException
exception.description: Exception thrown when

exception.name: UpgradePackageDeleteException
exception.description: Exception thrown when its not possible to delete the upgrade package.

exception.name: UpgradePackageDeleteNotAllowedException
exception.description: Exception thrown when its not allowed to delete the upgrade package.

exception.name: UpgradePackageDoesNotExistException
exception.description: Exception thrown when the specified upgrade package does not exist.

exception.name: UpgradePackageFileSystemErrorException
exception.description: Exception thrown when an error in the file system occurs.

exception.name: UpgradeRejectedException
exception.description: Exception thrown when the upgrade is rejected.

exception.name: VerifyChecksumException
exception.description: Exception thrown when the checksum is incorrect.

exception.name: VerifyCreationOfCVsException
exception.description: Exception thrown when its not possible to verify the creation of CV's.

exception.name: AttributeValueOutOfRangeException
exception.description: Exception thrown when an attribute value is out of range.

exception.name: CancelInstallRequestException
exception.description: Exception thrown when a cancel install equest for some reason fails.

exception.name: ClearAllPiuTypesReferencedByPlugInUnitException
exception.description: Exception thrown when its not possible to clear all PiuTypes referenced by PlugInUnit.

exception.name: ConditionallyMandatoryAttributeOrElementMissingException
exception.description: Exception thrown when an conditional mandatory attribute (or element) is missing.

exception.name: ConfigurationVersionMO_HandlerException
exception.description: Exception thrown when the creation of a CV during upgrade fails.

exception.name: CreateLoadModuleException
exception.description: Exception thrown when the creation of a load module fails.

exception.name: SwAllocationNotFoundException
exception.description: This class is an exception class thrown when a equipment specific error occurs.

exception.name: RepertoireNotFoundException
exception.description: This class is an exception class thrown when a equipment specific error occurs.

exception.name: NoDiskException
exception.description: Exception thrown when there is no hard disk.

exception.name: NoSuchAttributeException
exception.description: Exception thrown when an MO attribute is requested to be accessed but the access method for the is not defined (the attribute can not be accessed)

exception.name: NotHandledAttributeTypeException
exception.description: Exception class thrown when an attribute of not handled type is requested.

exception.name: RemovalFailedException
exception.description: Exception thrown when an element cannot be removed from a sequence.

exception.name: RestartRejectedException
exception.description: Exception thrown when restart of the PlugInUnit is not allowed.

exception.name: TransactionRequiredException
exception.description: Exception class thrown when an MO is accessed outside a transaction but the access method requires a transaction.

exception.name: UndeletableMoException
exception.description: Exception thrown when MO is not possible to delete.

exception.name: MoCardinalityViolationException
exception.description: Exception class thrown when the creation of an MO fails due to child - parent cardinality violation. The cardinality is specified in the MIM.

exception.name: MoHasChildrenException
exception.description: Exception class thrown when an MO is requested to be deleted, but the MO has children, which must be deleted first.

exception.name: MoNameAlreadyTakenException
exception.description: Exception thrown when an MO is created and the distinguished name of the MO is already in use.

exception.name: MoNotPossibleToReserveException
exception.description: Exception thrown when by an MO if its not possible to reserve the MO.

exception.name: MoNotReservedByUserException
exception.description: Exception thrown when a user tries to release an MO that is not reserved by this user.

exception.name: MoReservedNotDeletableException
exception.description: Exception thrown when trying to delete an MO that is reserved by another MO (user).

exception.name: AttrNotSettableAtCreateException
exception.description: Exception thrown when a create is ordered with attribute values that are not settable at create.

exception.name: AttrValueNotUniqueException
exception.description: Exception thrown when a value of an attribute is not unique.

exception.name: MaxNumberExceededException
exception.description: Exception thrown when the maximum number of childrens for an MO is exceeded.

exception.name: IllegalParentException
exception.description: Exception thrown when the parent of the MO is of the wrong type.

exception.name: FroNotLockedException
exception.description: Exception thrown when a fRo cannot be accessed.

exception.name: GeneralErrorException
exception.description: Exception thrown by an MO when there is a general error.

exception.name: IdentityNotAllowedException
exception.description: Exception thrown when an identity (LDN) specified at create is not allowed.

exception.name: IllegalMoTypeException
exception.description: Exception thrown when a reference to an MO is of a unexpected/wrong MO type.

exception.name: MoCanNotBeDeletedException
exception.description: Exception thrown when its not possible to delete an MO.

exception.name: ListOfTimeSlotsNotUniqueException
exception.description: Exception thrown when a time slot appears more than once in the time slot list.

exception.name: RouteNotFoundException
exception.description: Invalid IP route has been given as a parameter to an action.

exception.name: InvalidRouteException
exception.description: Invalid IP route has been given as a parameter to an action.

exception.name: HwLogFullException
exception.description: The hardware log is full, no more operator entries can be written.

exception.name: WrongAttributeTypeException
exception.description: Exception thrown when an MO attribute is requested to be set, but the requested value is of the wrong type.

exception.name: NoSuchFieldException
exception.description: Exception class thrown when a Struct is accessed but the reqested Struct element is not found.

exception.name: AttrMissingAtCreateException
exception.description: Exception thrown when an attribute that is mandatory at create is missing.

exception.name: SupportSystemConfigurationFailed
exception.description: If creation of a support system MO fails.

exception.name: InputParameterError
exception.description: If it fails to parse the XML data.

exception.name: NotPossibleToStartEqualizeCharging
exception.description: If it is not possible to start equalize charging due to the function preconditions are not met, or all PSUs are faulty or disconnected.

exception.name: EqualizeChargingIsNotActive
exception.description: If equalize charging is not ongoing when stopEqualizaCharging is received.

exception.name: NoConnectionWithHwUnit
exception.description: Connection with the HW unit lost.

exception.name: HwUnitLocked
exception.description: Administrative state for the MO is locked.

exception.name: LengthOutOfRangeException
exception.description: Thrown when number of characters used for name or value is out of range.

exception.name: SystConstantNotFoundException
exception.description: The system constant required to be deleted does not exist in the string.

exception.name: SystConstantsFullException
exception.description: Thrown when no more system constants can currently be overridden since the space reserved for overridden system constants is full.

exception.name: GetFileException
exception.description: An error was encountered during FTP get file. A filePath in the upgradeControlFile may be inconsistent with a filepath on the Ftp server.

exception.name: InstallException
exception.description: Indicates that an error in an installation has occurred.

exception.name: FtpServerNotAccessibleException
exception.description: Ftp server is not accessible. This may depend on erroneous IP address, username, password, or that the IP communication with the Ftp server is down, or that the Ftp server itself is malfunctioning.

exception.name: UpgradeLogFileNotAccessibleException
exception.description: The upgrade trace log file is not accessible, that is, the log file exists but it is not possible to access it with write permission.

exception.name: UpgradeControlFileException
exception.description: The file parser has found that the UpgradeControlFile is incorrect.

exception.name: UpgradeNotPossibleException
exception.description: Before an upgrade is started it was found that the upgrade can not take place. A possible reason is that the upgrade package that is running in the node is not in the upgrade window of this upgrade package.

exception.name: UpgradeLogFileNotInUseException
exception.description:
The upgrade trace output is currently not directed to a file.
This is a property that can be changed in the trace property file (Trace_01.prop).

exception.name: UpdateFTPServerDataException
exception.description: The execution of action updateFTPServerData failed for whatever reason.

exception.name: UpdateNotPossibleException
exception.description: The update failed due to some reason.

exception.name: RequestedTypeOfUPNotAllowedException
exception.description: Exception thrown when a database error occurs.

exception.name: FunctionBusyException
exception.description: The action is not allowed, the ConfigurationVersion MO is busy with another task.

exception.name: PriorityAlreadyInUseException
exception.description: Exception thrown when a priority is already in use.

exception.name: AlreadyRegisteredException
exception.description: Exception thrown when an object is already registered.

exception.name: MaxNoOfRefRegisteredException
exception.description: Exception thrown when the maximum number of references is reached.

exception.name: PriorityOutOfRangeException
exception.description: Exception thrown when the priority is out of range.

exception.name: NotRegisteredException
exception.description: Exception thrown when trying to de-register an object that is not registered in the database.

exception.name: UnknownCcIdException
exception.description:
The indicated Communication Context ID does not exist.
User category: Ericsson personnel

exception.name: TxbDoesNotSupportHsException
exception.description:
This operation cannot be performed if the TX board does not support HS.
User category: Ericsson personnel

exception.name: TotalNumOfUsersAboveMaxException
exception.description:
Total number of users is above maximum.
User category: Ericsson personnel

exception.name: TotalAvgPowerAboveMaxException
exception.description:
Total average power is above maximum.
User category: Ericsson personnel

exception.name: TestBoardDependencyException
exception.description: Board test cannot be done, since dependency to other board is not fulfilled.

exception.name: SysConstantsFullException
exception.description:
No more system constants can currently be overridden since the space reserved for overridden system constants is full.
User category: Ericsson personnel

exception.name: SlaveTuNotStableException
exception.description: The slave TU or CBU is not stable.

exception.name: ResourcesNotAvailableException
exception.description: Not possible to allocate enough resources, for example, hardware resources.

exception.name: ResourceLockedException
exception.description: The accessed resource is locked to another transaction (transaction collision).

exception.name: RepairDeliveryNoteDoesNotExistException
exception.description: No operator entry in the hardware log has been written.

exception.name: RepairDeliveryNoteAlreadyExistsException
exception.description: Only one operator entry is allowed in the hardware log.

exception.name: RbsConfigurationFailedException
exception.description: The configuration of the RBS failed.

exception.name: ParameterValueErrorException
exception.description: Parameter value not acceptable.

exception.name: OperationNotAllowedException
exception.description: Operation not allowed in current state.

exception.name: OperationFailedException
exception.description: Operation failed due to some temporary internal error.

exception.name: OcnsIsNotConfiguredException
exception.description:
OCNS cannot be activated if the cell has no OCNS configuration.
User category: Ericsson personnel

exception.name: OcnsIsActiveException
exception.description:
OCNS cannot be configured when OCNS is active on the cell.
User category: Ericsson personnel

exception.name: NoTxDiversityException
exception.description: TX diversity not configured for the corresponding carrier.

exception.name: NotInitiatedException
exception.description: The specified sector has not been initiated.

exception.name: NotHsdpaCapableException
exception.description:
The cell is not HSDPA capable.
User category: Ericsson personnel

exception.name: NotFoundException
exception.description:
The specified item is not found.
User category: Ericsson personnel

exception.name: NotEnoughDiskSpaceException
exception.description: There is not enough disk space on the node in order to execute the operation.

exception.name: NotActiveException
exception.description:
The function is not active.
User category: Ericsson personnel

exception.name: NoSlaveTuException
exception.description: No slave TU or CBU is in service.

exception.name: NoConnectionWithAuxiliaryUnitException
exception.description: Connection with the auxiliary unit lost.

exception.name: NoAccessToHwLogException
exception.description: Communication with the board/unit lost, or access to the hardware log is not possible.

exception.name: MoNotLockedException
exception.description: Administrative state for the MO is not locked.

exception.name: MoDisabledException
exception.description: This action cannot be performed if operational state is disabled for the MO.

exception.name: MoAccessException
exception.description:
Operation failed for some unspecified reason.
User category: Ericsson personnel

exception.name: MeasurementPeriodOverlapException
exception.description: There is a mutual conflict between the values of the measurement period, the measurement time and/or the reporting period.

exception.name: MacHsIsSetupException
exception.description:
HSDPA is setup in the cell.
User category: Ericsson personnel

exception.name: InternalErrorException
exception.description: An internal error that was detected by the hardware has occurred.

exception.name: HsdpaCodeResourceMismatchException
exception.description: There is no HSDPA Code Resource with the defined hsCodeResourceId.

exception.name: FunctionNotSupportedException
exception.description: Function not supported on this MO, for example, due to hardware limitations.

exception.name: FunctionNotImplementedException
exception.description: The underlying functionality has not yet been implemented.

exception.name: FtpServerNotAccessibleException
exception.description: FTP server is not accessible. This may depend on erroneous IP address, username, password, or that the IP communication with the FTP server is down, or that the FTP server itself is malfunctioning.

exception.name: FrequencyBandNotSupportedException
exception.description: The defined frequency band is not supported by hardware.

exception.name: DeviceNotAvailableException
exception.description:
A device is not allocated and setup.
User category: Ericsson personnel

exception.name: DeviceDisabledException
exception.description:
A device must be enabled, but is not.
User category: Ericsson personnel

exception.name: ConfigurationNotSupportedException
exception.description: The requested configuration is not supported.

exception.name: CellNotSetupException
exception.description:
The cell is not setup by the RNC.
User category: Ericsson personnel

exception.name: CellHaveBeenSetupByRncException
exception.description: The cell is setup by the RNC.

exception.name: BatteryNotFullyChargedException
exception.description: Battery not fully charged/charging ongoing.

exception.name: BatteryNotConnectedException
exception.description: Battery not connected.

exception.name: BandAndFrequencyMismatchException
exception.description: The band of the sector does not match the defined frequencies of the antenna branches of the sector.

exception.name: AlreadyInitiatedException
exception.description: The sector has already been initiated.

exception.name: AlreadyActiveOnRelatedDchException
exception.description:
Measurement/test is already active on related DCH. It is not possible to have the test on both transport and physical channel at the same time.
User category: Ericsson personnel

exception.name: AlreadyActiveException
exception.description: An attempt to start/activate a function failed, since it has already been started or is active.

exception.name: AttributeNotSettableAtMoCreateException
exception.description:
Exception thrown when an MO create is ordered with attribute values that are not allowed to set at creation.
Note: There this exception is created because the similar one in CPP is packaged in "UnusedDefs", interpreted as that it should not be used.

enum.name: Information
enum.description: Information about results from upgrade actions.

enumMember.name: EXECUTED
enumMember.description:
The invoked action has been successfully executed without warnings. One of three possible main results of executed action. The other two are: EXECUTED_WITH_WARNINGS and EXECUTION_FAILED.
Valid values for type of invoked action: INSTALL CANCEL_INSTALL VERIFY_UPGRADE UPGRADE

enumMember.name: UNSPECIFIED
enumMember.description:
An error or warning that is not specified is detected. See additionalInfo in the structure ActionResultData for further details.
Valid values for type of invoked action: INSTALL CANCEL_INSTALL VERIFY_UPGRADE UPGRADE

enumMember.name: LM_CHECKSUM_VER_FAILED
enumMember.description:
A load module checksum verification has failed.
Value valid for type of invoked action: INSTALL VERIFY_UPGRADE UPGRADE

enumMember.name: NOT_ENOUGH_AVAIL_DISK_SPACE
enumMember.description:
There is not enough disk space for the required number of new CVs to be created automatically during an upgrade.
Valid values for type of invoked action: VERIFY_UPGRADE UPGRADE

enumMember.name: MAX_NO_CV_WILL_BE_EXCEEDED
enumMember.description:
The maximum number of allowed CVs will be exceeded if the required number of new CVs is created automatically during an upgrade.
Valid values for type of invoked action: VERIFY_UPGRADE UPGRADE

enumMember.name: UPGRADE_FROM_CURRENT_UP_NOT_ALLOWED
enumMember.description:
The Upgrade Window element in the UCF does not specify the current Upgrade Package as a valid upgrade-from version.
Valid values for type of invoked action: VERIFY_UPGRADE UPGRADE

enumMember.name: NON_SUPPORTED_PIU
enumMember.description:
A plug-in-unit that is not supported is detected, that is, the plug-in-unit in the node is not defined in the UCF.
This fault does not prevent an upgrade execution.
Valid values for type of invoked action: VERIFY_UPGRADE UPGRADE

enumMember.name: FAULTY_PIU
enumMember.description:
A faulty plug-in-unit has been detected. This fault does not prevent an upgrade execution.
Valid values for type of invoked action: VERIFY_UPGRADE UPGRADE

enumMember.name: CREATION_OF_CV_FAILED
enumMember.description:
The auto-creation of an install CV failed.
Value valid for type of invoked action: INSTALL

enumMember.name: ACTION_NOT_ALLOWED
enumMember.description:
The requested action is not allowed as another action is already in progress for another UpgradePackage MO.
Valid values for type of invoked action: INSTALL CANCEL_INSTALL VERIFY_UPGRADE UPGRADE

enumMember.name: INST_MANUALLY_CANCELLED
enumMember.description:
An ongoing installation has been cancelled (aborted) due to request from client.
Value valid for type of invoked action: INSTALL

enumMember.name: FTP_SERVER_NOT_ACCESSIBLE
enumMember.description:
The FTP server to be used for downloads of load modules is not accessible.
Value valid for type of invoked action: INSTALL

enumMember.name: INSUF_DISK_FOR_LMS
enumMember.description:
The required disk space for load modules to be installed is insufficient.
Value valid for type of invoked action: INSTALL

enumMember.name: FTP_SERVER_IP_ADDR_ERROR
enumMember.description:
Error detected in the IP address of the FTP server.
Value valid for type of invoked action: INSTALL

enumMember.name: DELTA_INSTALL_MERGE_ERROR
enumMember.description:
The install of the delta UCF failed, that is, the analysis of the delta UCF with the current active UP's UCF failed.
Valid value for type of invoked action: INSTALL

enumMember.name: SELECTIVE_INSTALL_ERROR
enumMember.description:
Error detected during the selection phase of an install.
Value valid for type of invoked action: INSTALL

enumMember.name: EXECUTION_FAILED
enumMember.description:
The execution of invoked action failed. One of three possible main results of executed action. The other two are: EXECUTED and EXECUTED_WITH_WARNINGS.
Valid values for type of invoked action: INSTALL CANCEL_INSTALL VERIFY_UPGRADE UPGRADE

enumMember.name: EXECUTED_WITH_WARNINGS
enumMember.description:
The action has been successfully executed but with warnings.One of three possible main results of executed action. The other two are: EXECUTED and EXECUTION_FAILED.
Valid values for type of invoked action: INSTALL CANCEL_INSTALL VERIFY_UPGRADE

enumMember.name: LM_FILES_NOT_INST
enumMember.description:
All load module files required for a supported plug-in-unit (according to the UCF) are not installed.
Valid values for type of invoked action: VERIFY_UPGRADE UPGRADE

enumMember.name: NOT_SUPPORTED_SUBRACK_TYPE
enumMember.description: A subrack that is not supported is detected, that is, the subrack in the node is not defined in the UCF. This will prevent an upgrade from being executed.

enumMember.name: SLOT_OF_PIU_NOT_CONNECTED_TO_SWA
enumMember.description:
A Slot related to a plug-in-unit is not connected to an SwAllocation.
Valid values for type of invoked action: VERIFY_UPGRADE UPGRADE

enumMember.name: LM_TYPE_NOT_ALLOWED
enumMember.description:
ManagedObject(s) will be connected (via an SwAllocation) to Repertoire(s) referencing load modules of not allowed types. Both configured data and data in the UCF has been used to predict the SwAllocation connections during upgrade.
Valid values for type of invoked action: VERIFY_UPGRADE UPGRADE

enumMember.name: PIUTYPE_NOT_UNIQUE
enumMember.description:
Several SwAllocations connected to the same Slot define the same PiuType.
Valid values for type of invoked action: VERIFY_UPGRADE UPGRADE

enumMember.name: PIUTYPE_LOADLIST_INCONSISTENT
enumMember.description:
All Repertoires in a SwAllocation do not support the same set of PiuTypes.
Valid values for type of invoked action: VERIFY_UPGRADE UPGRADE

enumMember.name: PROGRAM_INSTANCES_INCONSISTENT
enumMember.description:
The result of combining UCF data for program instance values with how repertoires are connected to an upgradeable PIU is inconsistent.
Valid values for type of invoked action: VERIFY_UPGRADE UPGRADE

enumMember.name: HEAP_SIZE_INCONSISTENT
enumMember.description:
The result of combining UCF data for heap size values with how repertoires are connected to an upgradeable PIU is inconsistent.
Valid values for type of invoked action: VERIFY_UPGRADE UPGRADE

enumMember.name: POOL_SIZE_INCONSISTENT
enumMember.description:
The result of combining UCF data for pool size values with how repertoires are connected to an upgradeable PIU is inconsistent.
Valid values for type of invoked action: VERIFY_UPGRADE UPGRADE

enumMember.name: LOADER_DATA_INCONSISTENT
enumMember.description:
The result of combining UCF data for loader type and device loader name with how repertoires are connected to an upgradeable PIU is inconsistent.
Valid values for type of invoked action: VERIFY_UPGRADE UPGRADE

enumMember.name: DEVICE_LOADER_INFORMATION_INCONSISTENT
enumMember.description:
The result of combining UCF data for device loader information with how repertoires are connected to an upgradeable PIU is inconsistent.
Valid values for type of invoked action: VERIFY_UPGRADE UPGRADE

enumMember.name: LOADER_TYPE_NOT_ALLOWED_FOR_PARENT_MO
enumMember.description:
The result of combining UCF data for loader type with how repertoires are connected to an upgradeable PIU is inconsistent.
Valid values for type of invoked action: VERIFY_UPGRADE UPGRADE

enumMember.name: ACTION_NOT_ALLOWED_IF_MORE_THAN_ONE_UP
enumMember.description: The action is not allowed if more than one UP exists on node.

enumMember.name: ACTION_ALLOWED_ONLY_IF_UP_HWSENSITIVE
enumMember.description: The action is allowed only if the attribute actualTypeOfUP indicates that the UP type is HW_SENSITIVE and if the UP type in all referring CVs are of type HW_SENSITIVE.

enumMember.name: ACTION_ALLOWED_ONLY_FOR_CURRENT_UP
enumMember.description: The action is only allowed for current (active) UP.

enumMember.name: REMOVED_LM_FILES
enumMember.description: The load module files that have been removed.

enumMember.name: REMOVED_LM_FILES_XML_FILE
enumMember.description: An XML file that contains information of load module files that have been removed.

enumMember.name: REFERRING_CV_INFO
enumMember.description: Information about the CVs, where this UpgradePackage MO exists.

enumMember.name: UCF_VALIDATION_ERROR
enumMember.description: There is syntax or format problem detected in the UCF.

enumMember.name: INIT_UP_ERROR
enumMember.description: Initialitation of the Upgrade Package Mo failed i.e. the setting of an attribute in the UpgradePackageMo with data specfied in the UCF failed.

enumMember.name: AUE_REPORTED_FAILURE
enumMember.description: An AUE has reported failure or has not answered within an expected time.

enumMember.name: AUE_REPORTED_WARNING
enumMember.description: An AUE has reported warning.

enumMember.name: LACK_OF_DISK_SPACE_ON_C_DISK
enumMember.description: There is not enough with disk space for the required Load Module files to be installed.

enumMember.name: NO_NODE_TYPE_LIST_FOUND_THAT_MATCHES_USED_PIUS
enumMember.description: Not all used PIUs in the node are supported by a specific node type according to the Upgrade Control File.

enumMember.name: DISK_HEALTH_CHECK_FAILURE
enumMember.description: Error(s) detected during disk health check, such as: corrupt file system, configuration version(s) and/or upgrade package(s).

enumMember.name: MISMATCHED_LM_PATH
enumMember.description: The LM file path in the UCF is not matches the one configured in the node.

enumMember.name: REPERTOIRE_REPLACEMENT_ERROR_DETECTED
enumMember.description: Repertoire replacement definitions in the ExplicitReplacment UCF are not consistent i.e. depending on selected upgrade action.

enumMember.name: VERIFY_UPGRADE

enumMember.name: UPGRADE

enumMember.name: INSTALL
enumMember.description: An install action (one of the variants) has been invoked.

enumMember.name: CANCEL_INSTALL
enumMember.description: The cancelInstall action has been invoked.

enumMember.name: SHRINK
enumMember.description: The shrink action has been invoked.

enumMember.name: READREFERRINGCVINFORMATION
enumMember.description: The readReferringCvInformation action has been invoked.

enumMember.name: RESTORE_SU
enumMember.description: The restoreSu action has been invoked.

enum.name: EmergencyStatus
enum.description: This enumeration specifies the different stages of the emergency state.

enumMember.name: NEVER_USED
enumMember.description: EmergencyStatus has not been activated since installation of the LKF.

enumMember.name: ACTIVE
enumMember.description: EmergencyStatus goes from NEVER_USED to ACTIVE, the first time the node is emergency-unlocked. The licenses are open for the emergency state as described in the documentation about licensing. The maximum time in this state is 7 days. After expiry, EmergencyStatus goes to USE_DEGRADED. EmergencyStatus goes from ACTIVE to NEVER_USED when the LKF is installed with emergency unlock reset.

enumMember.name: USE_DEGRADED
enumMember.description:
EmergencyStatus goes to USE_DEGRADED from ACTIVE. All features and capacities are license-controlled in accordance with the installed LKF.
EmergencyStatus remains in USE_DEGRADED until: an emergency unlock of the node and EmergencyStatus goes to ACTIVE_AGAIN or, an LKF is installed with an entry, emergency unlock reset. Then EmergencyStatus goes to NEVER_USED.

enumMember.name: ACTIVE_AGAIN
enumMember.description: The EmergencyStatus goes from USE_DEGRADED to ACTIVE_AGAIN at emergency unlock of the node. The licenses are open for the emergency state as described in the documentation about licensing. The maximum time in this state is 7 days. After expiry the EmergencyStatus goes from ACTIVE_AGAIN to USE_DISABLED. The EmergencyStatus goes from ACTIVE_AGAIN to NEVER_USED at installation of an emergency unlock reset LKF.

enumMember.name: USE_DISABLED
enumMember.description: The EmergencyStatus goes to USE_DISABLED from ACTIVE_AGAIN. All features and capacities are license-controlled in accordance with the installed LKF. The node remains in USE_DISABLED until an LKF with the entry, emergency unlock reset, is installed. Then it goes to NEVER_USED.

enumMember.name: RESTARTS_WITH_NO_LIMITS
enumMember.description: This attributes indicates unlimited restarts and no faulty marking of the PIU. Used for critical PIU's such as TUBs, SCBs and some ET-boards.

enumMember.name: RESTARTS_WITH_FAULT_MARKED
enumMember.description: This attributes indicates the following sequential restarts: -cold with fault marked (not loaded). Alarm sent.

enumMember.name: RESTARTS_WITH_COLD_TEST
enumMember.description: This attributes indicates the following sequential restarts: -cold with test -cold with fault marked (not loaded). Alarm sent.

enumMember.name: RESTARTS_WITH_COLD
enumMember.description: This attributes indicates the following sequential restarts: -cold -cold with test -cold with fault marked (not loaded). Alarm sent.

enumMember.name: RESTARTS_WITH_WARM
enumMember.description: This attributes indicates the following sequential restarts: -warm -cold -cold with test -cold with fault marked (not loaded). Alarm sent.

enum.name: SilPortState
enum.description: Indication of Switch Internal Link port status.

enumMember.name: PORT_ACTIVE
enumMember.description: The port is active.

enumMember.name: PORT_PASSIVE
enumMember.description: The port is not active.

enumMember.name: PORT_NOT_CONNECTED
enumMember.description: The port is not connected.

enumMember.name: PORT_LOCKED
enumMember.description: The port is locked.

enumMember.name: PORT_NOT_INSTALLED
enumMember.description: The post is not installed.

enum.name: RestartRank
enum.description: This is used in the manualRestart action for the MOs ManagedElement, PlugInUnit and PiuDevice.

enumMember.name: RESTART_WARM
enumMember.description: Restarts the MO with the same software. The software is not reloaded from the disk. The traffic is affected least.

enumMember.name: RESTART_REFRESH
enumMember.description: Reloads the software from the disk, restarts the MO, and resets parts of the hardware. The traffic is affected more than for a warm restart.

enumMember.name: RESTART_COLD
enumMember.description: Reloads the software from the disk, restarts the MO, and resets all hardware. The traffic is affected more than for a refresh restart.

enumMember.name: RESTART_COLDWTEST
enumMember.description: Reloads the software from the disk, restarts the MO, and resets and tests the hardware. The traffic is affected most.

enumMember.name: LOCKED
enumMember.description: The resource is administratively prohibited from performing services for its users.

enumMember.name: UNLOCKED
enumMember.description: The resource is administratively permitted to perform services for its users. This is independent of its inherent operability.

enumMember.name: SHUTTING_DOWN
enumMember.description: Use of the resource is administratively permitted to existing instances of use only. While the system remains in the shutting down state the manager may at any time cause the managed object to revert to the unlocked state.

enum.name: AvailabilityStatus
enum.description:
Indicates possible status values of a corresponding availabilityStatus attribute. Since more than one status may be present at the same time while only one is shown, they are shown in the following order of priority (highest first):
NOT_INSTALLED POWER_OFF IN_TEST DEPENDENCY_LOCKED DEPENDENCY_FAILED FAILED OFF_LINE DEGRADED OFF_DUTY LOG_FULL NO_STATUS

enumMember.name: NO_STATUS
enumMember.description: No other availability status for this resource is currently present.

enumMember.name: IN_TEST
enumMember.description: The resource is undergoing a test procedure. Tests that do not exclude additional users can be present in any operational state or administrative state.

enumMember.name: FAILED
enumMember.description: The resource has an internal fault that prevents it from operating. The operational state is disabled.

enumMember.name: POWER_OFF
enumMember.description: The resource requires power to be applied and is not powered on. The operational state is disabled.

enumMember.name: OFF_LINE
enumMember.description: The resource requires a routine operation to be performed to place it online and make it available for use. The operation may be manual, automatic, or both. The operational state is disabled or enabled.

enumMember.name: OFF_DUTY
enumMember.description: The resource has been made inactive by some internal control process in accordance with a predetermined time schedule. Under normal conditions the control process can be expected to reactivate the resource at some scheduled time, and it is therefore considered to be optional. The operational state is enabled or disabled.

enumMember.name: DEGRADED
enumMember.description: The service available from the resource is degraded in some respect, such as in speed or operating capacity. However, the resource remains available for service, either because some services are satisfactory or because degraded service is preferable to no service at all. The operational state is enabled.

enumMember.name: NOT_INSTALLED
enumMember.description: The resource represented by the managed object is not present, or is incomplete. For example, a plug-in unit is missing, a cable is disconnected, or a software module is not loaded. The operational state is disabled.

enumMember.name: LOG_FULL
enumMember.description: This indicates a log full condition. Currently not used.

enumMember.name: DEPENDENCY_LOCKED
enumMember.description: The administrative state of a resource that this resource depends on is locked or the availability status of the other resource is dependency locked. The operational state is disabled.

enumMember.name: DEPENDENCY_FAILED
enumMember.description: The availability status of a resource that this resource depends on is failed or dependency failed. The operational state is disabled.

enumMember.name: DEPENDENCY_SHUTTINGDOWN
enumMember.description: The administrative state of a resource that this resource depends on is shutting down or the availability status of the other resource is dependency shutting down. The operational state is disabled.

enumMember.name: DISABLED
enumMember.description: The resource is totally inoperable and unable to provide service to the user(s).

enumMember.name: ENABLED
enumMember.description: The resource is partially or fully operable and available for use.

enumMember.name: PLANNED_RECONFIGURATION
enumMember.description: Restart ordered to perform planned activities such as reconfigurations.

enumMember.name: UNPLANNED_NODE_EXTERNAL_PROBLEMS
enumMember.description: Restart ordered to resolve node external problems.

enumMember.name: UNPLANNED_NODE_UPGRADE_PROBLEMS
enumMember.description: Restart ordered to resolve upgrade problems.

enumMember.name: UNPLANNED_O_AND_M_ISSUE
enumMember.description: Restart ordered to resolve O&M issues.

enumMember.name: UNPLANNED_CYCLIC_RECOVERY
enumMember.description: Restart ordered to stop further auto recovery attempts.

enumMember.name: UNPLANNED_LOCKED_RESOURCES
enumMember.description: Restart ordered to release locked resources.

enumMember.name: UNPLANNED_COLD_WITH_HW_TEST
enumMember.description: Restart ordered to perform HW tests.

enumMember.name: UNPLANNED_CALL_PROCESSING_DEGRADATION
enumMember.description: Restart ordered to improve Call Set Up or Call Drop Rate.

enumMember.name: UNPLANNED_LOW_COVERAGE
enumMember.description: Restart ordered to improve Cell Availability.

enumMember.name: UPGRADE_BOARD_RESTART
enumMember.description:
Restart ordered to effectuate autoconfiguration of a plug-in unit.
This is only used for PlugInUnit MO.

enumMember.name: OPERATOR_CLASSIFIED_PROBLEMS
enumMember.description: Restart ordered to resolve procedural errors or office environmental problems. Example: power, grounding, temperature, humidity or security problems.

enum.name: EdgePortMode
enum.description: The behavior of an edge port.

enumMember.name: ADMIN_EDGE_OFF
enumMember.description: The port is an active member of a spanning tree network and expects to receive BPDUs.

enumMember.name: AUTO_EDGE
enumMember.description: The port expects to be situated at the edge of the spanning tree enabled network and transits rapidly into forwarding state. The system automatically detects if it is an edge port.

enumMember.name: ADMIN_EDGE_ON
enumMember.description: The port expects to be situated at the edge of the spanning tree enabled network and transits rapidly into forwarding state. If the port receives BPDUs, it becomes a participant in the spanning tree network. It differs from AUTO_EDGE, in that once the port has become a participant in the spanning tree network, it remains so, regardless of further BPDU reception.

enumMember.name: ADMIN_EDGE_BPDU_GUARD
enumMember.description: The port expects to be situated at the edge of the spanning tree enabled network and transits rapidly into forwarding state. If the port receives BPDUs, it is temporarily disabled.

enumMember.name: ADMIN_EDGE_BPDU_FILTER
enumMember.description: The port expects to be situated at the edge of the spanning tree enabled network and transits rapidly into forwarding state. The port discards any received BPDUs.

enumMember.name: SCTP_PATHS
enumMember.description:
Path management where retransmissions are counted for each destination IP address.
Specification: RFC 4960

enumMember.name: IP_PATHS
enumMember.description: Path management based on the concept of IP path. An IP path is a pair of local and remote transport addresses. Retransmissions are counted for each IP path. The attribute pathMaxRtx specifies the maximum number of retransmissions per IP path.

enumMember.name: IP_PATHS_OPTIMIZED
enumMember.description: Path management similar to IP_PATHS, with the addition that the active primary path is avoided, if the previous transmission through it failed. New data will be transmitted over other paths, even though the active primary path is not detected as broken yet.

enum.name: CommLostOrigin
enum.description: Originator of the Communication lost event.

enumMember.name: UNKNOWN
enumMember.description: The originator is unknown, or there were no any Communication Lost after association establishment.

enumMember.name: LOCAL
enumMember.description: The last Communication Lost was originated by local node.

enumMember.name: REMOTE
enumMember.description: The last Communication Lost was originated by remote node.

enumMember.name: UNKNOWN
enumMember.description: Initial value or the reason is unknown after program restart.

enumMember.name: SCTP_RESTART
enumMember.description: The association was closed down because the SCTP Host has restarted.

enumMember.name: SHUTDOWN_FAILURE
enumMember.description: Shutdown Failure, max SHUTDOWN retransmits reached.

enumMember.name: USER_REQUEST_TERMINATE
enumMember.description: The SCTP user has requested graceful shutdown of the association.

enumMember.name: UNDETERMINED_ERROR
enumMember.description: An ABORT chunk with unknown reason was received by SCTP, or SCTP internal error.

enumMember.name: PEER_REQUEST_ABORT
enumMember.description: The remote side has closed the association ungracefully.

enumMember.name: MAX_RETRANSMIT_FAILED
enumMember.description: Maximum number of retransmissions (defined by associationMaxRtx and pathMaxRtx attributes of Sctp or SctpProfile MO) reached.

enumMember.name: RESOURCE_ERROR
enumMember.description: An ABORT chunk with the reason "Out Of Resources" was received by SCTP, or there are not enough resources in the local SCTP to proceed.

enumMember.name: PEER_REQUESTED_TERMINATE
enumMember.description: The remote side has requested graceful shutdown of the association.

enumMember.name: NO_USER_DATA_IN_CHUNK
enumMember.description: An ABORT chunk with the reason "No user data" was received by SCTP.

enumMember.name: DATA_REASSEMBLY_ERROR
enumMember.description: SCTP is not able to reassemble a message that was fragmented on the remote side.

enumMember.name: STREAM_SEQ_ERROR
enumMember.description: SCTP has received a DATA chunk with incorrect stream sequence number.

enumMember.name: INVALID_SACK
enumMember.description: Invalid SACK chunk is received.

enumMember.name: LOCAL_REQUEST_ABORT
enumMember.description: The SCTP user has requested to close the association ungracefully.

enumMember.name: INVALID_STREAM_ID
enumMember.description: An ABORT chunk with the reason "Invalid Stream Identifier" was received, or the SCTP has received a DATA chunk with invalid stream identifier.

enumMember.name: INVALID_MAND_PARAM
enumMember.description: An ABORT chunk with the reason "Invalid Mandatory Parameter" has been received by SCTP, or a received chunk contains a mandatory parameter with an invalid value.

enumMember.name: RESTART_WITH_NEW_ADDRESSES
enumMember.description: An ABORT chunk with the reason "restart of an Association with New Addresses" was received, or an INIT chunk was received and its IP addresses were previously not part of the association.

enumMember.name: PROTOCOL_VIOLATION
enumMember.description: An ABORT chunk with the reason "Protocol Violation" has been received, or the SCTP has detected a protocol violation of the peer.

enumMember.name: ICMP_RECEIVED
enumMember.description: An ICMP message is received and is treated as an ABORT chunk: - Type is "Destination unreachable", Code is "Protocol unreachable" for IPv4. - Type is "Parameter problem", Code is "Unrecognized Next Header type encountered" for IPv6.

enumMember.name: NO_USER_CONNECTION
enumMember.description: Connection with the SCTP user is lost.

enumMember.name: NO_SWITCHBACK
enumMember.description: The path selection behavior, where the active primary path continues to be used without switchback, unless there are new transmission problems.

enumMember.name: IMMEDIATE_SWITCHBACK
enumMember.description: The path selection behavior, where switchback to the preferred primary path is performed as soon as the preferred primary path becomes active.

enumMember.name: EXPONENTIAL_BACKOFF
enumMember.description: The path selection behavior, where switchback to the preferred primary path is performed only after a number of consecutive successful heartbeats.

enum.name: SecurityLevel
enum.description: The security level of the node. Describes both the requested and the operational security levels.

enumMember.name: LEVEL_UNDEFINED
enumMember.description:
Undefined. Equivalent to level 1.
Use the action adaptSecurityLevel to set the attribute requestedSecurityLevel to LEVEL_1, or the secmode command.
This value applies only during initial configuration of the node and does not normally occur in operation.

enumMember.name: LEVEL_1
enumMember.description:
Security Level 1, which is the lowest level. Corba security is not activated.
It is possible to login to the node remotely using Telnet, FTP, SSH, SFTP. Debug and Trace Port access may be enabled.

enumMember.name: LEVEL_2
enumMember.description: Security Level 2 adds secure Corba communication with authentication using an external database.

enumMember.name: LEVEL_3
enumMember.description: At Security Level 3, Authentication and Authorization using an external data base, is added to all remote access points. Telnet, FTP and debug access is not possible at this level (Timeout value is specified when calling the setSecurityLevel3 action).

enumMember.name: LEVEL_3_UNCONFIRMED
enumMember.description:
Security Level 3 has been activated, but it has not yet been confirmed with the command, secmode.
If the confirmation is not made within the timeout, the security level drops back to level 2.

enumMember.name: SFTP

enumMember.name: IDLE

enumMember.name: PREPARING_REQUEST
enumMember.description: The node is preparing the certificate enrollment sequence.

enumMember.name: POLLING
enumMember.description: An enrollment request has been sent to the enrollment server. The node is polling for a new certificate but the requested certificate has not yet been issued.

enumMember.name: NEW_CREDS_AWAIT_CONF
enumMember.description: Awaiting confirmation for the use of new credentials. An event is issued.

enumMember.name: ERROR
enumMember.description:
An error has occurred. An alarm is issued.
See the certEnrollErrorMsg attribute for a description of the error.
The only way to leave this state is by using the action, cancelCertEnrollment.

enumMember.name: VERIFY_JVM_PIUS

enumMember.name: VERIFYING_LM_TYPE_ALLOWED
enumMember.description:
Verifying that only allowed types of load modules are referenced in Repertoires to be connected to ManagedObject(s) via an SWA.
Both configured data and data in the UCF will be used to predict the SwAllocation connections during upgrade.

enumMember.name: VERIFY_PIUTYPE_LOADLIST
enumMember.description: Verifying that all Repertoires in a SwAllocation support the same set of PiuTypes.

enumMember.name: VERIFY_PROGRAM_CONSISTENCY
enumMember.description:
Verifying that programs that will exist in TO state are specified in a consistent manner, that is the result of combining UCF data with how repertoires are connected to an upgradeable PIU must be consistent. The following checks are done:
- heap value - pool value - program instances - loader data (attributes loader type, deviceLoaderName) - device loader information - loader type allowed for program parent MO

enumMember.name: NOT_PRE_UPGRADED
enumMember.description: The SU function is not pre-upgraded.

enumMember.name: PRE_UPGRADE_EXECUTING
enumMember.description: Pre-upgrade of SU function is in progress.

enumMember.name: PRE_UPGRADE_COMPLETED
enumMember.description: Pre-upgrade of SU function is completed.

enumMember.name: RESTORE_SU_EXECUTING
enumMember.description: Restore of SU function in progress.

enumMember.name: STANDARD
enumMember.description: The value normally used for manually created CVs.

enumMember.name: UPGRADE
enumMember.description:
A CV created during system upgrade, after reconfigurations are completed and before the new SW is taken into operation.
UPGRADE_TOLERATE_ERROR is used if the Upgrade Control File states that the function Tolerate Error is to be used in the upgrade path. The name of the CV starts with SU_.

enumMember.name: AUTOCREATE
enumMember.description:
A daily CV created automatically by the periodical CV function activated by setting autoCreatedCVIsTurnedOn to true.
The name of the CV starts with Au_.

enumMember.name: OTHER
enumMember.description: CVs of this type are created in many situations: - After a successful installation of an Upgrade package. The name of the CV starts with Si_. - A rollback CV created in the beginning of an upgrade after the prechecks are done and before any reconfiguration is started. The name of the CV starts with Rb_. - The final CV created after a successful upgrade. The name of the CV starts with Fi_. - A rollback CV created in the beginning of a restoration of an external CV. The name of the CV starts with RR_. - A CV created when the Autoconfiguration is switched off in order to save the configuration created during a PIU replacement. The name of the CV starts with CA_. - CVs created by the Robust Reconfiguration function. The name of the CV created when the function is activated starts with CB_. The name of the CV created when the function is confirmed starts with CC_.

enumMember.name: UPGRADE_TOLERATE_ERROR
enumMember.description:
A CV created during system upgrade, after reconfigurations are completed and before the new SW is taken into operation.
UPGRADE_TOLERATE_ERROR is used if the Upgrade Control File states that the function Tolerate Error is to be used in the upgrade path. The name of the CV starts with SU_.

enumMember.name: DOWNLOADED
enumMember.description:
A backup CV downloaded to the node from an FTP server.
The CV has previously been created by the external CV function. This type of CV can not be set as startable. The CV can have any name.

enumMember.name: RESTORED
enumMember.description:
A CV created after a successful restoration of a CV.
It is created by the external CV function. Depending on the method used, the name of the CV starts with RR_ or RF_.

enumMember.name: STANDALONE
enumMember.description: A CV that may be created when only one configured instance of a PlugInUnit MO exists on the node.

enumMember.name: CONFIRM_RESTORE
enumMember.description: Makes the restore permanent.

enumMember.name: FORCED_RESTORE
enumMember.description: Restores the node to a previously downloaded backup CV irrespectively of warnings are detected or not during the verification phase.

enumMember.name: GET_FROM_FTP_SERVER
enumMember.description: Downloads a remote backup of a CV to the node.

enumMember.name: PUT_TO_FTP_SERVER
enumMember.description: Creates a backup of a CV existing on the node and uploads it to an FTP server.

enumMember.name: RESTORE

enum.name: RPUOperationalMode
enum.description:
This enumeration contains the following values:
AsConfigured = The RSHs runs as the RPU is configured. SwitchOver = The RSHs has been switched over. Unavailable = No RSHs, that uses this RPU, are running.

enum.name: RPUReplicationMode
enum.description:
This enumaration contains the following values:
Always = Data replication is always performed. This overrides the characteristics set on the each container ( that is associated with the RPU ).
Never = Data replication is never performed. This overrides the characteristics set on the each container ( that is associated with the RPU ).
AtShutdown = Each time the RSH (which handles the RPU) is shut down, a complete snapshot is taken and replicated to the other MP, if necessary. Otherwise, the replication is performed according to the characteristics set on each container ( that is associated with the RPU ).
ApplControlled = The data replication is made according to the characteristics set on each container ( that is associated with the RPU ). This is the default value.

enumMember.name: ALWAYS
enumMember.description: Always = Data replication is always performed. This overrides the characteristics set on the each container ( that is associated with the RPU ).

enumMember.name: NEVER
enumMember.description: Data replication is never performed. This overrides the characteristics set on the each container ( that is associated with the RPU ).

enumMember.name: AT_SHUTDOWN
enumMember.description: AtShutdown = Each time the RSH (which handles the RPU) is shut down, a complete snapshot is taken and replicated to the other MP, if necessary. Otherwise, the replication is performed according to the characteristics set on each container ( that is associated with the RPU ).

enumMember.name: APPL_CONTROLLED
enumMember.description: ApplControlled = The data replication is made according to the characteristics set on each container ( that is associated with the RPU ). This is the default value.

enum.name: RPUNormalisationMode
enum.description:
This enumeration can have the following values:
Manual = Indicates that no normalization is done until the "switch" action is performed.
Automatic = Indicates that the normalization is done automatically, when the failed RPU is available again. This is the default value.

enum.name: RPUSwitchOverMode
enum.description:
This attribute can have the following values:
AtPiuFault = When the PlugInUnit (where the reliable program is activated) is fault marked (HW fault or others) or when the PlugInUnit is restarted with rank ColdWithTest. This is the default value.
AtPiuRestart = When the PlugInUnit (where the reliable program is activated) is restarted with any rank or when the PlugInUnit is fault marked (HW fault or others).

enum.name: LoadClass
enum.description: Defines the phase in the load and start sequence.

enumMember.name: MP
enumMember.description: The board is a Main processor.

enumMember.name: BP
enumMember.description: The board is a device board.

enumMember.name: OTHERS
enumMember.description: The board is not a Main processor or a device board.

enumMember.name: CMXB
enumMember.description: The board is a CMXB or SCXB board.

enumMember.name: NOT_INSTALLED
enumMember.description: The load module file is not installed on the disk.

enumMember.name: INSTALLED
enumMember.description: The load module file is installed on the disk.

enumMember.name: NOT_INSTALLED
enumMember.description: None of the load module file(s) required for this PiuType is installed.

enumMember.name: PARTLY_INSTALLED
enumMember.description: One or several load module file(s) required for this PiuType is not installed.

enumMember.name: INSTALLED
enumMember.description: All required load module file(s) for this PiuType are installed.

enumMember.name: STARTUP_MODE
enumMember.description: The system clock is starting up.

enumMember.name: LOCKED_MODE
enumMember.description: The system clock signal on the Timing Unit is locked: a synchronization reference is used to generate the system clock, the clock accuracy is 50 ppb or better.

enumMember.name: HOLD_OVER_MODE
enumMember.description: The system clock signal on the Timing Unit has holdover quality: no synchronization reference is used to generate the system clock, the clock accuracy is 50 ppb or better.

enumMember.name: FREE_RUNNING_MODE
enumMember.description: The system clock signal on the Timing Unit is free-running: no synchronization reference is used to generate the system clock, the clock accuracy is 4.6 ppm or better.

enumMember.name: FAILED_MODE
enumMember.description: The system clock signal on the Timing Unit is failed: there is fault in generating the system clock, no guarantee of clock accuracy level.

enumMember.name: LOSS_OF_TRACKING_MODE
enumMember.description: The frequency of the system clock is at its upper or lower limit.

enumMember.name: NOT_APPLICABLE
enumMember.description: The system clock signal on Timing Unit is not applicable: the TUB or the CBU is not present.

enumMember.name: DEGR_NOT_FAULT
enumMember.description: Degradation of the transmission link is NOT interpreted as a synchronization reference fault.

enumMember.name: DEGR_IS_FAULT
enumMember.description: Degradation of the transmission link is interpreted as a synchronization reference fault.

enumMember.name: INACTIVE
enumMember.description: Synchronization reference is currently not used in system clock generation.

enumMember.name: ACTIVE
enumMember.description: Synchronization is used in system clock generation.

enumMember.name: FAILED
enumMember.description: Synchronization reference cannot perform its required tasks.

enumMember.name: DEGRADED
enumMember.description: Capability of the synchronization reference to perform its required tasks is degraded, for example, because of high bit error rate. This value is applicable only for synchronization references that carry traffic, that is, for ET physical path terminations.

enumMember.name: LOSS_OF_TRACKING
enumMember.description: The algorithm for system clock regulation cannot follow the synchronization reference signal either because of the poor quality of the signal or because of a HW fault.

enumMember.name: OK
enumMember.description: Synchronization reference is capable of performing its required tasks.

enumMember.name: REF_PATH_FAILED_A
enumMember.description: Synchronization reference cannot be distributed on plane A.

enumMember.name: REF_PATH_FAILED_B
enumMember.description: Synchronization reference cannot be distributed on plane B.

enumMember.name: NOT_RELIABLE
enumMember.description: No NTP packets are received from the server. This value is only used for IP synchronization references.

enumMember.name: LOW_QUALITY
enumMember.description: The time stamp packets received from the NTP server are not reliable and the synchronization algorithm cannot lock to IP reference. This value is only used for IP synchronization references.

enumMember.name: PDV_PROBLEM
enumMember.description: A high or time-variant Packet Delay Variation (PDV) condition on a supervised IP synchronization reference is detected.

enumMember.name: SURVEY
enumMember.description: The node can move.

enumMember.name: POSITION_HOLD
enumMember.description: The node must not move.

enum.name: MacHsL1ParamStateMode
enum.description:
MAC HS L1 Ack parameter setting mode.

User category: Ericsson personnel

enum.name: SchFlowControlState
enum.description: Defines whether flow control is activated (ON) or deactivated (OFF).

enum.name: Sccpch_MultiplexPos
enum.description:
Fixed or flexible positions of transport channels to be used in SCCPCH.

User category: Ericsson personnel

enum.name: Sccpch_TfciPresence
enum.description:
The TFCI that must be included.

User category: Ericsson personnel

enum.name: OcnsPowerVariation
enum.description:
Power variation for all users.

User category: Ericsson personnel

enumMember.name: IDLE
enumMember.description: The resource is not currently in use.

enumMember.name: ACTIVE
enumMember.description: The resource is in use, and has sufficient spare capacity to provide for additional users simultaneously.

enumMember.name: BUSY
enumMember.description: The resource is in use, but it has no spare capacity to provide for additional users at this instant.

struct.name: SfpInformation
struct.description: Gives information about the SFP port. Only valid if the attribute sfpPort is true.

structMember.name: sfpProductNumber
structMember.description: The product number of an SFP module.

structMember.name: sfpType
structMember.description:
The type of SFP.
Example: GE_1000_BASE_T or GE_1000_BASE_CX.

structMember.name: sfpState
structMember.description: The state of the SFP port.

struct.name: AccountInfo
struct.description: Accounting information

structMember.name: remoteHost
structMember.description:
The domain name, IPv4 or IPv6 address to the remote host (file server).
The input format for an IPv4 address is four fields of digits, separated by a dot. Each field consists of one to three digits.
The input format for an IPv6 address is as defined in specification RFC 4291, chapter 2.2, bullet 1 and 2.
The input format for a domain name is as defined in specification RFC 952. When address resolution is requested and the DNS server responds with a list of resolved addresses, the first address presented by the DNS server is used by this attribute. Note that you need to configure a name-to-IP-address association in the DNS server, with an address that belongs to the correct address family. This means that a host name defininition in the DNS server should not mix IPv4 and IPv6 addresses. Instead, use two separate host names: one that resolves to the IPv4 address and one that resolves to IPv6 address.

structMember.name: userID
structMember.description: User ID for logging in to the remote host (file server).

structMember.name: password
structMember.description: Password used for logging in to the remote host (file server).

struct.name: AdminProductData
struct.description: Administrative Product Data

structMember.name: productNumber
structMember.description:
The product number of the product or document.
Examples: ABC 101 001, CXC 123 456, 1/BFD 101 999
For UpgradePackage, this is the document number of the upgrade package.
Maximum length for a product number is 36 when referring to a document.
The product number is mandatory for the MOs: ConfigurationVersion, UpgradePackage, LoadModule, PiuType, Subrack and SubrackProdType.

structMember.name: productRevision
structMember.description:
The revision state of the product.
Examples: R1, r1a, R1A02, P7B
The product revision is mandatory for the MOs: ConfigurationVersion, UpgradePackage, LoadModule, PiuType, Subrack and SubrackProdType.

structMember.name: productName
structMember.description:
The name of the product.
The product name is mandatory for the MOs: ConfigurationVersion, UpgradePackage, LoadModule, PiuType, Subrack and SubrackProdType.

structMember.name: productInfo
structMember.description:
Information about the product.
If AdminProductData is used by LoadModule the range is 0.. (unlimited).

structMember.name: productionDate
structMember.description:
The production date is represented in two ways:
- the preferred syntax is four-digits for the year, two digits for the month, and two digits for the day, a total of eight characters. Example: 19991231
- the date is also be represented by two digits for the year, followed by the letter W for week, and two digits for the number of the week, a total of five characters. Example: 99W52
The production date is mandatory for the MOs: ConfigurationVersion, UpgradePackage and LoadModule.

structMember.name: productName
structMember.description: A user-friendly name of the product.

structMember.name: productNumber
structMember.description:
Unique identity for each product, which is constituted by the Ericsson product number (ABC number).
The maximum number of characters for a product number is 24 including 2 slashes, 2 spaces and 2 characters for origination notation.
Example of product number: ABC 101 001 (1/ABC 101 01/1234) 123/ABCDE 101 1010/12345

structMember.name: productRevision
structMember.description:
Indicates the revision state of the product. It consists of a letter R or P, one or two digits and/or one or two letters. The maximum number of characters is four inclusive R or P. Example: R1A, R1A02, P7B
A suffix may be added to the revision state. The suffix may consists of one or two digits or one letter.

structMember.name: serialNumber
structMember.description: The serial number consists of 13 alphanumerical characters grouped as 6 plus 7 characters. The first 6 characters are to be used for factory codes and the last 7 characters are used for an individual number or batch number.

structMember.name: productionDate
structMember.description:
The production date can be represented in two ways.
1) The preferable syntax is a four-digit representation of the year, and a two-digit representation of the month and a two-digit representation of the day. The numbers of characters in this case, is eight. Example: 19991231
2) The date can also consist of two digits for the year, followed by the letter W for week and two digits for the number of week. The numbers of characters in this case, is five. Example: 99W12

structMember.name: countryCode
structMember.description: Two letter country code.

structMember.name: descriptionOfFault
structMember.description: Specific description of the fault observed. It is also important that other external factors are described as well. For product safety reasons also specify fire, water damage, and so on.

structMember.name: preparedBy
structMember.description: Name of the person preparing the log entry.

structMember.name: reference
structMember.description: Compliant reference.

structMember.name: stateCode
structMember.description:
The HW status when the failure occurred:
R = repaired unit failed during installation or test S = unit in service failure occurred T = new unit failed during installation or test

structMember.name: timeDate
structMember.description: Time stamp date and time as yymmdd hhmmss.

structMember.name: trNumber
structMember.description: If the board has a connection with a trouble report, the trNumber must be supplied.

struct.name: PowerMeasurements
struct.description: Specifies information related to current and voltage of a subrack.

structMember.name: currentLeft
structMember.description:
Specifies the value of the current, supplied from the leftmost slot in the subrack.
The value -1 means that no current measurement is available.

structMember.name: currentRight
structMember.description:
Specifies the value of the current, supplied from the rightmost slot in the subrack.
The value -1 means that no current measurement is available.

structMember.name: voltageLeft
structMember.description:
Specifies the value of the voltage, distributed from the leftmost slot in the subrack.
The value -1 means that no voltage measurement is available.

structMember.name: voltageRight
structMember.description:
Specifies the value of the voltage, distributed from the rightmost slot in the subrack.
The value -1 means that no voltage measurement is available.

structMember.name: distributedPower
structMember.description:
Specifies the total distribution of power in the subrack.
This attribute is applicable only if all other measurements in this struct are available.

struct.name: OperatingMode
struct.description: The operating mode

structMember.name: autoNegotiation
structMember.description:
Specifies if autonegotiation is enabled or disabled on this port.
Autonegotiation must be enabled for SFP ports and when port speed and duplex settings are configured as ETH_1000_MB_FULL or ETH_1000_MB_HALF.
Changing autonegotiation to OFF (manual mode), affects the automatic MDI/MDI-X configuration, which will change into manual mode as well (forcing a need to consider whether straight through or crossover cables shall be used).

structMember.name: configuredSpeedDuplex
structMember.description:
If autoNegotiation is false, this attribute specifies the fixed operating mode for the port. If autoNegotiation is true, it specifies the minimum acceptable operating mode for the port. If the minimum mode is not achieved, a link failure alarm is raised on the port.
If ETH_1000_MB_HALF or ETH_1000_MB_FULL is selected, autoNegotiation must be true. Selecting ETH_1000_MB_HALF or ETH_1000_MB_FULL when autoNegotiation is false, will disable the port.

struct.name: VidInformation
struct.description: Vlan identifier information

structMember.name: egressUntag
structMember.description: Untag at egress

structMember.name: vid
structMember.description: VLAN identifier

struct.name: PbitQueue
struct.description:
Maps the priorities (pbits) to queues. The pbits can take values from 0 to 7, each of which can be mapped to one of four queues.
Default values : pBit 0 -> 1 pBit 1 -> 0 pBit 2 -> 1 pBit 3 -> 1 pBit 4 -> 2 pBit 5 -> 2 pBit 6 -> 3 pBit 7 -> 3
Example: pBit 0, 1 and 3 all map to queue 1 by default.

structMember.name: queue
structMember.description: The switch queue.

structMember.name: pbit
structMember.description: The priority bit of the IP packet.

struct.name: EthModOperatingMode
struct.description: The operating mode on the Ethernet Module Port

structMember.name: autoNegotiation
structMember.description: See the descriptions of the relevant boards for the supported speeds and autonegotiation modes.

structMember.name: configuredSpeedDuplex
structMember.description: Specifies the operating speed for this port.

struct.name: PbitQueue8
struct.description:
Maps the priorities (pbits) to queues. The pbits can take values from 0 to 7, each of which can be mapped to one of eight queues.
Default values : pBit 0 -> 1 pBit 1 -> 0 pBit 2 -> 2 pBit 3 -> 3 pBit 4 -> 4 pBit 5 -> 5 pBit 6 -> 6 pBit 7 -> 7
Example: pBit 0 maps to queue 1 by default.

structMember.name: queue

structMember.name: pbit

Non-contiguous subnet mask: 11111111.11111111.11111111.11111010 (X = 250)

Indicates if the route should be redistributed.

structMember.name: bootFileName

structMember.name: serverHostName
structMember.description: Optional server host name. Set to "" if no name was provided by the DHCP Server.

structMember.name: clientHwAddress
structMember.description: The client HW address. The MAC address of the interface in interfaceName.

structMember.name: relayAgentIpAddress
structMember.description: The ip address of the DHCP Relay Agent, if the DHCP request was relayed.

structMember.name: yourIpAddress
