structMember.name: clientIpAddress
structMember.description: The client Ip Address. This attribute is not used.

structMember.name: interfaceName
structMember.description: The IP link interface name used to send out DHCP request.

structMember.name: broadcastAddress
structMember.description:
Applicable only if ipAddress is an IPv4 address.
The input format for an IPv4 address is four fields of digits, separated by a dot. Each field consists of one to three digits.

structMember.name: ipAddress
structMember.description:
Specifies an IPv4 address.
The input format for an IPv4 address is four fields of digits, separated by a dot. Each field consists of one to three digits.

structMember.name: prefixLength
structMember.description: Network Prefix Length.

struct.name: DscpPbit
struct.description:
Default values according to IEEE 802.1p :
pBit 0 -> DSCP 0, 48, 56 pBit 1 -> DSCP 10, 12, 14 pBit 2 -> spare pBit 3 -> DSCP 18, 20, 22 pBit 4 -> DSCP 26, 28, 30 pBit 5 -> DSCP 34, 36, 38 pBit 6 -> DSCP 46 pBit 7 -> not used
All other DSCP values maps to priority 0.

structMember.name: dscp
structMember.description:
DSCP - differentiated services code point.
The number of members in this sequence is 64.

structMember.name: pbit
structMember.description:
802.1p priorities according to IEEE 8021D: 0 - Best effort 1 - Background 2 - Spare 3 - Excellent effort 4 - Controlled load 5 - Voice, less than 100 ms delay 6 - Voice, less than 10 ms delay 7 - Network control
The number of members in this sequence is 64.

struct.name: AclEntry
struct.description: Access Control List Entry

structMember.name: localIpAddress
structMember.description: The input format is four fields of digits, separated by a dot. Each field consists of one to three digits.

structMember.name: remoteIpAddress
structMember.description: The input format is four fields of digits, separated by a dot. Each field consists of one to three digits.

structMember.name: localPortFiltering
structMember.description: If set to true, the filter rule matches on the specific port number mentioned in the localPort attribute. If set to false, all possible ports are used.

structMember.name: remotePortFiltering
structMember.description: If set to true, the filter rule matches on the specific port number mentioned in the remotePort attribute. If set to false, all possible ports are used.

structMember.name: protocol
structMember.description: Specifies the protocol that matches.

structMember.name: aclAction
structMember.description: The performed action.

structMember.name: localIpAddressMask
structMember.description:
Specifies the number of most significant bits that match in the localIpAddress.
If this field is set to 0, all local IP addresses match, independently of the value set in the field localIpAddress.

structMember.name: localPort
structMember.description: The local port.

structMember.name: remoteIpAddressMask
structMember.description:
Specifies the number of most significant bits that match in the remoteIpAddress.
If this field is set to 0, all remote IP addresses match, independently of the value set in the field remoteIpAddress.

structMember.name: remotePort
structMember.description: The remote port.

structMember.name: icmpType
structMember.description: Specifies the ICMP type value (as specified by IANA). This field is only valid if the protocol is set to ICMP. The value 256 is used to state that all possible values are included.

structMember.name: dscp
structMember.description: DSCP value of the IP Packet Header. The number of members in this sequence is 64 (0-63).

structMember.name: queue
structMember.description: Queue number between 1 and 8. The number of members in this sequence is 64 (0-63).

struct.name: EmergencyInfo
struct.description:
This attribute provides information about the current EmergencyState.
For the states NEVER_USED and USE_DISABLED the return value for time is insignificant.

structMember.name: state
structMember.description: The current emergency state of the license server.

structMember.name: time
structMember.description:
Indicates the remaining time in state ACTIVE or ACTIVE_AGAIN.
The time out values for the states ACTIVE and ACTIVE_AGAIN is 7 days.
The time out value is 0 when the state is NEVER_USED, USE_DEGRADED and USE_DISABLED.
1 day = 86400 s 7 days = 604800 s

structMember.name: expiryTime
structMember.description:
Indicates the expiry time as a string with the following format "yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss".
The expiry time value is empty when the state is NEVER_USED, USE_DEGRADED and USE_DISABLED.

struct.name: IntegrationUnlockInfo
struct.description:
This attribute provides information about the current IntegrationUnlockState.
For the states NEVER_USED and USE_DISABLED the return value for remaining time is insignificant.

structMember.name: state
structMember.description: The current integration unlock state of the license server.

structMember.name: remainingTime
structMember.description:
Indicates the remaining time in state ACTIVATED
The time out value for the state ACTIVATED is 21 days.
The time out value is 0 when the state is NEVER_USED or USE_DISABLED.
1 day = 86400 s 21 days = 1814400 s

structMember.name: expiryTime
structMember.description:
Indicates the expiry time as a string with the following format "yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss".
The expiry time value is empty when the state is NEVER_USED or USE_DISABLED.

structMember.name: lastSent
structMember.description:
Date and time when the last file was transferred.
The attribute is updated even if the transfer is unsuccessful.

structMember.name: transferInformation
structMember.description: Information about the last file transfer, including information about whether it was successful.

structMember.name: name
structMember.description: The name of the attribute.

structMember.name: value
structMember.description: The value of the attribute.

structMember.name: message
structMember.description:
Provides additional results.
The initial value is an emtpy string (""). Currently not used.

structMember.name: startTime
structMember.description:
The time the health check starts.
Format: yyyy:MM:dd HH:mm
The initial value is an empty string ("").

structMember.name: healthCheckResultCode

structMember.name: time

The time of the day, when the action startHealthCheck starts.
Format: hh:mm
hh - hour mm - minutes

structMember.name: weekday
structMember.description: The weekday, when the action startHealthCheck starts.

structMember.name: atmLayerDescription

structMember.name: etType

structMember.name: tdmSupport

structMember.name: productionDate
structMember.description:
The production date is represented in two ways:
- the preferred syntax is four-digits for the year, two digits for the month, and two digits for the day, a total of eight characters. Example: 19991231
- the date is also be represented by two digits for the year, followed by the letter W for week, and two digits for the number of the week, a total of five characters. Example: 99W52
The production date is mandatory for the MOs: ConfigurationVersion, UpgradePackage and LoadModule.

structMember.name: productName
structMember.description:
The name of the product.
The product name is mandatory for the MOs: ConfigurationVersion, UpgradePackage, LoadModule, PiuType, Subrack and SubrackProdType.

structMember.description:
The product number of the product or document.
Examples: ABC 101 001, CXC 123 456, 1/BFD 101 999
For UpgradePackage, this is the document number of the upgrade package.
Maximum length for a product number is 36 when referring to a document.
The product number is mandatory for the MOs: ConfigurationVersion, UpgradePackage, LoadModule, PiuType, Subrack and SubrackProdType.

The revision state of the product.
Examples: R1, R1A, R1A02, P7B
The product revision is mandatory for the MOs: ConfigurationVersion, UpgradePackage, LoadModule, PiuType, Subrack and SubrackProdType.

structMember.name: serialNumber
structMember.description: The serial number consists of 13 alphanumerical characters grouped as 6 plus 7 characters. The first 6 characters are to be used for factory codes and the last 7 characters are used for an individual number or batch number.

structMember.name: testState
structMember.description: Current state of battery test.

structMember.name: measuredElapsedTime
structMember.description: Time from test start until execution of this action Dependencies: The parameter value is undefined if parameter testState is PENDING.

structMember.name: measuredConsumedCapacityInTest
structMember.description: Measured total consumed capacity from test start until execution of this action Dependencies: The parameter value is undefined if parameter testState is PENDING.

structMember.name: estimatedRemainingBackupTime
structMember.description: Calculated estimate of remaining backup time Dependencies: The value is only defined if a battery capacity test is executed. The parameter value is undefined if a battery backup time test is executed. The parameter value is undefined if parameter testState is PENDING.

structMember.name: initiation
structMember.description: Describes how the battery test was initiated.

structMember.name: startDate
structMember.description: The date the battery test was started. Format: "YYYYMMDD"

structMember.name: startTime
structMember.description: The time the battery test was started. Format: "HH:MM", 24 h format

structMember.name: measuredConsumedCapacity
structMember.description: Measured total consumed capacity from test start until end of test

structMember.name: measuredBackupTime
structMember.description: The measured time from test start until end of test

structMember.name: estimatedNominalBatteryCapacity
structMember.description: Estimated nominal battery capacity of the tested battery Dependencies: The parameter value is undefined if a battery backup time test was executed.

structMember.name: estimatedBatteryStateOfHealth
structMember.description: Estimated state-of-health of the tested battery. State-Of-Health is calculated as: estimatedNominalBatteryCapacity / referenceBatteryCapacity * 100 Dependencies: The parameter value is undefined if a battery backup time test was executed.

structMember.name: outcome
structMember.description:
Outcome of the automatic evaluation of the battery test Possible values: • UNDEFINED • PASSED • FAILED
Dependencies: For a battery capacity test, the evaluation is done by comparing the estimatedBatteryStateOfHealth with the minimumStateOfHealth, if test mode is set to CONFIGURED. If testMode is set to AUTOMATIC, the estimatedBatteryStateOfHealth is compared with 70%. For a battery backup time test, the evaluation is done by comparing the measuredBackupTime with the minimumBackupTime.

structMember.name: faultReason
structMember.description: The reason why the configuration failed.

structMember.name: faultInformation
structMember.description: Additional Information describing the configuration fault.

structMember.name: modificationState
structMember.description: Indicates the status of the modification operation.

structMember.name: modificationInformation
structMember.description: Indicates the progress of the modification operation.

structMember.name: countryCode
structMember.description: Two-letter country-code.

structMember.name: descriptionOfFault
structMember.description: Specific description of the fault observed.

structMember.name: preparedBy
structMember.description: Name of the operator preparing the log entry.

structMember.name: reference
structMember.description: Complaint reference.

structMember.name: stateCode
structMember.description:
The hardware status when the failure occurred.
R = Repaired unit failed during installation or test. S = Unit in service when failure occurred. T = New unit failed during installation or test.

structMember.name: timeDate
structMember.description: Date and time when the log entry was written in the format "yymmdd hhmmss"

structMember.name: trNumber
structMember.description: A trouble report number.

structMember.name: noLimit
structMember.description: Specifies if no limit is applied.

structMember.name: value
structMember.description: The value to apply, if noLimit is false.

structMember.name: startDate
structMember.description: Date when the grace period was activated by the system. Is empty if the grace period has not yet been triggered. Timstamp Format is YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS (local time)

structMember.name: originalLicenseLimit
structMember.description: Shows which value the capacity license had when it entered Grace Period.

structMember.name: isGracePeriodControlled
structMember.description: Indicates if a grace period is supported for the capacity.

structMember.name: gracePeriodState
structMember.description: Indicates the current state of the grace period.

structMember.name: stopDate
structMember.description: Date when sharp licence control for this capacity license will be enforced. Is empty if the grace period has not yet been triggered. Timstamp Format is YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS (local time)

structMember.name: fileName
structMember.description: The full remote path and filename denoting a certificate file on a remote host (file server).

structMember.name: serialNumber
structMember.description:
A string of decimal digits containing the unique serial number of the certificate assigned by the certificate issuer.
Restriction: The only allowed characters for this string are the digits 0 to 9.

structMember.name: fingerprint
structMember.description:
A string in the following format: <hash-algorithm> [Fingerprint] = <bb1>:<bb2>: .. :<bbn>
where: <hash-algorithm> is MD5, SHA-1 or SHA1, and the substring Fingerprint is optional. The equals sign is mandatory and is followed by 16 (MD5) or 20 (SHA-1 or SHA1) bytes encoded in hexadecimal and separated by colon signs.
Examples:
MD5 Fingerprint=A4:AA:A6:35:70:AB:57:DC:34:27:8B:65:BE:CF:9B:9C
SHA-1 Fingerprint=B6:12:31:B4:C7:03:20:62:F2:2A:B3:3D:E8:2D:0C:8F:C9:73:BC:39
SHA1 Fingerprint=B6:12:31:B4:C7:03:20:62:F2:2A:B3:3D:E8:2D:0C:8F:C9:73:BC:39
The fingerprint hash value is computed on the DER encoding of the X.509 certificate.

structMember.name: issuer
structMember.description: A string representation of the X.509 name of the authority that has issued the certificate.

structMember.name: subject
structMember.description: A string representation of the X.509 name denoting the entity for which the certificate was issued.

structMember.name: serialNumber
structMember.description: A string representation of the certificate serial number (up to 40 digits long).

structMember.name: notValidBefore
structMember.description:
The time format is specified in UTC time. The format is : YYYYMMDDHHMMSS
Example: The valid format for UTC time 6 minutes, 27 seconds after 21:00 on 6 November 1985 is 19851106210627

structMember.name: notValidAfter
structMember.description:
The time format is specified in UTC time. The format is : YYYYMMDDHHMMSS
Example: The valid format for UTC time 6 minutes, 27 seconds after 21:00 on 6 November 1985 is 19851106210627

structMember.name: fingerprint
structMember.description:
A string in the following format: <hash-algorithm> [Fingerprint] = <bb1>:<bb2>: .. :<bbn>
where: <hash-algorithm> is MD5, SHA-1 or SHA1, and the substring Fingerprint is optional. The equals sign is mandatory and is followed by 16 (MD5) or 20 (SHA-1 or SHA1) bytes encoded in hexadecimal and separated by colon signs.
Examples:
MD5 Fingerprint=A4:AA:A6:35:70:AB:57:DC:34:27:8B:65:BE:CF:9B:9C
SHA-1 Fingerprint=B6:12:31:B4:C7:03:20:62:F2:2A:B3:3D:E8:2D:0C:8F:C9:73:BC:39
SHA1 Fingerprint=B6:12:31:B4:C7:03:20:62:F2:2A:B3:3D:E8:2D:0C:8F:C9:73:BC:39
The fingerprint hash value is computed on the DER encoding of the X.509 certificate.

structMember.name: caFingerPrint
structMember.description:
The certificate fingerprint for the Certificate Authority which issues the node certificate.
The fingerprint is a string in the following format:<hash-algorithm> [Fingerprint] = <bb1>:<bb2>: .. :<bbn>
where: <hash-algorithm> is MD5, SHA-1 or SHA1, and the substring Fingerprint is optional. The equals sign is mandatory and is followed by 16 (MD5) or 20 (SHA-1 or SHA1) bytes encoded in hexadecimal and separated by colon signs.
Examples:
MD5 Fingerprint=A4:AA:A6:35:70:AB:57:DC:34:27:8B:65:BE:CF:9B:9C
SHA-1 Fingerprint=B6:12:31:B4:C7:03:20:62:F2:2A:B3:3D:E8:2D:0C:8F:C9:73:BC:39
SHA1 Fingerprint=B6:12:31:B4:C7:03:20:62:F2:2A:B3:3D:E8:2D:0C:8F:C9:73:BC:39

structMember.name: enrollmentServerURL
structMember.description:
This must be a full URL for the enrollment server to use. The URL contains: method, host, an optional port, and URI parts.
The method is always http://
The host must be an IPv4 or IPv6 address.
The input format for an IPv4 address is four fields of digits, separated by a dot. Each field consists of one to three digits. Example: 192.168.33.27
The input format for an IPv6 address is as defined in specification RFC 4291, chapter 2.2, bullet 1 and 2. Example: [2001:db8:0::1] Note that the square brackets are included in the URL to distinguish the host IPv6 address from the port designation.
The optional port designation is written by appending a colon followed by the port to the host part. Example: 192.168.33.27:8080. If no port is given, the default HTTP port 80 is used.
The URI is the resource identifier of the resource on the server which will process the request. Example: /cgi-bin/pkiclient.exe
Complete URLs with the above examples: http://192.168.33.27:8080/cgi-bin/pkiclient.exe http://[2001:db8:0::1]:8080/cgi-bin/pkiclient.exe

structMember.name: distinguishedName
structMember.description:
The Distinguished Name (DN) to be used in the Subject field of the requested certificate. The component fields of the DN are encoded as FIELDNAME "=" VALUE where fields are separated with a comma (,) character.
Example: C=SE, L=LI, O=Ericsson AB, OU=PJF/LO, CN=RBS 123
As the comma character is used as field delimiter, a field value cannot contain it.
This string cannot be empty.

structMember.name: challengePassword
structMember.description: A string which allows the enrollment server to authenticate the request.

structMember.name: rollbackTimeOut
structMember.description:
If this parameter is set to a positive value and if no confirmation action has been executed within the rollback timeout, a rollback is performed automatically. After this rollback, the previous node credential applies.
This mechanism is a safeguard against the risk that the new credentials are unusable.
If this parameter is set to zero, no rollback takes place. It is recommended to set this parameter to 10 minutes.

structMember.name: issuer
structMember.description: A string representation of the X.509 name of the authority that has issued the certificate.

structMember.name: subject
structMember.description: A string representation of the X.509 name denoting the entity for which the certificate was issued.

structMember.name: serialNumber
structMember.description: A string representation of the certificate serial number (up to 10 digits long).

structMember.name: notValidBefore
structMember.description:
The time format is specified in UTC time. The format is : YYYYMMDDHHMMSS
Example: The valid format for UTC time 6 minutes, 27 seconds after 21:00 on 6 November 1985 is 19851106210627

structMember.name: notValidAfter
structMember.description:
The time format is specified in UTC time. The format is : YYYYMMDDHHMMSS
Example: The valid format for UTC time 6 minutes, 27 seconds after 21:00 on 6 November 1985 is 19851106210627

structMember.name: fingerprint
structMember.description:
A string in the following format: <hash-algorithm> [Fingerprint] = <bb1>:<bb2>: .. :<bbn>
where: <hash-algorithm> is MD5, SHA-1 or SHA1, and the substring Fingerprint is optional. The equals sign is mandatory and is followed by 16 (MD5) or 20 (SHA-1 or SHA1) bytes encoded in hexadecimal and separated by colon signs.
Examples:
MD5 Fingerprint=A4:AA:A6:35:70:AB:57:DC:34:27:8B:65:BE:CF:9B:9C
SHA-1 Fingerprint=B6:12:31:B4:C7:03:20:62:F2:2A:B3:3D:E8:2D:0C:8F:C9:73:BC:39
SHA1 Fingerprint=B6:12:31:B4:C7:03:20:62:F2:2A:B3:3D:E8:2D:0C:8F:C9:73:BC:39
The fingerprint hash value is computed on the DER encoding of the X.509 certificate.

struct.name: BoardTypePositions
struct.description:
Indicates the slot positions in the subrack where it is possible to insert the CMXB, SCU and TU boards.
If any of these positions are not specified, then a board type position with the value 0 is created.

structMember.name: cmxbPositionA
structMember.description:
Indicates the slot position in the subrack where the Ethernet Switch Board, CMXB, is situated.
This value must not be greater than defNumberOfSlots or numberOfSlots. 0 indicates that this board is not supported.

structMember.name: cmxbPositionB
structMember.description:
Indicates the slot position in the subrack where the Ethernet Switch Board, CMXB, is situated.
This value must not be greater than defNumberOfSlots or numberOfSlots. 0 indicates that this board is not supported.

structMember.name: scuPositionA
structMember.description:
Indicates the slot position in the subrack where the Switch Control Unit (SCU) board is situated.
This value must not be greater than defNumberOfSlots or numberOfSlots. 0 indicates that this board is not supported.

structMember.name: scuPositionB
structMember.description:
Indicates the slot position in the subrack where the Switch Control Unit (SCU) board is situated.
This value must not be greater than defNumberOfSlots or numberOfSlots. 0 indicates that this board is not supported.

structMember.name: tuPositionA
structMember.description:
Indicates the slot position in the subrack where the Timing Unit (TU) board is situated.
This value must not be greater than defNumberOfSlots or numberOfSlots. 0 indicates that this board is not supported.

structMember.name: tuPositionB
structMember.description:
Indicates the slot position in the subrack where the Timing Unit (TU) board is situated.
This value must not be greater than defNumberOfSlots or numberOfSlots. 0 indicates that this board is not supported.

struct.name: ProgramInstance
struct.description: Contains properties for one program instance.

structMember.name: distribution
structMember.description:
Specifies the processor and/or processor core, where the program instance executes.
In case of a single CPU or a single core, this value must be set to 0.
The instances can be distributed within only one PlugInUnit MO.

structMember.name: instanceId
structMember.description:
The instance ID of the program at the resource layer.
The value 0 means that it is not instatiated.

structMember.name: restartGroup
structMember.description:
The restart group this program instance belongs to. It controls the error escalation.
The value 0 means that this program instance does not belong to any restart group.

structMember.name: satellite
structMember.description: The satellite number.

structMember.name: elevation
structMember.description: The elevation of the satellite.

structMember.name: azimuth
structMember.description: The azimuth of the satellite.

structMember.name: signalNoiseRatio
structMember.description: The signal noise ratio (SNR) of the satellite.

structMember.name: clockIdentity
structMember.description:
The clock identity.
The value is presented as a hexadecimal value.

structMember.name: ptpPortNumber
structMember.description: The port number.

struct.name: NodeBLocalCellReadNbapDataStruct
struct.description: User category: Ericsson personnel

structMember.name: cId
structMember.description:
The cId, cell identifier, is the identifier of a cell in one RNC.
Requirement: CELL_RBS_FU:11, CELL_RBS_OM:1
structMember.specification: 3GPP TS 25.433, NBAP, UTRAN Iub interface NBAP signalling

structMember.name: maxTransmissionPower
structMember.description:
The maximum transmission power allowed for the cell. This parameter is currently unused by the RBS.
Requirement: CELL_RBS_FU:11, CELL_RBS_OM:1
structMember.specification: 3GPP TS 25.433, NBAP, UTRAN Iub interface NBAP signalling

structMember.name: numberOfInSyncInd
structMember.description:
Defines the number of successive in-sync indications after which the RBS must trigger the Radio Link Restore procedure.
Requirement: CELL_RBS_FU:11, CELL_RBS_OM:1
structMember.specification: 3GPP TS 25.433, NBAP, UTRAN Iub interface NBAP signalling

structMember.name: numberOfOutOfSyncInd
structMember.description:
Defines the number of successive out-of-sync indications after which the timer T_RLFAILURE must be restarted. See Dedicated Radio Link Handling, 7/155 17-HRB 105 102/1.
Requirement: CELL_RBS_FU:11, CELL_RBS_OM:1

structMember.name: tCell
structMember.description:
Timing delay defining start of SCH, CPICH and DL Scrambling Code(s) in a cell relative BFN.
Possible values: • CHIP_0 • CHIP_1024 • CHIP_1280 • CHIP_1536 • CHIP_1792 • CHIP_2048 • CHIP_2304 • CHIP_256 • CHIP_512 • CHIP_768
Requirement: CELL_RBS_FU:11, CELL_RBS_OM:1
structMember.specification: 3GPP TS 25.433, NBAP, UTRAN Iub interface NBAP signalling

structMember.name: tRlFailure
structMember.description:
The timer T_RLFAILURE used in the Radio Link Failure procedure.
Requirement: CELL_RBS_FU:11, CELL_RBS_OM:1
structMember.specification: 3GPP TS 25.433, NBAP, UTRAN Iub interface NBAP signalling

structMember.name: eulNoiseFloorLock
structMember.description: When set to true, locks the noise floor level. Used in conjunction with eulOptimalNoiseFloorEstimate to be able to lock the noise floor level to either the current level, when eulOptimalNoiseFloorEstimate is set to -1 (= undefined) or to a value defined in eulOptimalNoiseFloorEstimate.

structMember.name: eulOptimalNoiseFloorEstimate
structMember.description: Used in conjunction with eullNoiseFloorLock to be able to lock the noise floor level to either the current level, when eulOptimalNoiseFloorEstimate is set to -1 (=undefined value), or to a value defined in eulOptimalNoiseFloorEstimate.

structMember.name: eulDynRotMin
structMember.description:
The minimum RoT level allowed, that is the minimum value allowed for eulMaxRotCoverage and Dynamic RoT Level.
Requirement: DYNROT1_AD_RBS-OSS_3051:00632 Rev A

structMember.name: eulDynRotMax
structMember.description:
The maximum RoT level allowed, that is the maximum value allowed for eulMaxRotCoverage and Dynamic RoT Level.
Requirement: DYNROT1_AD_RBS-OSS_3051:00631 Rev A

class.name: ManagedObject
class.description: The ManagedObject MO represents a generic MO type. It does not represent any real resource in the system and can therefore not be instanciated. It is used as a MO-reference that can refer to multiple MO types.

class.name: SubrackProdType
class.description:
Subrack Product Type
Defines data specific for a subrack type, such as the configuration for the number of slots and the administrative product data.
Instances of this MO are created automatically during system upgrade. It is also possible to create instances manually, but this is not recommended.

attribute.name: boardPositions
attribute.description:
Indicates the slot positions in the subrack where it is possible to insert the CMXB, SCU and TU boards.
If any of these positions are not specified, then a board type position with the value 0 is created.

attribute.name: defNumberOfSlots
attribute.description: Defines the number of slots to be created in the subrack.

attribute.name: fanConfiguration
attribute.description:
Indicates the fan configuration in the subrack.
It is silent ignored if the attribute numberOfDenibDevices in MO Subrack is set to > -1. In this case the numberOfDenibDevices overrides this attribute for the fan configuration.

attribute.name: maxPowerDissipation
attribute.description:
Enables programs to read the specified maximum power dissipation.
This reading is needed to prevent subrack from overheating.

attribute.name: productData
attribute.description:
Specifies the product data for the backplane of the subrack.
Recommended: Exclude the trailing letters in the product revision of this MO. Examples: - R2B corresponds to R2 - R2B/3 remains as R2B/3 - R2B/A corresponds to R2

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

attribute.name: SubrackProdTypeId
attribute.description:
The value component of the RDN.
It is set automatically during system upgrade.
Note that if this MO is manually created (not recommended) the value for this attribute has to be set.

attribute.name: transmissionType
attribute.description: Specifies the type of transmission.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

class.name: Slot
class.description:
This MO represents a slot in a subrack. A slot can hold a plug-in-unit, a board represented by the PlugInUnit MO.
The number of slots in a subrack is specified when defining the Subrack MO.
The required number of Slot MOs are created automatically at creation of the Subrack MO, and cannot be deleted.
The RDN of this MO is selected with Slot=1 at the leftmost slot, and with incremental numbering towards the right hand side of the subrack.

attribute.name: SlotId
attribute.description:
The value component of the RDN.
It is set automatically when the MO instance is created.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: slotState
attribute.description: Indicates the state of the slot.

attribute.name: slotNumber
attribute.description: The number of the slot position from the left hand side, starting with 1.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

attribute.name: productData
attribute.description:
Describes the plug-in-unit that is currently inserted. The information is only available when slotState = USED.
If the board inserted in the slot stops working or is pulled out of the slot, the productData attribute will not change its value. The value of this attribute is changed when a new board is inserted into the slot.

attribute.name: upgradeGroupId
attribute.description:
This attribute can to group a number of PIUs, all in the group can be upgraded at the same time.
If upgradeGroupTypeName is "", this attribute is not used.

attribute.name: upgradeGroupTypeName
attribute.description: The upgradeGroupTypeName, together with the upgradeGroupId, defines an upgrade group.

attribute.name: activeSwAllocation
attribute.description:
The SwAllocation instance, among the predefined instances, which is active.
The SwAllocation instance which is active is the one currently used by the PlugInUnit, configured in this Slot. If no PlugInUnit is configured or if no matching SwAllocation, containing the specific PiuType, is found, the value of this attribute is null.

action.name: updateConfiguration
action.description: If autoConfiguration is enabled in ManagedElementData, this action will trigger auto configuration activities for the slot.

class.name: Equipment
class.description:
This MO is used as a structural element for the network element, that is, it only acts as a container for other MOs. This MO structures the equipment of the network element.
This MO is created automatically and cannot be deleted.
The RDN of this MO is Equipment=1.

attribute.name: EquipmentId
attribute.description:
The value component of the RDN.
It is set automatically when the MO instance is created.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: lastHwPiChange
attribute.description: Indicates the timestamp when the last hardware product information is changed.

class.name: Subrack
class.description: This MO is used to represent a subrack.

attribute.name: SubrackId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: switchModule
attribute.description:
Reference to a SwitchModule MO, where the switch module number is retrieved.
This number describes how the subrack is connected to the node, that is, how the subrack's cables are connected to the hub subrack. The hub subrack has switch module number 0. The default value of this attribute is NULL, which means that the switch module number is 0.
If the attribute transmissionType in the MO SubrackProdType is set to ATM_TRANSMISSION or ETHERNET10G, this attribute is mandatory. If transmissionType is set to ETHERNET_CABLE or ETHERNET_1G_10G, this attribute must be set to NULL.

attribute.name: subrackType
attribute.description: There can only be one hub subrack in the node. The hub subrack is used to control switching and synchronization for the complete node.

attribute.name: productType
attribute.description: This attribute describes the product type and is always set to the value "HW".

attribute.name: administrativeProductData
attribute.description:
Specifies the product information for the backplane of the subrack. The production date is not used.
Setting of this attribute will not have any effect.
attribute.deprecated: Replaced by attribute productData in MO SubrackProdType. This attribute will provide the same value as the replaced attribute.

attribute.name: subrackPosition
attribute.description:
Specifies the subrack position within a cabinet.
The purpose of this attribute is to help in troubleshooting as its value is included in the alarm information.
The subrack position is also included in the product inventory.
The subrack position consists of: - a mandatory integer (1-n) stating the cabinet ID, starting from the left, - a mandatory letter (A-Z) stating the Subrack vertical position, starting from the ground, and - an optional integer (1-n) stating the Subrack horizontal position, starting from the left.
Example: 1B2, 5C

attribute.name: cabinetPosition
attribute.description:
Specifies the position of the cabinet, within a group of other cabinets, in which this subrack is placed.
The purpose of this attribute is to help in troubleshooting as its value is included in the alarm information.

attribute.name: numberOfSlots
attribute.description:
Specifies the actual number of slots configured on the node.
This attribute is set to the value of defNumberOfSlots in MO SubrackProdType at create of the subrack.

attribute.name: operationalProductData
attribute.description: The operational product data describes the backplane of the subrack that is actually installed.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

attribute.name: subrackProdTypeRef
attribute.description:
Reference to an instance of SubrackProdType MO.
This attribute must be specified if administrativeProductData is not used.
If it is not specified, detection of a SubrackProdType MO with the exact matching product data is done, and if successful, attribute subrackProdTypeRef is set. If a SubrackProdType is not found, then the creation of the Subrack is rejected.
If both attributes administrativeProductData and subrackProdTypeRef are specified, this administrativeProductData is replaced by the product data for the SubrackProdType MO.

attribute.name: subrackNumber
attribute.description:
The number of the subrack.
If switchModule is set, any setting of this attribute will be ignored. It will instead display the value already set in the attribute switchModuleNumber, in the referred SwitchModule MO.

attribute.name: powerMeasurements
attribute.description: Indicates the power measurements of the subrack.

attribute.name: maxPowerDissipation
attribute.description: Indicates the maximum power dissipation of the subrack.

attribute.name: numberOfDenibDevices
attribute.description:
Specifies the total number of fans in the Denib-chain connected to the subrack.
This attribute is set to -1 by default, indicating that no Denib devices are used, and the attribute fanConfiguration then specifies the fan configuration for the subrack.
If fanConfiguration in MO SubrackProdType is set to NO_CPP_FAN, or BFD7422019_ONE, or EGEM2_TWO, then no external fan devices can be connected, and this attribute can only be set to -1.
If this attribute is set, it will always override the value in fanConfiguration.
If numberOfDenibDevices is to be changed, set this to 0 first to disable fan supervision. Configuration or maintenance changes can then be done to the Denib-chain of devices without generating any alarms. After HW changes, update the configuration accordingly, and then set the desired value for numberOfDenibDevices. This will then reactivate the fan supervision, and is the recommended way of working.
Otherwise, if fan supervision is activated and numberOfDenibDevices is to be changed to a value greater than 0, the cables from the SCBs must be disconnected from the fan units first. Wait about 3 min after the disconnection before setting the attribute.

action.name: removeSlots
action.description:
Removes the given number of Slot MOs from the model. The Slots with the highest slotNumber are removed. After this action no Slot will have APN = 0. The attribute numberOfSlots will be updated.
If there is a child MO the action will fail and the MOHasChildrenException is thrown.

parameter.name: numberOfSlotsToRemove
parameter.description: The number of slots to remove.

class.name: PlugInUnit
class.description:
Plug-In Unit
This MO represents a plug-in unit, that is a board inserted in a slot in a subrack.
There are two mutually exclusively sets of LED attributes, depending on the version of the system. The sets are (greenLed, redLed, yellowLed) and (faultIndicator, operationalIndicator, maintenanceIndicator). The set not in use will display the value NOT_APPLICABLE for its attributes.

attribute.name: PlugInUnitId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: The administrative state.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description:
The operational state.
It is set to ENABLED when the basic OS is started, all other programs on the MP/BP are loaded/started, and all hardware tests during start-up are performed.

attribute.name: productType
attribute.description: Describes the product type.

attribute.name: piuType
attribute.description: Reference to an instance of PiuType.

attribute.name: piuGroupNumber
attribute.description:
Indicates which restart group the plug-in unit belongs to.
A restart group consists of a number of plug-in units, where at least one must be enabled (working) or performing recovery. When no plug-in unit in a group is working, the node is restarted automatically.
Must have a positive value.
Zero indicates no group.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

attribute.name: pmProcessorLoad
attribute.description: The average CPU load on the whole system (all the cores) during the last 5 minutes.
attribute.condition: Automatic and continuous measurement, where the CPU average for the last 5 minutes is calculated every time the value is read. The CPU load is defined as 1 - bg in percent, where bg is defined as background load.

attribute.name: allowedSeqRestarts
attribute.description:
The number of automatic sequential restarts that are allowed for a PIU. When this number of automatic restarts has been exceeded, the automatic restarting halts and the PIU is fault-marked.
The time limit between two restarts is 5 minutes. This means that if the time between two restarts is less than 5 minutes, the restarts are counted, otherwise the restart counter is reset.
For example, RESTARTS_WITH_WARM means 3 restarts with time limit less than 5 minutes are accepted but when the 4th occurs within 5 minutes, the board is considered faulty and an alarm is issued. The attribute specifies the escalation staircase for automatic (spontanenous) restarts, for the board. Example: if the attribute it set to RESTARTS_WITH_COLD, the first restart will be of rank cold, the second (within five minutes) will be cold with test. The third restart (within five minutes) will fault-mark the board.
If no value is specified when the MO is created, a default value, fetched from defAllowedSeqRestarts in the referenced MO, PiuType, is used.

attribute.name: hwTestResult
attribute.description: Contains text information from latest performed hardware tests.

attribute.name: hwTestStatus
attribute.description: Indicates the status of hardware tests.

attribute.name: greenLed
attribute.description:
Indicates the operational status of the plug-in unit.
The following values are possible for this attribute:
NOT_APPLICABLE = The LED is not supported NOT_AVAILABLE = The LED state is not readable at the moment STEADY_LIGHT = Power present SLOW_BLINK = Missing resource FAST_BLINK = Load or test in progress FLICKERING = Busy

attribute.name: redLed
attribute.description:
Indicates the fault status of the plug-in unit.
The following values are possible for this attribute:
NOT_APPLICABLE =The LED is not supported NOT_AVAILABLE = The LED state is not available at the moment OUT = No fault STEADY_LIGHT = PIU fault

attribute.name: yellowLed
attribute.description:
Indicates the information status of the plug-in unit.
The following values are possible for this attribute:
NOT_APPLICABLE =The LED is not supported NOT_AVAILABLE = The LED state is not available at the moment OUT = PIU unlocked STEADY_LIGHT = PIU locked SLOW_BLINK = Shutting-down in progress FLICKERING = Busy

attribute.name: unitType
attribute.description: Displays the same value as the attribute productName from the struct AdminProductData in MO PiuType.

attribute.name: maintenanceIndicator
attribute.description: Indicates the behavior of the Maintenance indicator.

attribute.name: faultIndicator
attribute.description: Indicates the behavior of the Fault indicator.

attribute.name: operationalIndicator
attribute.description: Indicates the behavior of the Operational indicator.

attribute.name: statusIndicator
attribute.description: Indicates the behavior of the Status indicator.

attribute.name: pmProcessorCoreLoad
attribute.description: The average CPU load on each processor core during the whole ROP period.
attribute.condition: Automatic and continuous measurement, where the CPU average for the whole ROP period is calculated every time the value is read. The CPU load is defined as 1 - bg in percent, where bg is defined as background load.

action.name: manualRestart
action.description: Manual restart of the plug-in-unit.

parameter.name: restartRank
parameter.description: The restart rank.

parameter.name: restartReason
parameter.description: The reason for the restart.

parameter.name: restartInfo
parameter.description: A free text field where extra information can be added.

action.name: writeRepairDelivNote
action.description: Writes HW log entry. Only one HW log entry is allowed for each HW unit. The existing entries in the HW log are not updated.

parameter.name: preparedBy
parameter.description: Name of operator preparing the log entry.

parameter.name: countryCode
parameter.description: Two letter country code.

parameter.name: stateCode
parameter.description: The HW status when the failure occurred: R = repaired unit failed during installation or test S = unit in service failure occurred T = new unit failed during installation or test

parameter.name: descriptionOfFault
parameter.description: Specific description of the fault observed. It is also important that other external factors are described as well. For product safety reasons also specify fire, water damage, and so on.

parameter.name: trNumber
parameter.description: If the board has a connection with a trouble report, the trNumber must be supplied.

parameter.name: reference
parameter.description: Complaint reference.

action.name: readRepairDelivNote
action.description: Reads the content of the HW log entry, written with the action writeRepairDelivNote.

action.name: reconfigureProgramPrepare
action.description: Reconfigures Program MOs specified by the Repertoire Mos and PiuType MOs associated to this PlugInUnit MO. For the Program MOs that are not used anymore, the attribute startState is set to DISABLED.

action.name: removeDisabledPrograms
action.description: Removes disabled programs located under the PlugInUnit.

class.name: GeneralProcessorUnit
class.description:
General purpose Processor Unit (GPU)
The GeneralProcessorUnit MO represents the board specific hardware on the GPB, CBU, DUW or DUL, that is, hard disk, Ethernet, serial port and so on.
This unit may only be inserted in slot 1 - 27 (in a standard subrack).
The attribute availabilityStatus for the GeneralProcessorUnit MO is retreived from the PlugInUnit MO.

attribute.name: GeneralProcessorUnitId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description:
The operational state.
The value for operationalState is retrived from the parent of this MO, that is PlugInUnit MO.

attribute.name: hdVolumeDSize
attribute.description: The total size of the D volume.

attribute.name: hdVolumeDFreespace
attribute.description: The amount of freespace available on the D volume.

attribute.name: hdVolumePSize
attribute.description: The total size of the P volume.

attribute.name: hdVolumePFreespace
attribute.description: The amount of freespace available on the P volume.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

attribute.name: minimumHdVolumeDFreespace
attribute.description:
Minimum number of Megabytes of free space on D volume before an alarm is issued. 0 means that no alarm will be sent.
It is used as a threshold that triggers alarms when the D volume of any board is about to be full, that is, when the attribute hdVolumeDFreespace exceeds this value.
This value should be set large enough so that an alarm is raised for each D volume that is starting to have too little space for the new files of the next upgrade package. On the core MPs, that is the Fault tolerant Core (FTC) GPB boards, this value should be even larger, so that there is also room for the configuration version files (in addition to the next upgrade files).
This value should be small enough for each board, so that alarms are not sent unnecessarily when there is a lot of free space.
Alarm is raised if the value of hdVolumeDFreespace becomes less than or equal to this value. But in order to cease the alarm, the free space must become at least 1 Megabyte larger than this value. To free space on the D volumes, some old UpgradePackage MOs must be deleted. If only the FTC boards are affected, then some old configuration versions must be deleted. This is done through the ConfigurationVersion MO.

class.name: Jvm
class.description:
Java Virtual Machine (JVM)
This MO configures JVM parameters, including SW management of Java class libraries used in the machine.
This MO is created automatically and cannot be deleted.
The RDN of this MO is Jvm=1.

attribute.name: JvmId
attribute.description:
The value component of the RDN.
It is set automatically when the MO instance is created.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: classpath
attribute.description: The current classpath that the JVM is using.

attribute.name: admClasspath
attribute.description: New classpath that is activated at next restart of JVM. The classpath has a directory, which contains the load module, that is the classpath references the load module.

attribute.name: freeMemory
attribute.description:
The free memory in the java machine.
Before this value is read from the system, the action garbageCollect is invoked.

attribute.name: totalMemory
attribute.description: The total amount of memory allocated to the java machine.

attribute.name: mopplets
attribute.description:
Contains all classes that are to be initialized and started when the JVM restarts.
Technical note: The specified classes must implement the se.ericsson.cello.moframework.Mopplet interface and be found in a jar/zip-file pointed out by the classpath.

attribute.name: main
attribute.description:
Specifies the start class name.
For example: "se.ericsson.cello.oms.Oms".

attribute.name: options
attribute.description: Current options: -D<property>=<value> Set a system property value. Commonly java.class.path -Xms<size> Specify the size, in bytes, of the memory allocation pool. -Xss<size> Set thread stack size in bytes. -Xverify:[all | remote | none] Verify classes according to the suboption. -Xverify:all verifies all classes. -Xverify:remote verifies remote classes only. -Xverify:none turns off class verification.

attribute.name: properties
attribute.description: Specifies the current system properties.

attribute.name: reliableProgramUniter
attribute.description: Contains a reference to the ReliableProgramUniter MO that refers to the programs where the JVM executes.

attribute.name: admMain
attribute.description:
New start class that is activated at next restart of the JVM.
For example: "se.ericsson.cello.oms.Oms".

attribute.name: admOptions
attribute.description:
This attribute is used when setting one or more administrative options.
A set option is operational after the next Java Machine restart.
One or more options can be set, one option in each string of the sequence according to description in the attribute option.

attribute.name: reservedBySwAllocation
attribute.description:
Contains the SwAllocation instance that reserves this MO instance.
Restriction: This MO instance can be reserved by only one instance of SwAllocation.

action.name: garbageCollect
action.description: Runs the garbage collector.

action.name: setProperty
action.description:
Sets a system property, that is properties in the operating system.
The values set with this action are not saved in the database.

action.name: restart
action.description: Restarts the executing JVM instance.

class.name: MediumAccessUnit
class.description:
Medium Access Unit (MAU)
The MediumAccessUnit MO represents the Ethernet transceiver function on a General Processor Board (GPB) or a CBU board.
It is not possible to configure both the MediumAccessUnit MO and the FastEthernet MO under the same GeneralProcessorUnit MO. These MOs are mutually exclusive.
Ethernet links which are modelled by a MediumAccessUnit MO are used for O&M IP traffic only. MediumAccessUnit MOs must not be configured under a GeneralProcessorUnit MO which has an IpAccessHostGpb MO referring to it, and where the IpAccessHostGpb MO refers to a FastEthernet MO.
This MO is known in standards as "MediumAttachmentUnit".
When this MO has been created, a node restart is required. Create and set a new CV and restart the node.
The MediumAccessUnit is not possible to be deleted if it is the last instance.
Disturbances: Changing some of the attributes on this MO may cause a disturbance or loss of O&M connectivity. If there are any doubts regarding the results of the attribute changes, it is strongly recommended to activate the robust rollback function, by setting the attribute configCountdownActivated on the ConfigurationVersion MO first.

attribute.name: MediumAccessUnitId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: connectorLabel
attribute.description: This attribute is used by a management system to show the label on the port the connector is attached to.

attribute.name: pmNoOfDot3StatsLateCollisions
attribute.description: The number of times that a collision was detected on the interface after the minimum length of a frame.
attribute.condition: A frame collision occurs.

attribute.name: pmNoOfDot3StatsFCSErrors
attribute.description: The number of frames that did not pass the Frame Check Sequence (FCS) check. (When the packet is received, its value is compared with the FCS and if the package is damaged it is removed).
attribute.condition: A frame did not pass the FCS check.

attribute.name: linkSpeed
attribute.description: The Link Speed.

attribute.name: duplexMode
attribute.description: The duplex mode used.

attribute.name: operationalMode
attribute.description: The operational mode.

class.name: Fan
class.description:
The fan is used for cooling the CPP subrack and is connected to one or two Switch Core Units (SCU). This MO is used to control and send alarms from the fan.
The Fan MO cannot be created if the attribute fanConfiguration in the MO SubrackProdType used by the Subrack MO, indicates that there are no CPP controlled fans.

attribute.name: activeSwAllocation
attribute.description:
The SwAllocation instance, among the predefined instances, which is active.
The SwAllocation instance which is active is the one currently used by the Fan MO. If no matching SwAllocation, containing the specific PiuType, is found, the value of this attribute is null.

attribute.name: FanId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: The administrative state.

attribute.name: connectedToScu
attribute.description:
Specifies the SCU that the fan is connected to.
A fan must always be connected to a SCU that mediates the communication with a main processor.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: piuType
attribute.description: Reference to an instance of PiuType.

attribute.name: hdlcAddress
attribute.description: Specifies the physical address of the RS-485 communication link.
attribute.obsolete: Has no functional behavior. The only value that is used is 7. All other values can be set but will not be used.

attribute.name: operationalProductData
attribute.description: Describes the product data of the fan that is installed.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

attribute.name: criticalAirTempAlarmLimit
attribute.description:
Specifies the threshold value for the critical air temperature alarm.
This attribute must be greater than highAirTempAlarmLimit + 3, but it is recommended to set it to highAirTempAlarmLimit + 10.
attribute.dependencies: This attribute is set only if alarmLimitsSupported is true. If alarmLimitsSupported is set to false, this attribute is silently ignored.

attribute.name: yellowLed
attribute.description:
Indicates the information status of the fan.
The following values are possible for this attribute:
NOT_AVAILABLE = The LED state is not available at the moment OUT = Fan unlocked SLOW_BLINK = Minor alarm issued FLICKERING = Major alarm issued.

attribute.name: alarmLimitsSupported
attribute.description:
Indicates whether the air temperature alarm threshold is supported or not.
It is used by criticalAirTempAlarmLimit and highAirTempAlarmLimit.

attribute.name: fanNumber
attribute.description:
Specifies the fan used in the subrack.
Use the default fan number if there is only one fan in the subrack.
If external fan devices are used, this specifies the fan position in the Denib-chain counting from the leftmost SCB.

attribute.name: fanPosition
attribute.description: Indicates the position of the fan on the subrack. Possible values: - ABOVE - BELOW - the fanNumber, that is, digit 1 to 10, if external fan devices are used.

attribute.name: highAirTempAlarmLimit
attribute.description:
Specifies the threshold value for the warning air temperature alarm.
See the recommended limit for criticalAirTempAlarmLimit.
attribute.dependencies: This attribute is set only if alarmLimitsSupported is true. If alarmLimitsSupported is set to false, this attribute is silent ignored.

action.name: restartFan
action.description:
Restarts the fan, causes it to be initiated, re-booted and all load modules to be reloaded from persistent memory. This is also known as a forced reload.
This action is not valid when the attribute fanConfiguration in SubrackProdType MO is set to the values: - BFD528_ONE or - BFD528_TWO.

class.name: Cbu
class.description:
Control Base Unit (CBU) board
The CBU board integrates the functionality of TUB, SCB, GPB and ETB (ET-MC1) into one Plug-In Unit.
The operationalState is set to DISABLED if one of the functional parts is faulty. Even if the Cbu is marked with operationalState DISABLED, parts of the Cbu can still be operational.
A functional part on a CBU board can only be redundant with the same functional part on another CBU board and thus not with that functional part implemented on a discrete board. Also note that redundancy is only applicable for the GPB part and the TimingUnit part of the CBU board.
On the CBU board it is only possible to configure a maximum of 4 physical path terminations. These can be of type E1PhysPathTerm, J1PhyspathTerm or T1PhyspathTerm. It is not possible to create physical path terminations of different standards on the same board.
The GPU (General Processor Unit) part of the CBU board retrieves its availabilityStatus from the PlugInUnit MO, thus not represented on the Cbu MO.
When the ET-MC1 is part of the CBU board, it is only possible to configure 4 physical ports as either E1 (ETSI), J1 (TTC) or T1 (ANSI).
This unit may only be inserted in slot 1 and 24 (or more accurately at APN=1 and 0 in a non-standard subrack). If redundant configuration is needed, two CBUs must be inserted in the subrack.
If only one CBU board is used, it must be placed in slot 1 (in a non-standard subrack) to be able to read the product information data of the subrack.
The children of this MO cannot be deleted separately. They are deleted automatically, when this MO is deleted.

attribute.name: CbuId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: availabilityStatusEt
attribute.description:
The availability status for the Exchange Terminal part of the Cbu board.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: availabilityStatusTu
attribute.description:
The availability status for the Timing Unit part of the Cbu board.
It contains details about operationalState.

class.name: PiuDevice
class.description:
Plug-In Unit (PIU) Device
This MO represents a part of a plug-in unit, that is a separate restart domain.
Instances of this MO are created automatically during system upgrade.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description:
The administrative state.
If this attribute is set to SHUTTING_DOWN, it will immediately go into the state LOCKED.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
It contains details about operationalState.
Possible values when operationalState is set to DISABLED: - FAILED - DEPENDENCY_LOCKED - DEPENDENCY_FAILED

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: PiuDeviceId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: deviceId
attribute.description: The local identity of the device within the PIU.
attribute.dependencies: If the attribute loaderType in LoadModule MO is set to OSE_LOADER, the value of deviceId is the same as for the attributes instanceId and restartGroup from Program MO, struct ProgramInstance.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

action.name: manualRestart
action.description: Manual restart of the PIU device.

parameter.name: restartRank
parameter.description: The restart rank.

parameter.name: restartReason
parameter.description: The reason for the restart. This parameter is mandatory.

parameter.name: restartInfo
parameter.description: A free text field where extra information can be added. This parameter is optional.

class.name: InterPiuLink
class.description:
Inter PIU Link
This MO represents a cable between two plug-in units.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: InterPiuLinkId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: primaryPiuSlot
attribute.description: The slot where the primary PIU is placed.

attribute.name: secondaryPiuSlot
attribute.description: The slot where the secondary PIU is placed.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: The administrative state.

class.name: Shelf
class.description: This MO represents a shelf.

attribute.name: ShelfId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains an MO instance that reserves this MO instance.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: boardOrientation
attribute.description: Specifies the orientation of the hardware units in the shelf.

attribute.name: content
attribute.description: Specifies the content of the shelf.

attribute.name: noOfPositions
attribute.description: Specifies the number of physical positions in the shelf.

attribute.name: position
attribute.description:
Specifies the physical position of the shelf within the cabinet.
The position is given as a combination of vertical position, given in letters, and horizontal position, given in digits. Vertical positioning starts from the ground and horizontal positioning starts from the left.
Example: B1

attribute.name: positionRef
attribute.description: Reference to the cabinet, in which the shelf is placed.

class.name: AppUnit
class.description:
Active Patch Panel
The AppUnit MO represents one of the two APP units.
The APP unit is an optical-electrical unit which converts the node-external optical transmission to node-internal electrical transmission. The APP units are supervised by the closest subrack in the cabinet.

attribute.name: AppUnitId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains an MO instance that reserves this MO instance.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description:
The administrative state.
If this attribute is set to SHUTTING_DOWN, it will immediately go into the state LOCKED.

attribute.name: connectedToScx
attribute.description: The AppUnit is controlled through an SCX board. This attribute specifies the Slot MO representing that SCX board.

attribute.name: maintenanceIndicator
attribute.description: Indicates the behavior of the maintenance indicator.

attribute.name: operationalProductData
attribute.description: The operational product data describes the AppUnit that is actually installed.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

class.name: PfmUnit
class.description:
Power and Fan Module Unit
The PfmUnit MO represents one of the two PFM units in a subrack. The PFM unit is a combined power supply and cooling unit that is used in the EGEM2 hardware series, such as the RNC 8000.
This MO is system created when SubrackProdType MO with attribute transmissionType is set to ETHERNET_1G_10G.

attribute.name: PfmUnitId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains an MO instance that reserves this MO instance.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: activeSwAllocation
attribute.description:
The SwAllocation instance, among the predefined instances, which is active.
The SwAllocation instance which is active is the one currently used by the PfmUnit MO. If no matching SwAllocation containing the specific PiuType is found, the value of this attribute is null.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description:
The administrative state.
If this attribute is set to SHUTTING_DOWN, it will immediately go into the state LOCKED.

attribute.name: connectedToScx
attribute.description: The PfmUnit is controlled through an SCX board. This attribute specifies the Slot MO representing that SCX board.

attribute.name: maintenanceIndicator
attribute.description: Indicates the behavior of the maintenance indicator.

attribute.name: operationalProductData
attribute.description: Describes the product data of the PFM unit that is installed.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: piuType
attribute.description: Reference to an instance of PiuType.

attribute.name: position
attribute.description: Indicates the position of the PfmUnit on the subrack. Allowed values: - Upper - Lower

class.name: EthernetSwitchModulePort
class.description:
A port on an Ethernet Switch Module
When the MO is created, the physical port becomes active and can handle traffic. When the MO is deleted, the physical port becomes inactive and stops handling traffic.
Disturbances: If this port is preconfigured, but there is no physical connection, and - externalPort = true, and - attribute edgePortMode in MO SwitchPortStp = ADMIN_EDGE_BPDU_GUARD or ADMIN_EDGE_BPDU_FILTER, then any ongoing traffic using the internal Ethernet switch will be lost.

attribute.name: pmIfOutMulticastPkts
attribute.description: The number of transmitted good packets, with a multicast address, that are delivered to a higher sub-layer.
attribute.condition: A good packet with a multicast address is transmitted.

attribute.name: pmIfOutBroadcastPkts
attribute.description: The number of good packets with a broadcast address, which are transmitted and delivered to a higher sublayer.
attribute.condition: A good packet with a broadcast address is transmitted.

attribute.name: pmIfOutUcastPkts
attribute.description: The number of good packets addressed to a unicast address, which are transmitted and delivered to a higher sublayer.
attribute.condition: 1000 good packets with unicast addresses are transmitted.

attribute.name: pmIfInMulticastPkts
attribute.description: The number of packets, delivered by this sub-layer to a higher (sub-)layer, which were addressed to a multicast address at this sub-layer.
attribute.condition: A good packet with a multicast address is received.

attribute.name: pmIfInBroadcastPkts
attribute.description: The number of good packets received with a broadcast address delivered to a higher sublayer.
attribute.condition: A good packet with a broadcast address is received.

attribute.name: pmIfInUcastPkts
attribute.description: The number of good packets addressed to a unicast address, which are received and delivered to a higher sublayer.
attribute.condition: 1000 good packets with unicast addresses are received.

attribute.name: pmIfOutErrors
attribute.description: The number of transmitted packets, discarded due to errors found in the packets.
attribute.condition: An erroneous packet is discarded.

attribute.name: pmIfInErrors
attribute.description: The number of received packets, discarded due to errors found in the packets.
attribute.condition: An erroneous packet is discarded.

attribute.name: pmIfOutDiscards
attribute.description: The number of transmitted good packets, discarded due to lack of resources (for example, buffer space).
attribute.condition: A transmitted good packet is discarded due to resource problems.

attribute.name: pmIfInDiscards
attribute.description: The number of received good packets, discarded even though no error had been detected (for example, lack of buffer space, discarding port state, VLAN membership).
attribute.condition: A received good packet is discarded.

attribute.name: pmIfOutOctetsHi
attribute.description:
The number of octets transmitted by a port, including framing characters and bad packets, but excluding preamble sequences.
The high capacity counter for octets transmitted out on an interface is split into two parts. This counter represents the higher part of the 62 least significant bits of the high capacity counter for octets transmitted out on the interface. The two most significant bits of this 64 bits counter are discarded. This 64-bit counter is presented as 2*31 bits: pmIfOutOctetsHi (bit 61-31) and pmIfOutOctetsLo (bit 30-0) in the MOM.
attribute.condition: An octet is transmitted.

attribute.name: pmIfInOctetsHi
attribute.description:
The number of octets received by a port, including framing characters and bad packets, but excluding preamble sequences.
The high capacity counter for received octets on an interface is split into two parts. This counter represents the higher part of the 62 least significant bits of the high capacity counter for received octets. The two most significant bits of this 64 bit counter are discarded. This 64-bit counter is presented as 2*31 bits: pmIfInOctetsHi (bit 61-31) and pmIfInOctetsLo (bit 30-0) in the MOM.
attribute.condition: An octet is received.

attribute.name: portNo
attribute.description:
Physical Port number associated with this MO instance.
Each EthernetSwitchPort instance belonging to the same EthernetSwitch must have a unique portNo, which maps the MO instance to exactly one physical port.

attribute.name: untaggedIngressPriority
attribute.description: All packets that ingress the port untagged, will have a VLAN tag inserted with this priority in the 802.1p value field of the VLAN tag.

attribute.name: actualSpeedDuplex
attribute.description:
The mode in which the port is actually operating.
The value NO_LINK means that the link is disabled. See the attribute operatingMode for values of configured speed.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description:
The administrative state.
Setting this attribute to LOCKED will suppress port alarms. However, it does not stop traffic or impact RSTP.

attribute.name: EthernetSwitchModulePortId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: pbitQueueMap
attribute.description: Maps the pbit priority according to 802.1Q to switch queues for this port. Pbit refers to the PCP (Priority Code Point) field in the Ethernet header. Queue 0 has the lowest priority and queue 7 has the highest priority.

attribute.name: operatingMode
attribute.description:
Contains the configured speed duplex for the port.
If the port is a member of a LAG, that is if lagRef is set, this attribute cannot be changed.

attribute.name: currentPmRegister
attribute.description: Returns the current values of all PM counters.
attribute.obsolete: Has no functional behavior and is now redundant. Read operations can return undefined values.

attribute.name: pmIfInOctetsLo
attribute.description:
The number of octets received by a port, including framing characters and bad packets, but excluding preamble sequences.
The high capacity counter for received octets on an interface is split into two parts. This counter represents the lower part of the 62 least significant bits of the high capacity counter for octets transmitted out on the interface. The two most significant bit of this 64 bits counter are discarded. This 64-bit counter is presented as 2*31 bits: pmIfInOctetsHi (bit 61-31) and pmIfInOctetsLo (bit 30-0) in the MOM.
attribute.condition: An octet is received.

attribute.name: pmIfOutOctetsLo
attribute.description:
The number of octets transmitted by a port, including framing characters and bad packets, but excluding preamble sequences.
The high capacity counter for octets transmitted out on an interface is split into two parts. This counter represents the lower part of the 62 least significant bits of the high capacity counter for octets transmitted out on the interface. The two most significant bits of this 64 bit counter are discarded. This 64-bit counter is presented as 2*31 bits: pmIfOutOctetsHi (bit 61-31) and pmIfOutOctetsLo (bit 30-0) in the MOM.
attribute.condition: An octet is transmitted.

attribute.name: externalPort
attribute.description:
Specifies if the port is external.
If set to false, the port is defined to be connected to an ESL. If set to true, the port is defined to be connected to an external equipment.
If there is a link failure on an external port where RSTP is deactivated (by setting the edgePortMode in MO SwitchPortStp to ADMIN_EDGE_BPDU_FILTER or ADMIN_EDGE_BPDU_GUARD), any GigaBitEthernet MO connected to this Ethernet switch over the backplane is redirected to use the backplane to the other Ethernet switch in the subrack.
attribute.dependencies: egressUntagVlanRef and untaggedIngressVlanRef must be set to NULL first, before setting this attribute to false.

attribute.name: egressUntagVlanRef
attribute.description:
Reference to a list of Vlan MOs.
If a packet contains a vid with the same value as one of the referenced Vlan MOs, the packet will be untagged at egress.
If this attribute is set to null, the default value 1 is used for the vid.
The maximum number of Vlan MO references is 256.
Dependency: Any member of this list must also be a member of the list specified by the attribute vlanRef. Set this attribute in a different transaction from where the attribute vlanRef is set.
Dependency: If externalPort is set to false, this attribute must not be set.

attribute.name: vlanRef
attribute.description:
Reference to a list of Vlan MOs.
The referenced instances represent the VLANs that are opened on this port.
The maximum number of Vlan MO references is 256.

attribute.name: untaggedIngressVlanRef
attribute.description:
Reference to a Vlan MO.
In all packets that ingress the ethernet port untagged, a VLAN tag is inserted, with the vid of the referenced Vlan MO.
If this attribute is set to null, the default value 1 is used for the vid.
Dependency: The port must be a member of the specified VLAN, that is, the value of this attribute must be a member of the list in the attribute vlanRef. Set this attribute in a different transaction from where the attribute vlanRef is set.
Dependency: If externalPort is set to false, this attribute must not be set.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: trafficState
attribute.description:
Specifies if traffic is admitted on this port.
If set to true, traffic is admitted. If set to false, traffic is not admitted and the physical layer will be taken down.
attribute.disturbances: It is strongly recommended to activate the robust rollback function, by setting the attribute configCountdownActivated on the ConfigurationVersion MO first.

attribute.name: lagRef
attribute.description:
Reference to an instance of a Lag MO.
Specifies which LAG this port belongs to.
All ports in a LAG must fulfill the following conditions: - they must have identical configuration - they must be of the same physical type - they must belong to the same Ethernet switch, that is, have the same instance of EthernetSwitchModule MO as parent.
There can also exist HW specific restrictions, with respect to the number of allowed ports in a LAG and how the ports may be paired together. For details, see the description of the relevant board.

action.name: setPbitQueue
action.description:
Sets the pbitQueueMap attribute.
If pbitQueueMap is not set by this action, it takes the default values specified by the attribute type PbitQueue.
This action affects only one entry in the array.

parameter.name: pBit
parameter.description: The priority bit of the IP packet.

parameter.name: queue
parameter.description: The switch queue.

action.name: setAllVlanRefs
action.description:
Sets the attributes vlanRef, untaggedIngressVlanRef and egressUntagVlanRef.
Allows all attributes involved in the VLAN configuration to be set at the same time. If this action is not used, untaggedIngressVlanRef and egressUntagVlanRef must be set in separate transactions compared to vlanRef.

parameter.name: vlanRef
parameter.description: The reference to Vlan MO

parameter.name: untaggedIngressVlanRef
parameter.description: Reference to a Vlan MO.

parameter.name: egressUntagVlanRef
parameter.description: Reference to a Vlan MO.

class.name: EthernetSwitchModule
class.description:
Ethernet Switch Module
This MO specifies an Ethernet Switch Module.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: EthernetSwitchModuleId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: macAddress
attribute.description:
The Media Access Control address.
It is the mac address used to address the switch for switch management and by switch control protocols such as RSTP. If the board is not available, the attribute has the value "00:00:00:00:00:00".

attribute.name: backPlanePortState
attribute.description: The state of the ethernet back plane.

attribute.name: linkAggLinkSelection
attribute.description: Specifies the link selection method used in a LAG.

class.name: EthernetSwitch
class.description:
Ethernet Switch
This MO configures an Ethernet Switch.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

attribute.name: pbitQueueMap
attribute.description: Maps the pbit priority according to 802.1Q to switch queues for this port. Pbit refers to the PCP (Priority Code Point) field in the Ethernet header. Queue 0 has the lowest priority and queue 3 has the highest priority.

attribute.name: untaggedIngressPriority
attribute.description:
All packets that are untagged, when they ingress the internal port, have a VLAN tag inserted with this priority into the 802.1p value field of the VLAN tag.
If enableVlan is set to false, this attribute is ignored.

attribute.name: untaggedIngressVid
attribute.description:
All packets that are untagged, when they ingress the internal port, have a VLAN tag inserted with the specified VLAN id. If this attribute is set to 1, the default VLAN id is used. If another value is specified, the port must be a member of the specified VLAN, as defined by the vlanMembership attribute.
If enableVlan is set to false, this attribute is ignored.

attribute.name: vlanMembership
attribute.description:
The VLAN identities supported by the internal port, and the egress untag behavior for the VLAN on the internal port.
If the vid is set to 0, it means that no VLAN id is specified for the port and the value specified for egressUntag will be ignored. If vid is set to any non-zero value, that value will be added as a valid VLAN id for the port. If the egressUntag flag is set to true, all VLAN tags for the specified vid will be removed from frames at egress.
The attribute can contain a maximum of 8 VLAN identities, and all entries must have a unique vid (no entries with duplicate vid values are allowed).

attribute.name: enableVlan
