attribute.description: Specifies whether the switch uses VLAN. If disabled, all VLAN settings for the EthernetSwitchPort MO are ignored.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: EthernetSwitchId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: macAddress
attribute.description: Media Access Control address. It is used for the switch management. If the board is not available, the attribute has the value "00:00:00:00:00:00".

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: linkAggLinkSelection
attribute.description: Specifies the link selection method used in a LAG.

action.name: setPbitQueue
action.description:
Sets the pbitQueueMap attribute.
If pbitQueueMap is not set by this action, it takes the default values specified by the attribute type PbitQueue.
This action affects only one entry in the array.

parameter.name: pBit
parameter.description: The priority bit of the IP packet.

parameter.name: queue
parameter.description: The switch queue.

class.name: EthernetSwitchFabric
class.description:
Ethernet Switch Fabric
This MO is created automatically and cannot be deleted.
The RDN of this MO is EthernetSwitchFabric=1.

attribute.name: EthernetSwitchFabricId
attribute.description:
The value component of the RDN.
It is set automatically when the MO instance is created.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

class.name: Vlan
class.description:
A Virtual Local Area Network (VLAN)
Vid=1 is used as default VLAN to distribute untagged frames between external ports to the Ethernet Switch backplane. ESLs will also distribute untagged frames if an external VLAN is present.
If a Vlan MO is created, with the attribute vid set to 1, distribution of untagged frames will end.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: vid
attribute.description:
The VLAN Identifier.
Each value within the specified value range can be used by only one VLAN instance.
attribute.disturbances: Changing this attribute may cause traffic disturbances.

attribute.name: VlanId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: vlanType
attribute.description:
The type of the VLAN.
Only one VLAN instance can be configured with vlanType set to INTERNAL_IP_TRANSPORT.
Only one VLAN instance can be configured with vlanType set to BOARD_INTERNAL.

class.name: SwitchPortStp
class.description:
Spanning Tree Protocol (STP), port part
This MO is created automatically, as a consequence of creating its parent, and cannot be deleted.
The RDN of this MO is SwitchPortStp=1.

attribute.name: actualPathCost
attribute.description: Actual path cost.

attribute.name: configuredPathCost
attribute.description:
Configured path cost.
If manualPathCost is true, the value of the attribute actualPathCost will be determined by this attribute.
If manualPathCost is false, the value of the attribute actualPathCost may differ from the value of this attribute.

attribute.name: currentPmRegister
attribute.description: Returns the current values of all PM counters.
attribute.obsolete: Has no functional behavior and is now redundant. Read operations can return undefined values.

attribute.name: edgePortBpduGuardTimeOut
attribute.description:
The time before an edge port blocked with BPDU Guard goes unblocked.
If this attribute is set to 0, manual interaction via the action unblockEdgePort is needed.

attribute.name: edgePortMode
attribute.description:
The behavior of an edge port.
Setting the edgePortMode may cause a short link failure (several seconds).
Setting the edgePortMode to ADMIN_EDGE_BPDU_GUARD or ADMIN_EDGE_BPDU_FILTER turns on the external link redundancy feature if: - the MO SwitchPortStp is a child of EthernetSwitchModulePort, and - the attribute externalPort in MO EthernetSwitchModulePort is true. This disables all backplane ports in the subrack if the front port is disabled, so these modes cannot be used to preconfigure external ports without links.

attribute.name: manualPathCost
attribute.description:
Determines the possibility to manually configure the path cost.
If this attribute is set to true, the path cost can be configured by setting the attribute configuredPathCost.
If this attribute is set to false, the system ignores the attribute configuredPathCost.

attribute.name: priority
attribute.description:
Port priority.
The port with the lowest port priority value will be selected as Root port in the case when more than one port is connected to the Root bridge. If two ports have the same priority the one with the lowest port number gets the best priority.
The value must be a multiple of 16.

attribute.name: protocolVersion
attribute.description: The actual protocol version running on this port as the result of negotiation with the remote switch port.

attribute.name: remoteBridgeId
attribute.description:
The bridge id of the counterpart bridge in the spanning tree protocol messaging.
This attribute is relevant only for ports with the role alternate or root.
The attribute consists of priority and macaddress combined into a string, where the first 4 characters repesent the priority, and the last characters represent the macaddress. A hyphen (-) separates the two.
Example: "0000-00:00:00:00:00:00"

attribute.name: rootPathCost
attribute.description: Specifies the Root Path Cost used in Bridge Protocol Data Units (BPDUs) transmitted from this port.

attribute.name: stpRole
attribute.description: The STP role of the port.

attribute.name: stpState
attribute.description: The STP state of the port.

attribute.name: SwitchPortStpId
attribute.description:
The value component of the RDN.
It is set automatically when the MO instance is created.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: pmReceivedBpdu
attribute.description: The number of received RSTP and STP BPDUs.
attribute.condition: An RSTP or STP BPDU is received

attribute.name: pmTransmittedBpdu
attribute.description: The number of transmitted RSTP and STP BPDUs.
attribute.condition: An RSTP or STP BPDU is transmitted

attribute.name: settingsUsed
attribute.description: Indicates if the settings in this MO instance are used.

attribute.name: l2gpActive
attribute.description:
Enables L2GP on this port.
There can be a maximum of 16 instances of SwitchPortStp with l2gpActive = true in a node.

attribute.name: l2gpPortPriority
attribute.description: The priority of the L2GP port in relation to other L2GP ports within the RSTP domain. The value 1 indicates the highest priority.

attribute.name: l2gpPseudoRootId
attribute.description:
The bridge ID for the pseudo root bridge.
Automatically calculated by the system based on the l2gpPortPriority.

attribute.name: l2gpBpduReceive
attribute.description: Enables reception of BPDUs on an L2GP-enabled port.
attribute.dependencies: If l2gpActive is set to false, this attribute must be set to true.

action.name: unblockEdgePort
action.description:
Unblocks an edge port.
This actions is provided for cases, when a port needs to be unblocked before the time set by the timer edgePortBpduGuardTimeOut has elapsed.

class.name: EthernetSwitchPort
class.description:
A port on an Ethernet Switch
When the MO is created, the physical port becomes active and can handle traffic. When the MO is deleted, the physical port becomes inactive and stops handling traffic.

attribute.name: actualSpeedDuplex
attribute.description: The mode, in which the port is actually operating. The value NO_LINK means that the link is disabled or that autonegotiation is in progress. See attribute operatingMode for values of autonegotiation and configured speed.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description:
The administrative state.
Setting this attribute to LOCKED will suppress port alarms. However, it does not stop traffic or impact RSTP.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: currentPmRegister
attribute.description:
Returns the current values of all PM counters.
To activate the writing of statistical values in a PM counter, start a performance monitoring (scanner) on that counter. Otherwise, the value of the PM counter is set to -1.
attribute.obsolete: Has no functional behavior and is now redundant. Read operations can return undefined values.

attribute.name: EthernetSwitchPortId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: ingressPeakBitrate
attribute.description: The maximum allowed incoming bit rate on this port.

attribute.name: operatingMode
attribute.description:
A struct that contains the configured speed duplex for the port, and an indication of whether autonegotiation is performed.
If autonegotiation is set to true, it must be set to true for both ports in the Ethernet link. If autonegotiation is set to false, the speed duplex mode must be identically set for both ports in the Ethernet link.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: pbitQueueMap
attribute.description: Maps the pbit priority according to 802.1Q to switch queues for this port. Pbit refers to the PCP (Priority Code Point) field in the Ethernet header. Queue 0 has the lowest priority and queue 3 has the highest priority.

attribute.name: portNo
attribute.description:
Physical Port number associated with this MO instance.
Each EthernetSwitchPort instance belonging to the same EthernetSwitch must have a unique portNo, which maps the MO instance to exactly one physical port.

attribute.name: sfpInformation
attribute.description: Information about the SFP port. Valid only if the attribute sfpPort is set to true.

attribute.name: sfpPort
attribute.description: Specifies whether the switch port is an SFP port. Autonegotiation must be configured to true for an SFP port. Otherwise, the port may be disabled.

attribute.name: systemPort
attribute.description:
Specifies whether the switch port is a system (backhaul) port, which carries traffic to/from the IP interfaces on the board.
The IP interfaces on the board are automatically disabled, any time all ports designated as system ports on the switch are down. If no port on the switch is designated as a system port, the IP interfaces on the board are automatically disabled if all created ports on the board are disabled.

attribute.name: untaggedIngressPriority
attribute.description:
All packets that ingress the port untagged, will have a VLAN tag inserted with this priority in the 802.1p value field of the VLAN tag.
If the attribute enableVlan of the related EthernetSwitch MO is set to false, this attribute is ignored.

attribute.name: untaggedIngressVid
attribute.description:
All packets that ingress the ethernet port untagged, will have a VLAN tag inserted with the specified VLAN id. If this attribute is set to 1, the default VLAN id is used. If another value is specified, the port must be a member of the specified VLAN as defined by the vlanMembership attribute.
If the attribute enableVlan of the related EthernetSwitch MO is set to false, this attribute is ignored.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: vlanMembership
attribute.description:
The VLAN identities supported by this port, and the egress untag behavior for the VLAN on this port.
If the vid is set to 0, it means that no VLAN id is specified for the port and the value specified for egressUntag will be ignored. If vid is set to any non-zero value, that value will be added as a valid VLAN id for the port. If the egressUntag flag is set to true, all VLAN tags for the specified vid will be removed from frames at egress.
The attribute can contain a maximum of 256 VLAN identities, and all entries must have a unique vid (no entries with duplicate vid values are allowed).

attribute.name: pmIfInBroadcastPkts
attribute.description: The number of good packets received with a broadcast address delivered to a higher sublayer.
attribute.condition: A good packet with a broadcast address is received.

attribute.name: pmIfInDiscards
attribute.description: The number of received good packets, discarded due to lack of resources (for example, buffer space).
attribute.condition: A received good packet is discarded.

attribute.name: pmIfInErrors
attribute.description: The number of received packets, discarded due to errors found in the packets.
attribute.condition: An erroneous packet is discarded.

attribute.name: pmIfInMulticastPkts
attribute.description: The number of packets, delivered by this sub-layer to a higher (sub-)layer, which were addressed to a multicast address at this sub-layer.
attribute.condition: A good packet with a multicast address is received.

attribute.name: pmIfInOctetsHi
attribute.description:
The number of octets received by a port, including framing characters and bad packets, but excluding preamble sequences.
The high capacity counter for received octets on an interface is split into two parts. This counter represents the higher part of the 62 least significant bits of the high capacity counter for received octets. The two most significant bits of this 64 bit counter are discarded. This 64-bit counter is presented as 2*31 bits: pmIfInOctetsHi (bit 61-31) and pmIfInOctetsLo (bit 30-0) in the MOM.
attribute.condition: An octet is received.

attribute.name: pmIfInOctetsLo
attribute.description:
The number of octets received by a port, including framing characters and bad packets, but excluding preamble sequences.
The high capacity counter for received octets on an interface is split into two parts. This counter represents the lower part of the 62 least significant bits of the high capacity counter for octets transmitted out on the interface. The two most significant bit of this 64 bits counter are discarded. This 64-bit counter is presented as 2*31 bits: pmIfInOctetsHi (bit 61-31) and pmIfInOctetsLo (bit 30-0) in the MOM.
attribute.condition: An octet is received.

attribute.name: pmIfInUcastPkts
attribute.description: The number of good packets addressed to a unicast address, which are received and delivered to a higher sublayer.
attribute.condition: A good packet with a unicast address is received.

attribute.name: pmIfOutBroadcastPkts
attribute.description: The number of good packets, with a broadcast address, that are transmitted.
attribute.condition: A good packet with a broadcast address is transmitted.

attribute.name: pmIfOutDiscards
attribute.description: The number of good packets to be transmitted that were discarded due to lack of resources (for example buffer space).
attribute.condition: A good packet for transmission is discarded due to resource problems.

attribute.name: pmIfOutMulticastPkts
attribute.description: The number of transmitted outgoing packets with a multicast address.
attribute.condition: A good packet with a multicast address is transmitted.

attribute.name: pmIfOutErrors
attribute.description: The number of packets requested to be transmitted that were discarded due to errors found in the packets.
attribute.condition: An erroneous packet to be transmitted is discarded.

attribute.name: pmIfOutOctetsHi
attribute.description:
The number of octets transmitted by a port, including framing characters and bad packets, but excluding preamble sequences.
The high capacity counter for octets transmitted out on an interface is split into two parts. This counter represents the higher part of the 62 least significant bits of the high capacity counter for octets transmitted out on the interface. The two most significant bits of this 64 bits counter are discarded. This 64-bit counter is presented as 2*31 bits: pmIfOutOctetsHi (bit 61-31) and pmIfOutOctetsLo (bit 30-0) in the MOM.
attribute.condition: An octet is transmitted.

attribute.name: pmIfOutOctetsLo
attribute.description:
The number of octets transmitted by a port, including framing characters and bad packets, but excluding preamble sequences.
The high capacity counter for octets transmitted out on an interface is split into two parts. This counter represents the lower part of the 62 least significant bits of the high capacity counter for octets transmitted out on the interface. The two most significant bits of this 64 bit counter are discarded. This 64-bit counter is presented as 2*31 bits: pmIfOutOctetsHi (bit 61-31) and pmIfOutOctetsLo (bit 30-0) in the MOM.
attribute.condition: An octet is transmitted.

attribute.name: pmIfOutUcastPkts
attribute.description: The number of transmitted outgoing packets addressed to a unicast address.
attribute.condition: A good packet with a unicast address is transmitted.

attribute.name: lagRef
attribute.description:
Reference to an instance of a Lag MO.
Specifies which LAG this port belongs to.
All ports in a LAG must fulfill the following conditions: - they must have identical configuration - they must be of the same physical type - they must belong to the same Ethernet switch, that is, have the same instance of EthernetSwitch MO as parent.
There can also exist HW specific restrictions, with respect to the number of allowed ports in a LAG and how the ports may be paired together. For details, see the description of the relevant board.

attribute.name: trafficState
attribute.description:
Specifies if traffic is admitted on this port.
If set to true, traffic is admitted. If set to false, traffic is not admitted, and the physical layer will be taken down.
attribute.disturbances: It is strongly recommended to activate the robust rollback function, by setting the attribute configCountdownActivated on the ConfigurationVersion MO first.

action.name: setPbitQueue
action.description:
Sets the pbitQueueMap attribute.
If pbitQueueMap is not set by this action, it takes the default values specified by the attribute type PbitQueue.
This action affects only one entry in the array.

parameter.name: pBit
parameter.description: The priority bit of the IP packet.

parameter.name: queue
parameter.description: The switch queue.

class.name: SwitchStp
class.description:
Spanning Tree Protocol (STP), Switch Part
This MO is created automatically, as a consequence of creating its parent, and cannot be deleted.
The RDN of this MO is SwitchStp=1.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description:
The administrative state.
Turns on or off the use of the Spanning Tree Protocol.
SHUTTING_DOWN is not supported and if set the value is changed to LOCKED.
In case the parent MO is an instance of EthernetSwitchModule, this attribute is not applicable and is ignored by the system.

attribute.name: bridgeForwardDelay
attribute.description:
The delay used by the switch before changing to the Forwarding state, in case of a port interoperating with a legacy STP switch.
If interoperability with legacy STP bridges is wanted, the value of bridgeForwardDelay must be set to greater than or equal to (bridgeMaxAge/2 + 10). Refer to the description of the relevant board for details on validation of this relationship.

attribute.name: bridgeHelloTime
attribute.description:
Interval between periodic transmissions of configuration messages by designated ports.
If interoperability with legacy STP bridges is wanted, the value of bridgeHelloTime must be set to less than or equal to (bridgeMaxAge/2 -10). Ranges and limitations can vary between boards. Refer to the description of the relevant board for details.

attribute.name: bridgeId
attribute.description:
The bridge ID of the switch.
The attribute consists of priority and macaddress combined into a string, where the first 4 characters repesent the priority, and the last characters represent the macaddress. A hyphen (-) separates the two.
Example: "0000-00:00:00:00:00:00"

attribute.name: bridgeMaxAge
attribute.description:
The maximum time interval before a switch, not receiving any BPDUs, assumes that a network change has occurred.
If interoperability with legacy STP bridges is wanted, the value of bridgeMaxAge must be set to greater than or equal to 2 x (bridgeHelloTime +10). Refer to the description of the relevant board for details on validation of this relationship.

attribute.name: bridgePriority
attribute.description:
Switch priority used by the protocol.
The value must be a multiple of 4096.
The preferred rootswitch must have a low value and the standby rootswitch must have a value that is almost as low. To achieve as good convergence time as possible, when the rootswitch is lost, all switches must be set to a value that increases with the distance to the preferred rootswitch.

attribute.name: currentPmRegister
attribute.description: Returns the current values of all PM counters.
attribute.obsolete: Has no functional behavior and is now redundant. Read operations can return undefined values.

attribute.name: mode
attribute.description:
The kind of spanning tree protocol used.
The system supports Rapid Spanning Tree Protocol, RSTP.

attribute.name: rootBridgeId
attribute.description:
The bridge ID of the switch defined as the root bridge.
The attribute consists of priority and macaddress combined into a string, where the first 4 characters repesent the priority, and the last characters represent the macaddress. A hyphen (-) separates the two.
Example: "0000-00:00:00:00:00:00"

attribute.name: rootPortNumber
attribute.description: The root port number.

attribute.name: SwitchStpId
attribute.description:
The value component of the RDN.
It is set automatically when the MO instance is created.

attribute.name: topologyChangeTime
attribute.description: The time since the latest topology change occurred.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: pmTopologyChanges
attribute.description: Number of topology changes.
attribute.condition: Each time the spanning tree topology changes for this switch.

attribute.name: transmitHoldCount
attribute.description:
The maximum number of BPDUs that may be sent on one port to a neighboring switch.
When the maximum number is reached, only one more BPDU may be sent per second. A high value gives better convergence time. The fastest convergence is achieved with the value 10 in the entire RSTP domain.
Interworking switches must have the same value.

class.name: EthernetSwitchingAdm
class.description:
Ethernet Switching Administration
This MO specifies administrative information for Ethernet Switching.

attribute.name: EthernetSwitchingAdmId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: featureStateLinkAgg
attribute.description: Specifies if the licensed feature Link Aggregation is ACTIVATED or DEACTIVATED.

attribute.name: licenseStateLinkAgg
attribute.description: Indicates whether a valid license key is installed for the feature Link Aggregation.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: featureStateL2gp
attribute.description: Specifies if the licensed feature Layer 2 Gateway Port is ACTIVATED or DEACTIVATED.

attribute.name: licenseStateL2gp
attribute.description: Indicates whether a valid license key is installed for the feature Layer 2 Gateway Port.

attribute.name: l2gpRapidFailover
attribute.description:
Enables decrease of the convergence time at L2GP port failures and repairs.
If set to true, the attribute pseudoRootId in all instances of SwitchPortStp has the same value.

attribute.name: l2gpPathCost
attribute.description:
The L2GP path cost.
This attribute is applicable only if l2gpRapidFailover = true.
The L2GP path cost must be equal to, or slightly exceed, the theoretically most expensive way between two L2GPs. Typically, in a 10 Gbps network, it is set to 2000 + 2000 + 2000 = 6000.
If the value is set too high, for example 12000 instead of 6000, the convergence time increases at link failure. If the value is too low, both L2GPs are opened, but all links between them are blocked by RSTP.

class.name: Lag
class.description:
Link Aggregation Group (LAG)
A group of Ethernet links (ports) bundled together to act as a single link, to provide link redundancy and increased bandwidth.
The LAG provides load balancing over the bundled links, as configured by the attribute linkAggLinkSelection in the EthernetSwitch MO.
The LAG feature is license-controlled and it functions only when the attributes featureStateLinkAgg and licenseStateLinkAgg in the EthernetSwitchingAdm MO are ACTIVATED and ENABLED respectively.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: lacpMode
attribute.description:
Specifies the mode of LACP operation for the LAG.
If the instance of this MO is a child of EthernetSwitch MO, the only valid value is DISABLED.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: LagId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: aggregatedPortSpeed
attribute.description: The sum of the actual port speeds for all ports in this LAG.

attribute.name: masterPort
attribute.description:
The only configurable port in the LAG.
The port with the lowest port number automatically becomes the master port.
Attribute values of this port are distributed to other ports in the group.

attribute.name: requiredNumberOfLinks
attribute.description: Specifies the number of Ethernet links that need to be operational in order for the LAG to be operational.

class.name: ControlSwitch
class.description:
Control Switch
This MO represents one Control Switch board and its backplane ports which are connected to all boards in the subrack via the backplane.
There are two Control Switch boards in every subrack.

attribute.name: ControlSwitchId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: backPlanePortState
attribute.description: The state of the ethernet back plane ports.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: macAddress
attribute.description:
The Media Access Control address.
It is the mac address used to address the switch for switch management and by switch control protocols. If the board is not available, the attribute has the value "00:00:00:00:00:00".

class.name: ControlSwitchPort
class.description:
Control Switch Port
This MO represents one front port on the Control Switch board.
The Control Switch front port is active and handles traffic even if the ControlSwitchPort MO is not created.

attribute.name: ControlSwitchPortId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains an MO instance that reserves this MO instance.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: pmIfInDiscards
attribute.description: The number of received good packets, discarded even though no error had been detected (for example, lack of buffer space, discarding port state, VLAN membership).
attribute.condition: A received good packet is discarded.

attribute.name: pmIfOutErrors
attribute.description: The number of transmitted packets, discarded due to errors found in the packets.
attribute.condition: An erroneous packet is discarded.

attribute.name: pmIfOutDiscards
attribute.description: The number of transmitted good packets, discarded due to lack of resources (for example, buffer space).
attribute.condition: A transmitted good packet is discarded due to resource problems.

attribute.name: pmIfInErrors
attribute.description: The number of received packets, discarded due to errors found in the packets.
attribute.condition: An erroneous packet is discarded.

attribute.name: pmIfInBroadcastPkts
attribute.description: The number of good packets received with a broadcast address delivered to a higher sublayer.
attribute.condition: A good packet with a broadcast address is received.

attribute.name: pmIfOutUcastPkts
attribute.description: The number of good packets addressed to a unicast address, which are transmitted and delivered to a higher sublayer.
attribute.condition: 1000 good packets with unicast addresses are transmitted.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
Contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: pmIfOutOctets
attribute.description: The number of packets in octets transmitted by a port, including framing characters and bad packets, but excluding preamble sequences.
attribute.condition: 1000 packets in octets are transmitted.

attribute.name: pmIfOutBroadcastPkts
attribute.description: The number of good packets with a broadcast address, which are transmitted and delivered to a higher sublayer.
attribute.condition: A good packet with a broadcast address is transmitted.

attribute.name: actualSpeedDuplex
attribute.description:
The mode in which the port is actually operating.
The value NO_LINK means that the link is physically down.

attribute.name: pmIfInMulticastPkts
attribute.description: The number of packets, delivered by this sub-layer to a higher (sub-)layer, which were addressed to a multicast address at this sub-layer.
attribute.condition: A good packet with a multicast address is received.

attribute.name: pmIfOutMulticastPkts
attribute.description: The number of transmitted good packets, with a multicast address, that are delivered to a higher sub-layer.
attribute.condition: A good packet with a multicast address is transmitted.

attribute.name: pmIfInOctets
attribute.description: The number of packets in octets received by a port, including framing characters and bad packets, but excluding preamble sequences.
attribute.condition: 1000 packets in octets are received.

attribute.name: portNo
attribute.description:
Physical Port number associated with this MO instance.
Each ControlSwitchPort instance belonging to the same ControlSwitch must have a unique portNo, which maps the MO instance to exactly one physical port.

attribute.name: pmIfInUcastPkts
attribute.description: The number of good packets addressed to a unicast address, which are received and delivered to a higher sublayer.
attribute.condition: 1000 good packets with unicast addresses are received.

class.name: ControlInterSwitchLink
class.description:
Control Inter Switch Link (CISL)
This MO represents a link connecting two Control Switch ports.
Rules to create the links: - The left and right side LANs must be physically separated. No Control Inter Switch Links may connect the right and left side.
- No external networks may be connected to the control switches.
- Minimize jumps from one of the two central switches to the most distant switch to get optimal characteristics.
- No physical loops are allowed, redundancy is achieved by having two separate LANs.

attribute.name: ControlInterSwitchLinkId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description:
The administrative state.
Setting this attribute to LOCKED will suppress CISL alarms. However, this does not stop the traffic.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: controlSwitchPort1Ref
attribute.description: A reference to one of the ControlSwitchPort MOs to which the CISL is connected.

attribute.name: controlSwitchPort2Ref
attribute.description: A reference to one of the ControlSwitchPort MOs to which the CISL is connected.

class.name: SwitchCoreUnit
class.description:
Switch Core Unit (SCU)
This MO represents the board specific HW on the SCB. It collects HW failure on the board and sends alarms. It is also used for configuration of board specific FW.
This board can only be inserted in slot 1 and 28 in a standard subrack. The board has a number of switch internal link ports.

attribute.name: SwitchCoreUnitId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: administrativeStateSili
attribute.description:
The administrative state for the Switch Internal Link Interface (SILI) on the switch board.
This attribute refers to all ports, that is, the state LOCKED locks all ports, and UNLOCKED unlocks all ports.

attribute.name: operationalStateSil
attribute.description:
The operational state. Indicates the traffic handling capability of all ports as a group on the board, that is, it is enabled if one or more of the eight ports is enabled.
This attribute is only used for test.

attribute.name: operationalStateSync
attribute.description: The operational state of network synchronization distribution.

attribute.name: availabilityStatusSil
attribute.description:
The availability status of the Switch Internal Link (SIL) ports.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: availabilityStatusSync
attribute.description:
The availability status of the network synchronization distribution.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

attribute.name: silPorts
attribute.description:
Contains a list of port numbers.
The port number is between 0-7 and is used to read the state of the switch internal port. See also the actions getSilPortState, getOperState and getAvailState.

action.name: getSilPortState
action.description: Returns the status of the switch internal link port, which is the same as the LEDs on the unit.

action.name: getSilOperState
action.description: Returns the operational status of the switch internal link port.

action.name: getSilAvailState
action.description: Returns th availability status of the switch internal link port.

class.name: SwitchExtensionUnit
class.description:
Switch Extension Unit (SXU)
This MO represents the board specific HW on the SXB.
This board may only be inserted in slot 2-27 in a standard subrack. If redundant links are used, two boards must be inserted next to each other. The board has a number of switch internal link ports.

attribute.name: SwitchExtensionUnitId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: administrativeStateSil
attribute.description:
The administrative state for the Switch Internal Link (SIL) ports on the switch board.
This attribute refers to all ports, that is, the state LOCKED locks all ports, and UNLOCKED unlocks all ports.

attribute.name: operationalStateSil
attribute.description:
The operational state.
The operational state is enabled if one of the eight ports is enabled.

attribute.name: operationalStateSync
attribute.description: The operational state of network synchronization distribution.

attribute.name: availabilityStatusSil
attribute.description:
The availability state of the Switch Internal Link (SIL) ports.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: availabilityStatusSync
attribute.description:
The availability status of the network synchronization distribution.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

attribute.name: silPorts
attribute.description:
Contains a list of port numbers.
The port number is between 0-7 and is used to read the state of the switch internal port. Se also the actions getSilPortState, getSilOperState and getSilAvailState.

action.name: getSilPortState
action.description: Returns the status of the switch internal link port.

action.name: getSilOperState
action.description: Returns the operational status of the switch internal link port.

action.name: getSilAvailState
action.description: Returns the availability status of the switch internal link port.

class.name: SwitchFabric
class.description:
This MO represents the switch of a node. It is used for general switch configuration.
Today, only a maximum of 32 Switch Modules MOs and 2 SwitchInternalLinks MOs per InternalLinkGroup MOs are allowed in a node. However, in theory the switch addressing space in the system allows up to 256 SwitchModules MOs. This would then mean that there are 255 InternalLinkGroup MOs, each of which is allowed 256 SwitchInternalLink MOs by the addressing.
This MO is created automatically and cannot be deleted.
The RDN of this MO is SwitchFabric=1.

attribute.name: SwitchFabricId
attribute.description:
The value component of the RDN.
It is set automatically when the MO instance is created.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

class.name: SwitchModule
class.description:
This MO represents two switch planes of one subrack, that is either the main switch or an external switch.
If a non-redundant system, the administrativeStateSwitchPlaneA/B has to be set to LOCKED for the non-present plane.

attribute.name: SwitchModuleId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: switchModuleNumber
attribute.description:
Specifies the number of the switch module (SMN).
switchModuleNumber >= 0
The main switch module, with one or two TimingUnits, is given SMN = 0. SMN for extension switch modules depends on the port pair that the extension switch module is connected to in the main switch module.
The SMN is calculated according to the following formula:
switchModuleNumber [1..255] = int (APN/2)*8 + ISL-port in main [1..8] where, APN = ASCC Port Number ISL = Inter-Switch Link

attribute.name: secondSmnEvaluation
attribute.description:
Second Switch Module Number (SMN) Evaluation
There are two cables that are relevant for SMN numbering: - If the cabling is wrong, secondSmnEvaluation shows the second opinion about the switchModuleNumber. - Under normal conditions secondSmnEvaluation = switchModuleNumber.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description:
The administrative state.
When setting the administrativeState to SHUTTING_DOWN, a notification is sent that the state has been changed to LOCKED. There is however no guarantee that this operation has been successful due to limitations in the resource layer.

attribute.name: administrativeStateSwitchPlaneA
attribute.description:
The administrative state of switch plane A. It is not allowed to lock both switch plane A and B.
When setting the administrativeState to SHUTTING_DOWN, a notification is sent that the state has been changed to LOCKED. There is however no guarantee that this operation has been successful due to limitations in the resource layer.

attribute.name: administrativeStateSwitchPlaneB
attribute.description:
The administrative state of switch plane B. It is not allowed to lock both switch plane A and B.
When setting the administrativeState to SHUTTING_DOWN, a notification is sent that the state has been changed to LOCKED. There is however no guarantee that this operation has been successful due to limitations in the resource layer.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description:
The operational state.
At least one of the switch planes is set to ENABLED.

attribute.name: operationalStateSwitchPlaneA
attribute.description:
The operational state of Switch Module plane A.
This attribute is set to DISABLED if any of the switch ports is faulty. But the switch may still be used.

attribute.name: operationalStateSwitchPlaneB
attribute.description:
The operational state of Switch Module plane B.
This attribute is set to DISABLED if any of the switch ports is faulty. But the switch may still be used.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: availabilityStatusSwitchPlaneA
attribute.description:
The availability status of the Switch Plane A.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: availabilityStatusSwitchPlaneB
attribute.description:
The availability status of the Switch Plane B.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: activeSwitchPlane
attribute.description:
Specifies the active switch plane: A or B.
During multiple faults, both plan A and B may be used.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

class.name: InternalLinkGroup
class.description:
The Internal Link Group MO represents all switch internal links connecting the main switch to an external switch.
Switch internal links are automatically grouped in Reliable Groups for redundancy.

attribute.name: InternalLinkGroupId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: switchModuleNumber1
attribute.description: Contains a reference to the SwitchModule MO that is interconnected by the link in the InternalLinkGroup.

attribute.name: switchModuleNumber2
attribute.description: Contains a reference to the SwitchModule MO that is interconnected by the link in the InternalLinkGroup.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: The administrative state.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational status.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: currentPmRegister
attribute.description:
Returns the current values of all PM counters.
To read the values of the PM counter, start a measurement on that PM counter for the MO instance. Otherwise, the value of the PM counter is set to -1.
attribute.obsolete: Has no functional behavior and is now redundant. Read operations can return undefined values.

attribute.name: pmPeakBwLevel
attribute.description:
The counter shows the traffic load for each internal link group, consisting of a list of 8 numbers. The load is sampled every 2 s.
The counter is not supported on some boards. If enabled on unsupported boards, this can lead to traffic loss. Refer to the description of the relevant board for details.
PDF ranges: [0]: [0..74]%, [1]: [75..79]%, [2]: [80..84]%, [3]: [85..89]%, [4]: [90..93]%, [5]: [94..96]%, [6]: [97..99]%, [7]: [100]%
attribute.condition: Continuous measurement of load during the last measurement period.

action.name: getRlgLinks
action.description:
Returns a list of resource instance identities of the switch internal links in the specified Reliable Group.
The existing Reliable Groups are listed with action getReliableLinkGroups.

parameter.name: rlgNumber
parameter.description: Reliable link group number.

action.name: getLinkStatus
action.description: Returns the status of the specified switch internal link, within the specified Reliable Group.

parameter.name: rlgNumber
parameter.description: Reliable link group number.

action.name: getReliableLinkGroups
action.description:
Returns a sequence of Reliable Group numbers.
Each Reliable Group is identified by a unique number which can be used to read out the identities of the switch internal links that are allocated to the Reliable Group. This is done with action getRlgLinks.
The allocation of switch internal links to Reliable Groups is automatic.

class.name: SwitchInternalLink
class.description:
This MO represents a link interconnecting from either an SCB or an SXB port on the main switch to a SCB on an external switch.
The main switch is located in the hub subrack.
The SCB is represented by the SwitchCoreUnit MO, while the SXB is represented by the SwitchExtensionUnit MO.
Switch internal links are automatically grouped in Reliable Groups for redundancy.

attribute.name: SwitchInternalLinkId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: plugInUnit1
attribute.description: Contains a reference of one connection point for a SwitchCoreUnit or SwitchExtensionUnit.

attribute.name: plugInUnit2
attribute.description: Contains a reference of one connection point for a SwitchCoreUnit or SwitchExtensionUnit.

attribute.name: siliport1
attribute.description:
Switch internal port number on PlugInUnit 1.
On a standard SCB/SXB board, the ports are labeled from the bottom to the top.
Port nr -> label: 0 -> D 1 -> C 2 -> B 3 -> A
Note that this mapping can change when a board is added or removed.

attribute.name: siliport2
attribute.description:
Switch internal port number on PlugInUnit 2.
On a standard SCB/SXB board, the ports are labeled from the bottom to the top.
Port nr -> label: 0 -> D 1 -> C 2 -> B 3 -> A
Note that this mapping can change when a board is added or removed.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: The administrative state.

attribute.name: operationalStateTraffic
attribute.description:
The operational state of switch internal link.
There is no traffic if the link is set to DISABLED.

attribute.name: availabilityStatusTraffic
attribute.description:
The availability status of the switch internal link.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: operationalStateSync
attribute.description:
The operational state of network synchronization distribution.
There is no clock distribution if the link is set to DISABLED.

attribute.name: availabilityStatusSync
attribute.description:
The availability status of the network synchronization distribution.
It contains details about operationalState.

class.name: OspfInterface
class.description:
Open Shortest Path First (OSPF) Interface
This MO represents an interface that is used by the OSPF protocol to communicate with a neighbor node. By connecting an OSPF interface to a link MO that link is defined as a link to be used by OSPF.
Each OspfInterface MO must always be connected to an OspfArea MO.
Disturbances: Changing some of these attributes may cause a disturbance or loss of OAM connectivity. If there are any doubts regarding the results of the attribute changes, it is strongly recommended to activate the robust rollback function, by setting the attribute configCountdownActivated on the ConfigurationVersion MO first.

attribute.name: OspfInterfaceId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: ospfAreaRelated
attribute.description: The identity of the OspfArea connected to this OspfInterface. The default value is the default OspfArea MO.

attribute.name: lsaTransmissionInterval
attribute.description: The time between LSA re-transmissions over the interface.

attribute.name: helloInterval
attribute.description:
The time between sending OSPF Hello-packets over the interface.
This attribute must have a positive value.

attribute.name: routerDeadInterval
attribute.description: The time after which a neighbor router is declared dead when not heard from.

attribute.name: interfaceTransitDelay
attribute.description: Estimated delay for the transmission of a link state update package over the interface.

attribute.name: interfacePriority
attribute.description:
The interface priority. Each router is configured with a priority configured from 0 - 255 where 0 is the lowest priority and 255 the highest.
This attribute must have a positive value.

attribute.name: relatedLink
attribute.description:
Each OSPF interface is connected to one IP link.
The relatedLink can be either an IpAtmLink or an EthernetLink MO reference.

attribute.name: pmNoOfOspfIfEvents
attribute.description: The number of times this OSPF interface has changed its state or that an error has occurred. For more detailed information, see RFC 1850.
attribute.condition: A state change or error occurrence.

class.name: OspfArea
class.description:
Open Shortest Path First (OSPF) Area
An OSPF autonomous system is divided into OSPF areas. The OspfArea MO represents such OSPF areas.
A default OspfArea MO is automatically created when the Ospf MO is created and can only be deleted by deleting the Ospf MO.
It has the identity 1 or default_aue, that is the LDN of this MO is: ManagedElement=1,IpSystem=1,Ospf=1,OspfArea=1 or ManagedElement=1,IpSystem=1,Ospf=1,OspfArea=default_aue. The latter is created at an upgrade if the an OspfArea=1 already exists, that is not backbone OspfArea with areaId=0.0.0.0.
A maximum of 4 OspfAreas can be configured each with a maximum of 8 interfaces.
Disturbances: Changing some of these attributes may cause a disturbance or loss of OAM connectivity. If there are any doubts regarding the results of the attribute changes, it is strongly recommended to activate the robust rollback function, by setting the attribute configCountdownActivated on the ConfigurationVersion MO first.

attribute.name: OspfAreaId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: stubArea
attribute.description: Specifies whether the OSPF area is a stub area or not.

attribute.name: importExternalLsa
attribute.description: Specifies whether importing Autonomous System external LSAs is supported.

attribute.name: sendAreaSummary
attribute.description: Specifies whether the router originates and propagates summary LSAs into a stub-area.

attribute.name: stubAreaMetric
attribute.description:
Cost for default router when the router advertises into a stub area and the router is an area border router.
This attribute is set by default to the least metric among the interfaces to other areas.

attribute.name: stubAreaMetricType
attribute.description:
Stub area metric type.
RFC 1850 (OSPF V2 MIB):
comparableCost (external type 1) nonComparable (external type 2)

attribute.name: areaLsaChecksum
attribute.description: Represents 32-bit unsigned sum of the link-state advertisements LS check-sums contained in this area's link-state database.

attribute.name: areaId
attribute.description:
The OSPF area identity in form of an IP address. This areId uniquely identifies the area.
AreaId 0.0.0.0 is used for the OSPF backbone.
Range: 000.000.000.000 to 255.255.255.255.

attribute.name: range0
attribute.description: OspfArea IP address range zero (0).

attribute.name: range1
attribute.description: OspfArea IP address range one (1).

attribute.name: range2
attribute.description: OspfArea IP address range two (2).

attribute.name: pmNoOfOspfSpfRuns
attribute.description: The number of times that the intra-area route table has been calculated using the link-state database for this area. This is typically done using Dijkstras algorithm. For more detailed information, see RFC 1850.
attribute.condition: The link-state database is updated.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

action.name: addAreaRange
action.description: Adds aggregation range. Used to add a range of IP addresses to an OSPF area.

parameter.name: range
parameter.description: The area range aggregation.

action.name: deleteAreaRange
action.description:
Deletes an IP address range. Used to remove a range of IP addresses from an OSPF area.
Input is the area aggregation range index.

class.name: Ospf
class.description:
Open Shortest Path First (OSPF)
This MO represents an instance of the OSPF routing protocol running in a CPP based node.
When the Ospf MO is created a default OspfArea MO is also created. This OspfArea has the areaId 000.000.000.000. This is deleted when the Ospf MO is deleted.
The attribute range0 in the default OspfArea MO contains the following values: advertise = false ipAddress = 000.000.000.000 subnetMask = 000.000.000.000
Disturbances: Changing some of these attributes may cause a disturbance or loss of OAM connectivity. If there are any doubts regarding the results of the attribute changes, it is strongly recommended to activate the robust rollback function, by setting the attribute configCountdownActivated on the ConfigurationVersion MO first.

attribute.name: OspfId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: ospfRouterId
attribute.description:
This attribute has the format of an IP address.
To set this attribute, administrativeState has to be set to LOCKED.
The ospfRouterId is uniquely identifying the router in the Autonomous System. By convention to ensure uniqueness, this is configured to the value of one of the router's IP interface addresses.

attribute.name: ospfASBdrRtrStatus
attribute.description:
Specifies whether this router is configured as an Autonomous System border router.
This attribute must be set to true if the user wants to configure static routes, which are distributed to other OSPF routes as external routes.
Configuration of static routes is the same as adding and deleting static routes to the IpRoutingTable MO.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description:
The operational state.
This attribute can only be set to ENABLED when the attribute, workingMode in Ip MO is set to ROUTER_MODE.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: The administrative state.

attribute.name: ospfAreaBdrRtrStatus
attribute.description:
Area border router flag.
Indicates whether the router is acting as an area border router or not.

attribute.name: ipMo
attribute.description: Contains a reference to an Ip MO instance that reserves this MO.

attribute.name: pmNoOfOspfOriginateNewLsas
attribute.description: The number of new Link-State Advertisements (LSA) that have been originated. This number is incremented each time the router originates a new LSA. For more detailed information, see RFC 1850.
attribute.condition: A link related to the OSPF interface changes state, or during LSA refresh every 30 minutes.

attribute.name: pmNoOfOspfRxNewLsas
attribute.description: The number of Link-State Advertisements (LSA) received that are determined to be new instantiations. This number does not include newer instantiations of self-originated link-state advertisements. For more detailed information, see RFC 1850.
attribute.condition: An LSA is sent from the neighbor.

attribute.name: recoverTopoDb
attribute.description: Indicates whether the topology database is to be recovered from the database at restart.

attribute.name: topoDbStoreInterv
attribute.description: The interval with which the topology database is stored.

class.name: IpRoutingTable
class.description:
Internet Protocol (IP) Routing Table
This MO represents the IP routing table for the node.
This MO is created automatically as a consequence of creating an Ip MO, and cannot be deleted.
The RDN of this MO is IpRoutingTable=1.
Disturbances: Changing some of the attributes on this MO may cause a disturbance or loss of IP connectivity. If there are any doubts regarding the results of the attribute changes, it is strongly recommended to activate the robust rollback function, by setting the attribute configCountdownActivated on the ConfigurationVersion MO first.

attribute.name: IpRoutingTableId
attribute.description:
The value component of the RDN.
It is set automatically when the MO instance is created.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: indexOfDeletableStaticRoutes
attribute.description:
This attribute gives the indices for the static routes that can be deleted.
The indices are the same as those that are listed with the action listRoutes.

attribute.name: staticRoutes
attribute.description:
List of static routes.
When this attribute is set, all the static routes in the node configuration are either added, removed, modified or unchanged.
The actions, addStaticRoute and deleteStaticRoute, can be used to add or remove one single static route.
attribute.disturbances: Changing this attribute can affect OAM traffic.

action.name: addStaticRoute
action.description: Adds a new static route to the routing table.

parameter.name: ipAddress
parameter.description:
The destination IP address.
This IP address shall be the subnetwork address or host address corresponding to the subnetMask parameter. Otherwise it will automatically be corrected by calculating the bitwise AND of ipAddress and subnetMask.
Examples: ipAddress subnetMask => ipAddress corrected to 134.138.14.1 255.255.255.0 => 134.138.14.0 2001::1 64 => 2001:: 134.138.14.1 255.255.255.255 => 134.138.14.1 134.138.14.1 0.0.0.0 => 0.0.0.0

parameter.name: subnetMask
parameter.description:
The destination IP network mask or the network prefix length.
For IPv4, this attribute can be specified in dot-decimal format (network mask) or as a digit (network prefix length), range 0..32. The output format for IPv4 routes, in the action listRoutes, is always in dot-decimal format.
For IPv6, this attribute must be specified as a digit, range 0..128.
Examples: 255.255.255.0 64

parameter.name: hopIpAddress
parameter.description:
The next hop IP address.
If an attempt is made to add a static route with hopIpAddress starting with 0 or :: an exception is thrown.

parameter.name: routeMetric
parameter.description: The route metric.

parameter.name: redistribute
parameter.description: Specifies if the route shall be distributed via OSPF. This is only valid for IPv4 routes, set to false for IPv6 routes.

action.name: listRoutes
action.description:
Lists all static routes and some selected dynamic routes. It requires no input parameters.
The output is a formatted string, indicating the number of routes in the table followed by route information for each of these routes.
The routes are listed in an indexed order with the top row being index 0, the second row index 1, and so on. These indicies may be used in the action getRoutingTableEntry and are also the ones referred to in the attribute indexOfDeletableStaticRoutes. They are not the same as those in staticRoutes.indexOfStaticRoute.
The number of routes in the table is found at the very start of the returned string. Immediately following this is the information on each route in the list in turn. The route information for each route begins with a new line character (\n) and is followed by the following data items (in the order written below), which are separated from each other by a SPACE character:
- Destination IP address - Destination network mask for IPv4 routes or network prefix length for IPv6 routes - Next hop IP address or "onlink" for connected networks (interface routes) - Route metric - Route type - Interface name - Redistribute - Active
Below is an example list of routes that could be returned from this action: 6 0.0.0.0 0.0.0.0 134.138.14.1 10 2 le0 FALSE active 10.1.1.0 255.255.255.0 134.138.12.50 11 2 le0 FALSE active 134.138.14.0 255.255.255.0 onlink 1 2 le0 FALSE active 127.0.0.1 255.255.255.255 onlink 1 2 lo0 FALSE active 10.2.2.0 255.255.255.0 192.168.0.1 10 2 ~ FALSE inactive :: 0 2001:abcd:1234:5678::1 10 2 ipif1 FALSE active
In this case, there is one IPV4 default route, one active static route, two interface routes for le0 and lo0, one inactive static route and one IPV6 default route.
Note that the route types can be of the following types:
INET_RTPROTO_OTHER 1 INET_RTPROTO_LOCAL 2 INET_RTPROTO_NETMGMT 3 INET_RTPROTO_ICMP 4 INET_RTPROTO_OSPF 13
The types listed above also denote the origin of the routing entry.

action.name: getRoutingTableEntry
action.description:
Returns a RoutingTableEntry according to the specified index.
To be used with action, numberOfRoutes, within a transaction. To refresh the routing table stored in the MO, invoke the action numberOfRoutes.

action.name: numberOfRoutes
action.description:
Returns the number of entries in the routing table.
Each time this action is invoked, the MO retrieves routing table information from the resource layer and then builds a new array of RoutingTable structs to store this information.
The position or index of each route, in this array, is used to identify the route in getRoutingTableEntry() and in the indexOfStaticRoute in struct StaticRoute, which is a unique identifier for a static route. The unique identifier remains the same until explicitly changed, whereas its position in the array, built by this action, may change as routes are added or removed. The array contains both static and dynamic routes.
If this action is used together with getRoutingTableEntry(), which allows one to iterate through the array stored in the MO, the actions need transaction handling and they should be handled within the same transaction.

action.name: deleteStaticRoute
action.description:
Removes the RoutingTableEntry submitted as a parameter from the Routing Table, if it is found in the table.
Only static routes, previously added, can be deleted with this action.

action.name: modifyStaticRoute
action.description:
Modifies a static route in the routing table. All properties of a static route can be changed with this action.
All properties in oldRoute and newRoute must be specified.

parameter.name: oldRoute
parameter.description: Describes the properties of an existing route.

parameter.name: newRoute
parameter.description: Describes the properties wanted, after this action has been executed.

class.name: Ip
class.description:
Internet Protocol (IP)
This MO represents the IP protocol layer with IP forwarding functionality.
The PM counters in the Ip MO have a wrap-around time of approximately 2 hours.
The PM counters on the IP MO do not increment for IPv6 traffic. The counters reflect the aggregated OAM IPv4.
Disturbances: Changing some of the attributes on this MO may cause a disturbance or loss of OAM connectivity. If there are any doubts regarding the results of the attribute changes, it is strongly recommended to activate the robust rollback function, by setting the attribute configCountdownActivated on the ConfigurationVersion MO first.

attribute.name: dnsServerAddresses
attribute.description:
A list of IP addresses to Domain Name Servers.
IPv4 and IPv6 addresses are supported.
The input format for an IPv4 address is four fields of digits, separated by a dot. Each field consists of one to three digits. The input format for an IPv6 address is as defined in specification RFC4291, chapter 2.2, bullet 1 and 2. Example: 192.168.33.27 2001:db8:0::1
A maximum of 3 DNS server addresses is supported.

attribute.name: IpId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: workingMode
attribute.description: Specifies if the IP stack in the node works as a combined host/router (ROUTER_MODE) or only as a host (HOST_MODE).
attribute.dependencies: If the IpHostLink MO is used, do not set this attribute to ROUTER_MODE, since routing on incoming OAM traffic is not supported on this link type.

attribute.name: retransInterval
attribute.description: The retransmission interval.

attribute.name: noOfRetrans
attribute.description: The number of retransmissions.

attribute.name: isRecursiveSearch
attribute.description:
Specifies how the DNS client wants the DNS server do the search for the IP address in the network .
true - recursive search false - non-recursive search

attribute.name: isSubDomainName
attribute.description:
Specifies whether to use subsets of the fully qualified domain name to reach the simple domain name.
true - use subsets of domain name false - do not use subsets of domain name

attribute.name: isDefDomainName
attribute.description:
Specifies whether the default domain name is present.
true - present false - not present

attribute.name: defDomainName
attribute.description:
Contains default domain name. If isDefDomainName is set to true, the domain name found in this attribute is used by the DNS resolver and there is no need to submit the complete domain name. If the domain name is for example 'ws5741.uab.ericsson.se', then the default domain name would be '.uab.ericsson.se'. If isDefDomainName is set to true, there is no need for using '.uab.ericsson.se'. If set to false, then the complete domain name has to be used.
A valid domain name consists of one or more labels separated by dots ("."). Valid characters for a label shall be limited to letters 'a' - 'z', 'A' - 'Z', digits '0' - '9', the character '-' ("dash"). Character case shall be preserved. Total length of a label shall not exceed 255 characters.
The first and last character in the domain name has to be within the following alphabet: letters 'a' - 'z', 'A' - 'Z' and digits '0' - '9'.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description:
The operational state.
This attribute is set to ENABLED if at least one link is operational.

attribute.name: numberOfLinks
attribute.description: Indicates the number of links which are configured for the Ip MO. The links are the MOs: EthernetLink, IpAtmLink, IpHostLink and IpAccessHostEt.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains an Ospf MO instance that reserves this MO instance.

attribute.name: useHostFile
attribute.description:
Specifies if the host file is used. The hostFile is used by the resolver and chosen as a source of information before querying a DNS server.
true - use the host file false - do not use the host file
This is an example of the host file: 127.0.0.1 localhost 192.102.73.6 somehost 2001:db8::1 somehost
The file name is hosts and the path is /c/configuration.

attribute.name: dscp
attribute.description:
The DiffServ CodePoint.
The code point values are used by DiffServ enabled hosts and router to identify different service levels. When set, the DSCPs are mapped to Per Hop Behaviours (PHB) by forwarding devices along the path between the source and destination. PHBs dictates how each packet is handled, that is, what type of service that is applied to the packet when it is forwarded.
Only traffic originated from the node is tagged with the dscp value. The CPP based router does not implement functionality for handling different service levels when routing IP traffic.

attribute.name: icmpRedirect
attribute.description: Indicates if ICMP redirects is sent out or not.

attribute.name: udpChecksumState
attribute.description:
Enables or disables generation of UDP checksum. 0 = disabled 1 = enabled
The UDP checksum is used to verify that the UDP header has not been damaged during transmission.

attribute.name: connectionAttemptTimer
attribute.description: The time that elapses before a connection (TCP) attempt times out.
attribute.obsolete: Has no functional behaviour. It has become redundant and will be silently ignored. The default value is always used.

attribute.name: maxRetransmissionAttempts
attribute.description: The maximum number of retransmission attempts before a TCP connection is dropped. The default value is 12 attempts, which is around 15 minutes.
attribute.obsolete: Has no functional behaviour. It has become redundant and will be silently ignored. The default value is always used.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIpInReceives
attribute.description: Total number of datagrams received.
attribute.condition: An IP datagram is received.

attribute.name: pmNoOfHdrErrors
attribute.description: The number of datagrams discarded due to format error.
attribute.condition: An datagram with errors in its IP header is received.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIpAddrErrors
attribute.description: The number of datagrams discarded due to error in the address.
attribute.condition: A datagram with faulty destination address is received.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIpForwDatagrams
attribute.description: The number of datagrams forwarded.
attribute.condition: A datagram is forwarded.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIpInDiscards
attribute.description: The number of datagrams discarded due to resource limitations.
attribute.condition: A lot of datagrams that are needed to be fragmented and forwarded are received at a high rate.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIpOutDiscards
attribute.description: The number of datagrams discarded due to lack of resources.
attribute.condition: A lot of datagrams that are needed to be forwarded are received at a high rate.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIpReasmReqds
attribute.description: The number of fragments received that need reassembly.
attribute.condition: The fragmented datagrams that are addressed to the node are received.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIpReasmOKs
attribute.description: The number of datagrams successfully reassembled.
attribute.condition: A successful fragment reassembly occurred.

attribute.name: nodeInterfaceName
attribute.description: The interface name of the link object that determines the OAM IPv4 address for the node. This attribute cannot be set to an empty string.
attribute.dependencies: The value of this attribute is set to the value of the attribute interfaceName in the EthernetLink MO, or in the IpHostLink MO. The referenced link MO must exist, and specify the wanted nodeIpv4Address as the first element of the ipv4addresses attribute.
attribute.disturbances: Changing this attribute on this MO may cause a disturbance or loss of OAM connectivity or ORB restart.

attribute.name: nodeIpAddress
attribute.description: The OAM IPv4 address for the node.

attribute.name: ipAccessHostEtRef
attribute.description:
Specifies an IpAccessHostEt MO to be used as an alternative OAM access.
The purpose of the alternative OAM access is to have a limited access to the node through the outer IP host, if IPsec protection is used for the OAM traffic and the contact through IPsec is lost. If IPsec protection is used for OAM traffic the IpHostLink MO for the node access is connected to a VpnInterface MO. The alternative OAM access can be used for SSH communication (TCP port 22). The alternative OAM access is handled as any other type of link. That is, it is included in the attribute numberOfLinks, and in the operationalState and the availabilityStatus. The alternative OAM access is also visible as a route in the IpRoutingTable MO.
Only applicable for IPv4.

attribute.name: nodeIpv6InterfaceName
attribute.description: The interface name of the link object that determines the OAM IPv6 address for the node. The OAM IPv6 address for the node is removed if this attribute is set to an empty string.
attribute.dependencies: The value of this attribute is set to the value of the attribute interfaceName in the IpHostLink MO. The referenced link MO must exist, and specify the wanted nodeIpv6Address as the first element of the ipv6addresses attribute.
attribute.disturbances: Changing this attribute on this MO may cause a disturbance or loss of OAM connectivity or ORB restart.

attribute.name: nodeIpv6Address
attribute.description: The OAM IPv6 address for the node.

action.name: enableLink
action.description:
Enables the link referred to by the parameter.
For use by Ericsson staff only.

parameter.name: interfaceName
parameter.description: The interface name of the link.

action.name: disableLink
action.description:
Disables the link referred to by the parameter.
For use by Ericsson staff only.

parameter.name: interfaceName
parameter.description: The interface name of the link.

class.name: IpAtmLink
class.description:
Internet Protocol (IP) over ATM link.
LLC/SNAP encapsulated packets over AAL5, ATM PVCs, are used.
The performance monitoring counters in the IpAtmLink MO has a "Wrap-around time" of approximately 2 hours.
When setting the attributes fromUserMaxSduSize and toUserMaxSduSize on the Aal5TpVccTp MO, the defined SDU size must be 8 bytes larger then the mtuSize on the IpAtmLink MO.
Only Aal5TpVccTp MOs that terminates on an MP (Main Processor) may be used when setting up IpAtmLink MOs.
Disturbances: Changing some of the attributes on this MO may cause a disturbance or loss of OAM connectivity. If there are any doubts regarding the results of the attribute changes, it is strongly recommended to activate the robust rollback function, by setting the attribute configCountdownActivated on the ConfigurationVersion MO first.

attribute.name: IpAtmLinkId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description:
The operational state.
This attribute is dependent of the supervision of the link or, if it is closed, of the operational states of the underlying AAL5 termination points (Aal5TpVccTp MO) that are used to transport IP datagrams.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains an OspfInterface MO instance that reserves this MO instance.

attribute.name: ipAddress
attribute.description: The input format used by the operator is four fields of digits, separated by a dot. Each field consists of three digits.

attribute.name: subnetMask
attribute.description:
The attribute subnetMask states the subnet mask of the IP over ATM link (point-to-point link).
The input format used by the operator is four fields of digits, separated by a dot. Each field consists of three digits. For a point-to-point link, the subnet mask 255.255.255.252 is very likely.
The subnet mask has to be contiguous. That is, it has the LSB's set to 0 (zero).
Example:
255.255.255.X
Contiguous subnet mask: 11111111.11111111.11111111.11111110 (X = 254) 11111111.11111111.11111111.11111100 (X = 252)
Non-contiguous subnet mask: 11111111.11111111.11111111.11111010 (X = 250)

attribute.name: mtuSize
attribute.description:
Specifies the maximum IP datagram size that may be sent on the IP over ATM link in bytes, without fragmentation. Recommended MTU size is 1500 bytes to prevent IP fragmentation.
Note that the size of the IP datagram does not include the 8 Bytes added for the LLC/SNAP header before putting the IP datagram in AAL5 SDU.

attribute.name: metric
attribute.description:
The attribute metric states the metric "cost" of the IP over ATM link. The metric value is calculated as 10^8 /link bit speed.
For example: Metric for 10 Mbps Ethernet = 10^8/10^7 = 10 Metric for 100 Mbps Ethernet = 10^8/10^8 = 1

attribute.name: monitor
attribute.description: Specifies whether InvATMARP monitor is turned on or off.

attribute.name: monitorInterval
attribute.description: The interval between sending monitor packets.

attribute.name: monitorRetries
attribute.description: The number of retries when sending monitor packets.

attribute.name: interfaceName
attribute.description: The interface name.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIfInUcastPkts
attribute.description: The number of input unicast packets delivered to higher layer.
attribute.condition: A unicast IP packet is received.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIfInNUcastPkts
attribute.description: The number of input broadcast or multicast packets delivered to higher layer.
attribute.condition: A broadcast or multicast IP packet is received.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIfOutUcastPkts
attribute.description: The number of packets that higher-level protocols requested to be transmitted to a subnetwork-unicast address.
attribute.condition: A unicast IP packet is sent.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIfOutNUcastPkts
attribute.description: The number of output broadcast or multicast packets delivered to higher layer.
attribute.condition: A broadcast or multicast IP packet is sent.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIfInErrors
attribute.description: The number of input packets discarded due to any error.
attribute.condition: An erroneous IP packet is received.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIfInDiscards
attribute.description: The number of input packets discarded due to resource limitations.
attribute.condition: A lot of packets received at high rate.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIfOutDiscards
attribute.description: The number of outbound packets discarded due to resource limitations.
attribute.condition: A lot of packets sent at high rate.

attribute.name: aal5TpVccTpId
attribute.description:
Reference to an Aal5TpVccTp MO instance that represents the underlying AAL5 termination point (of an AAL5 PVC:s) for the IP over ATM link.
The operator gives the name of the Aal5TpVccTp MO to be used by the IP over ATM link.
Only Aal5TpVccTp MOs that terminates on an MP (Main Processor) may be used when setting up IpAtmLink MOs.

action.name: assignIpAddress
action.description: Sets the IP address and the subnet mask.

parameter.name: ipAddress
parameter.description: The input format used by the operator is four fields of digits, separated by a dot. Each field consists of one to three digits.

parameter.name: subnetMask
parameter.description: The input format used by the operator is four fields of digits, separated by a dot. Each field consists of one to three digits.

action.disturbances: The changing of the IP address with the operation assignIpAddress, may cause an interruption of the communication between the node and the network management tool. If an incorrect or erroneous IP address is configured, the communication with the node might be lost until the node is restarted or the IP address is changed to the correct value.

class.name: EthernetLink
class.description:
Ethernet Link
This MO represents the Internet Protocol over Ethernet link. There is a maximum of just one EthernetLink MO on the node.
Up to 5 unique IPv4 addresses can be assigned to this MO. The addresses are stored in a list in the attribute ipv4Addresses. The first entry of the address list is a candidate to be used as a node OAM IP address, which is configured in the Ip MO.
The EthernetLink MO cannot be deleted, if its first IP address is used as a node OAM IP address. Refer to the attribute nodeInterfaceName in the Ip MO for details.
The PM counters in the EthernetLink MO have a wrap-around time of approximately two hours.
Disturbances: Changing attributes of this MO can cause interruption of the OAM communication if the network management tool is connected via the Ethernet link. If there are any doubts regarding the results of the attribute changes, it is strongly recommended to activate the robust rollback function, by setting the attribute configCountdownActivated on the ConfigurationVersion MO first.

attribute.name: EthernetLinkId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: interfaceName
attribute.description: The interface name.
attribute.dependencies: The value of this attribute can be used as a reference, by the attributes nodeInterfaceName and nodeIpv6InterfaceName in the Ip MO.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: ipAddress
attribute.description:
Specifies the first IPv4 address of the Ethernet link. This attribute together with the attributes broadcastAddress and subnetMask is also represented by the first element of the attribute ipv4Addresses.
The input format for an IPv4 address is four fields of digits, separated by a dot. Each field consists of one to three digits. The address must not be a broadcast or multicast address.
