attribute.deprecated: Replaced by the first list entry of the attribute ipv4Addresses. This attribute will provide the same value as the replaced attribute.
attribute.dependencies: The value of this attribute must not be identical to the value of the attribute ipAddress in the IpHostLink MO.

attribute.name: subnetMask
attribute.description:
States the subnet mask for the first IPv4 address of the Ethernet link.
This attribute together with the attributes ipAddress and broadcastAddress, is also represented by the first element of the attribute ipv4Addresses.
This attribute and the attribute ipv4Addresses must not be set in the same transaction.
The input format for an IPv4 address is four fields of digits, separated by a dot. Each field consists of one to three digits.
The subnet mask must be contiguous.
Example: 255.255.255.X
Contiguous subnet masks: 11111111.11111111.11111111.11111110 (X = 254) 11111111.11111111.11111111.11111100 (X = 252)
Non-contiguous subnet mask: 11111111.11111111.11111111.11111010 (X = 250)
attribute.deprecated: Replaced by the first list entry of the attribute ipv4Addresses. This attribute will provide the same value as the replaced attribute.

attribute.name: broadcastAddress
attribute.description:
Specifies the first IPv4 broadcast address for the Ethernet link.
This attribute, together with the attributes ipAddress and subnetMask, is also represented by the first element of the attribute ipv4Addresses.
This attribute and the attribute ipv4Addresses must not be set in the same transaction.
The input format for an IPv4 address is four fields of digits, separated by a dot. Each field consists of one to three digits.
attribute.deprecated: Replaced by the first list entry of the attribute ipv4Addresses. This attribute will provide the same value as the replaced attribute.

attribute.name: mtuSize
attribute.description: Maximum transmission Unit for the Ethernet link.

attribute.name: metric
attribute.description:
Specifies the metric of the Ethernet link. The metric value is calculated as 10^8 divided by the link bit speed.
For example: Metric for 10 Mbps Ethernet = 10^8/10^7 = 10 Metric for 100 Mbps or faster Ethernet = 10^8/10^8 = 1

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description:
The operational state.
This attribute is dependent of the operational states of the underlying MAUs that represent the Ethernet transceiver function. If there is at least one operational MAU, the operationalState of EthernetLink is set to ENABLED.

attribute.name: macAddress
attribute.description: The MAC address is persistently stored in the flash PROM on the MP where the IP stack resides. It is stored there when the board is manufactured.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIfInUcastPkts
attribute.description:
The number of input unicast packets delivered to higher layer.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: A unicast IP packet is received.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIfInNUcastPkts
attribute.description:
The number of input broadcast or multicast packets delivered to higher layer.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: A broadcast or multicast IP packet is received.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIfOutUcastPkts
attribute.description:
The number of packets that higher-level protocols requested to be transmitted to a subnetwork-unicast address.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: A unicast IP packet is sent.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIfInErrors
attribute.description:
The number of input packets discarded due to any error.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: An erroneous IP packet is received.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIfInDiscards
attribute.description:
The number of input packets discarded due to resource limitations.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: A lot of packets received at high rate.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIfOutNUcastPkts
attribute.description:
The number of transmitted outgoing broadcast or multicast packets.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: A broadcast or multicast IP packet is sent.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIfOutDiscards
attribute.description:
The number of outbound packets discarded due to resource limitations.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: A lot of packets sent at high rate.

attribute.name: activeMau
attribute.description: Reference to the active Medium Access Unit (MAU).

attribute.name: availableMaus
attribute.description: Contains a list of references to all available Medium Access Units (MAUs).

attribute.name: ipv4Addresses
attribute.description: Specifies a list of all IPv4 addresses for the EthernetLink MO. The first entry of this list can be used as OAM node IP address. See Ip MO for configuration of OAM node IP address. The first entry of this list is also represented by the IPv4 address attributes: broadcastAddress, ipAddress and subnetMask. The ipAddress in the first element of this attribute cannot be set to 0.0.0.0 or an empty string.

attribute.name: ipv6Addresses
attribute.description:
Specifies a list of all IPv6 addresses for the EthernetLink MO. The first entry of this list can be used as OAM node IP address. See Ip MO for configuration of OAM node IP address.
IPv6 addresses can be used for test purposes only.

attribute.name: pmIpIfStatsInOctets
attribute.description:
The total number of received IP octets, including those with errors.
For test purpose only.
Only applicable for IPv6.
attribute.condition: An IP octet is received.

attribute.name: pmIpIfStatsInReceives
attribute.description:
The number of received IP datagrams, including those with errors.
For test purpose only.
Only applicable for IPv6.
attribute.condition: An IP datagram is received.

attribute.name: pmIpIfStatsOutOctets
attribute.description:
The total number of transmitted IP octets.
For test purpose only.
Only applicable for IPv6.
attribute.condition: An IP octet is transmitted.

attribute.name: pmIpIfStatsOutTransmits
attribute.description:
The total number of transmitted IP datagrams.
For test purpose only.
Only applicable for IPv6.
attribute.condition: An IP datagram is transmitted.

attribute.name: pmIpIfStatsInHdrErrors
attribute.description:
The number of received IP datagrams discarded due to errors in their IP headers, including version number mismatch, other format errors, hop count exceeded, errors discovered in processing their IP options, etc.
For test purpose only.
Only applicable for IPv6.
attribute.condition: An IP datagram discarded.

attribute.name: pmIpIfStatsInAddrErrors
attribute.description:
The number of recived IP datagrams discarded, because the IP address in their IP header's destination field was not a valid address to be received at this entity.
For test purpose only.
Only applicable for IPv6.
attribute.condition: An IP datagram discarded.

attribute.name: pmIpIfStatsInUnknownProtos
attribute.description:
The number of locally-addressed IP datagrams received successfully but discarded because of an unknown or unsupported protocol.
For test purpose only.
Only applicable for IPv6.
attribute.condition: An IP datagram is received.

attribute.name: pmIpIfStatsReasmReqds
attribute.description:
The number of IP fragments received that needed to be reassembled at this interface. When tracking interface statistics, the counter of the interface to which these fragments were addressed is incremented. This interface might not be the same as the input interface for some of the fragments.
For test purpose only.
Only applicable for IPv6.
attribute.condition: An IP datagram is received.

attribute.name: pmIpIfStatsReasmFails
attribute.description:
The number of failures detected by the IP re-assembly algorithm (for whatever reason: timed out, errors, etc.).
For test purpose only.
Only applicable for IPv6.
attribute.condition: An IP datagram is received.

attribute.name: pmIpIfStatsInDiscards
attribute.description:
The number of received IP datagrams for which no problems were encountered to prevent their continued processing, but were discarded (e.g., for lack of buffer space).
For test purpose only.
Only applicable for IPv6.
attribute.condition: An IP datagram is received.

attribute.name: pmIpIfStatsOutDiscards
attribute.description:
The number of IP datagrams that should be sent, but were discarded due to resource problems (for example, lack of buffer space).
For test purpose only.
Only applicable for IPv6.
attribute.condition: An IP datagram, which should be sent, is discarded due to resource problems.

attribute.name: pmIpIfStatsOutFragCreates
attribute.description:
The number of output datagram fragments that have been generated as a result of IP fragmentation. When tracking interface statistics, the counter of the outgoing interface is incremented for a successfully fragmented datagram.
For test purpose only.
Only applicable for IPv6.
attribute.condition: An IP datagram is transmitted.

action.name: assignAllIpAddresses
action.description:
Sets the attributes: ipAddress, subnetMask and broadcastAddress.
If broadcastAddress is set to the string CURRENT_VALUE, the old value remains.
If the IP address of the EthernetLink MO is an OAM IP address for the node, and if the IP address is changed, there is a risk that some sessions are closed.

parameter.name: ipAddress
parameter.description: The input format for an IPv4 address is four fields of digits, separated by a dot. Each field consists of one to three digits.

parameter.name: subnetMask
parameter.description:
The input format for an IPv4 address is four fields of digits, separated by a dot. Each field consists of one to three digits. The subnet mask must be contiguous.
Example: 255.255.255.X
Contiguous subnet masks: 11111111.11111111.11111111.11111110 (X = 254) 11111111.11111111.11111111.11111100 (X = 252)
Non-contiguous subnet mask: 11111111.11111111.11111111.11111010 (X = 250)

parameter.name: broadcastAddress
parameter.description: The input format is four fields of digits, separated by a dot. Each field consists of one to three digits.

action.disturbances: Changing the IP address with this action, can cause an interruption of the communication between the node and the network management tool, if the network management tool is connected using the EthernetLink MO. If an incorrect or erroneous IP address is configured, the communication with the node can be lost until the node is restarted or until the IP address is changed to the correct value.

class.name: IpOam
class.description:
Internet Protocol (IP) for Operation and Maintenance (OAM)
This MO constitutes the top structure level for MOs in IP for OAM.
This MO is created automatically and cannot be deleted.
The RDN of this MO is IpOam=1.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: IpOamId
attribute.description:
The value component of the RDN.
It is set automatically when the MO instance is created.

action.name: ping
action.description:
Calls a host or router to find out if it is present in the network.
The following parameter is returned: Ping result: The IP address or domain name - is alive or no answer.

parameter.name: host
parameter.description: The domain name or IP address to the host that is called.

action.name: traceRoute
action.description:
Gets information about the route through the IP network that is used for a destination with a specific IP address.
The following input parameter is used by this action: The domain name or IP address to a host that is trace-routed.
The following parameter is returned: Trace result - list of IP addresses/domain names or path not found.

class.name: Dhcp
class.description:
Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol
This MO represents a DHCP client and a DHCP Relay Agent.
This MO is created automatically and cannot be deleted.
The RDN of this MO is Dhcp =1.
Disturbances: Changing some of the attributes on this MO may cause a disturbance or loss of OAM connectivity. If there are any doubts regarding the results of the attribute changes, it is strongly recommended to activate the robust rollback function, by setting the attribute configCountdownActivated on the ConfigurationVersion MO first.

attribute.name: DhcpId
attribute.description:
The value component of the RDN.
It is set automatically when the MO instance is created.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: dhcpServerAddresses
attribute.description:
IP addresses to the DHCP server, used by the DHCP Relay Agent.
Default is an empty array.
Adding and removing addresses are done using the actions, addDhcpServerAddress() and removeDhcpServerAddress().

action.name: addDhcpServerAddress
action.description: Takes an array of IP addresses and adds them to the list contained in the DHCP Relay Agent.

parameter.name: ipAddressArray
parameter.description: Elements are assumed to have the format of a String with 4 fields of numerics, each field separated with a dot, for example 123.322.34.123. An empty array or empty string in first element is not allowed. Max 10 elements.

action.name: removeDhcpServerAddress
action.description: Takes an array of IP addresses and removes them from the list contained in the DHCP Relay Agent.

parameter.name: ipAddressArray
parameter.description: Elements are assumed to have the format of a String with 4 fields of numerics, each field separated with a dot, for example 123.322.34.123. An empty array or empty string in first element is not allowed. Max 10 elements.

parameter.name: numberOfSlotsToRemove
parameter.description: The number of slots to remove.

parameter.name: paramBothMinAndMax
parameter.description: Xxx.

class.name: IpHostLink
class.description:
IP Host Link
This MO, together with the IpInterface MO, Ipv6Interface MO or VpnInterface MO and related MOs, enables OAM node access via a Gigabit Ethernet interface.
A maximum of 5 unique IP addresses can be assigned to this MO. The addresses are stored in lists, in the attributes ipv4Addresses and ipv6Addresses. An instance of IpHostLink can be configured with either IPv4 or IPv6 addresses. IPv4 addresses can be used when this MO refers to IpInterface MO or VpnInterface MO. IPv6 addresses can be used when this MO refers to Ipv6Interface MO.
The first entry of each address list is a candidate to be used as OAM IP address for the node. See the Ip MO for information on how to configure an OAM IP address for the node. The first entry of the attribute ipv4Addresses is also supported in the deprecated attribute ipAddress.
The IP Host Link MO cannot be deleted, if one of its IP addresses is used as a node OAM IP address. Refer to the attributes nodeInterfaceName and nodeIpv6InterfaceName in the Ip MO for details.
Disturbances: Changing attributes of this MO can cause interruption of the OAM communication, if the network management tool is connected via the IP host link. If there are any doubts regarding the results of the attribute changes, it is strongly recommended to activate the robust rollback function, by setting the attribute configCountdownActivated on the ConfigurationVersion MO first.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: currentPmRegister
attribute.description: Returns the current values of all PM counters.
attribute.obsolete: Has no functional behavior and is now redundant. Read operations can return undefined values.

attribute.name: interfaceName
attribute.description: The interface name.
attribute.dependencies: The value of this attribute can be used as a reference, by the attributes nodeInterfaceName or nodeIpv6InterfaceName in the Ip MO.

attribute.name: ipAddress
attribute.description:
The IPv4 address of the IP host link.
The IP address must be unique with respect to other hosts in the node.
The IP address must belong to the subnet defined in the referenced IpInterface MO or VpnInterface MO.
attribute.deprecated: Replaced by the first list entry of the attribute ipv4Addresses. This attribute will provide the same value as the replaced attribute.
attribute.dependencies: The value of this attribute must not be identical to the value of the attribute ipAddress in the MO EthernetLink.

attribute.name: IpHostLinkId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: ipInterfaceMoRef
attribute.description:
Reference to an instance of IpInterface MO, Ipv6Interface MO or VpnInterface MO.
Only one IpHostLink is allowed to refer to the same IpInterface MO, Ipv6Interface MO or VpnInterface MO.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIfInUcastPkts
attribute.description:
The number of input unicast packets delivered to higher layer.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: A unicast IP packet is received.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIfInNUcastPkts
attribute.description:
The number of input broadcast or multicast packets delivered to higher layer.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: A broadcast or multicast IP packet is received.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIfOutUcastPkts
attribute.description:
The number of packets that higher-level protocols requested to be transmitted to a subnetwork-unicast address.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: A unicast IP packet is sent.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIfInErrors
attribute.description:
The number of input packets discarded due to any error.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: An erroneous IP packet is received.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIfInDiscards
attribute.description:
The number of input packets discarded due to resource limitations.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: A lot of packets received at high rate.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIfOutNUcastPkts
attribute.description:
The number of transmitted outgoing broadcast or multicast packets.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: A broadcast or multicast IP packet is sent.

attribute.name: pmNoOfIfOutDiscards
attribute.description:
The number of outbound packets discarded due to resource limitations.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: A lot of packets sent at high rate causes buffer overflow.

attribute.name: ipv4Addresses
attribute.description:
Specifies a list of all IPv4 addresses for the IpHostLink MO. The first entry of this list can be used as OAM IP address for the node. See the Ip MO for configuration of OAM IP address for the node.
The first entry of this list is also represented by the IPv4 address attribute: ipAddress.
The IP addresses must belong to the subnet defined in the referenced IpInterface MO or VpnInterface MO.
attribute.dependencies: This attribute can only be set if this MO refers to IpInterface MO or VpnInterface MO. The first element of this attribute cannot be set to 0.0.0.0 or an empty string, if this specific IpHostLink is referenced by the attribute nodeInterfaceName in Ip MO.

attribute.name: ipv6Addresses
attribute.description: Specifies a list of all IPv6 addresses for the IpHostLink MO. The first entry of this list can be used as OAM node IP address. See the Ip MO for configuration of OAM node IP address.
attribute.dependencies: This attribute can only be set if this MO refers to Ipv6Interface MO.

action.name: assignIpAddress
action.description:
Use this action if this MO refers to an IpInterface MO. Sets the first address in the attribute ipv4Addresses of this MO, and affects the referenced IpInterface MO. See the description of the parameters.
This action is not supported if this MO refers to a VpnInterface MO or an IPv6Interface MO.
If the IP address of this IpHostLink MO is the OAM IP address for the node, there is a risk that some sessions are closed when the IP address is changed.
This action overrides the restriction regarding changing the attribute networkPrefixLength in the IpInterface MO. This means that the subnet address can be changed by this action, as networkPrefixLength and defaultRouter0 can be changed simultaneously. All given IP addresses must belong to the same subnet.
If the subnet address (networkPrefixLength and defaultRouter0) must be changed, any other IP host that is configured on this IpInterface MO must first be deleted. This means that the reservedBy attribute for the IpInterface MO can contain only a single reference to the IpHostLink MO.
The IP address can temporarily be set to 0.0.0.0, to enable autoconfiguration of the node, using DHCP. The value 0.0.0.0 can only be set for one IpHostLink MO at a time. See also IpInterface MO.

parameter.name: ipAddress
parameter.description: The value assigned to ipAddress in this MO. The IP address must be an IPv4 address, and it must be unique with respect to other hosts in the node.

parameter.name: networkPrefixLength
parameter.description: The value assigned to the attribute networkPrefixLength in the related IpInterface MO. Unit: 1 bit

parameter.name: defaultRouter0
parameter.description: The value assigned to the attribute defaultRouter0 in the related IpInterface MO.

parameter.name: defaultRouter1
parameter.description: The value assigned to the attribute defaultRouter1 in the related IpInterface MO.

parameter.name: defaultRouter2
parameter.description: The value assigned to the attribute defaultRouter2 in the related IpInterface MO.

parameter.name: ownIpAddressActive
parameter.description: The value assigned to the attribute ownIpAddressActive in the related IpInterface MO.

action.name: assignIpAddress2
action.description:
Use this action if this MO refers to a VpnInterface MO. Sets the first address in the attribute ipv4Addresses of this MO, and affects the referenced VpnInterface MO. See the description of the parameters.
This action is not supported if this MO refers to an IpInterface MO or an Ipv6Interface MO.
If the IP address of this IpHostLink MO is the OAM IP address for the node, there is a risk that some sessions are closed when the IP address is changed.
This action overrides the restriction regarding changing the attribute networkPrefixLength and subnet in the VpnInterface MO.
The subnet address for the VpnInterface MO is calculated from the ipAddress and networkPrefixLength assigned in this action.
The IP address must not be set to 0.0.0.0, if this MO refers to a VpnInterface MO.

parameter.name: ipAddress
parameter.description: The value assigned to ipAddress in this MO. The IP address must be an IPv4 address, and it must be unique with respect to other hosts in the node.

parameter.name: networkPrefixLength
parameter.description: The value assigned to the attribute networkPrefixLength in the related VpnInterface MO. Unit: 1 bit

class.name: AccessControlList
class.description:
The AccessControlList MO defines which ingress traffic is allowed, and which is dropped, for each IP Interface. It consists of ACL entries. The highest priority entries are positioned first in the list, and the lowest, last in the list. An incoming packet that does not match any ACL entries is allowed into the node.
Policy rules for ESP traffic and IKE messaging are implicitly configured, when the IkePeer MO and the IpSecTunnel MO are configured. These policy rules are not configured in the AccessControlList MO. These policy rules have higher priority than the rules configured in the AccessControlList MO.

attribute.name: aclEntries
attribute.description:
Access Control List
If a packet does not match any entry in the list, it will pass.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

attribute.name: AccessControlListId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

action.name: addEntry
action.description: Adds an entry to the access control list.

parameter.name: entry
parameter.description: The ACL entry to be added.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: The index is the place in the list where the new entry is added. If there is an entry at that point in the list, that entry and the others that follow, are shifted down in the list.

action.name: removeEntry
action.description: Removes an entry in the access control list.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: The entry at this index is removed from the list. The entries that follow are shifted up in the list.

class.name: InternalEthernetPort
class.description:
Internal Ethernet Port
This MO configures the internal ethernet port, located on the board, which terminates the traffic to the node.
This MO must always refer to an EthernetSwitch MO. Both MOs must be located on the same board and have the same parent MO.
The pm counters in this MO reflect the direction of the traffic. PM counters named with the direction "In" counts traffic from the Ethernet switch into the node. PM counters named with the direction "Out" counts traffic out of the node into the Ethernet switch.

attribute.name: ethernetSwitchRef
attribute.description: Reference to an instance of EthernetSwitch MO.

attribute.name: dscpPbitMap
attribute.description:
The value of the DSCP and the corresponding pbit (priority).
The number of members in this sequence is 64.
All 64 possible dscpPbit structs must be defined when setting this attribute. If no values are set, the default values specified in the table in the dscpPbit struct are used.

attribute.name: frameFormat
attribute.description:
Ethernet outgoing frame format.
Before changing the value from ETHERNET_2_DIX to IEEE_802_3_LLC_SNAP, ensure first that the attribute mtu of the IpInterface is not greater than 1492. If mtu > 1492, reduce it to 1492 before changing this attribute.
attribute.disturbances: Setting this attribute may disrupt traffic on peer equipment.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: pmDot1qTpVlanPortInDiscardsLink
attribute.description: The number of valid frames discarded for VLAN reasons (for example, VLAN id not configured). The counter is relevant only if VLAN is configured on the IpInterface MO.
attribute.condition: A frame with an incorrect or unrecognizable VLAN id, is received.

attribute.name: pmIfInBroadcastPkts
attribute.description: The number of good packets received with a broadcast address delivered to a higher sublayer.
attribute.condition: A good packet with a broadcast address is received.

attribute.name: pmIfInDiscards
attribute.description: The number of received good packets, discarded due to lack of resources (for example, buffer space).
attribute.condition: A received good packet is discarded.

attribute.name: pmIfInErrors
attribute.description: The number of received packets, discarded due to errors found in the packets.
attribute.condition: An erroneous packet is discarded.

attribute.name: pmIfInMulticastPkts
attribute.description: The number of packets, delivered by this sub-layer to a higher (sub-)layer, which were addressed to a multicast address at this sub-layer.
attribute.condition: A good packet with a multicast address is received.

attribute.name: pmIfInOctetsHi
attribute.description:
The number of octets received by a port, including framing characters and bad packets, but excluding preamble sequences.
The high capacity counter for received octets on an interface is split into two parts. This counter represents the higher part of the 62 least significant bits of the high capacity counter for received octets. The two most significant bits of this 64 bit counter are discarded. This 64-bit counter is presented as 2*31 bits: pmIfInOctetsHi (bit 61-31) and pmIfInOctetsLo (bit 30-0) in the MOM.
attribute.condition: An octet is received.

attribute.name: pmIfInOctetsLo
attribute.description:
The number of octets received by a port, including framing characters and bad packets, but excluding preamble sequences.
The high capacity counter for received octets on an interface is split into two parts. This counter represents the lower part of the 62 least significant bits of the high capacity counter for octets transmitted out on the interface. The two most significant bit of this 64 bits counter are discarded. This 64-bit counter is presented as 2*31 bits: pmIfInOctetsHi (bit 61-31) and pmIfInOctetsLo (bit 30-0) in the MOM.
attribute.condition: An octet is received.

attribute.name: pmIfInUcastPkts
attribute.description: The number of good packets addressed to a unicast address, which are received and delivered to a higher sublayer.
attribute.condition: 1000 good packets with unicast addresess are received.

attribute.name: pmIfInUnknownProtos
attribute.description: The number of packets received which have an unsupported or unknown protocol.
attribute.condition: A packet with an unsupported or unknown protocol, is received.

attribute.name: pmIfOutBroadcastPkts
attribute.description: The total number of outgoing broadcast ethernet frames requested to be transmitted (including those that were discarded or not sent).
attribute.condition: An output broadcast packet is requested to be transmitted.

attribute.name: pmIfOutDiscards
attribute.description: The number of packets requested to be transmitted but discarded due to lack of resources (for example, buffer space).
attribute.condition: A packet to be transmitted is discarded due to resource problems.

attribute.name: pmIfOutErrors
attribute.description: The number of packets requested to be transmitted but discarded due to errors found in the packets.
attribute.condition: An erroneous packet to be transmitted is discarded.

attribute.name: pmIfOutMulticastPkts
attribute.description: The total number of outgoing multicast ethernet frames requested to be transmitted (including those that were discarded or not sent).
attribute.condition: A packet with a multicast address is requested to be transmitted.

attribute.name: pmIfOutOctetsHi
attribute.description:
The number of octets transmitted by a port, including framing characters and bad packets, but excluding preamble sequences.
The high capacity counter for octets transmitted out on an interface is split into two parts. This counter represents the higher part of the 62 least significant bits of the high capacity counter for octets transmitted out on the interface. The two most significant bits of this 64 bits counter are discarded. This 64-bit counter is presented as 2*31 bits: pmIfOutOctetsHi (bit 61-31) and pmIfOutOctetsLo (bit 30-0) in the MOM.
attribute.condition: An octet is transmitted.

attribute.name: pmIfOutOctetsLo
attribute.description:
The number of octets transmitted by a port, including framing characters and bad packets, but excluding preamble sequences.
The high capacity counter for octets transmitted out on an interface is split into two parts. This counter represents the lower part of the 62 least significant bits of the high capacity counter for octets transmitted out on the interface. The two most significant bits of this 64 bit counter are discarded. This 64-bit counter is presented as 2*31 bits: pmIfOutOctetsHi (bit 61-31) and pmIfOutOctetsLo (bit 30-0) in the MOM.
attribute.condition: An octet is transmitted.

attribute.name: pmIfOutUcastPkts
attribute.description: The total number of outgoing unicast ethernet frames requested to be transmitted (including those that were discarded or not sent).
attribute.condition: 1000 output unicast packets are requested to be transmitted.

attribute.name: InternalEthernetPortId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: currentPmRegister
attribute.description:
Returns the current values of all PM counters.
To activate the writing of statistical values in a PM counter, start a performance monitoring (scanner) on that counter. Otherwise, the value of the PM counter is set to -1.
attribute.obsolete: Has no functional behavior and is now redundant. Read operations can return undefined values.

attribute.name: macAddress
attribute.description:
Media Access Control address
If the board is not available, the attribute has the value "00:00:00:00:00:00".

attribute.name: configPbitArp
attribute.description:
Specifies pbit to use for ARP and GratARP.
Priorities according to IEEE 802.1Q. Pbit refers to the PCP (Priority Code Point) field in the Ethernet header.

action.name: setDscpPbit
action.description:
Sets the dscpPbitMap attribute .
Default values specified by IEEE 802.1p :
pBit 0 -> DSCP 0, 48, 56 pBit 1 -> DSCP 10, 12, 14 pBit 2 -> spare pBit 3 -> DSCP 18, 20, 22 pBit 4 -> DSCP 26, 28, 30 pBit 5 -> DSCP 34, 36, 38 pBit 6 -> DSCP 46 pBit 7 -> reserved for network control, normally not used
All other DSCP values map to priority 0.
This action affects only one entry in the array.

parameter.name: dscp
parameter.description: DSCP - differentiated services code point.

parameter.name: pbit
parameter.description: 802.1p priorities according to IEEE 8021P: 0 - Best effort 1 - Background 2 - Spare 3 - Excellent effort 4 - Controlled load 5 - Video 6 - Voice, less than 10 ms delay 7 - Network control

class.name: ExchangeTerminalIp
class.description:
Exchange Terminal IP
This MO represents the exchange terminal boards that offer IP transport capabilities.
Configuring an ExchangeTerminalIp MO under a PiuDevice MO is supported only on certain boards. If supported, it is specifically noted in the description of the relevant board.

attribute.name: ExchangeTerminalIpId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

class.name: IpInterface
class.description:
Internet Protocol (IP) Interface
This MO models the interface between an IP access host and Gigabit Ethernet, and between the default routers and their supervision.
A logical network is the LAN, priority tagged or untagged, or a VLAN that is vlan-tagged. A subnet is defined by networkPrefixLength and defaultRouter0.
For some boards, the Virtual LAN identity, vid, must be unique for each IP interface on the same board. For other boards, the same vid can be used for more than one IP interface on the same board. See the description of the relevant board.
All IP hosts connected to the same IP interface must belong to the same subnet. This also applies for a number of addresses describing the IpInterface MO. The attributes concerned are the following: - defaultRouter0 - defaultRouter1 - defaultRouter2 - ownIpAddressActive - ownIpAddressPassive
A maximum of 16 IpInterface MOs can be connected to one GigabitEthernet or InternalEthernetPort MO. For some boards, the maximum number can be lower.
A maximum of 128 hosts (IpAccessHostGpb, IpAccessHostSpb and IpAccessHostEt) can be connected to the 16 IP interfaces on the same board. However, one IpInterface can also be shared by all the 128 hosts. A maximum of two instances of IpAccessHostEt MO can be connected to one IpInterface MO.
An IpAccessHostEt MO and an IpHostLink MO can refer to the same IpInterface MO.
A maximum of 2500 host MOs (IpAccessHostGpb, IpAccessHostSpb and IpAccessHostEt) can be configured in a node.
If the node is configured using DHCP, the IP address of the IpHostLink MO is temporarily set to 0.0.0.0. All traffic for all IpInterface MOs on the board is distributed to this host. The PM counters of the IpInterface MOs are not always incremented when this option is set.

attribute.name: IpInterfaceId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: logging
attribute.description: Specifies whether logging of traffic events shall be performed for the IpInterface.

attribute.name: pmInDiscPolicy
attribute.description:
The number of packets received on the IP interface that matches a policy rule with action discard.
This counter is not supported on all ET boards, see the description of the relevant board for details.
attribute.condition: 1 packet is received

attribute.name: pmInPassedPolicy
attribute.description:
The number of packets received on the IP interface that matches a policy rule with action pass.
This counter is not supported on all ET boards, see the description of the relevant board for details.
attribute.condition: 1000 packets are received

attribute.name: pmInEsp
attribute.description:
The number of packets received on the IP interface with protocol ESP.
This counter is not supported on all ET boards, see the description of the relevant board for details.
attribute.condition: 1000 packets are received

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: vid
attribute.description:
The Virtual LAN (VLAN) identifier.
This attribute is applicable only when: - vLan is set to true - vlanRef is set to NULL.
vid 0 = priority tag only vid 1 - 4094 = with priority tag and vlan id
If vlanRef is set to a non-NULL value, it resets the value of this attribute to 1.
attribute.disturbances: Changing this attribute may cause traffic disturbances.

attribute.name: vLan
attribute.description:
Specifies whether VLAN tagging is used on this interface.
This attribute is applicable only when: - vlanRef is set to NULL.
Ethernet frames are untagged only when this attribute is set to false and vlanRef is set to NULL.
If vlanRef is set to a non-NULL value, it resets the value of this attribute to false.
attribute.disturbances: Changing this attribute can affect traffic.

attribute.name: rps
attribute.description:
Router Path Supervision
Router Path Supervision is done on the links defined by ownIpAddressActive and ownIpAddressPassive, if they have valid IP addresses defined when they are created.
It is possible to enable Router Path Supervision after the creation of the IpInterface MO, if it is disabled when the MO is created (rps = false) and if ownIpAddressActive is set.
It is possible to disable Router Path Supervision when the IpInterface MO has been created, by setting this attribute to false.
If this attribute is set to false, the egress traffic is directed to defaultRouter0, which means that traffic disturbances will occur if the default router 0 is unavailable.
If a router redundancy protocol, e.g. Virtual Router Redundancy Protocol (VRRP) is used, it is recommended that this attribute is set to false, in order to avoid interference.

attribute.name: mtu
attribute.description:
The maximum transfer unit, that is the maximum number of Ethernet payload octets sent in an Ethernet frame.
The actual MTU used by the hardware might be lower than the configured value due to HW limitations. See the description of the relevant board for details.
Dependencies: The maximum value for mtu depends on the attributes frameFormat and linkType in the parent MO GigaBitEthernet or frameFormat in the parent MO InternalEthernetPort. It also depends on if jumbo frames are supported.
If the attribute frameFormat = IEEE_802_3_LLC_SNAP, the maximum value of mtu is 1492.
The maximum value of mtu is 2000, if at least one of the following conditions are fulfilled: - the parent MO is GigaBitEthernet and linkType = BACKPLANE_PORTS - the board supports jumbo frames. See the description of the relevant board.
In other cases, the maximum value of mtu is 1500.
As a general rule, IpInterface MOs belonging to the same InternalEthernetPort MO or the same GigaBitEthernet MO must have the same MTU value, that is the same value on this attribute. However, some boards allow for a more flexible setting of MTU. See the description of the relevant board.

attribute.name: networkPrefixLength
attribute.description:
The subnet mask.
Example: networkPrefixLength = 24, subnet mask is 255.255.255.0 Example: networkPrefixLength = 28, subnet mask is 255.255.255.240
attribute.dependencies: This attribute can be changed using the action assignIpAddress on the IpHostLink MO. If the subnet address is to be changed by changing networkPrefixLength, any other IP host that is configured on this IpInterface MO must first be removed. This means that the reservedBy attribute can contain only a single reference to an IpHostLink MO.

attribute.name: defaultRouter0
attribute.description:
The IP address of the default router 0.
It is not allowed to set the value of this attribute to 0.0.0.0. The attributes defaultRouter0, defaultRouter1 and defaultRouter2 must not indicate the same IP address.
If rps is set to false, the egress traffic is always directed to this default router.
If the address of the defaultRouter0 is changed, it has to belong to the subnet defined by the networkPrefixLength and attribute rps must be set to false.
attribute.dependencies: This attribute can be changed using the action assignIpAddress on the IpHostLink MO. If the subnet address is to be changed by changing the network part of defaultRouter0, any other IP host that is configured on this IpInterface MO must first be removed. This means that the reservedBy attribute can contain only a single reference to an IpHostLink MO.

attribute.name: defaultRouter1
attribute.description:
The IP address of the default router 1.
The attributes defaultRouter0, defaultRouter1 and defaultRouter2 must not indicate the same IP address.
If the address of the defaultRouter1 is changed, it has to belong to the subnet defined by the networkPrefixLength or set to value 0.0.0.0. The attribute rps must have value false when the change is performed.
attribute.dependencies: This attribute can be changed using the action assignIpAddress on the IpHostLink MO.

attribute.name: defaultRouter2
attribute.description:
The IP address of the default router 2.
The attributes defaultRouter0, defaultRouter1 and defaultRouter2 must not indicate the same IP address.
If the address of the defaultRouter2 is changed, it has to belong to the subnet defined by the networkPrefixLength or set to value 0.0.0.0. The attribute rps must have value false when the change is performed.
attribute.dependencies: This attribute can be changed using the action assignIpAddress on the IpHostLink MO.

attribute.name: defaultRouter0State
attribute.description:
Indicates whether ping supervision is successful toward default router 0.
If router path supervision is turned off (rps = false) the value of this attribute is ENABLED.

attribute.name: defaultRouter1State
attribute.description:
Indicates whether ping supervision is successful toward default router 1.
If no default router 1 is configured, the value of this attribute is DISABLED.
If router path supervision is turned off (rps = false) the value of this attribute is ENABLED.

attribute.name: defaultRouter2State
attribute.description:
Indicates whether ping supervision is successful toward default router 2.
If no default router 2 is configured, the value of this attribute is DISABLED.
If router path supervision is turned off (rps = false) the value of this attribute is ENABLED.

attribute.name: defaultRouterTraffic
attribute.description: Indicates which of the default routers is selected for egress traffic.

attribute.name: defaultRouterPingInterval
attribute.description:
The interval at which the default router is ping-ed.
Must be larger than or equal to maxWaitForPingReply.
The value of this attribute is irrelevant, if rps = false.

attribute.name: maxWaitForPingReply
attribute.description:
If echo reply is not received within this time, ping supervision is considered to be failed.
This value is irrelevant, if rps = false.

attribute.name: maxNoOfFailedPings
attribute.description:
Maximum number of consecutive failed pings before the contact with the default router is considered to be lost.
This value is irrelevant, if rps = false.

attribute.name: noOfPingsBeforeOk
attribute.description:
Minimum number of consecutive successful pings before a default router is considered to be reachable, after having been considered unreachable.
This value is irrelevant, if rps = false.

attribute.name: switchBackTimer
attribute.description:
Switchback timer
When a higher-priority router has become reachable, the traffic switches back to default router 0 or default router 1, after expiry of the switchback timer.
This value is irrelevant, if rps = false.

attribute.name: ownIpAddressActive
attribute.description:
The IP address of Router Path Supervision on the active link.
The active link is the one where traffic is handled.
This IP address must be set, if rps = true.
This IP address can be shared with a host that is connected to the IP interface, but apart from that, the IP address must be unique.
attribute.dependencies: This attribute can be changed using the action assignIpAddress on the IpHostLink MO.

attribute.name: ownIpAddressPassive
attribute.description:
The IP address of Router Path Supervision on the passive link.
This IP address must be unique in the node if the attribute rps is set to true.
The attribute is not valid if the IpInterface belongs to an InternalEthernetPort MO.

attribute.name: subnet
attribute.description:
This attribute contains the subnet address of the IpInterface MO.
The subnet address is constructed from the address in defaultRouter0 and the attribute networkPrefixLength.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description:
Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.
A maximum of 96 users can reserve the IpInterface MOs configured on the same logical network.

attribute.name: pmIfStatsIpInReceives
attribute.description: Number of received IP datagrams, including those with errors.
attribute.condition: 1000 IP datagrams are received.

attribute.name: pmIfStatsIpInHdrErrors
attribute.description: Number of received IP datagrams with an error in the header.
attribute.condition: A received IP datagram is discarded due to error in header.

attribute.name: pmIfStatsIpAddrErrors
attribute.description: Number of received IP datagrams discarded due to invalid header address.
attribute.condition: An IP datagram with invalid header address is received.

attribute.name: pmIfStatsIpInDiscards
attribute.description: Number of received IP datagrams discarded due to resource problems (for example, lack of buffer space).
attribute.condition: A received IP datagram discarded due to resource problems.

attribute.name: pmIfStatsIpUnknownProtos
attribute.description: Number of IP datagrams received, with an unknown or not supported protocol.
attribute.condition: An IP datagram with an IP address belonging to UDP hosts and not shared with the address for RPS with a protocol which is unknown or not supported is received.

attribute.name: pmIfStatsIpOutRequests
attribute.description: Number of IP datagrams requested by the IP user protocol to be processed for sending.
attribute.condition: 1000 IP datagrams are requested for processing.

attribute.name: pmIfStatsIpOutDiscards
attribute.description: The number of IP datagrams that should be sent, but which were discarded due to resource problems (for example, lack of buffer space).
attribute.condition: An IP datagram, which should be sent, is discarded due to resource problems.

attribute.name: pmDot1qTpVlanPortOutFrames
attribute.description: The number of valid frames transmitted from this port, belonging to this VLAN and IP interface. If there are more than one IP interface belonging to the same VLAN, the total number of frames for a specific VLAN is the sum of the pmDot1qTpVlanPortOutFrames counter for all IP interfaces belonging to the VLAN. The counter is also used for number of un-tagged frames received from the LAN associated with the IP interface.
attribute.condition: 1000 ethernet frames are transmitted by this port to its segment from the local forwarding process for this VLAN. This includes bridge management frames originated by this device which are classified as belonging to this VLAN (e.g. GMRP, but not GVRP or STP). After a cold restart of the ET board the counter might not be equal to zero. This occurs because the AAL5 connection service allows IP system to use 'old' connection end-points to be set-up, which causes the configured IP hosts to be added , deleted and finally added again. The result is that unsolicited ARPs are sent for all re-configured IP hosts, but in the end the configuration will be correct.

attribute.name: trafficType
attribute.description:
The type of traffic on this interface.
This attribute is only for information, setting it does not affect traffic or system behaviour.

attribute.name: pmDot1qTpVlanPortInFrames
attribute.description: The number of valid frames received on this port, belonging to this VLAN and IP interface. If there are more than one IP interface belonging to the same VLAN, the total number of frames for a specific VLAN is the sum of the pmDot1qTpVlanPortInFrames counter for all IP interfaces belonging to the VLAN. The counter is also used for number of un-tagged frames received from the LAN associated with the IP interface.
attribute.condition: 1000 ethernet frames are received on this port with this VLAN and a protocol which is supported by the forwarding process. A frame received on this port is counted by this object if and only if it is for a protocol being processed by the local forwarding process for this VLAN. This object includes received bridge management frames classified as belonging to this VLAN (e.g. GMRP, but not GVRP or STP).

attribute.name: pmNoOfFailedPingsDefaultRouter0
attribute.description: The total number of failed pings towards the defaultRouter0 on the active link only. The counter value survives the link switch when applicable.
attribute.condition: An ICMP Echo Request message has not been replied to.

attribute.name: pmNoOfFailedPingsDefaultRouter1
attribute.description: The total number of failed pings towards the defaultRouter1 on the active link only. The counter value survives the link switch when applicable.
attribute.condition: An ICMP Echo Request message has not been replied to.

attribute.name: pmNoOfFailedPingsDefaultRouter2
attribute.description: The total number of failed pings towards the defaultRouter2 on the active link only. The counter value survives the link switch when applicable.
attribute.condition: An ICMP Echo Request message has not been replied to.

attribute.name: currentPmRegister
attribute.description:
Returns the current values of all PM counters.
To activate the writing of statistical values in a PM counter, start a performance monitoring (scanner) on that counter. Otherwise, the value of the PM counter is set to -1.
attribute.obsolete: Has no functional behavior and is now redundant. Read operations can return undefined values.

attribute.name: vlanRef
attribute.description:
Reference to an instance of a Vlan MO.
The referenced instance represents an external VLAN that is opened on this port.
This attribute is applicable only when this instance is related to a GigaBitEthernet MO.
When configuring backplane ports, that is if the attribute linkType in the GigaBitEthernet MO is set to BACKPLANE_PORTS, this attribute is mandatory.
When configuring front ports, that is if the attribute linkType in the GigaBitEthernet MO is set to FRONT_PORTS, this attribute can be used.
If this attribute is set to a non-NULL value, it overrides the values of the attribute pair vid and vLan, which are cleared and reset to 1 and false respectively and ignored by the system.

attribute.name: accessControlListRef
attribute.description: Reference to an instance of an AccessControlList MO.

attribute.name: trafficSchedulerRef
attribute.description: Reference to an instance of a TrafficScheduler MO.

attribute.name: pmIpIfStatsHCInOctets
attribute.description: The total number of received IP octets, including those with errors.
attribute.condition: An IP octet is received.

attribute.name: pmIpIfStatsHCOutOctets
attribute.description: The total number of transmitted IP octets.
attribute.condition: An IP octet is transmitted.

attribute.name: pmIpIfStatsHCOutTransmits
attribute.description: The total number of transmitted IP datagrams.
attribute.condition: An IP datagram is transmitted.

attribute.name: pmIpIfStatsHCInReceives
attribute.description: The number of received IP datagrams, including those with errors.
attribute.condition: An IP datagram is received.

class.name: GigaBitEthernet
class.description:
This MO type models a GigaBit Ethernet interface on an ET board for IP.
The MO can handle two physical interfaces on boards that support configurable link redundancy.
For boards that do not support configurable link redundancy, only attributes and pm counters for link1 are applicable.
For details on links and portNo, see the description of the relevant board.

attribute.name: GigaBitEthernetId
attribute.description: The value componenet of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description:
The administrative state.
Traffic is not stopped if administrativeState is set to LOCKED.

attribute.name: link1State
attribute.description:
Operational state of the link 1.
Is not relevant if the availabilityStatus is DEPENDENCY_FAILED or DEPENDENCY_LOCKED.

attribute.name: link2State
attribute.description:
Operational state of the link 2.
This attribute is applicable only if the board supports configurable link redundancy.
Is not relevant if the availabilityStatus is DEPENDENCY_FAILED or DEPENDENCY_LOCKED.

attribute.name: dscpPbitMap
attribute.description:
Specifies the value of the DSCP and corresponding pbit (priority).
The number of members in this sequence is 64.
All the 64 possible DscpPbit structs must be defined when setting this attribute. If no values are submitted, the default values from struct DscpPbit are used.

attribute.name: macAddressLink1
attribute.description:
The MAC address of link 1.
Note that on some boards, macAddressLink1 will always be used for the active link.
If the board is not available, the attribute has the value "00:00:00:00:00:00".

attribute.name: macAddressLink2
attribute.description:
The MAC address of link 2.
Note that on some boards, macAddressLink2 will always be used for the passive link.
If the board is not available, the attribute has the value "00:00:00:00:00:00".
This attribute is applicable only if the board supports configurable link redundancy.

attribute.name: frameFormat
attribute.description:
Ethernet outgoing frame format.
Before changing the value from ETHERNET_2_DIX to IEEE_802_3_LLC_SNAP, ensure that the attribute mtu of the related IpInterface MO or Ipv6Interface MO is not higher than 1492. If this is the case, reduce the mtu to 1492 before changing this attribute.
attribute.disturbances: Setting this attribute may disrupt traffic on peer equipment.

attribute.name: primaryLink
attribute.description:
Specifies which link is primary and which is secondary.
This attribute is applicable only on boards where link redundancy is supported. This also includes boards where link redundancy does not need to be configured.
If linkType = FRONT_PORTS then link 1 is the lower port and link 2 is the upper port. For details regarding port numbering, see the description of the relevant board.
If linkType = BACKPLANE_PORTS then link1 is connected to the EthernetSwitchModule with the lowest slot number in the subrack, and link2 is connected to the EthernetSwitchModule with the highest slot number in the subrack.
attribute.disturbances: Setting of this attribute may cause traffic disturbance.

attribute.name: activeLink
attribute.description:
Indicates the active link.
This attribute is only applicable for boards supporting configurable link redundancy.

attribute.name: autoNegotiation
attribute.description:
Indicates whether auto-negotiation is performed.
In normal traffic situations this attribute is set to true.
attribute.dependencies: If this attribute is set to true, it must be set to true for the other port in the Ethernet link. If it is set to false, it must be set to false for the other port in the Ethernet link.

attribute.name: protectiveMode
attribute.description:
Indicates whether a switchover to the secondary link is allowed.
If configurable link redundancy is supported and this attribute is set to false, it means that a board with two Ethernet connectors works as if it had one connector.
This attribute is applicable only if the board supports configurable link redundancy.

attribute.name: switchBackTimer
attribute.description:
The switch-back timer, after the primary link has returned to state ENABLED (working).
This attribute is applicable only on boards where configurable link redundancy is supported.
The value 0 (zero) means that the system does not switch back from the secondary link to the primary link. Traffic continues to run on the secondary link until - a manual switch is performed, or - an automatic switch is performed by the Link Switch Supervision Function (in case of link failure on the secondary link, while the primary link is up).

attribute.name: pmIfInOctetsLink1Lo
attribute.description: The total number of octets received on the link 1, including framing characters. The high-capacity counter for received octets an interface has been split into two parts. This counter represents the lower part of the 62 least significant bits of the high-capacity counter for received octets. The two most significant bit of this 64 bit counter is discarded. This 64-bit counter is presented as 2*31 bits: pmIfInOctetsLinkxHi (bit 62-31) and pmIfInOctetsLinkxLo (bit 30-0) in the MOM.
attribute.condition: An octet is received.

attribute.name: pmIfOutOctetsLink1Lo
attribute.description: The total number of octets transmitted out on link 1, including framing characters. The high capacity counter for octets transmitted out on an interface has been split into two parts. This counter represents the lower part of the 62 least significant bits of the high capacity counter for octets transmitted out on the interface. The two most significant bit of this 64 bit counter is discarded. This 64-bit counter is presented as 2*31 bits: pmIfOutOctetsLinkxHi (bit 62-31) and pmIfOutOctetsLinkxLo (bit 30-0) in the MOM.
attribute.condition: An octet is transmitted.

attribute.name: pmIfInOctetsLink1Hi
attribute.description: The total number of octets received on the link 1, including framing characters. The high-capacity counter for received octets on an interface has been split into two parts. This counter represents the higher part of the 62 least significant bits of the high-capacity counter for received octets. The two most significant bit of this 64 bit counter is discarded. This 64-bit counter is presented as 2*31 bits: pmIfInOctetsLinkxHi (bit 62-31) and pmIfInOctetsLinkxLo (bit 30-0) in the MOM.
attribute.condition: An octet is received.

attribute.name: pmIfOutOctetsLink1Hi
attribute.description: The total number of octets transmitted out on link 1, including framing characters. The high capacity counter for octets transmitted out on an interface has been split into two parts. This counter represents the higher part of the 62 least significant bits of the high capacity counter for octets transmitted out on the interface. The two most significant bit of this 64 bit counter is discarded. This 64-bit counter is presented as 2*31 bits: pmIfOutOctetsLinkxHi (bit 62-31) and pmIfOutOctetsLinkxLo (bit 30-0) in the MOM.
attribute.condition: An octet is transmitted.

attribute.name: pmIfInUnknownProtosLink1
attribute.description: The number of packets received on link 1, which had a protocol not supported or unknown.
attribute.condition: A packet with a not supported or unknown protocol is received.

attribute.name: pmIfInErrorsLink1
attribute.description: The number of packets received on link 1, which were discarded due to errors found in the packets.
attribute.condition: An erroneous packet is discarded.

attribute.name: pmIfOutErrorsLink1
attribute.description: The number of packets requested to be transmitted on link 1, but which were discarded due to errors found in the packets.
attribute.condition: An erroneous packet is discarded.

attribute.name: pmIfInUcastPktsLink1
attribute.description: The total number of incoming unicast ethernet frames on link 1.
attribute.condition: 1000 packets with unicast addresses are received.

attribute.name: pmIfInDiscardsLink1
attribute.description: The number of received packets discarded on link 1, due to lack of resources (for example, buffer space).
attribute.condition: A received packet is discarded.

attribute.name: pmIfOutUcastPktsLink1
attribute.description: The total number of outgoing unicast ethernet frames requested to be transmitted on link 1 (including those that were discarded or not sent).
attribute.condition: 1000 output unicast packets are requested to be transmitted.

attribute.name: pmIfOutDiscardsLink1
attribute.description: The number of packets requested to be transmitted on link 1, but which were discarded due to lack of resources (for example, buffer space).
attribute.condition: A packet is discarded due to resource problems.

attribute.name: pmIfInMulticastPktsLink1
attribute.description: The number of packets on link 1, delivered by this sub-layer to a higher (sub-)layer, which were addressed to a multicast address at this sub-layer.
attribute.condition: A packet with a multicast address is received.

attribute.name: pmIfInBroadcastPktsLink1
attribute.description: The number of packets received on link1, with a broadcast address delivered to a higher sub-layer.
attribute.condition: A packet with a broadcast address is received.

attribute.name: pmIfOutMulticastPktsLink1
attribute.description: The total number of outgoing multicast ethernet frames requested to be transmitted on link 1 (including those that were discarded or not sent).
attribute.condition: A packet with a multicast address is requested to be transmitted.

attribute.name: pmIfOutBroadcastPktsLink1
attribute.description: The total number of outgoing broadcast ethernet frames requested to be transmitted on link 1 (including those that were discarded or not sent).
attribute.condition: An output broadcast packet is requested to be transmitted.

attribute.name: pmDot1qTpVlanPortInDiscardsLink1
attribute.description: The number of valid frames discarded on link 1, due to reasons related to VLAN (for example, the VLAN ID is not configured).
attribute.condition: This counter is stepped for packets with a VLAN ID that is erroneous or unrecognizable. It is relevant only if the attribute vLan on the MO IpInterface is set.

attribute.name: pmIfInOctetsLink2Lo
attribute.description: The total number of octets received on link 2, including framing characters. The high-capacity counter for received octets an interface has been split into two parts. This counter represents the lower part of the 62 least significant bits of the high-capacity counter for received octets. The two most significant bit of this 64 bit counter is discarded. This 64-bit counter is presented as 2*31 bits: pmIfInOctetsLinkxHi (bit 62-31) and pmIfInOctetsLinkxLo (bit 30-0) in the MOM.
attribute.condition: An octet is received.

attribute.name: pmIfOutOctetsLink2Lo
attribute.description: The total number of octets transmitted out on link 2, including framing characters. The high capacity counter for octets transmitted out on an interface has been split into two parts. This counter represents the lower part of the 62 least significant bits of the high capacity counter for octets transmitted out on the interface. The two most significant bit of this 64 bit counter is discarded. This 64-bit counter is presented as 2*31 bits: pmIfOutOctetsLinkxHi (bit 62-31) and pmIfOutOctetsLinkxLo (bit 30-0) in the MOM.
attribute.condition: A packet with a not supported or unknown protocol is received.

attribute.name: pmIfInOctetsLink2Hi
attribute.description: The total number of octets received on link 2, including framing characters. The high-capacity counter for received octets on an interface has been split into two parts. This counter represents the higher part of the 62 least significant bits of the high-capacity counter for received octets. The two most significant bit of this 64 bit counter is discarded. This 64-bit counter is presented as 2*31 bits: pmIfInOctetsLinkxHi (bit 62-31) and pmIfInOctetsLinkxLo (bit 30-0) in the MOM.
attribute.condition: An octet is received.

attribute.name: pmIfOutOctetsLink2Hi
attribute.description: The total number of octets transmitted out on link 2, including framing characters. The high capacity counter for octets transmitted out on an interface has been split into two parts. This counter represents the higher part of the 62 least significant bits of the high capacity counter for octets transmitted out on the interface. The two most significant bit of this 64 bit counter is discarded. This 64-bit counter is presented as 2*31 bits: pmIfOutOctetsLinkxHi (bit 62-31) and pmIfOutOctetsLinkxLo (bit 30-0) in the MOM.
attribute.condition: An octet is transmitted.

attribute.name: pmIfInUnknownProtosLink2
attribute.description: The number of packets received on link 2, which had a protocol not supported or unknown.
attribute.condition: A packet with a not supported or unknown protocol is received.

attribute.name: pmIfInErrorsLink2
attribute.description: The number of packets received on link 2, which were discarded due to errors found in the packets.
attribute.condition: An erroneous packet is discarded.

attribute.name: pmIfOutErrorsLink2
attribute.description: The number of packets requested to be transmitted on link 2, but which were discarded due to errors found in the packets.
attribute.condition: An erroneous packet is discarded.

attribute.name: pmIfInDiscardsLink2
attribute.description: The number of received packets discarded on link 2, due to lack of resources (for example, buffer space).
attribute.condition: A received packet is discarded.

attribute.name: pmIfOutUcastPktsLink2
attribute.description: The total number of outgoing unicast ethernet frames requested to be transmitted on link 2 (including those that were discarded or not sent).
attribute.condition: 1000 output unicast packets are requested to be transmitted.

attribute.name: pmIfOutDiscardsLink2
attribute.description: The number of packets requested to be transmitted on link 2, but which were discarded due to lack of resources (for example, buffer space).
attribute.condition: A packet is discarded due to resource problems.

attribute.name: pmIfInMulticastPktsLink2
attribute.description: The number of packets on link 2, delivered by this sub-layer to a higher (sub-)layer, which were addressed to a multicast address at this sub-layer.
attribute.condition: A packet with a multicast address is received.

attribute.name: pmIfInBroadcastPktsLink2
attribute.description: The number of packets received on link 2, with a broadcast address delivered to a higher sub-layer.
attribute.condition: A packet with a broadcast address is received.

attribute.name: pmIfOutMulticastPktsLink2
attribute.description: The total number of outgoing multicast ethernet frames requested to be transmitted on link 2 (including those that were discarded or not sent).
attribute.condition: A packet with a multicast address is requested to be transmitted.

attribute.name: pmIfOutBroadcastPktsLink2
attribute.description: The total number of outgoing broadcast ethernet frames requested to be transmitted on link 2 (including those that were discarded or not sent).
attribute.condition: An output broadcast packet is requested to be transmitted.

attribute.name: pmDot1qTpVlanPortInDiscardsLink2
attribute.description: The number of valid frames discarded on link 2, due to reasons related to VLAN (for example, the VLAN ID is not configured).
attribute.condition: This counter is stepped for packets with a VLAN ID that is erroneous or unrecognizable. It is relevant only if the attribute vLan on the MO IpInterface is set.

attribute.name: shutDownTimeout
attribute.description:
The shutting-down timer. It is used when administrativeState is set to SHUTTING_DOWN.
This value must be positive.

attribute.name: statePropagationDelay
attribute.description: This attribute is used to delay the propagation of fault on both links.

attribute.name: currentPmRegister
attribute.description:
Returns the current values of all PM counters.
To activate the writing of statistical values in a PM counter, start a performance monitoring (scanner) on that counter. Otherwise, the value of the PM counter is set to -1.
attribute.obsolete: Has no functional behavior and is now redundant. Read operations can return undefined values.

attribute.name: linkType
attribute.description:
Indicates if the GigaBitEthernet link for external traffic is using the front ports or the backplane ports.
For IP ET boards that have only backplane ports, this attribute must be set to BACKPLANE_PORTS.
For IP ET boards that have only front ports, this attribute must be set to FRONT_PORTS.
If the backplane ports are used, the link is a 10G link.

attribute.name: pmIfInUcastPktsLink2
attribute.description: The total number of incoming unicast ethernet frames on link 2.
attribute.condition: 1000 packets with unicast addresses are received.

attribute.name: sfpInformation
attribute.description: Information about the SFP port. Valid only if the attribute sfpPort is set to true.

attribute.name: sfpPort
attribute.description: Specifies if the port is an SFP port. Autonegotiation must be configured to true for an SFP port. Otherwise, the port may be disabled.

attribute.name: portNo
attribute.description:
Port number associated with this MO instance.
This attribute is applicable only on boards where link redundancy is not supported.
For details regarding port numbering, see the description of the relevant board.

attribute.name: actualSpeedDuplex
attribute.description:
The mode, in which the port is actually operating.
The value NO_LINK means that the link is disabled or that autonegotiation is in progress.
The following values are possible for this attribute, for electrical interfaces: - ETH_100_MB_FULL - ETH_1000_MB_FULL
The following values are possible for this attribute, for optical interfaces: - ETH_1000_MB_FULL

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

attribute.name: configuredSpeedDuplex
attribute.description: Specifies the wanted fixed speed for the port.
attribute.dependencies:
If autoNegotiation is false, this attribute specifies the fixed speed for the port. If autoNegotiation is true, it specifies the minimum acceptable speed for the port. If the minimum mode is not achieved, an alarm is issued but the port is still enabled.
If autoNegotiation is set to false, the speed duplex mode must be identically set for the ports on both sides of the Ethernet link.
attribute.disturbances: Setting this attribute may cause traffic disturbance.

attribute.name: masterMode
attribute.description: Specifies master/slave mode.
attribute.dependencies:
If autoNegotiation is false, this attribute specifies if the link is in master or slave mode. If autoNegotiaion is true, this attribute is ignored.
If masterMode is set to true, it must be set to false for the other port in the Ethernet link. If masterMode is set to false, it must be set to true for the other port in the Ethernet link.

attribute.name: defRoutersLinkSwitch
attribute.description:
Indicates whether link switch, triggered by default router supervision, is enabled or not.
This attribute is only applicable for boards supporting configurable link redundancy.
A switch to the secondary link is triggered, if the following conditions are fulfilled: - the primary link is active, - all default routers are down on the primary link for all IpInterface MOs (with default router supervision), - at least one default router is up on the secondary link
When at least one of the default routers is up on the primary link, a switch-back is triggered after the predefined switch-back timer has elapsed.
After the link switch triggered by the default router supervision is performed, at least one of the alarms emitted prior to the switch on IpInterface MOs using this GigaBitEthernet MO will be ceased, as at least one default router is now reachable on the new active link. Example of emitted alarm: Contact to Default Router 1 Lost.
There will be no link switch due to default router supervision if any of the links on the GigaBitEthernet MO is faulty.

attribute.name: configPbitArp
attribute.description:
Specifies pbit to use for ARP and GratARP.
Priorities according to IEEE 802.1Q. Pbit refers to the PCP (Priority Code Point) field in the Ethernet header.

action.name: setDscpPbit
action.description:
This action sets the attribute, dscpPbitMap.
Default values:
pBit 0 -> DSCP 0, 48, 56 pBit 1 -> DSCP 10, 12, 14 pBit 2 -> spare pBit 3 -> DSCP 18, 20, 22 pBit 4 -> DSCP 26, 28, 30 pBit 5 -> DSCP 34, 36, 38 pBit 6 -> DSCP 46 pBit 7 -> reserved for network control, normally not used
All other DSCP values map to priority 0.
This action affects only one entry in the array.

parameter.name: dscp
parameter.description: DSCP - differentiated services code point.

parameter.name: pbit
parameter.description: 802.1p priorities as specified in IEEE 8021D: 0 - Best effort 1 - Background 2 - Spare 3 - Excellent effort 4 - Controlled load 5 - Voice, less than 100 ms delay 6 - Voice, less than 10 ms delay 7 - Network control

class.name: IpSystem
class.description:
IP System
This MO constitutes the top structure level for IP-related MOs.
This MO is created automatically and cannot be deleted.
The RDN of this MO is IpSystem=1.

attribute.name: IpSystemId
attribute.description:
The value component of the RDN.
It is set automatically when the MO instance is created.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

class.name: IpAccessAutoConfig
class.description:
IP Access Autoconfiguration
Represents Autoconfiguration for the IP Access Hosts.
The IP addresses of the autoconfigured hosts must match with the subnet implicitly defined for the hosts, through all of the interfaces.

attribute.name: IpAccessAutoConfigId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve IP access hosts.

attribute.name: nrOfUnusedAdresses
attribute.description:
Number of unused addresses
The number of addresses in the range that are not used.

attribute.name: totalNrOfAddresses
attribute.description:
Total number of addresses in the range.
The first address in the range is the same one as the one for networkAddress.

attribute.name: minIpAddress
attribute.description:
Minimum IP address
The lowest value that can be used as host IP address. If autoConfig=ON for an IP access host, it is not necessary to assign explicitly an IP address and prefix length to the host. The IP address is assigned by the Control Plane, based on the identity of IpAccessAutoConfig specified for the IP access host.

attribute.name: maxIpAddress
attribute.description:
Maximum IP address
The highest value that can be used as host IP address. If autoConfig=ON for an IP access host, it is not necessary to assign explicitly an IP address and prefix length to the host. The IP address is assigned by the Control Plane, based on the identity of IpAccessAutoConfig specified for the IP access host.

class.name: IpAccessHostGpb
class.description:
IP Access Host, executing on a General Purpose processor Board (GPB) or a Control Base Unit (CBU).
The host cannot be configured on a Main Processor (MP) that has a MediumAccessUnit child MO, if the IpAccessHostGpb MO refers to a FastEthernet MO.
A maximum of 2500 host MOs (IpAccessHostGpb, IpAccessHostSpb and IpAccessHostEt) can be configured in a node. See the descriptions of the relevant boards for limitations.
A maximum of 128 host MOs (IpAccessHostGpb, IpAccessHostSpb and IpAccessHostEt) can refer to IpInterface MOs on one board.
Only one IpAccessHostGpb MO can be configured on one GPB.

attribute.name: IpAccessHostGpbId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains an MO instance that reserves this MO instance.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: The administrative state.

attribute.name: generalProcessorUnitId
attribute.description:
Reference to an instance of GeneralProcessorUnit MO.
Default location of the IP host after a node restart. The location can be overriden by the value of the attribute activeGpuId.

attribute.name: autoConfig
attribute.description: This attribute specifies whether autoconfiguration for the IP Access Host is used.

attribute.name: autoConfigIdentity
attribute.description:
The identity of the IpAccessAutoConfig MO used by this host.
This attribute is mandatory if autoConfig is set to ON.

attribute.name: autoConfigIdentity2
attribute.description:
The identity of the IpAccessAutoConfig MO used by this host.
This attribute must be set, if autoConfig is set to ON and if the host has two IP addresses assigned automatically.

attribute.name: ipAddress1
attribute.description:
The first IP address of the host.
This IP address must be unique with respect to other hosts in the node.
This attribute must be set, only if autoConfig is set to OFF.
This IP address must belong to the subnet which is indicated in the MO referenced by interface1 or interface2.
attribute.disturbances: Changing this attribute can affect traffic.

attribute.name: ipAddress2
attribute.description:
The second IP address of the host.
This IP address must be unique with respect to other hosts in the node.
This attribute must be set, only if autoConfig is set to OFF.
This IP address must belong to the subnet which is indicated in the MO referenced by interface1 or interface2.
attribute.disturbances: Changing this attribute can affect traffic.

attribute.name: ipDefaultTtl
attribute.description: The default value of the Time-To-Live (TTL) field of the IP header. The value is inserted into datagrams originating at this host, whenever a TTL value is not supplied by the transport layer protocol.

attribute.name: ipReasmTimeout
attribute.description:
The maximum number of seconds, during which received fragments are held while they are awaiting reassembly at this host.
The value for this attribute must be greater than zero.
Recommended values, according to RFC 1122, are between 60 and 120.
attribute.deprecated: Replaced by the attribute reassemblyTimeout.

attribute.name: interface1
attribute.description:
Reference to an IpInterface MO or to a FastEthernet MO.
If two IP addresses are used, and thus two interfaces, this interface is for IP address 1.
The attributes interface1 and interface2 have their own instances of the IpInterface MO. When the IpAccessHostGpb MO is configured as multihomed, do not configure these IpInterface MOs on the same ET IP board.
