The interface specified in this attribute can be added or removed by the respective actions for adding or removing interfaces.

attribute.name: interface2
attribute.description:
Reference to an IpInterface MO or to a FastEthernet MO.
This attribute must refer to an MO of the same type as interface1.
This attribute must be set, if ipAddress2 or autoConfigIdentity2 is set.
The attributes interface1 and interface2 have their own instances of the IpInterface MO. When the IpAccessHostGpb MO is configured as multihomed, do not configure these IpInterface MOs on the same ET IP board.
The interface specified in this attribute can be added or removed by the respective actions for adding or removing interfaces.

attribute.name: pmIpInReceives
attribute.description: The total number of input datagrams received from interfaces, including those received in error.
attribute.condition: A datagram is received.

attribute.name: pmIpInHdrErrors
attribute.description: The number of input datagrams discarded due to errors in their IP headers, including bad checksums, version-number mismatch, other format errors, time-to-live exceeded, errors discovered in processing their IP options, etc.
attribute.condition: A datagram is discarded.

attribute.name: pmIpInAddrErrors
attribute.description: The number of input datagrams discarded because the IP address in the destination field of the IP header was not a valid address to be received at this entity. This count includes invalid addresses (for example, 0.0.0.0) and addresses of unsupported Classes (for example, Class E). For entities that are not IP routers and therefore do not forward datagrams, this counter includes datagrams discarded because the destination address was not a local address.
attribute.condition: A datagram with invalid IP address is discarded.

attribute.name: pmIpInUnknownProtos
attribute.description: The number of locally addressed datagrams received successfully but discarded because of an unknown or unsupported protocol.
attribute.condition: A local datagram with invalid protocol is discarded.

attribute.name: pmIpInDiscards
attribute.description: The number of input IP datagrams, for which no problems were encountered that prevent their continued processing, but which were discarded, for example, due to lack of buffer space. Note that this counter does not include any datagrams discarded while awaiting reassembly.
attribute.condition: A correct input datagram is discarded, for example, due to lack of buffer space.

attribute.name: pmIpInDelivers
attribute.description: The total number of input datagrams successfully delivered to IP user protocols, including Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP).
attribute.condition: A datagram is delivered successfully.

attribute.name: pmIpOutRequests
attribute.description: The total number of IP datagrams which local IP user protocols, including Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) supplied to IP in requests for transmission. Note that this counter does not include any datagrams counted in ipForwDatagrams.
attribute.condition: A datagram is supplied to IP in requests for transmission.

attribute.name: pmIpOutDiscards
attribute.description: The number of output IP datagrams, for which no problem was encountered to prevent transmission to their destination, but which were discarded (for example, due to lack of buffer space). Note that this counter includes datagrams counted in ipForwDatagrams, if any such packets met this (discretionary) discard criterion.
attribute.condition: A correct output datagram is discarded,for example, due to lack of buffer space.

attribute.name: pmIpReasmReqds
attribute.description: The number of IP fragments received that needed to be reassembled at this entity.
attribute.condition: An IP fragment is received.

attribute.name: pmIpReasmOKs
attribute.description: The number of IP datagrams successfully reassembled.
attribute.condition: A datagram is successfully reassembled.

attribute.name: pmIpReasmFails
attribute.description: The number of failures detected by the IP reassembly algorithm (for whatever reason: timed out, errors, etc). Note that this is not necessarily a count of discarded IP fragments since some algorithms (notably the algorithm in RFC 815) can lose track of the number of fragments by combining them as they are received.
attribute.condition: A datagram reassembly failed.

attribute.name: pmIpFragOKs
attribute.description: The number of IP datagrams that have been successfully fragmented at this entity.
attribute.condition: A datagram is successfully fragmented.

attribute.name: pmIpFragFails
attribute.description: The number of IP datagrams that have been discarded because they needed to be fragmented at this entity but could not be fragmented, for example, because their Don't Fragment flag was set.
attribute.condition: A datagram is discarded, as fragmentation was prevented by the Don't Fragment flag.

attribute.name: pmIpFragCreates
attribute.description: The number of IP datagram fragments that have been generated as a result of fragmentation at this entity.
attribute.condition: A datagram fragment is generated.

attribute.name: pmIcmpInMsgs
attribute.description: The total number of Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) messages that the entity received. Note that this counter includes all those counted by icmpInErrors.
attribute.condition: An ICMP message is received.

attribute.name: pmIcmpInErrors
attribute.description: The number of Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) messages that the entity received but determined as having ICMP-specific errors (bad ICMP checksums, bad length, etc.).
attribute.condition: An erroneous ICMP message is received.

attribute.name: pmIcmpInDestUnreachs
attribute.description: The number of Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) Destination Unreachable messages received.
attribute.condition: An ICMP Destination Unreachable message is received.

attribute.name: pmIcmpInTimeExcds
attribute.description: The number of Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) Time Exceeded messages received.
attribute.condition: An ICMP Time Exceed message is received.

attribute.name: pmIcmpInParamProbs
attribute.description: The number of Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) Parameter Problem messages received.
attribute.condition: An ICMP Parameter Problem message is received.

attribute.name: pmIcmpInSrcQuenchs
attribute.description: The number of Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) Source Quench messages received.
attribute.condition: An ICMP Source Quench message is received.

attribute.name: pmIcmpInRedirects
attribute.description: The number of Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) Redirect messages received
attribute.condition: An ICMP Redirect message is received.

attribute.name: pmIcmpInEchos
attribute.description: The number of Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) Echo Request messages received.
attribute.condition: An ICMP Echo Request message is received.

attribute.name: pmIcmpInEchoReps
attribute.description: The number of Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) Echo Reply messages received.
attribute.condition: An ICMP Echo Reply message is received.

attribute.name: pmIcmpOutMsgs
attribute.description: The total number of Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) messages that this entity attempted to send. This counter includes all those messages counted by icmpOutErrors. Note that this counter does not count if the user application uses raw IP sockets for sending out ICMP messages. Ping function managed via the COLI command is an example of such application.
attribute.condition: An attempt to send an ICMP message.

attribute.name: pmIcmpOutErrors
attribute.description: The number of Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) messages that this entity did not send due to problems discovered within ICMP, such as a lack of buffers. This value does not include errors discovered outside the ICMP layer, for example the inability of IP to route the resultant datagram.
attribute.condition: An ICMP message is not sent due to problems within ICMP.

attribute.name: pmIcmpOutDestUnreachs
attribute.description: The number of Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) Destination Unreachable messages sent.
attribute.condition: An ICMP Destination Unreachable message is sent .

attribute.name: pmIcmpOutParmProbs
attribute.description: The number of Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) Parameter Problem messages sent.
attribute.condition: An ICMP Parameter Problem is sent.

attribute.name: pmIcmpOutEchos
attribute.description: The number of Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) Echo Request messages sent. Note that this counter does not count if the user application uses raw IP sockets for sending out ICMP messages. Ping function managed via the COLI command is an example of such application.
attribute.condition: An ICMP Echo Request message is sent.

attribute.name: pmIcmpOutEchoReps
attribute.description: The number of Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) Echo Reply messages sent
attribute.condition: An ICMP Echo Reply message is sent.

attribute.name: pmUdpInDatagrams
attribute.description: The total number of User Datagram Protocol (UDP) datagrams delivered to UDP users.
attribute.condition: A UDP datagram is sent.

attribute.name: pmUdpNoPorts
attribute.description: The total number of received User Datagram Protocol (UDP) datagrams, for which there was no application at the destination port.
attribute.condition: A UDP datagram is received, but is not delivered because of no application at destination port.

attribute.name: pmUdpInErrors
attribute.description: The number of received User Datagram Protocol (UDP) datagrams that could not be delivered for reasons other than the lack of an application at the destination port.
attribute.condition: A UDP datagram is received, but is not delivered for another reason than: No application at destination port.

attribute.name: pmUdpOutDatagrams
attribute.description: The total number of User Datagram Protocol (UDP) datagrams sent from this entity.
attribute.condition: A UDP datagram is sent.

attribute.name: activeGpuId
attribute.description:
Reference to the active GeneralProcessorUnit MO.
After restart, the reference is the same as generalProcessorUnitId.
The reference can be set only by the user of the IpAccessHostGpb MO.

attribute.name: reassemblyTimeout
attribute.description: The maximum number of milliseconds, during which received fragments are held while they are awaiting reassembly at this host.

action.name: addInterface1AutoConfigOff
action.description:
Sets the autoConfig attribute to OFF, if no other interface exists.
This action cannot be performed, if an interface exists and autoConfig is ON.
An interface must be removed before a new one can be added.

action.name: addInterface1AutoConfigOn
action.description:
Sets the autoConfig attribute to ON, if no other interface exists.
This action cannot be performed, if an interface exists and autoConfig is OFF.
An interface must be removed before a new one can be added.

action.name: addInterface2AutoConfigOff
action.description:
Sets the autoConfig attribute to OFF, if no other interface exists.
This action cannot be performed, if an interface exists and autoConfig is ON.
An interface must be removed before a new one can be added.

action.name: addInterface2AutoConfigOn
action.description:
Sets the autoConfig attribute to ON, if no other interface exists.
This action cannot be performed, if an interface exists and autoConfig is OFF.
An interface must be removed before a new one can be added.

action.name: removeInterface1
action.description: Sets the attribute interface1 to NULL.

action.name: removeInterface2
action.description: Sets the attribute interface2 to NULL.

class.name: IpAccessHostSpb
class.description:
IP Access Host, executing on a Special Purpose Module (SPM) on a Special Purpose processor Board (SPB).
A maximum of 2500 host MOs (IpAccessHostGpb, IpAccessHostSpb and IpAccessHostEt) can be configured in a node. See the descriptions of the relevant boards for limitations.
A maximum of 128 host MOs (IpAccessHostGpb, IpAccessHostSpb and IpAccessHostEt) can refer to IpInterface MOs on one board.
Only one IpAccessHostSpb can be configured on one SPM.

attribute.name: IpAccessHostSpbId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: The administrative state.

attribute.name: autoConfig
attribute.description: This attribute specifies whether autoconfiguration for the IP Access Host is used.

attribute.name: autoConfigIdentity
attribute.description:
The identity of the IpAccessAutoConfig MO used by this host.
This attribute is mandatory if autoConfig is set to ON.

attribute.name: spmId
attribute.description:
Reference to an instance of Spm MO or PiuDevice MO.
Default location of the IP host after a node restart. The location can be overridden by the value of the attribute activeSpmId.

attribute.name: ipAddress
attribute.description:
The first IP address of the host.
This IP address must be unique with respect to other hosts in the node.
This attribute must be set, only if autoConfig is set to OFF.
attribute.disturbances: Changing this attribute can affect traffic.

attribute.name: ipDefaultTtl
attribute.description: The default value of the Time-To-Live (TTL) field of the IP header. The value is inserted into datagrams originating at this host, whenever a TTL value is not supplied by the transport layer protocol.

attribute.name: ipReasmTimeout
attribute.description:
The maximum number of seconds, during which received fragments are held while they are awaiting reassembly at this host.
The value for this attribute must be greater than zero.
Recommended values, according to RFC 1122, are between 60 and 120.
attribute.deprecated: Replaced by the attribute reassemblyTimeout.

attribute.name: pmIcmpInDestUnreachs
attribute.description: The number of Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) Destination Unreachable messages received.
attribute.condition: An ICMP Destination Unreachable message is received.

attribute.name: pmIcmpInEchos
attribute.description: The number of Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) Echo Request messages received.
attribute.condition: An ICMP Echo Request message is received.

attribute.name: pmIcmpInEchoReps
attribute.description: The number of Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) Echo Reply messages received.
attribute.condition: An ICMP Echo Reply message is received.

attribute.name: pmIcmpInErrors
attribute.description: The number of Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) messages that the entity received but determined as having ICMP-specific errors (bad ICMP checksums, bad length, etc.).
attribute.condition: An erroneous ICMP message is received.

attribute.name: pmIcmpInMsgs
attribute.description: The total number of Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) messages that the entity received. Note that this counter includes all those counted by icmpInErrors.
attribute.condition: An ICMP message is received.

attribute.name: pmIcmpInParamProbs
attribute.description: The number of Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) Parameter Problem messages received.
attribute.condition: An ICMP Parameter Problem message is received.

attribute.name: pmIcmpInRedirects
attribute.description: The number of Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) Redirect messages received
attribute.condition: An ICMP Redirect message is received.

attribute.name: pmIcmpInSrcQuenchs
attribute.description: The number of Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) Source Quench messages received.
attribute.condition: An ICMP Source Quench message is received.

attribute.name: pmIcmpInTimeExcds
attribute.description: The number of Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) Time Exceeded messages received.
attribute.condition: An ICMP Time Exceed message is received.

attribute.name: pmIcmpOutDestUnreachs
attribute.description: The number of Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) Destination Unreachable messages sent.
attribute.condition: An ICMP Destination Unreachable message is sent .

attribute.name: pmIcmpOutEchos
attribute.description: The number of Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) Echo Request messages sent. Note that this counter does not count if the user application uses raw IP sockets for sending out ICMP messages. Ping function managed via the COLI command is an example of such application.
attribute.condition: An ICMP Echo Request message is sent.

attribute.name: pmIcmpOutEchoReps
attribute.description: The number of Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) Echo Reply messages sent
attribute.condition: An ICMP Echo Reply message is sent.

attribute.name: pmIcmpOutErrors
attribute.description: The number of Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) messages that this entity did not send due to problems discovered within ICMP, such as a lack of buffers. This value does not include errors discovered outside the ICMP layer, for example the inability of IP to route the resultant datagram.
attribute.condition: An ICMP message is not sent due to problems within ICMP.

attribute.name: pmIcmpOutMsgs
attribute.description: The total number of Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) messages that this entity attempted to send. This counter includes all those messages counted by icmpOutErrors. Note that this counter does not count if the user application uses raw IP sockets for sending out ICMP messages. Ping function managed via the COLI command is an example of such application.
attribute.condition: An attempt to send an ICMP message.

attribute.name: pmIcmpOutParmProbs
attribute.description: The number of Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) Parameter Problem messages sent.
attribute.condition: An ICMP Parameter Problem is sent.

attribute.name: pmIpFragFails
attribute.description: The number of IP datagrams that have been discarded because they needed to be fragmented at this entity but could not be fragmented, for example, because their Don't Fragment flag was set.
attribute.condition: A datagram is discarded, as fragmentation was prevented by the Don't Fragment flag.

attribute.name: pmIpFragCreates
attribute.description: The number of IP datagram fragments that have been generated as a result of fragmentation at this entity.
attribute.condition: A datagram fragment is generated.

attribute.name: pmIpFragOKs
attribute.description: The number of IP datagrams that have been successfully fragmented at this entity.
attribute.condition: A datagram is successfully fragmented.

attribute.name: pmIpInAddrErrors
attribute.description: The number of input datagrams discarded because the IP address in the destination field of the IP header was not a valid address to be received at this entity. This count includes invalid addresses (for example, 0.0.0.0) and addresses of unsupported Classes (for example, Class E). For entities that are not IP routers and therefore do not forward datagrams, this counter includes datagrams discarded because the destination address was not a local address.
attribute.condition: A datagram with invalid IP address is discarded.

attribute.name: pmIpInDiscards
attribute.description: The number of input IP datagrams, for which no problems were encountered that prevent their continued processing, but which were discarded, for example, due to lack of buffer space. Note that this counter does not include any datagrams discarded while awaiting reassembly.
attribute.condition: A correct input datagram is discarded, for example, due to lack of buffer space.

attribute.name: pmIpInDelivers
attribute.description: The total number of input datagrams successfully delivered to IP user protocols, including Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP).
attribute.condition: A datagram is delivered successfully.

attribute.name: pmIpInHdrErrors
attribute.description: The number of input datagrams discarded due to errors in their IP headers, including bad checksums, version-number mismatch, other format errors, time-to-live exceeded, errors discovered in processing their IP options, etc.
attribute.condition: A datagram is discarded.

attribute.name: pmIpInReceives
attribute.description: The total number of input datagrams received from interfaces, including those received in error.
attribute.condition: A datagram is received.

attribute.name: pmIpInUnknownProtos
attribute.description: The number of locally addressed datagrams received successfully but discarded because of an unknown or unsupported protocol.
attribute.condition: A local datagram with invalid protocol is discarded.

attribute.name: pmIpOutRequests
attribute.description: The total number of IP datagrams which local IP user protocols, including Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) supplied to IP in requests for transmission. Note that this counter does not include any datagrams counted in ipForwDatagrams.
attribute.condition: A datagram is supplied to IP in requests for transmission.

attribute.name: pmIpOutDiscards
attribute.description: The number of output IP datagrams, for which no problem was encountered to prevent transmission to their destination, but which were discarded (for example, due to lack of buffer space). Note that this counter includes datagrams counted in ipForwDatagrams, if any such packets met this (discretionary) discard criterion.
attribute.condition: A correct output datagram is discarded,for example, due to lack of buffer space.

attribute.name: pmIpReasmFails
attribute.description: The number of failures detected by the IP reassembly algorithm (for whatever reason: timed out, errors, etc). Note that this is not necessarily a count of discarded IP fragments since some algorithms (notably the algorithm in RFC 815) can lose track of the number of fragments by combining them as they are received.
attribute.condition: A datagram reassembly failed.

attribute.name: pmIpReasmOKs
attribute.description: The number of IP datagrams successfully reassembled.
attribute.condition: A datagram is successfully reassembled.

attribute.name: pmIpReasmReqds
attribute.description: The number of IP fragments received that needed to be reassembled at this entity.
attribute.condition: An IP fragment is received.

attribute.name: pmUdpInDatagrams
attribute.description: The total number of User Datagram Protocol (UDP) datagrams delivered to UDP users.
attribute.condition: A UDP datagram is sent.

attribute.name: pmUdpInErrors
attribute.description: The number of received User Datagram Protocol (UDP) datagrams that could not be delivered for reasons other than the lack of an application at the destination port.
attribute.condition: A UDP datagram is received, but is not delivered for another reason than: No application at destination port.

attribute.name: pmUdpNoPorts
attribute.description: The total number of received User Datagram Protocol (UDP) datagrams, for which there was no application at the destination port.
attribute.condition: A UDP datagram is received, but is not delivered because of no application at destination port.

attribute.name: pmUdpOutDatagrams
attribute.description: The total number of User Datagram Protocol (UDP) datagrams sent from this entity.
attribute.condition: A UDP datagram is sent.

attribute.name: activeSpmId
attribute.description:
Reference to the active Spm MO or PiuDevice MO.
After restart, the reference is the same as the spmId.
The reference can be set only by the user of the IpAccessHostSpb MO.

attribute.name: autoConfigIdentity2
attribute.description:
The identity of the IpAccessAutoConfig MO used by this host.
This attribute must be set, if autoConfig is set to ON and if the host has two IP addresses assigned automatically.

attribute.name: interface2
attribute.description:
Reference to an IpInterface MO.
The attributes ipInterface and interface2 have their own instances of the IpInterface MO. When the IpAccessHostSpb MO is configured as multihomed, do not configure these IpInterface MOs on the same ET IP board.
The interface specified in this attribute can be added or removed by the respective actions for adding or removing interfaces.

attribute.name: ipAddress2
attribute.description:
The second IP address of the host at multihoming.
This IP address must be unique with respect to other hosts in the node.
This attribute must be set, only if autoConfig is set to OFF.
This IP address must belong to the subnet which is indicated in the MO referenced by ipInterface or interface2.
attribute.disturbances: Changing this attribute can affect traffic.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

attribute.name: ipInterface
attribute.description:
Reference to an IpInterface MO.
The attributes ipInterface and interface2 have their own instances of the IpInterface MO. When the IpAccessHostSpb MO is configured as multihomed, do not configure these IpInterface MOs on the same ET IP board.
The interface specified in this attribute can be added or removed by the respective actions for adding or removing interfaces.

attribute.name: reassemblyTimeout
attribute.description: The maximum number of milliseconds, during which received fragments are held while they are awaiting reassembly at this host.

action.name: addInterface1AutoConfigOff
action.description:
Sets the autoConfig attribute to OFF, if no other interface exists.
This action cannot be performed, if an interface exists and autoConfig is ON.
An interface must be removed before a new one can be added.

action.name: addInterface1AutoConfigOn
action.description:
Sets the autoConfig attribute to ON, if no other interface exists.
This action cannot be performed, if an interface exists and autoConfig is OFF.
An interface must be removed before a new one can be added.

action.name: addInterface2AutoConfigOff
action.description:
Sets the autoConfig attribute to OFF, if no other interface exists.
This action cannot be performed, if an interface exists and autoConfig is ON.
An interface must be removed before a new one can be added.

action.name: addInterface2AutoConfigOn
action.description:
Sets the autoConfig attribute to ON, if no other interface exists.
This action cannot be performed, if an interface exists and autoConfig is OFF.
An interface must be removed before a new one can be added.

action.name: removeInterface1
action.description: Sets the attribute ipInterface to NULL.

action.name: removeInterface2
action.description: Sets the attribute interface2 to NULL.

class.name: IpAccessHostEt
class.description:
IP Access Host on an ET board for IP.
A maximum of 2500 host MOs (IpAccessHostGpb, IpAccessHostSpb and IpAccessHostEt) can be configured in a node. See the descriptions of the relevant boards for limitations.
A maximum of 128 host MOs (IpAccessHostGpb, IpAccessHostSpb and IpAccessHostEt) can refer to IpInterface MOs on one board.
A maximum of two instances of IpAccessHostEt MO can refer to one IpInterface MO. For some boards, the maximum number can be lower. Only one instance of IpAccessHostEt MO can refer to a VpnInterface MO, an IpInterfaceGroup MO or an Ipv6Interface MO.
If this MO refers to a VpnInterface MO, it represents an inner IP address (IP address within the VPN).
An IpAccessHostEt MO with an IPv6 address cannot be a parent of an IpSyncRef MO, and it cannot be referenced by an IpMux MO or a VpnInterface MO.

attribute.name: IpAccessHostEtId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: The administrative state.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: ipAddress
attribute.description:
The IP address of the host.
The input format for an IPv4 address is four fields of digits, separated by a dot. Each field consists of one to three digits.
The input format for an IPv6 address is as defined in specification RFC4291, chapter 2.2, bullet 1 and 2.
This IP address must be unique with respect to other hosts in the node.
An IPv4 address must belong to the subnet which is indicated in the MO referenced by ipInterfaceMoRef.
If this MO refers to an IpInterfaceGroup MO, the IP address in this attribute must: - be different from the attribute ownIpAddressActive in both the IpInterface MOs referenced by the IpInterfaceGroup MO. - belong to the same subnet as the IP interfaces referenced by the IpInterfaceGroup MO.
attribute.disturbances: Changing this attribute can affect traffic.

attribute.name: ipDefaultTtl
attribute.description:
The default value of the Time-To-Live (TTL) field of the IP header. The value is inserted into datagrams originating at this host, whenever a TTL value is not supplied by the transport layer protocol.
This attribute is not applicable for an IPv6 address.

attribute.name: ipInterfaceMoRef
attribute.description:
For IPv4: Reference to an IpInterface MO or VpnInterface MO, or IpInterfaceGroup MO.
For IPv6: Reference to an Ipv6Interface MO.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: pmIpInAddrErrors
attribute.description:
The number of received IP packets where the packet source IP address is either a Broadcast address or a Multicast address.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: The source IP address is either a Broadcast address or a Multicast address.

attribute.name: pmIpInDelivers
attribute.description:
The number of recevied IP packets that was successfully terminated and delivered to higher level protocols.
The counter is increased by one for every 1000 packets. This value is zero if less than 1000 packets are counted.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: 1000 IP packets are successfully terminated and delivered to higher level protocols.

attribute.name: pmIpInDiscards
attribute.description:
The number of input IP datagrams, for which no problems were encountered that prevent their continued processing, but which were discarded, for example, due to lack of buffer space. This counter does not include any datagrams discarded while awaiting reassembly.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: An IP packet is discarded due to lack of queuing capacity.

attribute.name: pmIpInHdrErrors
attribute.description:
The number of received packets discarded due to errors in the IP header, that is: - The checksum of the IP header is faulty. Note that the check is only done when the length of the header is larger than 5, i.e. the packet contains options. In case the header length is 5 the check is performed by the IpInterface, compare with the pmIfStatsIpInHdrErrors counter.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: An IP packet is discarded due to errors in the IP header.

attribute.name: pmIpInReceives
attribute.description:
The total number of IP packets received by the host regardless of encapsulated protocol. This also includes faulty packets which have been discarded. The counter is increased by one for every 1000 packets. This value is zero if less than 1000 packets are counted.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: 1000 IP packets are received.

attribute.name: pmIpInUnknownProtos
attribute.description:
The number of received IP packets discarded by the host due to unknown or unsupported protocol.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: An IP packet is discarded due to unknown protocol.

attribute.name: pmIpOutDiscards
attribute.description:
The number of output IP datagrams, for which no problem was encountered to prevent transmission to their destination, but which were discarded (for example, due to lack of buffer space). This counter includes datagrams counted in ipForwDatagrams, if any such packets met this (discretionary) discard criterion.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: An IP packet is discarded due to lack of queuing capacity.

attribute.name: pmIpOutRequests
attribute.description:
The total number of IP datagrams which local IP user protocols, including Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) supplied to IP in requests for transmission. This counter does not include any datagrams counted in ipForwDatagrams.
Counted at two locations. The counter is increased by one for every 1000 packets. This value is zero if less than 1000 packets are counted.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: 1000 IP datagrams are requested for transmission by a higher level protocol.

attribute.name: pmIcmpInDestUnreachs
attribute.description:
The number of received ICMP Destination Unreachable messages.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: An ICMP Destination Unreachable message is received.

attribute.name: pmIcmpInEchoReps
attribute.description:
The number of received ICMP Echo Reply messages.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: An ICMP Echo Reply message is received.

attribute.name: pmIcmpInEchos
attribute.description:
The number of received ICMP Echo Request messages.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: An ICMP Echo Request message is received.

attribute.name: pmIcmpInErrors
attribute.description:
The number of ICMP messages discarded due to ICMP header error (that is, bad checksum or length field) or when the ICMP message has an unsupported type value.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: An ICMP message is discarded due to ICMP header error or it has an unsupported type value.

attribute.name: pmIcmpInMsgs
attribute.description:
The total number of received ICMP messages regardless of its type and code.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: An ICMP message is received.

attribute.name: pmIcmpInParamProbs
attribute.description:
The number of received ICMP messages indicating Parameter Problem.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: An ICMP message indicating Parameter Problem is received.

attribute.name: pmIcmpInRedirects
attribute.description:
The number of received ICMP Redirect messages.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: An ICMP Redirect message is received.

attribute.name: pmIcmpInSrcQuenchs
attribute.description:
The number of received ICMP Source Quench messages.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: An ICMP Source Quench message is received.

attribute.name: pmIcmpInTimeExcds
attribute.description:
The number of received ICMP Time Exceeded messages.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: An ICMP Time Exceeded message is received.

attribute.name: pmIcmpOutDestUnreachs
attribute.description:
The number of sent ICMP Destination Unreachable messages.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: An ICMP Destination Unreachable message is sent.

attribute.name: pmIcmpOutEchoReps
attribute.description:
The number of sent ICMP Echo Reply messages.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: An ICMP Echo Reply message is sent.

attribute.name: pmIcmpOutEchos
attribute.description:
The number of sent ICMP Echo Request messages.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: An ICMP Echo Request message is sent.

attribute.name: pmIcmpOutErrors
attribute.description:
The number of ICMP messages not sent out due to internal capacity problem, that is: - Out of buffer situation in xscale.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: An ICMP message is sent due to internal capacity problem.

attribute.name: pmIcmpOutMsgs
attribute.description:
The total number of sent ICMP messages regardless of its type and code.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: An ICMP message is sent.

attribute.name: pmIcmpOutParamProbs
attribute.description:
The number of sent ICMP messages indicating problem with the header parameters (for instance, incorrect arguments in an option) such that it cannot complete processing the datagram and it must discard the datagram.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: An ICMP message is sent indicating problem with the header parameters.

attribute.name: pmUdpInDatagrams
attribute.description:
The number of received UDP datagrams delivered to higher level protocol/user, including datagrams received during session release. It does not count UDP datagrams discarded due to unresolved port (pmUdpNoPorts), nor datagrams discarded due to bad checksum (pmUdpInErrors). The counter is increased by one for every 1000 packets. This value is zero if less than 1000 packets are counted.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: 1000 UDP datagrams are delivered to a higher level protocol/user.

attribute.name: pmUdpInErrors
attribute.description:
The number of received UDP datagrams that could not be delivered for reasons other than the lack of an application at the destination port, that is: - Incorrect UDP checksum. - The desired queue for payload towards the application is full. - UDP datagrams with length = 8, hence no data to deliver to the user. - Too large UDP datagram.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: A UDP datagram cannot be delivered.

attribute.name: pmUdpNoPorts
attribute.description:
The number of received IP packets with unresolved UDP port number. The port number is considered unresolved if one of the following conditions applies:
- the packet destination port is not available (open for traffic), that is, no session with local port number matching the packet destination port exists
- if packet destination port number is available (and no session release operation is in progress) and the packet source port does not correspond to the remote UDP port configured for the session using the destination/local port, then the packet is discarded.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.deprecated: Replaced by the counter, pmIpPortUnreachable, which is a general counter for IP packets with unresolved higher layer protocol destination port number.
attribute.condition: An IP packet is received with unresolved UDP port number.

attribute.name: pmUdpOutDatagrams
attribute.description:
The number of UDP datagrams sent to the IP protocol layer for encapsulation and transmission to the network. The counter is increased by one for every 1000 packets. This value is zero if less than 1000 packets are counted.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: 1000 UDP datagrams are sent to the IP protocol layer.

attribute.name: currentPmRegister
attribute.description:
Returns the current values of all PM counters.
To activate the writing of statistical values in a PM counter, start a performance monitoring (scanner) on that counter. Otherwise, the value of the PM counter is set to -1.
attribute.obsolete: Has no functional behavior and is now redundant. Read operations can return undefined values.

attribute.name: ntpServerMode
attribute.description:
Specifies whether a host is acting as an NTP server.
This attribute cannot be set to ENABLED, if there are any IpSyncRef MOs in the node.

attribute.name: pmIpPortUnreachable
attribute.description:
The number of received IP packets that could not be delivered to a higher layer protocol, because of unresolved destination port number or because of unresolved TEID (Tunnel Endpoint Identifier) value.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: The counter steps if the destination port number is unresolved. For UDP, this occurs when: - no session with local port number matching the packet destination port exists - a session with local port number matching the packet destination port exists, but the packet source port does not correspond to the remote UDP port defined for the session. For SCTP, this occurs when: - the destination port number does not match a range of local port numbers used by an SCTP protocol entity tied to the ET IP host. For GTP-U: The counter steps if the TEID is unresolved. This occurs when: - no tunnel with TEID, matching the TEID value received in the packet, exists.

attribute.name: ntpDscp
attribute.description: The DSCP value to be used for outgoing NTP packets.

attribute.name: pmIpFragCreates
attribute.description:
The number of IP fragments that are generated as a result of fragmentation at this entity.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: An IP fragment is generated.

attribute.name: pmIpFragFails
attribute.description:
The number of IP datagrams which need to be fragmented, but which cannot be, e g due to that their "Don't Fragment" flag is set.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: An IP datagram needing fragmentation cannot be fragmneted.

attribute.name: pmIpFragOks
attribute.description:
The number of IP datagrams which are successfully fragmented at this entity.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: An IP datagram is fragmented.

attribute.name: pmIpReasmFails
attribute.description:
The number of IP datagrams which failed to be reassembled. Possible reasons for failure can be for example reassembly timeout, fragments received in the wrong order, and mapping of fragments for more than one fragmented datagram to the same reassembly queue.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: The IP reassembly algorithm detected a failure, while reassembling.

attribute.name: pmIpReasmOks
attribute.description:
The number of IP datagrams which are successfully reassembled.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: An IP datagram is reassembled.

attribute.name: pmIpReasmReqds
attribute.description:
The number of received fragments which are required to be reassembled at this entity.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: A fragment is received and scheduled for reassembly.

attribute.name: pmMeanAtmConnSetupIntensity
attribute.description:
The average number of connection setups per second during the ROP period.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: A connection is set up

attribute.name: pmPeakAtmConnSetupIntensity
attribute.description:
The highest number of connection setups per second during the ROP period.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: A connection is set up

attribute.name: pmStdDevAtmSetupIntensity
attribute.description:
The standard deviation in connection setups per second during the ROP period.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: A connection is set up

attribute.name: networkPrefixLength
attribute.description:
The length of the network prefix.
This attribute is applicable only for an IPv6 address. For IPv4 this attribute is silently ignored.

attribute.name: pmInAppLayerError
attribute.description:
The number of received packets discarded due to corrupted application headers, for example RTP header faults such as: - the RTP version is not equal to 2, - the X-bit is not equal to 0, - the P-bit is not equal to 0, or - a cc-field indicating a longer header than the actual payload size.
Only applicable for IPv4.
attribute.condition: An IP packet is discarded due to corrupted application header.

action.name: ping
action.description:
Calls a remote host or router to find out if it is present in the network.
The following parameter is returned: Ping result: The IP address - is alive or no answer.
Note that the result of executing ping on itself has no meaning for IpAccessHostEt, no answer does not indicate that the host is down.

parameter.name: host
parameter.description:
The IP address to the host that is called.
The input format for an IPv4 address is four fields of digits, separated by a dot. Each field consists of one to three digits.
The input format for an IPv6 address is as defined in specification RFC4291, chapter 2.2, bullet 1 and 2.
It is possible to use this action for both IPv4 and IPv6, but the called host must have the same IP version as this MO.

class.name: IpSyncRef
class.description:
IP Synchronization Reference
Administers the synchronization reference based on time stamps carried by NTP packets.
This MO is configured only if the attribute ntpServerMode in all the IpAccessHostEt MOs in the node is set to DISABLED.
Refer to the description of the relevant board that supports NTP clients for configuration details.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: The administrative state.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: IpSyncRefId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: ntpServerIpAddress
attribute.description:
This attribute contains the domain name or the IP address of the NTP server to be used. It must be a valid IP address or a valid domain name.
A valid IP address is four eight-bit numbers separated by dots. The eight-bit numbers are represented in decimal form.
A valid domain name: - has characters of type letters, numbers and a hyphen "-", where hyphens can be anywhere in the middle of a name, but cannot be located at the end or beginning of a name - cannot have spaces - is case insensitive - can include dots for the use of sub domains.
Two IpSyncRef MOs belonging to the same IpAccessHostEt MO, must have different ntpServerIpAddress values.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

attribute.name: syncStatus
attribute.description: The synchronization status. It reflects both the local and the remote peer of the IP synchronization reference.
attribute.deprecated: Replaced by the attribute syncRefStatus in Synchronization MO.

attribute.name: cachedIpAddress
attribute.description: This attribute contains the latest IP address received from the DNS server with the specified domain name. If domain name is not valid or no value yet received from the DNS server this will be a null string.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

class.name: FastEthernet
class.description:
This MO type models a Fast Ethernet interface on the GPB or CBU.
It is not possible to configure both the MediumAccessUnit MO and the FastEthernet MO under the same GeneralProcessorUnit MO. These MOs are mutually exclusive.
A maximum of 16 Fast Ethernet MOs can be configured per node.
A maximum of 16 IpAccessHost MOs can be connected to the FastEthernet MO.
The FastEthernet MO does not have to be configured on the same processor as the IpAccessHostGpb MOs connected to it.

attribute.name: FastEthernetId
attribute.description: The value componenet of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description:
The administrative state.
Traffic is not stopped if administrativeState is set to LOCKED.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

attribute.name: macAddress
attribute.description:
The MAC address of the ethernet link.
If the board is not available, the attribute has the value "00:00:00:00:00:00".

attribute.name: subnet
attribute.description: This attribute contains the subnet address of the FastEthernet MO.

attribute.name: defaultRouter
attribute.description: The IP address of the default router.

attribute.name: mtu
attribute.description: The maximum transfer unit.

attribute.name: networkPrefixLength
attribute.description:
The subnet mask.
Example: networkPrefixLength = 24, subnet mask is 255.255.255.0 Example: networkPrefixLength = 28, subnet mask is 255.255.255.240

attribute.name: pmIfInErrors
attribute.description: Number of input packets discarded due to any error.
attribute.condition: An input packet is discarded.

attribute.name: pmIfInUcastPkts
attribute.description: The number of unicast packets, delivered by this sublayer to a higher (sub-)layer, that were not addressed to a multicast or broadcast address at this sublayer.
attribute.condition: An input Unicast Packet is delivered to a higher layer.

attribute.name: pmIfOutUcastPkts
attribute.description: The total number of outgoing unicast ethernet frames requested to be transmitted (including those that were discarded or not sent).
attribute.condition: An output unicast packet is requested to be transmitted.

attribute.name: pmIfInDiscards
attribute.description: The number of inbound packets that were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected that prevented them from being delivered to a higher-layer protocol. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space.
attribute.condition: An input packet is discarded due to resource limitations.

attribute.name: pmIfInUnknownProtos
attribute.description: The number of packets received that had a protocol not supported or unknown.
attribute.condition: A packet with a not supported or unknown protocol, is received.

attribute.name: pmIfOutErrors
attribute.description: The number of packets requested to be transmitted, but which were discarded due to errors found in the packets.
attribute.condition: A erroneous packet is discarded.

attribute.name: pmIfOutDiscards
attribute.description: The number of packets requested to be transmitted, but which were discarded due to lack of resources (for example, buffer space).
attribute.condition: A packet is discarded due to resource problems.

attribute.name: pmIfInMulticastPkts
attribute.description: The number of multicast packets, delivered by this sublayer to a higher (sub-)layer, that were addressed to a multicast address at this sublayer. For a MAC layer protocol, this includes both Group and Functional addresses.
attribute.condition: An input multicast packet is delivered to a higher layer.

attribute.name: pmIfInBroadcastPkts
attribute.description: The number of broadcast packets, delivered by this sublayer to a higher (sub-)layer, that were addressed to a broadcast address at this sublayer.
attribute.condition: An input broadcast packet is delivered to a higher layer.

attribute.name: pmIfOutMulticastPkts
attribute.description: The total number of multicast packets that higher-level protocols requested to be transmitted, and which were addressed to a multicast address at this sublayer, including those that were discarded or not sent.
attribute.condition: An output multicast packet is delivered to a higher layer.

attribute.name: pmIfOutBroadcastPkts
attribute.description: The total number of outgoing broadcast ethernet frames requested to be transmitted (including those that were discarded or not sent).
attribute.condition: An output broadcast packet is requested to be transmitted.

attribute.name: pmIfInOctetsLo
attribute.description: The total number of octets transmitted, including framing characters. The high-capacity counter for octets transmitted out on an interface has been split into two parts. This counter represents the lower part of the 62 least-significant bits of the high-capacity counter for octets transmitted out on the interface. The two most significant bits of this 64-bit counter are discarded. This 64-bit counter is presented as 2*31 bits: pmIfInOctetsHi (bit 62-31) and pmIfInOctetsLo (bit 30-0) in the MOM.
attribute.condition: An octet is received.

attribute.name: pmIfOutOctetsLo
attribute.description: The total number of octets transmitted out on the interface, including framing characters. The high-capacity counter for octets transmitted out on an interface has been split into two parts. This counter represents the lower part of the 62 least-significant bits of the high-capacity counter for octets transmitted out on the interface. The two most-significant bits of this 64-bit counter are discarded. This 64-bit counter is presented as 2*31 bits: pmIfOutOctetsHi (bit 62-31) and pmIfOutOctetsLo (bit 30-0) in the MOM.
attribute.condition: An octet is transmitted.

attribute.name: pmIfInOctetsHi
attribute.description: The total number of octets transmitted, including framing characters. The high-capacity counter for octets transmitted out on an interface has been split into two parts. This counter represents the higher part of the 62 least significant bits of the high capacity counter for octets transmitted out on the interface. The two most significant bits of this 64-bit counter are discarded. This 64-bit counter is presented as 2*31 bits: pmIfInOctetsHi (bit 62-31) and pmIfInOctetsLo (bit 30-0) in the MOM.
attribute.condition: An octet is received.

attribute.name: pmIfOutOctetsHi
attribute.description: The total number of octets transmitted out on the interface, including framing characters. The high-capacity counter for octets transmitted out on an interface has been split into two parts. This counter represents the higher part of the 62 least-significant bits of the high-capacity counter for octets transmitted out on the interface. The two most-significant bits of this 64-bit counter are discarded. This 64-bit counter is presented as 2*31 bits: pmIfOutOctetsHi (bit 62-31) and pmIfOutOctetsLo (bit 30-0) in the MOM.
attribute.condition: An octet is transmitted.

class.name: IpAccessSctp
class.description:
Represents access for SCTP to one or two IP hosts on ET boards for IP.
Use two IP hosts for the multi-homing facility in SCTP. Multi-homing is supported for IPv4 only. Both IP hosts must refer to the same type of MO (IpInterface or IpInterfaceGroup).
On some boards, several IpAccessSctp MOs can refer to the same IpAccessHostEt MO, by means of port distribution.
On other boards, there can be one IpAccessSctp MO for each IpAccessHostEt MO.

attribute.name: IpAccessSctpId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserves this MO instance.

attribute.name: ipAccessHostEtRef1
attribute.description:
The identity of a primary IpAccessHostEt referred to by this MO.
The attributes, ipAccessHostEtRef1 and ipAccessHostEtRef2, must not refer to the same IpAccessHostEt MO instance.
This attribute must always contain a valid MO reference.

attribute.name: ipAccessHostEtRef2
attribute.description:
The identity of a secondary IpAccessHostEt referred to by this MO.
The attributes, ipAccessHostEtRef1 and ipAccessHostEtRef2, must not refer to the same IpAccessHostEt MO instance.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
It contains details about operationalState.

class.name: IpMux
class.description:
IP Multiplexing
Provides IP multiplexing and RTP header compression (either termination of RTP with compressed header or sending compression information, T-bit, in backplane). The support for this may vary between board types. See the description of the relevant board for details.

attribute.name: currentPmRegister
attribute.description:
Returns the current values of all PM counters.
To activate the writing of statistical values in a PM counter, start a performance monitoring (scanner) on that counter. Otherwise, the value of the PM counter is set to -1.
attribute.obsolete: Has no functional behavior and is now redundant. Read operations can return undefined values.

attribute.name: ipAccessHostEtRef
attribute.description: Reference to an instance of IpAccessHostEt MO.

attribute.name: IpMuxId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: maxMuxPacketSize
attribute.description:
The maximum length for multiplexed packets.
If the attribute mtu in the related IpInterface MO has a lower value than this attribute, mtu determines the maximum length of multiplexed packets and this attribute is ignored.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: pmIpMuxNotApplied
attribute.description: The number of user data sessions for which IP multiplexing is requested, but cannot be applied.
attribute.condition: IP multiplexing is requested, but cannot be applied.

class.name: TrafficScheduler
class.description:
An egress Traffic Manager entity is configured by the TrafficScheduler MO and by the TrafficManagementQueue MO. The configuration of an egress Traffic Manager entity is initiated by creating an TrafficScheduler MO. The TrafficScheduler MO configures scheduling and shaping, and mapping of DSCP values to queues.
The TrafficScheduler MO automatically creates a number of TrafficManagementQueue MO children. The number of children created is equivalent to the highest queue number, with at least one mapped DSCP value in the dscpMap attribute of TrafficScheduler MO. To add or delete queues, the TrafficScheduler MO has to be deleted and created again with an updated dscpMap attribute.
The maximum number of TrafficScheduler MOs equals the sum of the maximum allowed numbers of IpInterface MOs and of Ipv6Interface MOs.
All IpInterface MOs and Ipv6Interface MOs referring to the same TrafficScheduler MO must use the same GigabitEthernet MO.

attribute.name: TrafficSchedulerId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains an MO instance that reserves this MO instance.

attribute.name: egressCir
attribute.description:
This attribute defines the Committed Information Rate (CIR), that is, the average rate in Mbps, used by the traffic shaper on the egress direction of the interface. If the value is zero (default value), there is effectively no rate limit. The lowest configurable value (above zero) is 2 Mbps.
If the sum of the egressCir values for the TrafficScheduler MOs referenced by the IpInterface or Ipv6Interface MOs connected to the same physical interface exceeds the equivalent IP Layer bandwidth of the physical interface, the shaping characteristics are undefined and are not deterministic.

attribute.name: egressCbs
attribute.description:
The maximum Committed Burst Size (CBS) in number of bytes sent in the egress direction.
An egress Traffic Manager entity is allowed to burst 2 x MTU bytes even if egressCbs is configured to a value lower than 2 x MTU. The MTU for an TrafficScheduler MO referenced by one or more IpInterface MOs or Ipv6Interface MOs, is assumed to be the MTU with the highest value amongst all IpInterface MOs and Ipv6Interface MOs.

attribute.name: wpStartQueue
attribute.description:
The queue number on which the Weighted Priority Scheduling starts.
The value 1000 means that Weighted Priority Scheduling is not used for any queue.

class.name: TrafficManagementQueue
class.description:
Handles configuration of a single queue.
Automatically created when creating a TrafficScheduler MO. The number of children created is equivalent to the highest queue number, with at least one mapped DSCP value in the dscpMap attribute of MO TrafficScheduler.
To add or delete queues, the MO TrafficScheduler has to be deleted and re-created with an updated dscpMap attribute.

attribute.name: TrafficManagementQueueId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains an MO instance that reserves this MO instance.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: queueLength
attribute.description: Specifies the maximum depth of each queue in bytes, beyond which all newly arrived packets will be dropped.

attribute.name: queueWeight
attribute.description:
The minimum guaranteed rate that the scheduler, in case of Weighted Priority Scheduling, must allocate to a queue. This minimum rate is relative to the average rate of the traffic shaper (configured by attribute egressCir in the TrafficScheduler MO)
The sum of queueWeight for all queues can not exceed 100 and such a configuration will be rejected.
If the sum of all active queue weights is less than 100, the amount that each queue gets served by the scheduler, equals to the weight of the queue plus non-reserved bandwidth divided by the number of queues.

attribute.name: pmQueueOutOctets
attribute.description: The number of octets in both headers and payload, transmitted from the queue.
attribute.condition: An octet is transmitted.

attribute.name: pmQueueOutPackets
attribute.description: The number of packets transmitted from the queue.
attribute.condition: A packet is transmitted.

attribute.name: pmQueueDroppedPackets
attribute.description: The number of packets that have been dropped instead of enqueued by the queue manager.
attribute.condition: A packet is dropped.

attribute.name: pmQueueDroppedOctets
attribute.description: The number of octets that have been dropped instead of enqueued by the queue manager. Both headers and payload are counted.
attribute.condition: An octets is dropped.

attribute.name: queueOccupancyPackets
attribute.description: Indicates the current number of packets in the queue.

attribute.name: queueOccupancyPercentage
attribute.description: Indicates the queue filling level in percentage of the queue length.

class.name: TrafficManagement
class.description:
This MO handles licensing information for the Egress IP Traffic Shaping feature.
If the license for this feature is not enabled and if the feature is not activated in the node, the TrafficScheduler MO and TrafficManagementQueue MO will not propagate the configurations to its resources. Instead basic traffic management behavior will be applied to all IP interfaces.

attribute.name: TrafficManagementId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: featureState
attribute.description:
Specifies if the licensed feature Egress IP Traffic Shaping is ACTIVATED or DEACTIVATED.
The feature is not enabled until the feature state is ACTIVATED and there is a valid Egress IP Traffic Shaping license in the node.

attribute.name: licenseState
attribute.description: Indicates whether a valid license key is installed for the feature Egress IP Traffic Shaping.

class.name: IpInterfaceGroup
class.description:
This MO groups two IpInterface MOs, to allow an IpAccessHostEt MO to switch between different PIUs or PIU devices.
This is needed to provide the function movable host for Sctp, on boards where the processor board role and the IP ET board role reside on the same processor unit.
The IpAccessHostEt MO referring to a IpInterfaceGroup MO can only be used for Sctp. That is, no other MO than an IpAccessSctp MO can refer to an IpAccessHostEt MO, referring to IpInterfaceGroup MO.
The IP interfaces referenced by primaryIpInterfaceRef and secondaryIpInterfaceRef must belong to the same subnet and the same VLAN.
The IP interfaces referenced by primaryIpInterfaceRef and secondaryIpInterfaceRef must belong to different PIUs or PIU Devices.

attribute.name: primaryIpInterfaceRef
attribute.description: The primary IP interface.

attribute.name: secondaryIpInterfaceRef
attribute.description: The secondary IP interface.

attribute.name: activeIpInterfaceRef
attribute.description: The IP interface which is currently active and, if enabled, used for traffic.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: IpInterfaceGroupId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

class.name: Ipv6Interface
class.description:
Internet Protocol (IP) Interface for IPV6.
This MO models the interface between an IP access host and Gigabit Ethernet.
There can only be one instance of this MO for each VLAN on one Ethernet port.
One IpAccessHostEt MO and one IpHostLink MO can refer to the same Ipv6Interface MO.

attribute.name: Ipv6InterfaceId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: mtu
attribute.description:
The maximum transfer unit.
The maximum value for mtu must not be set without first checking the value of the attribute frameFormat in the referenced GigaBitEthernet MO.
If frameFormat = ETHERNET_2_DIX, the maximum value of mtu is 2000. If frameFormat = IEEE_802_3_LLC_SNAP, the maximum value of mtu is 1492.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: pmIpIfStatsOutDiscards
attribute.description: The number of IP datagrams that should be sent, but were discarded due to resource problems (for example, lack of buffer space).
attribute.condition: An IP datagram, which should be sent, is discarded due to resource problems.

attribute.name: pmIpIfStatsHCInReceives
attribute.description: The number of received IP datagrams, including those with errors.
attribute.condition: An IP datagram is received.

attribute.name: vid
attribute.description:
The Virtual LAN (VLAN) identifier.
This attribute is applicable only when: - vLan is set to true - front ports are configured, that is the attribute linkType of the GigaBitEthernet MO is set to FRONT_PORTS
Each instance of this MO must have a unique value of this attribute.
vid 0 = priority tag only vid 1 - 4094 = with priority tag and vlan id
The value of this attribute is reset to 1 if vlanRef is set to a non-NULL value.

attribute.name: vLan
attribute.description:
Specifies whether VLAN tagging is used on this interface.
This attribute is applicable only when front ports are configured, that is, when this instance is related to a GigaBitEthernet MO, which has the attribute linkType set to FRONT_PORTS.
If set to false, the Ethernet frames are untagged. If set to true, the Ethernet frames are tagged.
The value of this attribute is reset to false if vlanRef is set to a non-NULL value.

attribute.name: ethernetRef
attribute.description:
Reference to a GigaBitEthernet MO.
Only one instance of this MO can refer to a specific instance of GigaBitEthernet MO.

attribute.name: interfaceName
attribute.description: Indicates the automatically defined interface name that is used in the IpRoutingTable MO, for showing which routes are valid for this instance of Ipv6Interface.

attribute.name: pmIpIfStatsHCInOctets
attribute.description: The total number of received IP octets, including those with errors.
attribute.condition: An IP octet is received.

attribute.name: pmIpIfStatsHCOutOctets
attribute.description: The total number of transmitted IP octets.
attribute.condition: An IP octet is transmitted.

attribute.name: pmIpIfStatsHCOutTransmits
attribute.description: The total number of transmitted IP datagrams.
attribute.condition: An IP datagram is transmitted.

attribute.name: pmIpIfStatsInHdrErrors
attribute.description: The number of received IP datagrams discarded due to errors in their IP headers, including version number mismatch, other format errors, hop count exceeded, errors discovered in processing their IP options, etc.
attribute.condition: An IP datagram discarded.

attribute.name: pmIpIfStatsInAddrErrors
attribute.description: The number of recived IP datagrams discarded, because the IP address in their IP header's destination field was not a valid address to be received at this entity.
attribute.condition: An IP datagram discarded.

attribute.name: pmIpIfStatsInUnknownProtos
attribute.description:
The number of locally-addressed IP datagrams received successfully but discarded because of an unknown or unsupported protocol.
When tracking interface statistics, the counter of the interface to which these datagrams were addressed is incremented. This interface might not be the same as the input interface for some of the datagrams.
attribute.condition: An IP datagram is received.

attribute.name: pmIpIfStatsReasmReqds
attribute.description:
The number of IP fragments received that needed to be reassembled at this interface.
When tracking interface statistics, the counter of the interface to which these fragments were addressed is incremented. This interface might not be the same as the input interface for some of the fragments.
attribute.condition: An IP datagram is received.

attribute.name: pmIpIfStatsReasmFails
attribute.description:
The number of failures detected.
The number of failures detected by the IP re-assembly algorithm (for whatever reason: timed out, errors, etc.).
attribute.condition: An IP datagram is received.

attribute.name: pmIpIfStatsInDiscards
attribute.description: The number of received IP datagrams for which no problems were encountered to prevent their continued processing, but were discarded (e.g., for lack of buffer space).
attribute.condition: An IP datagram is received.

attribute.name: pmIpIfStatsOutFragCreates
attribute.description:
The number of output datagram fragments that have been generated as a result of IP fragmentation.
When tracking interface statistics, the counter of the outgoing interface is incremented for a successfully fragmented datagram.
attribute.condition: An IP datagram is transmitted.

attribute.name: pmUdpIfStatsInError
attribute.description:
The number of received UDP datagrams that could not be delivered for reasons other than the lack of an application at the destination port, that is: - Incorrect UDP checksum. - The desired queue for payload towards the application is full. - UDP datagrams with length = 8, hence no data to deliver to the user.
Only packets belonging to an IpAccessHostEt will be counted, no packets for IpHostLink will be counted.
attribute.condition: A UDP datagram cannot be delivered.

attribute.name: vlanRef
attribute.description:
Reference to an instance of a Vlan MO.
The referenced instance represents an external VLAN that is opened on this port.
When configuring backplane ports, that is if the attribute linkType in the GigaBitEthernet MO is set to BACKPLANE_PORTS, this attribute is mandatory.
When configuring front ports, that is if the attribute linkType in the GigaBitEthernet MO is set to FRONT_PORTS, this attribute may be used for certain board types.
If this attribute is set to a non-NULL value, it overrides the values of the attribute pair vid and vLan.

attribute.name: trafficSchedulerRef
attribute.description: Reference to an instance of a TrafficScheduler MO.

class.name: Ipv6
class.description:
This MO type specifies the license information for the feature IPv6.
If the feature is not activated or if there is no license installed, the IPv6 traffic flow will be disabled.

attribute.name: Ipv6Id
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: featureState
attribute.description:
Specifies if the licensed feature IPv6 is ACTIVATED or DEACTIVATED.
The actual IPv6 service is not enabled until the feature state is ACTIVATED and there is a valid IPv6 license in the node.

attribute.name: licenseState
attribute.description: Indicates whether a valid license key is installed for the feature IPv6.

attribute.name: DscpGroupId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: pmIfStatsDscpInOctets
attribute.description: Series of measurements recorded during a reporting period where each measurement is the number of octets in input IP packets received by the IPv4/IPv6 interface including those received with invalid address but excluding packets received with error in the IP header error using one of the DSCP values in the DSCP aggregation group during the measurement interval. Octets from packets in pmIfStatsDscpInPkts must be counted here. The first value in the range will show the current sampling interval.
attribute.condition: This counter is incremented when an IP packet is received using one of the DSCP values configured in the DSCP aggregation group.

attribute.name: pmIfStatsDscpInPkts
attribute.description: Series of measurements recorded during a reporting period where each measurement is the number of input IP packets received by the IPv4/IPv6 interface including those received with invalid address but excluding packets received with error in the IP header using one of the DSCP values in the DSCP aggregation group during the measurement interval. The first value in the range will show the current sampling interval.
attribute.condition: This counter is incremented when an IP packet is received using one of the DSCP values configured in the DSCP aggregation group.

attribute.name: pmIfStatsDscpOutOctets
attribute.description: Series of measurements recorded during a reporting period where each measurement is the number of octets in IP packets using one of the DSCP values in the DSCP aggregation group that the IPv4/IPv6 interface delivered to the lower layers for transmission during the measurement interval. Octets from packets in pmIfStatsDscpOutPkts must be counted here. The first value in the range will show the current sampling interval.
attribute.condition: This counter is incremented when an IP packet is transmitted using one of the DSCP values configured in the DSCP aggregation group.

attribute.name: pmIfStatsDscpOutPkts
attribute.description: Series of measurements recorded during a reporting period where each measurement is the number of IP packets using one of the DSCP values in the DSCP aggregation group that the IPv4/IPv6 interface supplied to the lower layers for transmission during the measurement interval. The first value in the range will show the current sampling interval.
attribute.condition: This counter is incremented when an IP packet is transmitted using one of the DSCP values configured in the DSCP aggregation group.

attribute.name: samplingInterval
attribute.description:
The time interval between consecutive DSCP aggregation group usage measurements of all DDM counters for this MO.
The 10 s sampling interval is not supported if the ROP is 60 minutes.
In that case the counters will be disabled and only provide -2 values.

attribute.name: dscpValues
attribute.description:
An array where each DSCP decimal codepoint value (0-63) in the group is set.
One DSCP value can only be set once and at least one value must be set.

class.name: Icmp
class.description:
Internet Control Message Protocol
This MO collects statistics for ICMP packets, for the entire node.
It is created automatically when the Ipv6 MO is created.

attribute.name: pmIcmpStatsInErrors
attribute.description: The number of ICMP messages on the protocol version specified in the attribute icmpStatsIpVersion, which the node received, but determined as having ICMP-specific errors.
attribute.condition: An ICMP message with ICMP-specific errors.

attribute.name: IcmpId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: pmIcmpStatsInMsgs
attribute.description: The total number of ICMP messages on the protocol version specified in the attribute icmpStatsIpVersion, received by the node, which includes all those counted by pmIcmpStatsInErrors.
attribute.condition: Number of ICMP messages received by the interface.

attribute.name: pmIcmpStatsOutMsgs
attribute.description: The total number of ICMP messages on the protocol version specified in the attribute icmpStatsIpVersion, which this node attempted to send. This counter includes all those counted by pmIcmpStatsOutErrors.
attribute.condition: Number of ICMP message sent attempts.

attribute.name: pmIcmpStatsOutErrors
attribute.description: The number of ICMP messages on the protocol version specified in the attribute icmpStatsIpVersion, which this node did not send, due to problems discovered within ICMP, such as a lack of buffers.
attribute.condition: An ICMP message which is not sent.

attribute.name: pmIcmpStatsInPktsDestUnreach
attribute.description: The number of ICMP Destination Unreachable messages on the protocol version specified in the attribute icmpStatsIpVersion, received by the node.
attribute.condition: An ICMP Destination Unreachable message is received.

attribute.name: pmIcmpStatsOutPktsDestUnreach
attribute.description: The number of ICMP Destination Unreachable messages on the protocol version specified in the attribute icmpStatsIpVersion, sent by the node.
attribute.condition: An ICMP Destination Unreachable message is sent.

attribute.name: pmIcmpStatsInPktsTimeExcds
attribute.description: The number of ICMP Time Exceeded messages on the protocol version specified in the attribute icmpStatsIpVersion, received by the node.
attribute.condition: An ICMP Time Exceeded message is received.

attribute.name: pmIcmpStatsOutPktsTimeExcds
attribute.description: The number of ICMP Time Exceeded messages on the protocol version specified in the attribute icmpStatsIpVersion, sent by the node.
attribute.condition: An ICMP Time Exceeded message is sent.

attribute.name: pmIcmpStatsInPktsParmProb
attribute.description: The number of ICMP Parameter Problem messages on the protocol version specified in the attribute icmpStatsIpVersion, received by the node.
attribute.condition: An ICMP Parameter Problem message is received.

attribute.name: pmIcmpStatsOutPktsParmProb
attribute.description: The number of ICMP Parameter Problem messages on the protocol version specified in the attribute icmpStatsIpVersion, sent by the node.
attribute.condition: An ICMP Parameter Problem message is sent.

attribute.name: pmIcmpStatsInPktsTooBig
attribute.description: The number of ICMP Packet Too Big messages on the protocol version specified in the attribute icmpStatsIpVersion, received by the node.
attribute.condition: An ICMP Packet Too Big message is received.

attribute.name: pmIcmpStatsOutPktsTooBig
attribute.description: The number of ICMP Packet Too Big messages on the protocol version specified in the attribute icmpStatsIpVersion, sent by the node.
attribute.condition: An ICMP Packet Too Big message is sent.

attribute.name: pmIcmpStatsInPktsEchos
attribute.description: The number of ICMP Echo (request) messages on the protocol version specified in the attribute icmpStatsIpVersion, received by the node.
attribute.condition: An ICMP Echo (request) message is received.

attribute.name: pmIcmpStatsOutPktsEchos
attribute.description: The number of ICMP Echo (request) messages on the protocol version specified in the attribute icmpStatsIpVersion, sent by the node.
attribute.condition: An ICMP Echo (request) message is sent.

attribute.name: pmIcmpStatsInPktsEchoRep
attribute.description: The number of ICMP Echo Reply messages on the protocol version specified in the attribute icmpStatsIpVersion, received by the node.
attribute.condition: An ICMP Echo Reply message is received.

attribute.name: pmIcmpStatsOutPktsEchoRep
attribute.description: The number of ICMP Echo Reply messages on the protocol version specified in the attribute icmpStatsIpVersion, sent by the node.
attribute.condition: An ICMP Echo Reply message is sent.

attribute.name: pmIcmpStatsInPktsRoutSol
attribute.description: The number of ICMP Router Solicit messages on the protocol version specified in the attribute icmpStatsIpVersion, received by the node.
attribute.condition: An ICMP Router Solicit message is received.

attribute.name: pmIcmpStatsOutPktsRoutSol
