attribute.description: The number of ICMP Router Solicit messages on the protocol version specified in the attribute icmpStatsIpVersion, sent by the node.
attribute.condition: An ICMP Router Solicit message is sent.

attribute.name: pmIcmpStatsInPktsRoutAdv
attribute.description: The number of ICMP Router Advertisement messages on the protocol version specified in the attribute icmpStatsIpVersion, received by the node.
attribute.condition: An ICMP Router Advertisement message is received.

attribute.name: pmIcmpStatsOutPktsRoutAdv
attribute.description: The number of ICMP Router Advertisement messages on the protocol version specified in the attribute icmpStatsIpVersion, sent by the node.
attribute.condition: An ICMP Router Advertisement message is sent.

attribute.name: pmIcmpStatsInPktsNeighSol
attribute.description: The number of ICMP Neighbor Solicit messages on the protocol version specified in the attribute icmpStatsIpVersion, received by the node.
attribute.condition: An ICMP Neighbor Solicit message is received.

attribute.name: pmIcmpStatsOutPktsNeighSol
attribute.description: The number of ICMP Neighbor Solicitation messages on the protocol version specified in the attribute icmpStatsIpVersion, sent by the node.
attribute.condition: An ICMP Neighbor Solicit message is sent.

attribute.name: pmIcmpStatsInPktsNeighAdv
attribute.description: The number of ICMP Neighbor Advertisement messages on the protocol version specified in the attribute icmpStatsIpVersion, received by the node.
attribute.condition: An ICMP Neighbor Advertisement message is received.

attribute.name: pmIcmpStatsOutPktsNeighAdv
attribute.description: The number of ICMP Neighbor Advertisement messages on the protocol version specified in the attribute icmpStatsIpVersion, sent by the node.
attribute.condition: An ICMP Neighbor Advertisement message is sent.

attribute.name: pmIcmpStatsInPktsRedir
attribute.description: The number of Redirect messages on the protocol version specified in the attribute icmpStatsIpVersion, received by the node.
attribute.condition: An ICMP Redirect message is received.

attribute.name: pmIcmpStatsOutPktsRedir
attribute.description: The number of Redirect messages sent.
attribute.condition: An ICMP Redirect message is sent.

attribute.name: icmpStatsIpVersion
attribute.description:
The IP version that this MO collects statistics for.
IPv4 is not supported.

class.name: IpTermServ
class.description: Represents access for IP Termination Service to one or two IpAccessHostEt boards.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: IpTermServId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: plugInUnitRef
attribute.description:
Reference to an instance of PlugInUnit MO.
It indicates which processor the IpTermServ instance is executing on.
The PlugInUnit must be of type GPB.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: primaryIpAccessRef
attribute.description:
The identity of a primary IpAccessHostEt referred to by this MO.
The attributes, primaryIpAccessRef and secondaryIpAccessRef, must not refer to the same IpAccessHostEt MO instance.
This attribute must always contain a valid MO reference.

attribute.name: secondaryIpAccessRef
attribute.description:
The identity of a secondary IpAccessHostEt referred to by this MO.
The attributes, primaryIpAccessRef and secondaryIpAccessRef, must not refer to the same IpAccessHostEt MO instance.

class.name: TwampResponder
class.description:
Two Way Active Measurement Protocol Responder
This MO represents the session reflector functionality (according to RFC 5357) in a TWAMP light architecture.
When created, the node reflects TWAMP packets received on the specified UDP port.

attribute.name: udpPort
attribute.description:
The local UDP port that the TWAMP responder receives TWAMP packets on.
The port can be configured in range 1-49151 but a number of ports will be reserved by the system and can not be used.

attribute.name: actualModes
attribute.description:
Show the twamp modes that are supported by the responder.
In this release always set to the string “UNAUTHENTICATED”

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description:
The administrative state.
When LOCKED, the TWAMP Responder does not respond on incoming probe packets.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description:
The operational state.
Will be disabled if it receives state changes from the IpAccessHostEt MO.
Will also be disabled if the alarm below is detected and if there is no active twampresponder license

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
It contains details about operationalState.
In addition to this, the value degraded shall be used when the TwampResponder has reached the maximum number of test sessions.

attribute.name: pmTestInReceives
attribute.description: The number of packets received (from the IP layer) by the TWAMP responder.
attribute.condition: A packets has been received (from the IP layer) by the TWAMP responder.

attribute.name: pmTestInErrors
attribute.description: The number of packets with errors. This includes packets smaller than 40 bytes.
attribute.condition: A packet with errors in Twamp format has been received by the TWAMP responder (from the IP layer). This includes packets smaller than 40 bytes.

attribute.name: pmTestInDiscards
attribute.description: The number of packets discarded due to that the administrative state is locked or that the system has reached the maximum limits of test sessions.
attribute.condition: A packets has been received (from the IP layer) by the TWAMP responder but is discarded due to that administrativestate is locked or that the system has reached the maximum limits of testsessions.

attribute.name: pmTestOutTransmits
attribute.description: The number of Twamp packets transmitted (to the IP layer).
attribute.condition: A packet has been transmitted (to the IP layer) by the TWAMP responder.

attribute.name: pmTestSessions
attribute.description: The number of established test sessions.
attribute.condition: Increased when a new testsession is established, decreased when a testsession is removed (due to that the session timer expires).

attribute.name: ipAccessHostEtRef
attribute.description: Reference to an instance of a IpAccessHostEt MO.

attribute.name: TwampResponderId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

class.name: Ippm
class.description:
IP Performance Management
This MO is a container for various IP performance management functions.

attribute.name: responderFeatureState
attribute.description: Feature state for the TWAMP responder license controlled feature.

attribute.name: responderLicenseState
attribute.description: License state for the TWAMP responder feature.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: IppmId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: DefaultRouterId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: nextHopIpAddr
attribute.description:
The next hop IP address.
The input format for an IPv6 address is as defined in specification RFC4291, chapter 2.2, bullets 1 and 2.

class.name: Licensing
class.description:
Licensing
This MO represents the Licensing (Software Keys) functions.
This MO is created automatically and cannot be deleted.
The RDN of this MO is Licensing=1.

attribute.name: LicensingId
attribute.description:
The value component of the RDN.
It is set automatically when the MO instance is created.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: emergencyStateInfo
attribute.description:
Indicates information about the emergency status and the time remaining in the current state.
If the node is in emergency state USE_DEGRADED or USE_DISABLED, the the value of the struct attribute time is insignificant.

attribute.name: licenseFileUrl
attribute.description:
Indicates the URL to the License Key File if this is a licensed node.
If the node is not licensed, an empty string is returned.

attribute.name: fingerprint
attribute.description: The fingerprint of the node.

attribute.name: lastLicensingPiChange
attribute.description: Indicates the timestamp when the last licensing product information is changed. This is triggered by the action updateLicenseKeyFile.

attribute.name: licenseFileUrlIpv6
attribute.description:
Indicates the IPv6 URL to the License Key File if this is a licensed node.
If the node is not licensed, an empty string is returned.

attribute.name: integrationUnlockStateInfo
attribute.description: Indicates information about the integration unlock status and the time remaining in the current state.

action.name: updateLicenseKeyFile
action.description: Sends a request to the FTP/SFTP server to update the license key file.

parameter.name: userId
parameter.description: The user ID for login to FTP/SFTP server where license key files are located. If a NULL string userId is given, anonymous FTP/SFTP transfer is assumed. Max length is 32 characters.

parameter.name: password
parameter.description: The password for login to the FTP/SFTP server where license key files are located. Max length is 20 characters.

parameter.name: ipAddress
parameter.description:
The domain name, IPv4 or IPv6 address of the FTP/SFTP server.
The input format for an IPv4 address is four fields of digits, separated by a dot. Each field consists of one to three digits.
The input format for an IPv6 address is as defined in specification RFC 4291, chapter 2.2, bullet 1 and 2.
The input format for a domain name is as defined in specification RFC 952. When address resolution is requested and the DNS server responds with a list of resolved addresses, the first address presented by the DNS server is used by this action. Note that you need to configure a name-to-IP-address association in the DNS server, with an address that belongs to the correct address family. If the node is configured for OAM IP connectivity over IPv6, the address in the DNS association must be an IPv6 address.
Max length is 255 characters.

parameter.name: sFile
parameter.description: Source name and path of the license key file on the FTP/SFTP server. Max length is 256 characters.

action.name: setEmergencyState
action.description:
Sets the license server into emergency state, which opens up the licenses as described in the documentation about licensing.
Disabling emergency state is done by loading a new license key file.

class.name: Log
class.description:
Log
This MO configures how to transfer log data to a server. The log file will be transferred to the file server, specified in accountinfo, when the log file reaches the size displayed in logSize.

attribute.name: logSize
attribute.description: The maximum size of the log file.

attribute.name: logFilePath
attribute.description: Destination file path on the log file server.

attribute.name: logName
attribute.description:
The name of the log.
It must be included in the attribute logs, in the MO LogService.

attribute.name: accountInfo
attribute.description:
Account Information
Information for the server connection.

attribute.name: transferData
attribute.description: Information about the last file transfer.

attribute.name: LogId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

action.name: pushLog
action.description:
Transfers the log to the log file server.
The destination file path is set in the attribute logFilePath.

class.name: LogService
class.description:
Log Service
This MO is created automatically and cannot be deleted.
The RDN of this MO is LogService=1.

attribute.name: logs
attribute.description: List of logs included in this service.

attribute.name: LogServiceId
attribute.description:
The value component of the RDN.
It is set automatically when the MO instance is created.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

class.name: TransportNetwork
class.description:
Transport Network
This MO structures the transport network of the managed element. It is created automatically and cannot be deleted.
The RDN of this MO is TransportNetwork=1.

attribute.name: TransportNetworkId
attribute.description:
The value component of the RDN.
It is set automatically when the MO instance is created.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

class.name: ManagedElement
class.description:
Managed Element
This MO is the top MO in the MOM. A management application will communicate with the ManagedElement MO for the purpose of monitoring and controlling it.
This MO is created automatically and cannot be deleted.
The RDN of this MO is ManagedElement=1.

attribute.name: ManagedElementId
attribute.description:
The value component of the RDN.
It is set automatically when the MO instance is created.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: site
attribute.description: This attribute gives information about geographical location, for example place name.

attribute.name: logicalName
attribute.description: Specifies the logical name of a node.

attribute.name: productType
attribute.description: This attribute describes the product type and is always set to the value "Node".

attribute.name: productName
attribute.description: This attribute describes the implemented functionality.

attribute.name: productNumber
attribute.description: This attribute uniquely identifies the product, for example ROF123.

attribute.name: productRevision
attribute.description: This attribute identifies the version of the product, for example R2A.

attribute.name: mimName
attribute.description: The name and version of the MIM on the node.
attribute.deprecated: Replaced by mimInfo

attribute.name: faultTolerantCoreStates
attribute.description:
Retrieves information of PIUs (maximum 2 PIUs) that are running Fault Tolerant Core (FTC). This attribute contains an array of strings, for example:
ManagedElement=1,Equipment=1,Subrack=1,Slot=1,PlugInUnit=1;ftcState=Active ManagedElement=1,Equipment=1,Subrack=1,Slot=2,PlugInUnit=1;ftcState=PassiveReady
The possible FTC states are Init, NotConfigured, Active, Unavailable, PassiveNotReady, PassiveReady.

attribute.name: applicationConfiguration
attribute.description: Specifies configuration data critical for an application.

attribute.name: mimInfo
attribute.description: The name, version and release of the MIM.

attribute.name: healthCheckSchedule
attribute.description: The scheduled time and weekday, when the health check starts.

attribute.name: healthCheckResult
attribute.description: The result of the latest health check.

action.name: startHealthCheck
action.description:
Initiates a health check.
The health check investigates consistency of the file systems, configuration versions and upgrade packages. Alarms will be generated if a fault is found, see the alarms: - File System Diagnostic Error - Configuration Version Corrupt - Upgrade Package Corrupt
Only one health check action at a time can be active. Further attempts to start the health check are rejected. If the attribute operationalState of a PlugInUnit MO instance is set to DISABLED, the corresponding plug-in unit is not checked.

action.name: manualRestart
action.description: Manual restart of the node.

parameter.name: restartRank
parameter.description: The restart rank.

parameter.name: restartReason
parameter.description: The reason for the restart.

parameter.name: restartInfo
parameter.description: A free text field where extra information can be added.

class.name: ManagedElementData
class.description:
This object contains attributes and actions on node level.
This MO is created automatically and cannot be deleted.
The RDN of this MO is ManagedElementData=1.

attribute.name: ManagedElementDataId
attribute.description:
The value component of the RDN.
It is set automatically when the MO instance is created.

attribute.name: autoConfigurationAllowed
attribute.description:
This attribute specifies if the system is allowed to automatically configure detected objects.
Autoconfiguration is supported for upgradable hardware connected to CPP Subrack and Slot.
When setting this attribute from true to false the system creates a new CV.

attribute.name: documentServerAddress
attribute.description:
The base URL for the documentation server.
The attribute is read by the Element Management application to find the documentation server in the network. The URL shall contain the document server, for example:
http://cpi2.al.sw.ericsson.se/alexserv
The syntax "http://cpi.al.sw.ericsson.se/alexserv?LI=EN/LZN7450008R2A" is deprecated, and will not be supported in a future release. Please use the attribute docLibUserDefined if docLibSystemDefined is not available.

attribute.name: logonServerAddress
attribute.description:
A list of node names or IP addresses of the single logon servers (SLSs). The list uses commas to seperate the single logon server addresses, e.g. "https://SLS1,https://SLS2,https://SLS3", these addresses consists of the URLs to the concerned SLS servers. Maximum of 3 SLSs are supported. The attribute is read by Element Management application to find the single logon server in the network.
The input format for an IPv4 address is four fields of digits, separated by a dot. Each field consists of one to three digits.
The input format for an IPv6 address is as defined in specification RFC 4291, chapter 2.2, bullet 1 and 2.
The input format for a domain name is as defined in specification RFC 952. When address resolution is requested and the DNS server responds with a list of resolved addresses, the first address presented by the DNS server is used by this attribute. Note that you need to configure a name-to-IP-address association in the DNS server, with an address that belongs to the correct address family. If the node is configured for OAM IP connectivity over IPv6, the address in the DNS association must be an IPv6 address.
Complete URLs with the above examples: http://[2001:db8:0::1]:8080/cgi-bin/pkiclient.exe

attribute.name: ntpServerAddressPrimary
attribute.description:
This is the IP address to the NTP server.
If this NTP server is not configured, this attribute responds with 0.0.0.0.
The input format for an IPv4 address is four fields of digits, separated by a dot. Each field consists of one to three digits.
The input format for an IPv6 address is as defined in specification RFC 4291, chapter 2.2, bullet 1 and 2.
Domain names are supported. The input format for a domain name is as defined in specification RFC 952. When address resolution is requested and the DNS server responds with a list of resolved addresses, the first address presented by the DNS server is used by this attribute. Note that you need to configure a name-to-IP-address association in the DNS server, with an address that belongs to the correct address family. If the node is configured for OAM IP connectivity over IPv6, the address in the DNS association must be an IPv6 address.

attribute.name: ntpServiceActivePrimary
attribute.description:
Specifies if the node should poll the primary NTP server for information.
Even if this NTP server is not configured, this attribute still responds with its default value.

attribute.name: ntpMinPollPrimary
attribute.description:
This value states the minimum interval (in seconds) for polling the primary NTP server.
This value must be > 0.
Even if this NTP server is not configured, this attribute still responds with its default value.

attribute.name: ntpMaxPollPrimary
attribute.description:
This value states the maximum interval (in seconds) for polling the primary NTP server.
This value must be > 0.
Even if this NTP server is not configured, this attribute still responds with its default value.

attribute.name: ntpBurstFlagPrimary
attribute.description:
This is the burst flag used towards the primary NTP server.
Even if this NTP server is not configured, this attribute still responds with its default value.

attribute.name: ntpServerAddressSecondary
attribute.description:
This is an alternative IP address to an NTP server.
If this NTP server is not configured, this attribute responds with 0.0.0.0.
The input format for an IPv4 address is four fields of digits, separated by a dot. Each field consists of one to three digits.
The input format for an IPv6 address is as defined in specification RFC 4291, chapter 2.2, bullet 1 and 2.
Domain names are supported. The input format for a domain name is as defined in specification RFC 952. When address resolution is requested and the DNS server responds with a list of resolved addresses, the first address presented by the DNS server is used by this attribute. Note that you need to configure a name-to-IP-address association in the DNS server, with an address that belongs to the correct address family. If the node is configured for OAM IP connectivity over IPv6, the address in the DNS association must be an IPv6 address.

attribute.name: ntpServiceActiveSecondary
attribute.description:
Specifies if the node should poll the secondary NTP server for information.
Even if this NTP server is not configured, this attribute still responds with its default value.

attribute.name: ntpMinPollSecondary
attribute.description:
This value states the minimum interval (in seconds) for polling the secondary NTP server.
This value must be > 0.
Even if this NTP server is not configured, this attribute still responds with its default value.

attribute.name: ntpMaxPollSecondary
attribute.description:
This value states the maximum interval (in seconds) for polling the secondary NTP server.
This value must be > 0.
Even if this NTP server is not configured, this attribute still responds with its default value.

attribute.name: ntpBurstFlagSecondary
attribute.description:
This is the burst flag used towards the secondary NTP server.
Even if this NTP server is not configured, this attribute still responds with its default value.

attribute.name: nodeUTCTime
attribute.description:
This attribute specifies the UTC time used in the node.
It is the number of milliseconds elapsed since the epoch time (January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 GMT).
To set this attribute, all the three attributes, ntpServiceActive for Primary, Secondary and Third, must be false.

attribute.name: nodeLocalTimeZone
attribute.description:
Specifies the time zone of the node. This attribute is needed by management application to convert UTC time from a log or NTP service to local time. It will not change the real time clock on the node.
Choose a time zone abbreviation, three characters, in the list below, or specify a node local time in the format "+/-" and "hh:mm", where "hh" is hours and "mm" is minutes. Example: GMT or +01:30
Time zone and its offset in hours:
GMT (Greenwich Mean Time) 0 UTC (Coordinated Universal Time) 0 ECT (Central European Standard Time) + 1 EET (Eastern European Time) + 2 ART (Eastern European Time) + 2 EAT (Eastern African Time) + 3 MET (Iran Time) + 3.5 NET (Armenia Time) + 4 PLT (Pakistan Time) + 5 IST (India Standard Time) + 5.5 BST (Bangladesh Time) + 6 VST (Indochina Time) + 7 CTT (China Standard Time) + 8 JST (Japan Standard Time) + 9 CST (Central Standard Time) + 9.5 EST (Eastern Standard Time) + 10 AET (Eastern Standard Time) + 10 SST (Solomon Is. Time) + 11 NST (New Zealand Standard Time) + 12 CAT (Central Alaska Time) - 1 AGT (Argentina Time) - 3 BET (Brazil Time) - 3 CNT (Newfoundland Standard Time) - 3.5 PRT (Atlantic Standard Time) - 4 IET (Eastern Standard Time) - 5 ACT (Central Standard Time) - 6 PNT (Mountain Standard Time) - 7 MST (Mountain Standard Time) - 7 PST (Pacific Standard Time) - 8 AST (Alaska Standard Time) - 9 HST (Hawaii Standard Time) - 10 MIT (West Saoma Time) - 11 --
Reference: http://www.greenwichmeantime.com

attribute.name: daylightSavingTime
attribute.description: This attribute states if daylight saving time is used on this node. It is used by the node, and will not change the real time clock on the node.

attribute.name: hdVolumeCSize
attribute.deprecated: Replaced by hdVolumeCExt.

attribute.name: hdVolumeCFreespace
attribute.deprecated: Replaced by hdVolumeCFreespaceExt.

attribute.name: nodeUniqueID
attribute.description: This is a unique node identity to be set only in the factory.

attribute.name: swServerUrlList
attribute.description:
A comma-separated list of URLs, ending with the folder name containing CXC folders.
Example: Entering URL "http://111.222.333.444:8080/Ericsson" makes the node look for files located in "http://111.222.333.444:8080/Ericsson/CXC112233/Rxxx/jarfile.jar"
For downloading of software for system upgrade, see the attribute ftpServerIpAddress in MO UpgradePackage.
The input format for an IPv4 address is four fields of digits, separated by a dot. Each field consists of one to three digits.
The input format for an IPv6 address is as defined in specification RFC 4291, chapter 2.2, bullet 1 and 2.
The input format for a domain name is as defined in specification RFC 952. When address resolution is requested and the DNS server responds with a list of resolved addresses, the first address presented by the DNS server is used by this attribute. Note that you need to configure a name-to-IP-address association in the DNS server, with an address that belongs to the correct address family. If the node is configured for OAM IP connectivity over IPv6, the address in the DNS association must be an IPv6 address.
Complete URLs with the above examples: http://[2001:db8:0::1]:8080/cgi-bin/pkiclient.exe

attribute.name: piuGroupEscalationType
attribute.description: The type of node restart when it is a problem with the last PIU in a PIU group.

attribute.name: minimumHdVolumeCFreespace
attribute.description:
Minimum number of Megabytes of free space on C volume before an alarm is issued. 0 means that no alarm will be sent.
It is used as a threshold that triggers alarms when the C volume is about to be full (i.e. when the attribute hdVolumeCFreespaceExt exceeds this value).
The value should be set large enough so that an alarm is raised when the C volume is starting to have too little space for the new files of the next upgrade package.
The value should be small enough, so that the alarm is not sent unnecessarily when there is a lot of free space.
Alarm is raised if the value of hdVolumeCFreespaceExt becomes less than or equal to this value. But in order to cease the alarm, the free space must become at least 1 Megabyte larger than this value. To free space on the C volume, some old UpgradePackage MOs should be deleted.

attribute.name: docLibSystemDefined
attribute.description:
The identity of the ALEX document library defined for this node type and version, set by the system.
The attribute is read by the Element Management application to find the documentation library. The value must contain the used library identity, without spaces, for example: EN/LZN7450008R2A

attribute.name: docLibUserDefined
attribute.description:
The identity of an ALEX document library that can be defined by the user.
Use this attribute to set the library identity, if the attribute docLibSystemDefined is not available, or if the system-defined ALEX library is not available on the document server. If this attribute is set, it is used by the Element Manager to indentify the documentation library, instead of the value of docLibSystemDefined.
The value contains the library identity, without spaces, for example: EN/LZN7450008R2A

attribute.name: ntpBurstFlagThird
attribute.description:
This is the burst flag used towards the third NTP server.
Even if this NTP server is not configured, this attribute still responds with its default value.

attribute.name: ntpMaxPollThird
attribute.description:
This value states the maximum interval (in seconds) for polling the third NTP server.
This value must be > 0.
Even if this NTP server is not configured, this attribute still responds with its default value.

attribute.name: ntpMinPollThird
attribute.description:
This value states the minimum interval (in seconds) for polling the third NTP server.
This value must be > 0.
Even if this NTP server is not configured, this attribute still responds with its default value.

attribute.name: ntpServerAddressThird
attribute.description:
This is an alternative IP address to an NTP server.
If this NTP server is not configured, this attribute responds with 0.0.0.0.
The input format for an IPv4 address is four fields of digits, separated by a dot. Each field consists of one to three digits.
The input format for an IPv6 address is as defined in specification RFC 4291, chapter 2.2, bullet 1 and 2.
Domain names are supported. The input format for a domain name is as defined in specification RFC 952. When address resolution is requested and the DNS server responds with a list of resolved addresses, the first address presented by the DNS server is used by this attribute. Note that you need to configure a name-to-IP-address association in the DNS server, with an address that belongs to the correct address family. If the node is configured for OAM IP connectivity over IPv6, the address in the DNS association must be an IPv6 address.

attribute.name: ntpServiceActiveThird
attribute.description:
Specifies if the node should poll the third NTP server for information.
Even if this NTP server is not configured, this attribute still responds with its default value.

attribute.name: autoConfigurationStatus
attribute.description: Displays if autoconfiguration is in progress or not.

attribute.name: hdVolumeCSizeExt
attribute.description: The total size of the C volume on the node. The C volume may be replicated on several hard disks.

attribute.name: hdVolumeCFreespaceExt
attribute.description: The amount of freespace available on the C volume. The C volume may be replicated on several hard disks in a node.

action.name: createNtpPrimary
action.description:
This action creates the primary Network Time Protocol (NTP).
There must exist a primary NTP, and can exist a secondary and a third NTP.
Once the NTP is created, it is then possible to change the attributes, such as the IP address, burst flag, max- and min poll, and also specify which NTP is active.
The input format for an IPv4 address is four fields of digits, separated by a dot. Each field consists of one to three digits.
The input format for an IPv6 address is as defined in specification RFC 4291, chapter 2.2, bullet 1 and 2.
Domain names are supported. The input format for a domain name is as defined in specification RFC 952. When address resolution is requested and the DNS server responds with a list of resolved addresses, the first address presented by the DNS server is used by this action. Note that you need to configure a name-to-IP-address association in the DNS server, with an address that belongs to the correct address family. If the node is configured for OAM IP connectivity over IPv6, the address in the DNS association must be an IPv6 address.

action.name: createNtpSecondary
action.description:
This action creates the secondary/alternative Network Time Protocol (NTP).
There must exist a primary NTP, and can exist a secondary and a third NTP.
Once the NTP is created, it is then possible to change the attributes, such as the IP address, burst flag, max- and min poll, and also specify which NTP is active.
The input format for an IPv4 address is four fields of digits, separated by a dot. Each field consists of one to three digits.
The input format for an IPv6 address is as defined in specification RFC 4291, chapter 2.2, bullet 1 and 2.
Domain names are supported. The input format for a domain name is as defined in specification RFC 952. When address resolution is requested and the DNS server responds with a list of resolved addresses, the first address presented by the DNS server is used by this action. Note that you need to configure a name-to-IP-address association in the DNS server, with an address that belongs to the correct address family. If the node is configured for OAM IP connectivity over IPv6, the address in the DNS association must be an IPv6 address.

action.name: deleteNtpPrimary
action.description: This action deletes the primary NTP.

action.name: deleteNtpSecondary
action.description: This action deletes the secondary NTP.

action.name: setNodeUniqueId
action.description:
Used for setting the attribute nodeUniqueId.
This action should only be used in the factory, it is not for general use by the operator.

action.name: createNtpThird
action.description:
This action creates the third alternative Network Time Protocol (NTP).
There must exist a primary NTP, and can exist a secondary and a third NTP.
Once the NTP is created, it is then possible to change the attributes, such as the IP address, burst flag, max- and min poll, and also specify which NTP is active.
The input format for an IPv4 address is four fields of digits, separated by a dot. Each field consists of one to three digits.
The input format for an IPv6 address is as defined in specification RFC 4291, chapter 2.2, bullet 1 and 2.
Domain names are supported. The input format for a domain name is as defined in specification RFC 952. When address resolution is requested and the DNS server responds with a list of resolved addresses, the first address presented by the DNS server is used by this action. Note that you need to configure a name-to-IP-address association in the DNS server, with an address that belongs to the correct address family. If the node is configured for OAM IP connectivity over IPv6, the address in the DNS association must be an IPv6 address.

action.name: deleteNtpThird
action.description: This action deletes the third NTP.

class.name: WebServer
class.description:
Web Server
This MO is used for publishing data over HTTP in the node. The loadmodules to be published over HTTP are normally displayed in the SwAllocation MO, where the attribute repertoireList contains at least one reference to a Repertoire MO with load modules for web publishing and the attribute slotList contains a reference to the WebServer MO.
If the SwAllocation MO is not configured as above, then all loadmodules defined for HTTP publishing in the UCF file are published.
The SwAllocation MO is created automatically and cannot be changed or deleted. Only userLabel can be set.
The RDN of this MO is WebServer=1.

attribute.name: WebServerId
attribute.description:
The value component of the RDN.
It is set automatically when the MO instance is created.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: reservedBySwAllocation
attribute.description:
Contains the SwAllocation instance that reserves this MO instance.
Restriction: This MO instance can be reserved by only one instance of SwAllocation.

class.name: SystemFunctions
class.description:
System Functions
This MO structures the system functions of the managed element. It is created automatically and cannot be deleted.
The RDN of this MO is SystemFunctions=1.

attribute.name: SystemFunctionsId
attribute.description:
The value component of the RDN.
It is set automatically when the MO instance is created.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

class.name: PmService
class.description:
Performance Management Service for statistical rop files.
This MO configures limits of this service for the node.
This MO is created automatically and cannot be deleted.
The RDN of this MO is PmService=1.

attribute.name: minorAlarmCeasingDelta
attribute.description:
The percentage of the attribute maxNoOfCounters used to calculate the minor alarm ceasing limit.
Minor alarm ceasing limit = maxNoOfCounters * (100 - minorAlarmCeasingDelta) / 100
A minor alarm is ceased when the total number of active counters becomes lower than the minor alarm ceasing limit.
The attribute value must confirm to the following rule: The calculated minor alarm ceasing limit >= the calculated warning alarm ceasing limit.

attribute.name: maxNoOfMonitors
attribute.description:
The maximum number of simultaneously active performance monitorings.
If this limit is exceeded, when a performance monitoring is created or resumed, the create or resume operation is rejected.
To keep the number of active performance monitorings below the limit, performance monitorings can be suspended if the value is set to a lower value than before. The most recently defined performance monitorings are suspended first.

attribute.name: maxNoOfPmFiles
attribute.description:
The maximum number of Result Output Period (ROP) files that are maintained in the node.
If a new file is created and the limit is exceeded, the oldest file is deleted.
If the value is set to a lower value than before, files can be deleted to keep the number of stored files below the limit. The oldest file is deleted first.

attribute.name: performanceDataPath
attribute.description: The name of the path to where the ROP files are stored.

attribute.name: performanceDataVolume
attribute.description: The volume (c, p or any r-volume) where the ROP files are stored. The format for this attribute is: /c/, /pxxx/ or /rxxx/, where each x is a digit (0..9).

attribute.name: PmServiceId
attribute.description:
The value component of the RDN.
It is set automatically when the MO instance is created.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: warningAlarmLimitPercent
attribute.description:
The percentage of the attribute maxNoOfCounters used to calculate the warning alarm limit.
Warning alarm limit = maxNoOfCounters * warningAlarmLimitPercent/100
A warning alarm is raised if the total number of active counters exceeeds the warning alarm limit.
The attribute value must confirm to the following rule: warningAlarmLimitPercent > warningAlarmCeasingDelta.

attribute.name: warningAlarmCeasingDelta
attribute.description:
The percentage of maxNoOfCounters used to calculate the warning alarm ceasing limit.
Warning alarm ceasing limit = maxNoOfCounters * (warningAlarmLimitPercent - warningAlarmCeasingDelta)/100.
A warning alarm is ceased when the total number of active counters becomes lower than the warning alarm ceasing limit.
The attribute value must confirm to the following rules: The calculated warning alarm ceasing limit <= the calculated minor alarm ceasing limit. warningAlarmLimitPercent > warningAlarmCeasingDelta.

attribute.name: maxNoOfCounters
attribute.description:
The maximum number of simultaneously active counters.
If this limit is exceeded, when a performance monitoring is created or resumed, the create or resume operation is rejected. If the total number of simultaneously active counters becomes higher than a preset percentage of the maximum limit, a alarm is issued.
To keep the number of active counters below the limit, performance monitorings can be suspended if this value is set to a lower value than before. The most recently defined performance monitorings are suspended first.

attribute.name: transactionTimeOut
attribute.description: The time for the transaction timeout that is applied for all transactions created internally by the Performance Management Service, for example when creating a performance monitoring.

class.name: Ncli
class.description:
Node Command Line Interface (NCLI)
This MO is responsible to start/stop the NCLI Server.
This MO is created automatically and cannot be deleted.
The RDN of this MO is Ncli=1.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description:
The administrative state.
The NCLI Server is stopped by setting the administrativeState to LOCKED. This will close down all ongoing NCLI sessions immediately.
When setting the administrativeState to SHUTTING_DOWN, 1800 seconds (30 minutes) will elapse before the MO goes into state LOCKED. During this time no new NCLI sessions are accepted.
Setting the administrativeState to UNLOCKED starts the NCLI Server.

attribute.name: NcliId
attribute.description:
The value component of the RDN.
It is set automatically when the MO instance is created.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

action.name: executeCommandFile
action.description:
This action executes a NCLI command file on the node file system.
The action is synchronous and not possible to abort.
All commands in the command file will be included in an internally created transaction. This transaction is committed only if all commands in the file are successfully executed. If any command fails, the transaction is rolled back.
The command file can specify a transaction mode where each command in the file is run in its own transaction.
The command file contains one valid NCLI command per row.

class.name: Mspg
class.description:
Multiplex Section Protection Group
This MO represents unidirectional 1+1 MSP, as well as optimized bidirectional MSP.
This MO controls two different protection mechanisms: 1. Standard 1+1 MSP mechanism, where failure on the working line causes a switch to the standby line. 2. Equipment protection, where a failure on the working board causes a switch to the standby board. While executing an equipment protection switch, the node on the other end of the multiplexer section, switches using 1+1 MSP.
It is possible to force traffic to one port or board by using the attribute, administrativeState. Setting administrative state to LOCKED on the working board automatically causes an equipment switch to the standby board. Similarily, setting administrative state to LOCKED on the working port causes an MSP switch to the standby port.
Configure an MSP protection interface as follows: 1. Create the working interface. 2. Create the standby interface by creating an Os155SpiTtp with the attribute, muxMode set to STANDBY (standby for protection). 3. Create an MSPG MO with references to the two Os155SpiTtp MOs.
The two ports selected for the MSPG must have the attribute, standardMode configured in exactly the same way.
The Os155SpiTtp MO created for standby does not create any children, for example, no Vc3Ttp or Vc4Ttp MOs are created.
If the working line and the protection line are not created on the same board, all Os155SpiTtp children of the ExchangeTerminal MOs must be reserved by an Mspg or by an MspgExtended MO. This condition must be fulfilled for the MSP function to work. If the MSP function is not used, Os155SpiTtp children of the ExchangeTerminal MOs must not be reserved by an Mspg or by an MspgExtended MO.
Before configuring Msp and equipment protection for additional physical lines of a particular ExchangeTerminal board, where some lines are already configured for protection, make sure that all related Os155SpiTtp children reside on the working board. That is, that the ExchangeTerminal instance referred to by selectedBoard is also the parent of the Os155SpiTtp instance referred to by os155SpiWorkingId, for all previously configured instances of Mspg or MspgExtended.
In all cases but one, MSP is configured as unidirectional and non-revertive (the node on each side of the optical line switches independently of the other and there is no automatic switchback when the fault has been recovered from). If the working interface is configured as an HG channelized TTC STM-1 interface (that is, Os155SpiTtp is configured with the attributes, standardMode = TTC and muxMode = E1_T1_HG_LEVEL), the MSP is configured as a bidirectional MSP (as specified in Annex B in ITU-T G.841).
If optimized bidirectional switching is configured, the configured working interface corresponds to section 1 (as defined in G.841) and the configured standby interface corresponds to section 2. Initially, the primary section (refer to G.841 for details) corresponds to section 1 (that is, the configured working interface) and the secondary section corresponds to section 2 (that is, the configured standby interface). After a restoration of a fault that caused a MSP switch, the primary and secondary sections will swap.

attribute.name: MspgId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: os155SpiWorkingId
attribute.description: The working OS155 physical path termination.

attribute.name: os155SpiStandbyId
attribute.description: The standby OS155 physical path termination.

attribute.name: switchMode
attribute.description:
The switching mode. Two values are possible:
switchMode = LOCKED if any of the involved Os155SpiTtp MOs is locked (or is indirectly locked from the PlugInUnit MO).
switchMode = AUTOMATIC in all other cases.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: selectedPort
attribute.description: The port currently selected by the MSPG. The selected port can change only as a result of an MSP switch or an equipment protection switch.

attribute.name: selectedBoard
attribute.description:
The ExchangeTerminal MO that is currently used to process the user plane traffic.
The only action that can change the selected board is an equipment protection switch.

attribute.name: degCauseMsp
attribute.description:
Defines whether a degraded signal (DEG) defect should cause an automatic MSP switch.
This attribute applies to the ETSI standard.

attribute.name: lockout
attribute.description:
If lockout is set to true, the MSP logic is frozen meaning that no MSP switch occur, regardless of what happens on the lines. The APS (K1KL2) signalling also continues to signal the request and/or responses that it did when the set operation was perfomed.
This attribute applies when an HG channelized STM-1 TTC interface is used.

attribute.name: primarySection
attribute.description:
The primary section indicates the Os155SpiTtp that currently has the role of primary interface. As a consequence of a completed MSP switch, the primary and secondary sections can be interchanged.
This attribute applies to the STM-1 Channelized TTC case.

attribute.name: rdiSecondarySf
attribute.description:
Specifies if MSPG should prevent an MSP switch, if MS-RDI is present on the secondary section.
This attribute applies to the STM-1 Channelized TTC case.

action.name: manualMspSwitch
action.description:
Initiates a switch when there is no defect. This action is not possible when bidirectional MSP is used, that is, when a working interface configured as an HG channelized STM-1 interface.
This action can fail for the following reasons: FailedResource - the switch was not possible as there was a fault that affected traffic on the port to which the switch was requested, that is, the port that was not selected. LockedResource - the port to which the switch is intended, is administratively locked, that is, the port is locked or its PlugInUnit MO is locked. UnknownReason - there is another fault that prevents the action.

class.name: E1PhysPathTerm
class.description:
E1 Physical Path Termination
This MO represents an E1 (2 Mbit/s) physical interface in the node.
Disturbances: Changing lower layer attributes may affect O&M connectivity, if they are part of the O&M connection.

attribute.name: E1PhysPathTermId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: lineNo
attribute.description: The line number on the board.

attribute.name: reservedByTraffic
attribute.description: The identity of the AtmPort MO that reserves this MO instance.

attribute.name: loopback
attribute.description:
The loopback state of this physical path termination.
The attribute administrativeState must be set to LOCKED when setting the attribute loopback.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: The administrative state.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: crc4Mode
attribute.description: Indicates whether the E1 uses Cyclical Redundancy Check (CRC) 4 framing.

attribute.name: idlePattern
attribute.description:
The idle pattern applies only to ports using TDM switching. It defines the pattern being sent out on a timeslot that is not occupied by a 64 Kbit/s TDM connection.
Changing from A_LAW or U_LAW to UNDEFINED is allowed, but setting up one ET board with both U_LAW and A_LAW is not allowed. For example, if you want to change from A_LAW to U_LAW on one ET board, you must first change idlePattern to UNDEFINED on each physical port belonging to the board. That is: A_LAW -> UNDEFINED -> U_LAW, or U_LAW -> UNDEFINED -> A_LAW.

attribute.name: degDegThr
attribute.description: Specifies how many of the received blocks are allowed to have bit errors. The measurement is made each second. If the threshold is exceeded, the second is considered to be bad.

attribute.name: degDegM
attribute.description: The number of bad seconds in a row that causes a Degraded Signal alarm.

attribute.name: rdiReporting
attribute.description:
Indicates whether the alarm PDH Remote Defect Indication (RDI) is to be issued.
true - reporting enabled. false - reporting disabled.

attribute.name: aisReporting
attribute.description:
Indicates whether the alarm PDH Alarm Indication Signal (AIS) is to be issued.
true - reporting enabled. false - reporting disabled.

attribute.name: shutDownTimeout
attribute.description:
The shut-down timer.
It is used when the administrativeState is set to SHUTTING_DOWN. When the timer expires, administrativeState is set to LOCKED.

attribute.name: reservedBySync
attribute.description: The identity of the Synchronization MO that reserves this MO instance.

attribute.name: reservedByImaLink
attribute.description: The identity of the ImaLink MO that reserves this MO instance.

attribute.name: pmEs
attribute.description: Transmission Errored Seconds (ES). The number of seconds with block errors or equivalent during the PM interval. The granularity period of 60 minutes is not supported.
attribute.condition: This counter is incremented for each second where one or more blocks or equivalent with one or more errors are received. The counter is also incremented if one or several defects causing Alarm Indication Signal (AIS) insertion occur during the second. The counter is not incremented during unavailable time.

attribute.name: pmSes
attribute.description: Transmission Severely Errored Seconds (SES). The number of seconds during available time that have a severe bit error rate or equivalent during the PM interval. The granularity period of 60 minutes is not supported.
attribute.condition: This counter is incremented for each second with a severe bit error ratio or equivalent. The counter is also incremented if one or more defects causing Alarm Indication Signal (AIS) insertion occurs during the second. The counter is not incremented during unavailable time.

attribute.name: pmUas
attribute.description: Transmission Unavailable Seconds (SES). The accumulated unavailable time in seconds during the interval. Unavailable time starts when 10 consecutive SES are detected (them being part of the unavailable time) and ends when 10 consecutive non-SES are detected. The granularity period of 60 minutes is not supported.
attribute.condition: This counter is incremented for each second of unavailable time. Note that there is a delay of 10 seconds in the classification of a second as available or unavailable.

attribute.name: currentPmRegister
attribute.description: Returns the current values of all PM counters.
attribute.obsolete: Has no functional behavior and is now redundant. Read operations can return undefined values.

J1 Physical Path Termination
This MO represents a J1 (1.5 Mbit/s) physical interface in the node.

attribute.name: J1PhysPathTermId

The availability status.

attribute.name: degThreshold

The value of this attribute gives a BER of 10 raised to the power of -X, where X is the value of degThreshold.
If the threshold is exceeded, a Degraded Signal (DEG) alarm is issued.

class.name: Os155SpiTtp
class.description:
Optical Section (OS) 155 Mbit/s SDH Physical Interface (SPI) Trail Termination Point (TTP)
This MO represents the physical interface and the termination of the SDH Regenerator and Multiplexer Section Layers.
This MO is common for all standards. The attribute, standardMode defines whether the interface complies to ETSI , ANSI or TTC requirements.
An STM -1 interface can be used for three different purposes: a) Channelized interface providing E1, HG or DS1 channels within the STM-1 signal using SDH or SONET multiplexing. b) Unchannelized interface providing a 150 Mbit/s payload pipe for ATM transport. c) Interface used as standby interface when using MSP 1+1.
The mode that the inteface is used for is defined by the attribute, muxMode. The value E1_T1_HG_LEVEL corresponds to case a). The value VC4_STS3CSPE_LEVEL corresponds to case b). The value, STANDBY corresponds to case c).
Depending on the values of muxMode and standardMode, additional managed objects are automatically created as a consequence of creating the Os155SpiTtp MO as follows:
muxMode = VC4_STS3CSPE_LEVEL standardMode = ETSI, TTC A Vc4Ttp MO is created under the Os155SpiTtp MO.
muxMode = VC4_STS3CSPE_LEVEL standardMode = ANSI An Sts3CspeTtp MO is created under the Os155SpiTtp MO.
muxMode = STANDBY standardMode = ETSI, TTC, ANSI No objects under the Os155SpiTtp are created.
muxMode = E1_T1_HG_LEVEL standardMode = ETSI A Vc4Ttp MO, 63 Vc12Ttp MOs and 63 E1Ttp MOs are created under the Os155SpiTtp MO.
muxMode = E1_T1_HG_LEVEL standardMode = ANSI 3 Sts1SpeTtp MOs, 3*28 Vt15Ttp MOs and 3*28 T1Ttp MOs are created under the Os155SpiTtp MO.
muxMode = E1_T1_HG_LEVEL standardMode = TTC 3 Vc3Ttp MOs, 3*28 Vc11Ttp MOs and 3*28*4 HgTtp MOs are created under the Os155SpiTp MO.
An STM-1 ET board does not support all combinations of muxMode and standardMode. See the attribute description in the MO for the respective exchange terminal.
If the Os155SpiTtp is configured as part of an MSPG protection group and is configured as standby, that is muxMode set to STANDBY, no children of this MO will be created.

attribute.name: Os155SpiTtpId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: lineNo
attribute.description:
The line number.
The maximum range of this attribute can vary between the boards. See the description of the relevant board for details.

attribute.name: standardMode
attribute.description: The standard that this MO complies to.

attribute.name: shutDownTimeout
attribute.description:
The shut-down timer.
It is used when the administrativeState is set to SHUTTING_DOWN. When the timer expires, administrativeState is set to LOCKED.

attribute.name: muxMode
attribute.description: The level at which the STM-1 or OC3 signal is demultiplexed.

attribute.name: msDegThreshold
attribute.description: Specifies the number of received blocks that are allowed to have bit errors. The measurement is taken every second. If the threshold is exceeded, that second is considered as a bad second.
attribute.dependencies: This attribute is applicable only if the supervisionMode has value BURSTY.

attribute.name: msDegM
attribute.description:
Specifies the number of bad seconds in a continuous measurement period that causes a MS Degraded Signal alarm.
See the explanation of bad seconds in attribute msDegThreshold.
attribute.dependencies: This attribute is applicable only if the supervisionMode has value BURSTY.

attribute.name: msRdiReporting
attribute.description:
Indicates whether the alarm Multiplexer Section (MS) Remote Defect Indication (RDI) is to be issued.
true - enable reporting. false - disable reporting.

attribute.name: msAisReporting
attribute.description:
Indicates whether the alarm Multiplexer Section (MS) Alarm Indication Signal (AIS) is to be issued.
true - enable reporting. false - disable reporting.

attribute.name: loopBack
attribute.description:
The loopback state of this physical path termination.
The attribute administrativeState must be set to LOCKED when setting the attribute loopBack.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: The administrative state.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

attribute.name: reservedBySync
attribute.description: The identity of the Synchronization MO that reserves this MO instance.

attribute.name: pmMsEs
attribute.description: Transmission Errored Seconds (ES). The number of seconds with block errors or equivalent during the PM interval. The granularity period of 60 minutes is not supported.
attribute.condition: This counter is incremented for each second where one or more blocks or equivalent with one or more errors are received. The counter is also incremented if one or several defects causing Alarm Indication Signal (AIS) insertion occur during the second. The counter is not incremented during unavailable time.

attribute.name: pmMsSes
attribute.description: Transmission Severely Errored Seconds (SES). The number of seconds during available time that have a severe bit error rate or equivalent during the PM interval. The granularity period of 60 minutes is not supported.
attribute.condition: This counter is incremented for each second with a severe bit error ratio or equivalent. The counter is also incremented if one or more defects causing Alarm Indication Signal (AIS) insertion occurs during the second. The counter is not incremented during unavailable time.

attribute.name: pmMsUas
attribute.description: Transmission Unavailable Seconds (SES). The accumulated unavailable time in seconds during the interval. Unavailable time starts when 10 consecutive SES are detected (them being part of the unavailable time) and ends when 10 consecutive non-SES are detected. The granularity period of 60 minutes is not supported.
attribute.condition: This counter is incremented for each second of unavailable time. Note that there is a delay of 10 seconds in the classification of a second as available or unavailable.

attribute.name: pmMsBbe
attribute.description: Transmission Background Block Errors (BBE). The granularity period of 60 minutes is not supported.
attribute.condition: This counter is incremented for each block with one or more errors. The counter is not incremented during unavailable time or if the second is classified as Severely Errored Seconds (SES).

attribute.name: currentPmRegister
attribute.description: Returns the current values of all PM counters.
attribute.obsolete: Has no functional behavior and is now redundant. Read operations can return undefined values.

attribute.name: poissonDegThreshold
attribute.description:
Specifies the maximum Bit Error Rate (BER) for the MS Degraded Signal (MS-DEG) alarm.
BER is the ratio of the erroneous bits detected to the number of bits transmitted.
The attribute gives a maximum BER of 10e-poissonDegThreshold. If the threshold is exceeded, the MS-DEG alarm is issued.
attribute.dependencies: This attribute is applicable only if the supervisionMode has value POISSON.

attribute.name: supervisionMode
attribute.description: Controls if the detection of the MS-DEG alarm should assume Poisson or Bursty distribution of errors.

attribute.name: sfpInformation
attribute.description:
Indicates information about the SfpPort.
If sfpPort is false, this attribute is not applicable.

attribute.name: sfpPort
attribute.description:
Indicates if the port is an SFP port.
Autonegotiation must be configured to true for an SFP port. Otherwise, the port may be disabled.

class.name: Sts1SpeTtp
class.description:
Synchronous Transport Signal Level 1, Synchronous Payload Envelope, Trail Termination Point
This MO represents the termination of the SONET higher-order paths.
This MO is created automatically as a consequence of creating an Os155SpiTtp MO when the following condition is true:
muxMode=E1_T1_HG_LEVEL and standardMode=ANSI
As this MO is created automatically, it cannot be deleted.
The RDN of this MO is Sts1SpeTtp=1 to Sts1SpeTtp=3.

attribute.name: Sts1SpeTtpId
attribute.description:
The value component of the RDN.
It is set automatically when the MO instance is created.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

Indicates whether the alarms Alarm Indication Signal - P (AIS-P) are to be issued.
true - reporting enabled. false - reporting disabled.

attribute.name: rdiPReporting
attribute.description:
Indicates whether the alarms Remote Defect Indication - P (RDI-P) are to be issued.
true - reporting enabled. false - reporting disabled.

attribute.name: timConsequentAction
attribute.description:
Trace Identifier Mismatch (TIM) consequent action, that is for generation of Alarm Indication Signal (AIS) downstream and Remote Defect Indication (RDI) upstream as a consequence of the TIM detection.
true - enabled. false - disabled.

attribute.name: expectedPathTrace
attribute.description:
The expected path trace.
The string can be a maximum of 62 characters in length, or an empty string (""). A non-empty string not being of full length is padded automatically with NULL characters. The string can consist of printable ASCII characters. CR and LF are added automatically at the end of the string.
An empty string means that the detection of Trace Identifier Mismatch (TIM) is disabled. This attribute is set to an empty string every time the attribute pathTraceFormat is set.

attribute.name: transmittedPathTrace
attribute.description:
The transmitted path trace.
The string can be a maximum of 62 characters in length, or an empty string (""). A non-empty string not being of full length is padded automatically with NULL characters. The string can consist of printable ASCII characters. CR and LF are added automatically at the end of the string.

attribute.description: Transmission Errored Seconds (ES). The number of seconds with block errors or equivalent during the PM interval. The granularity period of 60 minutes is not supported.
attribute.condition: This counter is incremented for each second where one or more blocks or equivalent with one or more errors are received. The counter is also incremented if one or several defects causing Alarm Indication Signal (AIS) insertion occur during the second. The counter is not incremented during unavailable time.

attribute.name: pmSesp
attribute.description: Transmission Severely Errored Seconds (SES). The number of seconds during available time that have a severe bit error rate or equivalent during the PM interval. The granularity period of 60 minutes is not supported.
attribute.condition: This counter is incremented for each second with a severe bit error ratio or equivalent. The counter is also incremented if one or more defects causing Alarm Indication Signal (AIS) insertion occurs during the second. The counter is not incremented during unavailable time.

attribute.name: pmUasp
attribute.description: Transmission Unavailable Seconds (SES). The accumulated unavailable time in seconds during the interval. Unavailable time starts when 10 consecutive SES are detected (them being part of the unavailable time) and ends when 10 consecutive non-SES are detected. The granularity period of 60 minutes is not supported.
attribute.condition: This counter is incremented for each second of unavailable time. Note that there is a delay of 10 seconds in the classification of a second as available or unavailable.

attribute.name: currentPmRegister
attribute.description: Returns the current values of all PM counters.
attribute.obsolete: Has no functional behavior and is now redundant. Read operations can return undefined values.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains an MO instance that reserve this MO instance.

class.name: T1Ttp
class.description:
T1 Trail Termination Point
This MO represents a channelized T1 interface in the node.
This MO is created automatically as a consequence of creating an Os155SpiTtp MO and it cannot be deleted.
The RDN of this MO is T1Ttp=1.

attribute.name: T1TtpId
attribute.description:
The value component of the RDN.
It is set automatically when the MO instance is created.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: aisReporting
attribute.description:
Indicates whether the alarm PDH Alarm Indication Signal (AIS) is to be issued.
true - reporting enabled. false - reporting disabled.

attribute.name: rdiReporting
attribute.description:
Indicates whether the alarm PDH Remote Defect Indication (RDI) is to be issued.
true - reporting enabled. false - reporting disabled.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

attribute.name: reservedByImaLink
attribute.description: The identity of the ImaLink MO that reserves this MO instance.

attribute.name: pmEs
attribute.description: Transmission Errored Seconds (ES). The number of seconds with block errors or equivalent during the PM interval. The granularity period of 60 minutes is not supported.
attribute.condition: This counter is incremented for each second where one or more blocks or equivalent with one or more errors are received. The counter is also incremented if one or several defects causing Alarm Indication Signal (AIS) insertion occur during the second. The counter is not incremented during unavailable time.

attribute.name: pmSes
attribute.description: Transmission Severely Errored Seconds (SES). The number of seconds during available time that have a severe bit error rate or equivalent during the PM interval. The granularity period of 60 minutes is not supported.
attribute.condition: This counter is incremented for each second with a severe bit error ratio or equivalent. The counter is also incremented if one or more defects causing Alarm Indication Signal (AIS) insertion occurs during the second. The counter is not incremented during unavailable time.

attribute.name: pmUas
attribute.description: Transmission Unavailable Seconds (SES). The accumulated unavailable time in seconds during the interval. Unavailable time starts when 10 consecutive SES are detected (them being part of the unavailable time) and ends when 10 consecutive non-SES are detected. The granularity period of 60 minutes is not supported.
attribute.condition: This counter is incremented for each second of unavailable time. Note that there is a delay of 10 seconds in the classification of a second as available or unavailable.

attribute.name: currentPmRegister
attribute.description: Returns the current values of all PM counters.
attribute.obsolete: Has no functional behavior and is now redundant. Read operations can return undefined values.

attribute.name: idlePattern
attribute.description:
The idle pattern applies only to ports using TDM switching. It defines the pattern being sent out on a timeslot that is not occupied by a 64 Kbit/s TDM connection.
Changing from A_LAW or U_LAW to UNDEFINED is allowed, but setting up one ET board with both U_LAW and A_LAW is not allowed. For example, if you want to change from A_LAW to U_LAW on one ET board, you must first change idlePattern to UNDEFINED on each physical port belonging to the board. That is: A_LAW -> UNDEFINED -> U_LAW, or U_LAW -> UNDEFINED -> A_LAW.

attribute.name: degDegM
attribute.description: The number of bad seconds in a row that causes a Degraded Signal alarm.

attribute.name: degDegThr
attribute.description: Specifies how many of the received blocks are allowed to have bit errors. The measurement is made each second. If the threshold is exceeded, the second is considered to be bad.

class.name: Sts3CspeTtp
class.description:
Synchronous Transport Signal Level 3, Synchronous Payload Envelope, Trail Termination Point
This MO represents the termination of the SONET higher-order paths.
This MO is created automatically as a consequence of creating an Os155SpiTtp MO when the following condition is true:
muxMode=VC4_STS3CSPE_LEVEL and standardMode=ANSI
As this MO is created automatically, it cannot be deleted.
The RDN of this MO is Sts3CspeTtp=1.

attribute.name: Sts3CspeTtpId
attribute.description:
The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: rdiPReporting

true - enabled. false - disabled.

attribute.name: expectedPathTrace
attribute.description:
The expected path trace.
The string can be a maximum of 62 characters in length, or an empty string (""). A non-empty string not being of full length is padded automatically with NULL characters. The string can consist of printable ASCII characters. CR and LF are added automatically at the end of the string.
An empty string means that the detection of Trace Identifier Mismatch (TIM) is disabled. This attribute is set to an empty string every time the attribute pathTraceFormat is set.

attribute.name: transmittedPathTrace
attribute.description:
The transmitted path trace.
The string can be a maximum of 62 characters in length, or an empty string (""). A non-empty string not being of full length is padded automatically with NULL characters. The string can consist of printable ASCII characters. CR and LF are added automatically at the end of the string.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description:
Contains an MO instance that reserve this MO instance.
Identity of the AtmPort reserving this MO.

attribute.name: pmEsp
attribute.description: Transmission Errored Seconds (ES). The number of seconds with block errors or equivalent during the PM interval. The granularity period of 60 minutes is not supported.
attribute.condition: This counter is incremented for each second where one or more blocks or equivalent with one or more errors are received. The counter is also incremented if one or several defects causing Alarm Indication Signal (AIS) insertion occur during the second. The counter is not incremented during unavailable time.

attribute.name: pmSesp
attribute.description: Transmission Severely Errored Seconds (SES). The number of seconds during available time that have a severe bit error rate or equivalent during the PM interval. The granularity period of 60 minutes is not supported.
attribute.condition: This counter is incremented for each second with a severe bit error ratio or equivalent. The counter is also incremented if one or more defects causing Alarm Indication Signal (AIS) insertion occurs during the second. The counter is not incremented during unavailable time.

attribute.name: pmUasp
attribute.description: Transmission Unavailable Seconds (SES). The accumulated unavailable time in seconds during the interval. Unavailable time starts when 10 consecutive SES are detected (them being part of the unavailable time) and ends when 10 consecutive non-SES are detected. The granularity period of 60 minutes is not supported.
attribute.condition: This counter is incremented for each second of unavailable time. Note that there is a delay of 10 seconds in the classification of a second as available or unavailable.

attribute.name: currentPmRegister
attribute.description: Returns the current values of all PM counters.
attribute.obsolete: Has no functional behavior and is now redundant. Read operations can return undefined values.

class.name: Vc4Ttp
class.description:
Virtual Container (VC) 4 Trail Termination Point
This MO represents the termination of the SDH VC4 path. The VC4 can either be used for channelized access, in which case VC12 MOs are created as children of the Vc4Ttp MO, or be used to carry ATM traffic, in which case there is a relationship between the AtmPort MO and the Vc4Ttp MO.
This MO is created automatically as a consequence of creating an Os155SpiTtp MO when the following conditions are true:
a) muxMode = VC4_STS3CSPE_LEVEL and standardMode = ETSI or b) muxMode = VC4_STS3CSPE_LEVEL and standardMode = TTC or c) muxMode=E1_T1_HG_LEVEL and starndardMode=ETSI.
As this MO is created automatically, it cannot be deleted.
The RDN of this MO is Vc4Ttp=1.

attribute.name: Vc4TtpId
attribute.description:
The value component of the RDN.
It is set automatically when the MO instance is created.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: pathTraceFormat
attribute.description:
Indicates the format of the attributes, expectedPathtrace and transmittedPathtrace. The format may be in 16 or 64 characters. Usually, 16 is used for ETSI and 64 for ANSI/TTC.
ITU_T_G707=16 GR_253_CORE=64
The 16-character format requires that 15 characters are specified, where no character is the null character. (The 16th character is added automatically.)
The 64-character format requires that 62 characters are specifed, where no character is the null character. (Carriage return and line feed are added automatically.)

attribute.name: transmittedPathTrace
attribute.description:
The transmitted path trace.
Can be defined in either 16-character format for ETSI or 64-character format for TTC.
The string can be a maximum of 15 or 62 characters in length, or an empty string (""). A non-empty string not being of full length is padded automatically with NULL characters. A 15-character string can consist of the characters “0” to “9”, “A” to “Z” or “a” to “z”. A CRC-7 is added automatically at the beginning of the string. A 62-character string can consist of printable ASCII characters. CR and LF are added automatically at the end of the string.

attribute.name: expectedPathTrace
attribute.description:
The expected path trace.
Can be defined in either 16-character format for ETSI, or 64-character format for TTC.
The string can be a maximum of 15 or 62 characters in length, or an empty string (""). A non-empty string not being of full length is padded automatically with NULL characters. A 15-character string can consist of the characters "A - Z", "a - z", or "0 - 9". A CRC-7 is added automatically at the beginning of the string. A 62-character string can consist of printable ASCII characters. CR and LF are added automatically at the end of the string.
An empty string for this attribute means that the detection of Trace Identifier Mismatch (TIM) is disabled. This attribute is set to empty string every time attribute pathTraceFormat is set.

attribute.name: timConsequentAction
attribute.description:
Trace Identifier Mismatch (TIM) consequent action, that is for generation of Alarm Indication Signal (AIS) downstream and Remote Defect Indication (RDI) upstream as a consequence of the TIM detection.
true - enabled. false - disabled.

attribute.name: vcDegThreshold
attribute.description: Specifies how many of the received blocks are allowed to have bit errors. The measurement is made each second. If the threshold is exceeded, the second is considered to be bad.

attribute.name: vcDegM
attribute.description: The number of bad seconds in a row that causes a Degraded Signal alarm.

attribute.name: auAisReporting
attribute.description:
Indicates whether the alarm Administrative Unit (AU4) Alarm Indication Signal (AIS) is to be issued.
true - enable reporting. false - disable reporting.

attribute.name: vcRdiReporting
attribute.description:
Indicates whether the alarm VC4 Remote Defect Indication (RDI) is to be issued.
true - enable reporting. false - disable reporting.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

attribute.name: pmVcEs
attribute.description: Number of Errored Seconds, (ES), for the Virtual Container 4, VC4, or Virtual Container 12, VC12. The granularity period of 60 minutes is not supported.
attribute.condition: This counter is incremented for each second where one or more blocks or equivalent with one or more errors are received. The counter is also incremented if one or several defects causing Alarm Indication Signal (AIS) insertion occur during the second. The counter is not incremented during unavailable time.

attribute.name: pmVcSes
attribute.description: Number of Severely Errored Seconds, (SES), for the Virtual Container 4, VC4, or Virtual Container 12, VC12. The granularity period of 60 minutes is not supported.
attribute.condition: This counter is incremented for each second with a severe bit error ratio or equivalent. The counter is also incremented if one or more defects causing Alarm Indication Signal (AIS) insertion occurs during the second. The counter is not incremented during unavailable time.

attribute.name: pmVcUas
attribute.description: Transmission Unavailable Seconds (UAS). The accumulated unavailable time in seconds during the interval. Unavailable time starts when 10 consecutive Severely Errored Seconds (SES) are detected (them being part of the unavailable time) and ends when 10 consecutive non SES are detected. The granularity period of 60 minutes is not supported.
attribute.condition: This counter is incremented for each second of unavailable time. Note that there is a delay of 10 seconds in the classification of a second as available or unavailable.

attribute.name: pmVcBbe
attribute.description: Transmission Background Block Errors (BBE). Number of errored blocks not being part of a SES. The granularity period of 60 minutes is not supported.
attribute.condition: This counter is incremented for each block with one or more errors. The counter is not incremented during unavailable time or if the second is classified as Severely Errored Seconds (SES).

attribute.name: currentPmRegister
attribute.description: Returns the current values of all PM counters.
attribute.obsolete: Has no functional behavior and is now redundant. Read operations can return undefined values.

It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description:
This attribute contains information on what can be configured on the board, as well as restrictions and specifications.
Refer to the description of the relevant board for details on functions and characteristics of this board.

attribute.name: shuttingDownTimer
attribute.description: This attribute specifies the time that the attribute administrativeState of the related PluginUnit MO is allowed to stay in state SHUTTING_DOWN.

attribute.name: pmAal2ConnectionNo
attribute.description:
The counter shows the AAL2 connection capacity utilization of the ET board represented by a histogram, consisting of a list of 21 numbers. The first number is maximal capacity (max AAL2 capacity) and the next 20 numbers are different load ranges (range counters) for the Exchange Terminal MO.
