attribute.description:
This attribute indicates the status of ongoing calibration operation. In case no calibration has been performed since last DU restart it shows state UNKNOWN.
NOTE: The calibrationStatus is not used to verify or confirm if RET is calibrated or not. The RET is calibrated unless an alarm indicates otherwise.

attribute.name: iuantBaseStationId
attribute.description: Base station ID. This attribute is part of the IUANT protocol specification (see 3GPP TS 25.466) and has no operational impact.

attribute.name: iuantSectorId
attribute.description: RBS internal sector ID. This attribute is part of the IUANT protocol specification (see 3GPP TS 25.466) and has no operational impact.

attribute.name: iuantAntennaOperatingGain
attribute.description: Antenna gain for each of four operating bands, starting with the lowest value. This attribute is part of IUANT protocol definition (see 3GPP TS 25.466) and has no operational impact.

attribute.name: iuantInstallationDate
attribute.description: Installation date. This parameter is part of the IUANT protocol specification (see 3GPP 25.466) and has no operational impact.

attribute.name: iuantInstallersId
attribute.description: ID of the responsible installer. This attribute is part of the IUANT protocol specification (see 3GPP TS 25.466) and has no operational impact.

action.name: sendAntennaConfigurationFile
action.description:
The ANU stores vendor and antenna specific configuration data for the relationship between the movement of the drive system and the beam tilt position of the addressed antenna.
Transaction Required: Yes

parameter.name: server
parameter.description: The ip-address or hostname of the FTP-server storing the Antenna Configuration File needed by the RetSubunit.

parameter.name: path
parameter.description: The file path to the Antenna Configuration File needed by the RetSubunit.

parameter.name: userName
parameter.description: The user name to the FTP-server storing the Antenna Configuration File needed by the RetSubunit.

parameter.name: password
parameter.description: The password to the FTP-server storing the Antenna Configuration File needed by the RetSubunit.

action.name: forceCalibration
action.description:
Exercises the antenna drive unit over its entire range of travel to ensure fault-free operation and synchronize the measured and actual beam tilt of the antenna
Transaction Required: No
action.disturbances: This is a Time Consuming Procedure (TCP) that cannot be executed simultaneously with another TCP, while it can be executed simultaneously with a maximum of one EP. It may affect traffic.

class.name: TmaSubUnit
class.description: This MO represents the TMA SubUnit providing low noise amplification of the uplink received by the reserving branch.

attribute.name: TmaSubUnitId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: ulGain
attribute.description: Internal uplink gain of the TMA Subunit as specified in 3GPP TS 25.466

attribute.name: dlTrafficDelay
attribute.description: Internal traffic delay for the downlink.

attribute.name: ulTrafficDelay
attribute.description: Internal traffic delay for the uplink.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Refers to the instance of the RfBranch MO to which this Tower Mounted Amplifier (TMA) Subunit is connected.

attribute.name: iuantAntennaSerialNumber
attribute.description: Unique hardware identifier for the antenna where the antenna near unit is installed. This attribute is part of the IUANT protocol specification (see 3GPP TS 25.466) and has no operational impact.

attribute.name: iuantAntennaModelNumber
attribute.description: Vendor-specific antenna model identifier. This parameter is part of the IUANT protocol specification (see 3GPP 25.466) and has no operational impact.

attribute.name: iuantAntennaOperatingBand
attribute.description: Operating band used by the Antenna Subunit connected to this TmaSubunit. This parameter is part of the IUANT protocol specification (for details on coding see table B.2 of Annex B on 3GPP 25.466) and has no operational impact.

attribute.name: iuantAntennaGain
attribute.description: Antenna gain on the central frequency (resolution of 5MHz) of the band transmitted on the antenna port where this subunit is installed. The attribute is part of IUANT protocol definition (see 3GPP 25.466) and has no operational impact.
attribute.deprecated: Since L11B. Planned to be removed.

attribute.name: iuantAntennaInstalledMechanicalTilt
attribute.description: Antenna tilt fixed on the installation, defined as the inclination of the antenna element axis with respect to the vertical plane. It is a signed value. A positive value indicates downtilt, and a negative value indicates uptilt. This attribute is part of the IUANT protocol specification (see 3GPP TS 25.466) and has no operational impact.

attribute.name: iuantAntennaBearing
attribute.description: Antenna bearing expressed as bearing value x 10. This attribute is part of IUANT protocol definition (see 3GPP 25.466) and has no operational impact.

attribute.name: iuantTmaSubunitFreqTx
attribute.description: Downlink frequency band across this Tower Mounted Amplifier (TMA) SubUnit. It is a sequence of 2 values (16-bit unsigned) stating minimum and maximum frequencies for the TMA transmission path (see 3GPP TS 25.466).
attribute.deprecated: Since L11A. Replaced by attribute iuantTmaSubunitFreqRangeTx.

attribute.name: iuantTmaSubunitFreqRx
attribute.description: Uplink frequency band across this Tower Mounted Amplifier (TMA) SubUnit. It is a sequence of 2 values (16-bit unsigned) stating minimum and maximum for the TMA transmission path (see 3GPP TS 25.466).
attribute.deprecated: Since L11A. Replaced by attribute iuantTmaSubunitFreqRangeRx.

attribute.name: iuantTmaSubunitMinGain
attribute.description: Minimum gain available on this TMA Subunit.

attribute.name: iuantTmaSubunitMaxGain
attribute.description: Maximum gain available on this TMA Subunit.

attribute.name: iuantTmaSubunitGainRes
attribute.description: Gain resolution on the Tower Mounted Amplifier (TMA) subunit expressed in gain value [dB] times 4 (see 3GPP TS 25.466).

attribute.name: subunitNumber
attribute.description: Subunit identifier carried on L7 messages. While an antenna near unit is identified by one High-Level Data Link Control (HDLC) address (L2), subunits are identified by application level (L7) identifiers.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description: The availability status. It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: dlAttenuation
attribute.description: Internal attenuation in downlink of the TMA Subunit

attribute.name: iuantTmaSubunitFreqRangeTx
attribute.description:
Downlink frequency band across the Tower Mounted Amplifier (TMA) subunit. It is a sequence of 2 values (16-bit unsigned) stating minimum and maximum frequencies for the TMA transmission path .
This attribute is part of the IUANT protocol specification (see 3GPP TS 25.466) and has no operational impact.

attribute.name: iuantTmaSubunitFreqRangeRx
attribute.description:
Uplink frequency band across the Tower Mounted Amplifier (TMA) subunit. It is a sequence of 2 values (16-bit unsigned) stating minimum and maximum frequencies for the TMA transmission path.
This attribute is part of the IUANT protocol specification (see 3GPP TS 25.466) and has no operational impact.

attribute.name: iuantBaseStationId
attribute.description: Base station ID. This attribute is part of the IUANT protocol specification (see 3GPP TS 25.466) and has no operational impact.

attribute.name: iuantSectorId
attribute.description: RBS internal sector ID. This attribute is part of the IUANT protocol specification (see 3GPP TS 25.466) and has no operational impact.

attribute.name: iuantAntennaOperatingGain
attribute.description: Antenna gain for each of four operating bands, starting with the lowest value. This attribute is part of IUANT protocol definition (see 3GPP TS 25.466) and has no operational impact.

attribute.name: iuantInstallationDate
attribute.description: Installation date. This parameter is part of the IUANT protocol specification (see 3GPP 25.466) and has no operational impact.

attribute.name: iuantInstallersId
attribute.description: ID of the responsible installer. This attribute is part of the IUANT protocol specification (see 3GPP TS 25.466) and has no operational impact.

class.name: AntennaSubunit
class.description: This MO groups the antenna elements that, because of being controlled by the same RET radiate with the same tilt angle.

attribute.name: AntennaSubunitId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: totalTilt
attribute.description:
Total antenna elevation including the installed tilt and the tilt applied by the Remote Electrical Tilt (RET). Total tilt is defined as the inclination of the maximum of the antenna main beam with respect to the horizontal plane.
Tilt is a signed value. Positive indicates downtilt, and negative indicates uptilt, found by the following equation:
totalTilt = AntennaUnit.MechanicaAntennalTilt+RetSubunit.electricalTilt
NOTE: If the antenna has no RET installed, this value does not account for the inclination that the antenna beam may have by default, with respect to the direction orthogonal to the antenna element axis.

attribute.name: minTotalTilt
attribute.description:
The minimum antenna elevation including the installed tilt and the tilt applied by the Remote Electrical Tilt (RET) described by the inclination of the maximum of the antenna main beam with respect to the horizontal plane. It is a signed value. Positive indicates downtilt, and negative indicates uptilt. The limitation on total tilt is found by the following equation:
TotalTilt = AntennaUnit.MechanicaAntennalTilt + RetSubunit.electricalTilt
NOTE: If the antenna has no RET installed, the total tilt value does not necessarily account for the inclination that the antenna beam might have by default, with respect to the direction orthogonal to the antenna element axis.

attribute.name: maxTotalTilt
attribute.description:
The maximum antenna elevation including the installed tilt and the tilt applied by the Remote Electrical Tilt (RET), described by the inclination of the maximum of the antenna main beam with respect to the horizontal plane. It is a signed value. Positive indicates downtilt, and negative indicates uptilt. It sets a limitation on total tilt which is given by:
TotalTilt = AntennaUnit.MechanicaAntennalTilt + RetSubunit.electricalTilt
NOTE: If the antenna has no RET installed, this value does not account for the inclination that the antenna beam might have by default, with respect to the direction orthogonal to the antenna element axis.

attribute.name: retSubunitRef
attribute.description: Reference to the RetSubunit controlling the tilt of this AntennaSubunit.

attribute.name: azimuthHalfPowerBeamwidth
attribute.description: Specifies the azimuth half power beamwidth for the antenna.

attribute.name: customComChBeamfrmWtsAmp
attribute.description: This parameter shall contain an array of eight amplitudes for custom common channel beamforming weights. At least one of the eight amplitudes have to be non-zero for the custom beamforming weights to take effect. NOTE: Actual value = Set value / 100
attribute.deprecated: Since L12B. Replaced by customComChBeamfrmWtsAmplitude. Has no functional behavior.
attribute.disturbances: Changed coverage may affect traffic.

attribute.name: customComChBeamfrmWtsPhase
attribute.description: This parameter shall contain an array of eight phases for custom common channel beamforming weights.
attribute.disturbances: Changed coverage may affect traffic.

attribute.name: commonChBeamfrmPortMap
attribute.description: This parameter selects between co-polarized and cross-polarized beamforming antenna port mapping. This parameter has no effect if azimuthHalfPowerBeamwidth is set to 65. In that case, "cross-polarized" antenna port mapping will be used.
attribute.disturbances: Changed coverage may affect traffic.

attribute.name: customComChBeamfrmWtsAmplitude
attribute.description: This parameter shall contain an array of eight amplitudes for custom common channel beamforming weights. At least one of the eight amplitudes have to be non-zero for the custom beamforming weights to take effect. NOTE: Actual value = Set value / 100
attribute.disturbances: Changed coverage may affect traffic.

class.name: AntennaUnit
class.description: This MO represents an antenna unit that contains several antenna subunits installed with a common mechanical tilt.

attribute.name: AntennaUnitId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: mechanicalAntennaTilt
attribute.description: The fixed antenna tilt of the installation, defined as the inclination of the antenna element axis with respect to the vertical plane. It is a signed value. Positive indicates downtilt, and negative indicates uptilt.

class.name: AntennaUnitGroup
class.description: This MO is a container of references to the antenna and antenna near products (RET/TMA) serving a Sector.

attribute.name: AntennaUnitGroupId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a reference to the SectorEquipmentFunction MO instance that reserves this MO instance.
attribute.dependencies: The MO may not be deleted if it is reserved.

class.name: AuPort
class.description: This MO represents an antenna feeder port on the Antenna Unit where the antenna branch is connected.

attribute.name: AuPortId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a reference to the RfBranch MO that reserves this MO instance.

class.name: RicmDeviceSet
class.description:
This MO is created by the auto-configuration function (attribute autoConfigurationAllowed must be set to TRUE in MO ManagedElementDatafunction) when the grand-parent AuxPlugInUnit or PlugInUnit is created. For the MO to be correctly configured the AuxPlugInUnit or PlugInUnit must refer to a proper PiuType.
This MO models a Radio Interface Connection device set.

attribute.name: RicmDeviceSetId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description: The availability status. It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: usageState
attribute.description:
Indicates the usage of a device group:
• ACTIVE • BUSY • IDLE

class.name: RiPort
class.description:
This MO represents a port on the DU or the Radio where the Radio Interface (CPRI and HSSL possibly in case of XMU) cable is connected. It is used to connect a Radio to a DU or to another Radio.
When the RiPort is a child of PlugInUnit (i.e. the DU), the valid RDN values are A, B, C, D, E and F. When it is a child of AuxPlugInUnit representing a radio, the valid RDN values are DATA_1 and DATA_2. When it is a child of AuxPlugInUnit representing an XMU, the valid RDN values are B1, B2, C1, C2, C3, C4, C5, C6, D1, D2, D3, D4, D5, and D6.
The RiPort on each unit must refer to each other to make the configuration of the radio interface connection complete.

attribute.name: RiPortId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: remoteRiPortRef
attribute.description: Refers to the RiPort-object on the remote unit to which this unit is connected.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description: The availability status. It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserves this MO instance.

class.name: SrioTestPort
class.description: This MO presents a sRIO test port on DU. It is used to connect to the UE simulator UcTool.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: Defines the operational state.

attribute.name: portNr
attribute.description:
Port to open
Disturbance: Requires a node restart to take affect

attribute.name: SrioTestPortId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

class.name: OptionalFeatureLicense
class.description: Each instance of this feature MO class represent an optional feature.

attribute.name: OptionalFeatureLicenseId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: markedForDeletion
attribute.description: A timestamp indicating the garbage collection time for the MO instance. Timstamp Format is YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS (local time)

attribute.name: serviceState
attribute.description: Indicates whether the feature is operable or inoperable, and whether the feature is providing service.

attribute.name: licenseState
attribute.description: Indicates the status of the license, ENABLED or DISABLED. The value is ENABLED when a license key is installed.

attribute.name: keyId
attribute.description: The license key ID for the feature.

attribute.name: featureState
attribute.description: Activates or deactivates the licensed feature. The value of the attribute is irrelevant when no valid license key is installed for the feature. Please refer to feature CPI document for details on steps needed to make feature functionality available.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

class.name: CapacityFeatureLicense
class.description: Each instance of this capacity MO class represent a capacity license.

attribute.name: CapacityFeatureLicenseId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: gracePeriodResetThreshold
attribute.description: Configures how many percent the licensed value must be increased before grace period is activated again.

attribute.name: gracePeriodActivationThreshold
attribute.description: Shows how much accumulated overshoot (% over 24 hours of the current licensed capacity) is allowed before Grace Period is activated.

attribute.name: gracePeriodLength
attribute.description: The length of grace period i.e. the number of days that grace period is active

attribute.name: licenseState
attribute.description: Indicates the status of the license, ENABLED or DISABLED. The value is ENABLED when a license key is installed.

attribute.name: capacityType
attribute.description: Defines the type for the capacity license.

attribute.name: gracePeriod
attribute.description: Shows information about grace period

attribute.name: licensedCapacity
attribute.description: Defines the node licensed capacity as defined in the License Key File.

attribute.name: keyId
attribute.description: The license key ID for the capacity license.

attribute.name: currentCapacityLimit
attribute.description: Indicates the current capacity limit applied in the node. noLimit = true is shown when emergency state or grace period is activated.

attribute.name: capacityUnit
attribute.description: Defines the unit for licensed capacity.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: markedForDeletion
attribute.description: A timestamp indicating the garbage collection time for the MO instance. Timstamp Format is YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS (local time)

class.name: XmuDeviceSet
class.description: This MO models an auXiliary Multiplexing Unit (XMU) device set.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description: The availability status. It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: XmuDeviceSetId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: usageState
attribute.description: Indicates the usage of a device group.

class.name: XpProgram
class.description:
This MO models a program executing on an auxiliary unit.
This MO is created by the auto-configuration function (attribute autoConfigurationAllowed must be set to TRUE in MO ManagedElementDatafunction) when the grand-parent AuxPlugInUnit MO is created. For the MO to be correctly configured, the AuxPlugInUnit MO must refer to a proper PiuType MO.

attribute.name: XpProgramId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: startState
attribute.description:
Indicates if the XpProgram can be used after an auxiliary unit restart. Program use is allowed if the state is enabled.
Only 1 program is allowed to have the state ENABLED at the same time for each device group.

attribute.name: loadModule
attribute.description: Refers to the corresponding LoadModule MO. It contains information for loading: product data, load module file path, and file size.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

class.name: AuxPlugInUnit
class.description: This MO models an auxiliary plug-in unit.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: The administrative state.
attribute.dependencies: Modification of the attribute value is not allowed as long as ENodeBFunction::technicianPresent=true.

attribute.name: productData
attribute.description: The product ID of the installed AuxPlugInUnit/HW Unit. If the corresponding hardware unit is not installed yet, the struct contains empty strings.

attribute.name: greenLed
attribute.description:
Indicates the operational status of the Auxiliary Plug-in Unit.
The following values are possible for this attribute:
NOT_AVAILABLE = The LED state is not readable at the moment STEADY_LIGHT = Power present SLOW_BLINK = Missing resource FAST_BLINK = Load or test in progress FLICKERING = Busy
attribute.deprecated: Since L11A. Replaced by attribute operationalIndicator.

attribute.name: redLed
attribute.description:
Indicates the fault status of the Auxiliary Plug-in Unit.
The following values are possible for this attribute:
NOT_AVAILABLE = The LED state is not available at the moment OUT = No fault STEADY_LIGHT = PIU fault
attribute.deprecated: Since L11A. Replaced by attribute faultIndicator.

attribute.name: yellowLed
attribute.description:
Indicates the information status of the Auxiliary Plug-in Unit.
The following values are possible for this attribute:
NOT_AVAILABLE = The LED state is not available at the moment OUT = PIU unlocked STEADY_LIGHT = PIU locked SLOW_BLINK = Shutting-down in progress FLICKERING = Busy
attribute.deprecated: Since L11A. Replaced by attribute maintenanceIndicator.

attribute.name: AuxPlugInUnitId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: Defines the operational state.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description: The availability status of the device.

attribute.name: piuType
attribute.description: Refers to the corresponding PiuType MO. Used by the auto-configuration and system upgrade functions to create corresponding device group and XpProgram MOs.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserves this MO instance.

attribute.name: unitType
attribute.description: Mirrors the attribute PiuType.productData(productName).

attribute.name: positionRef
attribute.description: Refers to the cabinet or shelf in which the AuxPlugInUnit is placed or to which it belongs.

attribute.name: position
attribute.description: The absolute position of the AuxPlugInUnit in a shelf. Position numbering starts from left or ground with the first position numbered 1. A board can occupy more than one position, depending on its width. When a board occupies more than one position, its position number is the left-most position it occupies.

attribute.name: positionInformation
attribute.description:
The position of a AuxPlugInUnit. It can be:
- On a shelf - Not on a shelf but inside or outside the cabinet - At a remote site
If the hardware is contained on a shelf, the attribute position is used. Otherwise this attribute can be used, for example, to provide the address of a remote site, or to indicate that the unit is installed in connection to a specific shelf.

attribute.name: faultIndicator
attribute.description:
The fault status of the auxiliary plug-in unit as shown by the optical indicator on the unit.
Valid values:
• NOT_APPLICABLE = This indicator is not supported. • NOT_AVAILABLE = The indicator state is currently not available. • OFF = No hardware fault. • STEADY_ON = Hardware fault.
attribute.dependencies: Only applicable to RBS 6000. If RBS 3000, see redLed.

attribute.name: operationalIndicator
attribute.description:
The operational status of the auxiliary plug-in unit as shown by the optical indicator on the unit. Valid values:
• NOT_APPLICABLE = This indicator is not supported. • NOT_AVAILABLE = The indicator state is currently not available. • OFF = No power. • STEADY_ON = Operational, the unit can perform its intended purpose. • SLOW_BLINK = Dependent resource missing, the unit is non-operational. • DOUBLE_FLASH_AND_STEADY_ON = Loading software, the unit is operational during software loading. • DOUBLE_FLASH_AND_OFF = Loading software, the unit is non-operational during software loading.
attribute.dependencies: Only applicable to RBS 6000. If RBS 3000, see greenLed

attribute.name: maintenanceIndicator
attribute.description:
The maintenance status of the auxiliary plug-in unit as shown by the optical maintenance indicator on the unit. Valid values:
• NOT_APPLICABLE = The indicator is not supported. • NOT_AVAILABLE = The indicator state is currently not available. • OFF = Non-maintenance mode (board unlocked) • STEADY_ON = Full maintenance mode (board locked) • SLOW_BLINK = Removing ongoing traffic in unit • FAST_BLINK = Alarms suppressed in unit
attribute.dependencies: Only applicable to RBS 6000. If RBS 3000, see yellowLed.

action.name: writeRepairDeliveryNoteToHwLog
action.description:
Writes hardware log entry requested by the operator. Only one hardware log entry is allowed for each hardware unit, and update of an existing entry is not allowed.
preparedBy Name of operator preparing the log entry.
countryCode Two-letter country code.
stateCode The hardware status when the failure occurred. R = Repaired unit failed during installation or test. S = Unit in service failure occurred. T = New unit failed during installation or test.
descriptionOfFault Specific description of the fault observed. It is also important that other external factors are described. For product safety also specify; fire, water damage, and so on.
trNumber If the board has a connection with a trouble report a trouble report number must be supplied.
reference Complaint reference.
Transaction Required: No
Parameters
preparedBy Data Type: String Range: 1..15
countryCode Data Type: String Range: 2..2
stateCode Data Type: String Range: 1..1
descriptionOfFault Data Type: String Range: 1..64
trNumber Data Type: String Range: 0..10
reference Data Type: String Range: 0..8

action.name: readRepairDeliveryNoteFromHwLog
action.description:
Reads the content of the hardware log entry written by the operator using the writeRepairDeliveryNoteToHwLog action.
Transaction Required: No.

action.name: reconfigureProgramPrepare
action.description: Seeks a matching PIU type for an auxiliary plug-in unit at SW upgrade. Depending on found PIU type, the XP program is reconfigured.

action.name: restartUnit
action.description: Restarts the corresponding auxiliary plug-in unit. The XP program with startState = enabled is reloaded from flash memory (forced reload).

class.name: TrDeviceSet
class.description:
This MO is created by the auto-configuration function (attribute autoConfigurationAllowed must be set to TRUE in MO ManagedElementDatafunction) when the grand-parent AuxPlugInUnit or PlugInUnit is created. For the MO to be correctly configured the AuxPlugInUnit or PlugInUnit must refer to a proper PiuType.
This MO models a Transmit/Receive device set.

attribute.name: TrDeviceSetId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description: The availability status. It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: usageState
attribute.description:
Indicates the usage of a device group:
• ACTIVE • BUSY • IDLE

class.name: RbsSlot
class.description:
This MO models a slot in an RBS subrack. Automatically created based on the value of the noOfSlots attribute on the corresponding subrack MO.
PERSISTENT=Yes

attribute.name: RbsSlotId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

class.name: RbsSubrack
class.description:
This MO models an RBS subrack.
PERSISTENT=Yes

attribute.name: noOfSlots
attribute.description: Number of slots in the subrack.

attribute.name: RbsSubrackId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: subrackPosition
attribute.description:
The subrack position.
The value consist of (<X><Y><Z>): X: cabinet position within the node, a digit (1-9), starting from left. Y: subrack vertical position within the cabinet, a letter (A-Z), starting from the ground. Z: subrack horizontal position within the cabinet, a digit (1-9), starting from left.
Examples: 1A1, 1B1, 1B2, 2A1.
DEPENDENCIES=The value of attribute cabinetPosition corresponds to the first digit in attribute subrackPosition.

attribute.name: cabinetPosition
attribute.description:
The cabinet position within a node, starting from left. The cabinet position value is a digit between 1-9.
Example: 9
DEPENDENCIES=The value of attribute cabinetPosition corresponds to the first digit in attribute subrackPosition.

class.name: SectorEquipmentFunction
class.description: This MO serves as a mapping between the cell and the RBS equipment used to provide coverage in a certain geographical area. The MO also controls the maximum output power of the sector.

attribute.name: SectorEquipmentFunctionId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: The administrative state.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description: The availability status. It contains details about operationalState. This attribute is set by the application in the RBS.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state. This attribute is set by the application in the RBS.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Lists SectorCarrier or EUtranCellFDD/TDD MO instances that reserve this MO instance. Max 4 SectorCarrier can reserve the same SectorEquipmentFunction.

attribute.name: fqBand
attribute.description:
The E-UTRA frequency band used in the SectorEquipmentFunction, based on the radio connected to the SectorEquipmentFunction.
Range 1-32 for frequency division duplex, and 33 or higher for time division duplex (defined in 3GPP TS 36.104).

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: confOutputPower
attribute.description:
The requested maximum sector power.
The value represents the sum of the power for all antenna connectors used by the sector.
0 represents 0 Watt output power.
Note: The valid range of confOutPutPower will be limited by the Radio Unit hardware capability and/or the lack of suitable HWAC.
attribute.deprecated: Since L13B. Replaced by attribute configuredOutputPower. Planned to be removed.
attribute.disturbances: Changes may affect traffic.
attribute.takesEffect: Lock/unlock of the Cell and Sector MOs.

attribute.name: rfBranchRef
attribute.description: Reference to the RfBranch or AntennaPath MO instances being reserved.

attribute.name: mixedModeRadio
attribute.description: Determines whether this SectorEquipmentFunction is shared with another node.

attribute.name: sectorPower
attribute.description:
The available sector power.
The value represents the sum of the power for all Radio Units used by the sector and is the minimum of either of; sum of the RU capabilities, sum of the allocated output power capacity licenses, confOutputPower.
attribute.deprecated: Since L13B. Replaced by attribute availableSectorPower. Planned to be removed.

attribute.name: configuredOutputPower
attribute.description:
Requested maximum sector power.
The value represents the sum of the power for all antenna connectors used by the sector.
The value 0 represents 0 mW output power.
Note: The valid range of confOutPutPower will be limited by the RU hardware capability or the lack of suitable HWAC, or both.
attribute.disturbances: Changes may affect traffic

attribute.name: availableSectorPower
attribute.description:
Available sector power.
The value represents the sum of the power for all RUs used by the sector and is the lowest of the following:
-Sum of the RU capabilities -Sum of the allocated output power capacity licenses -Value of parameter confOutputPower

class.name: ResourceAllocationFunction
class.description:
This MO represents the carrier branch resource allocation functionality in the RBS.
The RDN for this MO type is "ResourceAllocationFunction=1".

attribute.name: ResourceAllocationFunctionId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

class.name: SystemConstants
class.description: This MO models system constants.

attribute.name: systConstants
attribute.description: A string that holds system constants (name and value). A system constant pair consists of a name and a value. The name and value is separated by ’:’ while system constant pairs are separated by ’,’. If a system constant is not included in the attribute, then the default value of system constant is used. The default value is hard-coded by the owner of system constant.

attribute.name: SystemConstantsId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

action.name: writeSystConst
action.description:
This action adds a new constant pair (name and value) to systConstants string or modifies an existing constant pair in the systConstants string. The possible system constants to add are specified in system contstant excel file. The name and value are not allowed to include the characters ‘,’ or ‘:’ .
Parameters
Name: name Range: 1-31 Description: The name of the system constant Dependency: The total number of characters allowed for name and value together may not exceed 31
Name: value Range: 1-31 Description: The value of the system constant Dependency: The total number of characters allowed for name and value together may not exceed 31
Persistent: Yes

action.name: resetSystConst
action.description:
This action deletes a constant pair (name and value) from systConstants string. When a system constant is deleted from the string then the default value of the system constant is used.
Parameters
Name: name Range: 1-31 Description: The name of the system constant

class.name: DeviceGroup
class.description:
This MO is created by the auto-configuration function (attribute autoConfigurationAllowed must be set to TRUE in MO ManagedElementDatafunction) when the parent AuxPlugInUnit or PlugInUnit is created. For the MO to be correctly configured the AuxPlugInUnit or PlugInUnit must refer to a proper PiuType.
This MO must at manual configuration be created in the same transaction as its parent MO (PlugInUnit or AuxPlugInUnit) and its children MOs. If not done accordingly then a restart of the system is required to facilitate proper function.
Generic device group for device boards and auxiliary units . Depending on type of device board/auxiliary unit it may contain different kind of device sets and number of devices in the sets. The device group type is given by the MO ID, i.e. the value of the DeviceGroupId attribute.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description: The availability status. It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: usageState
attribute.description:
Indicates the usage of a device group:
• ACTIVE • BUSY • IDLE

attribute.name: DeviceGroupId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: piuFroId
attribute.description: The fRO id for the parent PlugInUnit MO. In case parent MO is other than PlugInUnit attribute is set to 0.

class.name: SubDeviceGroup
class.description:
This MO is created by the auto-configuration function (attribute autoConfigurationAllowed must be set to TRUE in MO ManagedElementDatafunction) when the parent PlugInUnit or AuxPlugInUnit is created. For the MO to be correctly configured the PlugInUnit or AuxPlugInUnit must refer to a proper PiuType. This MO must at manual configuration be created in the same transaction as its parent MO (PlugInUnit, AuxPlugInUnit) and its children MOs. If not done accordingly then a restart of the system is required to facilitate proper function.
Generic device group for logical boards. Depending on type of device board it may contain different kind of device sets and number of devices in the sets. The device group type is given by the MO ID, i.e. the value of the SubDeviceGroupId attribute.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description: The availability status. It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: SubDeviceGroupId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: usageState
attribute.description:
Indicates the usage of a device group:
• ACTIVE • BUSY • IDLE

class.name: NodeManagementFunction
class.description: MOClass for node management.

attribute.name: alarmSuppressed
attribute.description: Indicates that all alarms in the node are suppressed. Alarm suppression can be started on site via a push on the Maintenance Button or off site via OSS-RC. Persistently stored attribute not handled by CV.
attribute.dependencies: Remote management applications can only change this attribute if attribute ENodeBFunction::technicianPresent=false.

attribute.name: technicianPresent
attribute.description: Indicates that a technician on site has pushed the Maintenance Button. Persistently stored attribute not handled by CV.

attribute.name: collectTraceStatus
attribute.description: Status of trace collection, initiated with operation collectTraces.

attribute.name: collectLogsStatus
attribute.description: Status of logs collection, initiated with operation collectAutIntLogs.

attribute.name: indicatorState
attribute.description: Check the alarms and based on that information distribute the correct indicator status to the Status Indicator. Valid values: • OFF = No fault exist in the node or in remote units • STEADY_ON = A fault exist in the node. • SLOW_BLINK = Fault in remote unit.

attribute.name: oaMLinkSuperVisionActive
attribute.description: Controls enabling and disabling the supervision function that restarts the RBS when the O&M link is disabled.

attribute.name: NodeManagementFunctionId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

action.name: collectTraces
action.description:
Starts traces collection. Log files from the RBS node are collected and stored into a gzipped file, /c/logfiles/CollectTraces.log.zip. The same file is used every time, that is if a result file exists it is overwritten. If the action is started when a trace collection is already ongoing a ActionAlreadyInProgressException is thrown. Attribute collectTraceStatus shows the status of this operation.
Transaction Required: No.

action.name: collectAutIntLogs
action.description:
Starts collection log files that are relevant to autointegration. The action runs COLI commands to produce a set of log files in the RBS node. The log files are collected and stored into the directory /c/logfiles/autointegration. For each log file, the same filename is used every time which means that old files are overwritten. If the action is started when a trace collection is already ongoing a ActionAlreadyInProgressException is thrown. Note that other logs and traces that are already filebased are not covered by this action. Attribute collectLogsStatus shows the status of this operation.
Transaction Required: No.

action.name: clearTechnicianPresent
action.description: Resets the attribute technicianPresent to false.

class.name: RbsConfiguration
class.description: This MO is used for the configuration of the RBS done at site. The MO handles configuration of O&M access, Site Equipment and Licensing. The MO supports download of configuration files from a remote site or from a client. It is an MO creating and modifying other MOs.

attribute.name: RbsConfigurationId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: configFaultReason
attribute.description: The reason for configuration failure.

attribute.name: progressInformation
attribute.description: The configuration operation that is currently performed.

attribute.name: progressLevel
attribute.description: The progress of RBS integration. The progress notification is divided into equal parts in steps of 10%. The progress ranges from starting the integration until the RBS is operational and integrated in OSS-RC.

attribute.name: rbsConfigLevel
attribute.description: The configuration level of the RBS.

attribute.name: ossCorbaNameServiceAddress
attribute.description: The IP address/hostname of the OSS-RC CORBA name server. Used to resolve the OSS-RC notification service.

attribute.name: configurationReport
attribute.description: The configuration report stored as a string.

attribute.name: dhcpClientIdentifier
attribute.description: The Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) client ID used in the DHCP request to identify the RBS.

attribute.name: supportedConfigFileRevisions
attribute.description: The supported file names, product numbers and revisions of the listed configuration files.

attribute.name: progressReport
attribute.description: Will hold information about the auto-integration process in the RBS, will be parsed by the Integrate RBS application to update the GUI with new progress information.

attribute.name: rbsModificationStateInfo
attribute.description: Descibes the status and progress information of the modification operations.

attribute.name: progressReportUpdateCounter
attribute.description: This counter is incremented each time the progressReport attribute is updated.

attribute.name: configurationReportUpdateCounter
attribute.description: This counter is incremented each time the configurationReport attribute is updated.

action.name: cancelRbsIntegration
action.description:
Cancels the integration process by restarting the RBS node with the latest CV. The integration is not resumed automatically after restart.
Transaction Required: No.

action.name: storeConfigurationReport
action.description:
Parameters:
string smrsUserId The user ID needed for the SMRS server. Length range: 0..128 Persistent: Yes
string smrsPassword The password needed for the SMRS server. Length range: 0..128 Persistent: No
string smrsAddress The IP address/hostname to the server where the configuration report shall be stored. Length range: 0..128 Persistent: No
string configReportFilePath The file path on the server where to store the configuration report Length range: 0..128 Persistent: No
Transaction Required: No.

action.name: startProductionTestConfiguration
action.description:
Configures the relevant MOs with O&M access (site basic), RBS equipment & S1 & Cell parameters from the file specified in the parameter list. This action is used for Node Production Center test only.
Progress is indicated by the rbsConfigLevel attribute.
Parameters:
string dhcpClientIdentifier DHCP Client Identifier used in the DHCP Request to identify the RBS. Length range: 0..256 Undefined value = "" Persistent: Yes
String siteBasicFilePath The local file path to the O&M access (site basic) configuration. Length range: 0..255 Persistent: Yes
String rbsEquipmentFilePath The local file path to the rbs equipment configuration. Length range: 0..255 Persistent: Yes
String productionTestConfFilePath The local file path to the Node Production Center test configuration. Length range: 0..255 Persistent: Yes
string logicalName The logical name of the RBS. The attribute is set by the NPC Operator. Length range: 0..255 Persistent: Yes
Transaction Required: Yes

action.name: setUniqueLogicalName
action.description:
Sets the Unique Logical Name for the RBS.
Parameters:
string uniqueLogicalName Length range: 0..255 Sets the Unique Logical Name for the RBS. Persistent: Yes

action.name: startRbsIntegration
action.description: Configures the relevant MOs with basic IP parameters from the parameter list. Stores values from parameter list persistent. The JVM is restarted when this action is performed. The integration is automatically resumed after restart.

parameter.name: parametersXml
parameter.description:
Contains an XML string with all the needed information to perform an auto integration.
Undefined value = "" Persistent: Yes

action.name: updateRbsIntegrationParameters
action.description: Supplies the RBS with additional information needed during the autointegration.

parameter.name: updatedParametersXml
parameter.description:
Contains an XML string will extra information requested by the RBS during autointegration.
Undefined value = "" Persistent: Yes

action.name: changeIpForOamSetting
action.description: Downloads an IP configuration for OAM and uses the configuration data to configure the relevant MOs in order to change the IP configuration on an already operational node, including possible activation or deactivation of IPsec for OAM. The OAM Host IP address will change or be reset when this action is performed and as a consequence the Object Request Broker (ORB) is restarted. As a prerequisite for using this action to activate IPsec is that an IPsec license is installed. IPsec credentials must also be installed, or alternatively enrollment data for IPsec must be included in the configuration bundle. Upon completion of the new configuration, OSS will be notified of the new OAM IP address in use. The action will fail if prerequisites are not met or if OAM connectivity cannot be established over the newly configured connection. In case of failure, IP configuration for OAM will not be changed.

parameter.name: smrsUserId
parameter.description: string smrsUserId The user ID needed for the SMRS server. Persistent: No

parameter.name: smrsPassword
parameter.description: string smrsPassword The password needed for the SMRS server. Persistent: No

parameter.name: summaryFileUrl
parameter.description:
string summaryFileUrl This string shall be composed in the following way “sftp://<smrsAddress>/<cfgSummaryFilePath>” The summary file can reference up to three other files to be downloaded as part of the configuration: 1. A file containing IPsec for OAM configurations, including desired on/off setting (mandatory) 2. An ISCF containing trusted certificates and/or enrollment data for IPsec credentials (required if IPsec credentials are not present) 3. A license key file (required if current license key file does not provide IPsec)
Persistent: No
Where
smrsAddress The IP address/hostname to the server where the summary file is stored.
string cfgSummaryFilePath The file path on the server where to find the summary file.

parameter.name: summaryFileHash
parameter.description:
A string in the following format: <hash-algorithm> = <bb1>:<bb2>: .. :<bbn> The hash shall be computed over the summary file. If the hash of the downloaded summary file does not match the specified hash the action will be aborted.
where: <hash-algorithm> is SHA1 The equals sign is mandatory and is followed by 20 (SHA1) bytes encoded in hexadecimal and separated by colon signs.
Examples: SHA1=B6:12:31:B4:C7:03:20:62:F2:2A:B3:3D:E8:2D:0C:8F:C9:73:BC:39

parameter.name: rbsIntegrationCode
parameter.description: string rbsIntegrationCode The RBS integration code (RIC) is required in the case where IPsec for OAM is to be activated but the needed credentials are missing on the node and must also be installed as part of the action. The RIC will have been created during the preparation of certificate enrollment data in OSS and is needed for decrypting the data in the ISCF file. If the required credentials already exist on the node then no ISCF will be used and the rbsIntegrationCode parameter will be ignored. Persistent: No

action.name: modifyConfiguration
action.description: Updates the RBS with the MOs that are specified in the supplied file and do not exist in the current CV. The file must validate the database schema according to rules for the xsd schema for the file.

parameter.name: parametersXml
parameter.description: XML string containing the modification request.

class.name: Sctp
class.description:
Stream Control Transmission Protocol (SCTP)
This MO represents an SCTP host. SCTP transports signalling messages between SCTP users over IP networks.
Most of the attributes are specified in the IETF RFC 4960.
class.specification: Many of the attributes are specified in the IETF RFC 4960.

attribute.name: SctpId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: numberOfAssociations
attribute.description: The maximum number of associations that can be handled by this SCTP MO.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

attribute.name: ipAccessHostGpbId
attribute.description: Reference to an instance of an IpAccessHostGpb MO.
attribute.dependencies: Setting of this attribute is rejected if ipAccessSctpRef is set.

attribute.name: minimumRto
attribute.description:
The minimum value for RTO.
The value of this attribute has the following relationship to the values of other attributes: tSack + expected Round Trip Time < minimumRto < maximumRto
A new value of the attribute applies to both existing and new associations.

attribute.name: maximumRto
attribute.description:
The maximum value for the RTO.
The value of this attribute must be greater than the value of minimumRto.
A new value of the attribute applies to both existing and new associations.

attribute.name: initialRto
attribute.description:
The initial value that the Retransmission Timeout (RTO) takes prior to the first measurement of the Round-Trip Time (RTT).
The value of this attribute has the following relationship to the values of other attributes: minimumRto <= initialRto <= maximumRto
A new value of the attribute does not apply to associations that are already established.

attribute.name: rtoAlphaIndex
attribute.description:
The attribute rtoAlphaIndex (Retransmission Timeout Alpha Index) computes the value of the Smoothed Round-Trip Time (SRTT) for a specific destination address. It weights the RTT values.
The value of this attribute is used to create a value of RTO.Alpha between 0 and 1. A value close to 1 gives a higher importance to the last RTT measurement. The range of possible values and the actual value given to the RTO.Alpha parameter are the following:
rtoAlphaIndex = 1 -> RTO.Alpha = 1/2 rtoAlphaIndex = 2 -> RTO.Alpha = 1/4 rtoAlphaIndex = 3 -> RTO.Alpha = 1/8 rtoAlphaIndex = 4 -> RTO.Alpha = 1/16
A new value of the attribute applies to both existing and new associations.

attribute.name: rtoBetaIndex
attribute.description:
The attribute rtoBetaIndex (Retransmission Timeout Beta Index) computes the value of RTTVar (Round Trip Time Variation) of a destination address.
The value of this attribute is used to create a value of RTO.Beta between 0 and 1. A value close to 1 gives a higher importance to the last observed variation. The range of possible values and the actual value given to the RTO.Beta parameter are the following:
rtoBetaIndex = 1 -> RTO.Beta = 1/2 rtoBetaIndex = 2 -> RTO.Beta = 1/4 rtoBetaIndex = 3 -> RTO.Beta = 1/8 rtoBetaIndex = 4 -> RTO.Beta = 1/16
A new value of the attribute applies to both existing and new associations.

attribute.name: validCookieLife
attribute.description:
The attribute sets the lifespan of the State Cookie sent in the INIT_ACK chunk. It limits the amount of time between sending the INIT_ACK and the reception of a COOKIE_ECHO chunk when establishing an association.
It is recommended that the value of this attribute has the following relationship to the values of other attributes: validCookieLife >= maximumRto * maxInitialRtrAtt.
A new value of the attribute does not apply to associations that are already established.

attribute.name: allowedIncrementCookieLife
attribute.description:
The attribute defines the allowed increment of the validCookieLife parameter (in local node) when an increase of the parameter is requested from remote node.
A new value of the attribute does not apply to associations that are already established.

attribute.name: keyChangePeriod
attribute.description:
Defines how often the secret key used for computing the Message Authentication Code (MAC) on the State Cookie is changed.
A new value of the attribute does not change the current measurement interval. It applies only to subsequent intervals.
A new value of the attribute applies to both existing and new associations.

attribute.name: associationMaxRtx
attribute.description:
The maximum number of consecutive retransmissions to a remote peer (on all the remote transport addresses of the peer). If the number of retransmissions becomes greater than this value, the remote peer is considered to be unreachable and the association is closed down.
Set the value of this attribute within the following limits:
- If the selection algorithm is set to SCTP_PATHS: pathMaxRtx <= associationMaxRtx <= number of remote transport addresses * pathMaxRtx, - If the selection algorithm is set to IP_PATHS: pathMaxRtx <= associationMaxRtx <= number of IP paths * pathMaxRtx.
The value might need to be increased to avoid frequently lost associations in an unstable network.
A new value of this attribute applies to both existing and new associations.

attribute.name: pathMaxRtx
attribute.description:
If the path selection algorithm is SCTP_PATHS, this attribute specifies the maximum number of consecutive retransmissions to a remote transport address. For other path selection algorithms, this attribute specifies the maximum number of consecutive retransmissions over an IP path.
If the number of retransmissions becomes greater than this value, the remote transport address or the IP path is considered to be "inactive" and no data is sent to it. If all the remote transport addresses or all IP paths become "inactive", the association will be closed down.
The value of this attribute has the following relationships to the values of other attributes: - one attempt <= pathMaxRtx <= associationMaxRtx - pathMaxRtx >= potentiallyFailedMaxRtx
Adapt the value to the network quality. A low value reduces the time for fault detection, but it is recommended only for stable networks.
The value might need to be increased to avoid frequently lost associations in an unstable network.
If multi-homed SCTP is used and when tests for insertion and removal of the Ethernet cable are performed, wait 60 seconds between inserting the first cable and removing the second cable. That is: remove cable, insert cable, wait 60 seconds, remove second cable, insert second cable.
A new value of this attribute applies to both existing and new associations.
The recommended value for pathMaxRtx is as follows: - If the selection algorithm is set to SCTP_PATHS, set the value to associationMaxRtx / number of remote transport addresses. - If the selection algorithm is set to IP_PATHS, set the value to associationMaxRtx / number of IP paths.

attribute.name: maxInitialRtrAtt
attribute.description:
The maximum number of retransmissions allowed for both INIT and COOKIE_ECHO chunks. If the number of retransmissions exceeds this value, SCTP aborts the initialization of the association and reports the error to the SCTP user.
A new value of the attribute does not apply to associations that are already established.

attribute.name: maxShutDownRtrAtt
attribute.description:
The maximum number of retransmissions during the shutdown phase of an association.
A new value of the attribute applies to both existing and new associations.

attribute.name: heartbeatInterval
attribute.description:
The amount of time added to the RTO of a specific address when setting up the period of time between sending heartbeats. Small values can lead to an earlier detection of unreachable addresses than higher values. However, sending the heartbeat too often can lead to a performance penalty.
A new value of the attribute does not change the current measurement interval. It applies only to subsequent intervals.
A new value of the attribute applies to both existing and new associations.

attribute.name: heartbeatStatus
attribute.description:
Enables and disables heartbeats for associations.
true - enable heartbeats. false - disable heartbeats.
A new value of this attribute applies to both existing and new associations.

attribute.name: maxIncomingStream
attribute.description:
The allowed maximum number of incoming streams for an association.
A change to this attribute does not affect the existing associations. To apply a new value, the endpoint must be re-created.

attribute.name: maxOutgoingStream
attribute.description:
The allowed maximum number of outgoing streams for an association.
A change to this attribute does not affect the existing associations. To apply a new value, the endpoint must be re-created.

attribute.name: maxUserDataSize
attribute.description:
The maximum number of bytes of an IP datagram that can be transferred in a single unit over a specific path in an IP network. If an IP datagram exceeds the Path Maximum Transfer Unit (PMTU), it is either fragmented or dropped.
For Sctp that uses IPv6 addresses, the minimum value of this attribute is 1240.
This value does not include the IP header, 20 bytes for IPv4 or 40 bytes for IPv6.
For Sctp that uses IPv4 addresses, the recommended value of this attribute is 1480. For Sctp that uses IPv6 addresses, the recommended value of this attribute is 1460.
If IPsec is used, the value of this attribute must be less than the recommended value to make room for the overhead specified by IPsec protocol to prevent message fragmentation on IP level.
To avoid fragmentation of the SCTP data by the local IPv4 stack, SCTP aligns the actual used maxUserDataSize with the mtu attribute of the used IpInterface / FastEthernet MO(s). SCTP calculates the actual used maxUserDataSize value in the following way: max { min {maxUserDataSize, mtu - ipHeaderSize}, 508 }, where ipHeaderSize is 20 octets. For a multi-homed SCTP endpoint, the minimum value of the mtu attribute from both IpInterface / FastEthernet MOs is used in calculation. If the value of the mtu attribute of the used FastEthernet MO is less than 532 octets, then fragmentation of the SCTP data by the local IPv4 stack can not be avoided.
To avoid fragmentation of the SCTP data by the local IPv6 stack, the value of this attribute shall have the following relationship to the values of the mtu attribute of the Ipv6Interface MO: maxUserDataSize <= mtu - ipHeaderSize, where ipHeaderSize is 40 octets
A new value of this attribute applies to both existing and new associations.

attribute.name: mBuffer
attribute.description:
The attribute sets the size of the buffer used for storing user data pending to be sent or retransmitted in an association. That is, the attribute sets the maximum amount of user data that SCTP buffers before discarding user messages.
The value may need to be increased to ensure stable data flow at high load. It must be greater than the value of nThreshold
A new value of this attribute applies to both existing and new associations.

attribute.name: nThreshold
attribute.description:
Sets the value of the threshold used to ask the SCTP user to stop the delivery of a data on an association. A congestion indication will be sent to the user when the SCTP send buffer usage is above nTreshold.
The value of this attribute has the following relationship to the value of mBuffer: - nThreshold must be less than mBuffer, - nThreshold = 3/4 * mBuffer, is the normal value.
The value may need to be increased to ensure stable dataflow at high load.
A new value of this attribute applies to both existing and new associations.

attribute.name: tSack
attribute.description:
The time delay for sending the Selective Acknowledgement (SACK), that is, the time from reception of the DATA chunk to sending of the SACK chunk.
A new value of the attribute does not change the current measurement interval. It applies only to subsequent intervals.
A new value of the attribute applies to both existing and new associations.

attribute.name: maxDataSizeIp
attribute.description:
The maximum number of bytes that SCTP can fetch every time it reads from the IP socket.
This value includes the IP header, 20 bytes.
attribute.deprecated: Has no functional behaviour. It has become redundant and will always return 1500.

attribute.name: initialAdRecWin
attribute.description:
The initial value of the advertised receiver window credit.
If the value of this attribute is increased, it applies to both existing and new associations. If the value is decreased, it does not apply to associations that are already established.

attribute.name: intervalOobPkts
attribute.description:
The number of seconds after which the counter for out-of-the-blue packets is reset.
A new value of the attribute does not change the current measurement interval. It applies only to subsequent intervals.
A new value of the attribute applies to both existing and new associations.

attribute.name: intervalLostUser
attribute.obsolete: Has no functional behavior. The value will be ignored by the system.

attribute.name: maxBurst
attribute.description:
The number of packages that are sent during the fast retransmit phase when a SACK is processed.
A new value of the attribute applies to both existing and new associations.

attribute.name: nPercentage
attribute.description:
This attribute is set as a percentage of the attribute nThreshold. A congestion-ceased indication is sent to the SCTP user when the usage of the SCTP send buffer drops below nPercentage.
A new value of the attribute applies to both existing and new associations.

attribute.name: bundlingActivated
attribute.description:
Enables and disables the use of bundling.
A new value of this attribute applies to both existing and new associations.

attribute.name: bundlingTimer
attribute.description:
Specifies the maximum SCTP bundling delay.
Value=0 means that SCTP bundles only what is available and sends directly (no delay).
A new value of the attribute does not change the current measurement interval. It applies only to subsequent intervals.
A new value of the attribute applies to both existing and new associations.

attribute.name: pmSctpCurrEstab
attribute.description: Number of SCTP associations for which the current state is either ESTABLISHED, SHUTDOWN-PENDING, or SHUTDOWN-RECEIVED.
attribute.condition: The state of the SCTP association is either ESTABLISHED, SHUTDOWN-PENDING, or SHUTDOWN-RECEIVED.

attribute.name: pmSctpActiveEstab
attribute.description: Number of times that SCTP associations have made a direct transition to the ESTABLISHED state from the COOKIE-ECHOED state.
attribute.condition: State change from COOKIE-ECHOED directly to ESTABLISHED.

attribute.name: pmSctpPassiveEstab
attribute.description: Number of times that SCTP associations have made a direct transition from the CLOSED state to the ESTABLISHED state.
attribute.condition: State change from CLOSED directly to ESTABLISHED.

attribute.name: pmSctpAborted
attribute.description: Number of times that SCTP associations have made a direct transition to the CLOSED state from any state, using the chunk ABORT.
attribute.condition: State change from any state directly to CLOSED, using ABORT.

attribute.name: pmSctpShutdowns
attribute.description: Number of times that SCTP associations have made a direct transition to the CLOSED state from either the SHUTDOWN-SENT state or the SHUTDOWN-ACK-SENT state.
attribute.condition: State change from SHUTDOWN-SENT or SHUTDOWN-ACK-SENT directly to CLOSED.

attribute.name: pmSctpStatAssocOutOfBlue
attribute.description:
Number of out-of-the-blue packets that are received by the host.
These are SCTP packets that are correctly formed (with a correct checksum), but where the receiver is not able to identify the association to which this packet belongs.
attribute.condition: An unidentified packet is received.

attribute.name: pmSctpStatSentChunks
attribute.description: Number of transmitted DATA chunks (excluding retransmissions).
attribute.condition: A DATA chunk is transmitted.

attribute.name: pmSctpStatRecChunks
attribute.description:
Number of received DATA chunks.
The counter does NOT include abnormal or discarded chunks.
attribute.condition: A DATA chunk is received.

attribute.name: pmSctpStatOutOfOrderSendChunks
attribute.description: Number of unordered chunks transmitted to the peers.
attribute.condition: An unordered chunk is transmitted.

attribute.name: pmSctpStatOutOfOrderRecChunks
attribute.description: Number of unordered chunks received from the peers.
attribute.condition: An unordered chunk is received.

attribute.name: pmSctpStatChecksumErrorCounter
attribute.description: Number of SCTP packets received from the peers, with an invalid checksum.
attribute.condition: An SCTP packet with invalid checksum received.

attribute.name: pmSctpStatRetransChunks
attribute.description: Number of DATA chunks retransmitted to the peers.
attribute.condition: A DATA chunk is retransmitted.

attribute.name: pmSctpStatSentControlChunks
attribute.description: Number of transmitted control chunks.
attribute.condition: A control chunk is transmitted.

attribute.name: pmSctpStatReceivedControlChunks
attribute.description:
Number of received control chunks.
The counter includes abnormal and discarded chunks.
attribute.condition: A control chunk is received.

attribute.name: pmSctpStatFragmentedUserMsg
attribute.description: Number of fragmented user messages, incremented when the first data chunk of fragmented message is sent.
attribute.condition: A fragmented message is transmitted.

attribute.name: pmSctpStatReassembledUserMsg
attribute.description: Number of reassembled user messages, incremented when the first data chunk of a fragmented message is received.
attribute.condition: The first data chunk of a fragmented message is received.

attribute.name: pmSctpStatSentPackages
attribute.description: Number of transmitted packets.
attribute.condition: An SCTP package is transmitted.

attribute.name: pmSctpStatReceivedPackages
attribute.description: Number of received packets, including duplicates and those received in error.
attribute.condition: A SCTP package is received.

attribute.name: pmSctpStatCommStop
attribute.description: Number of times SCTP has sent a congestion indication to the user.
attribute.condition: A communication stop indication is sent.

attribute.name: pmSctpStatCommResume
attribute.description: Number of times SCTP has sent a congestion ceased indication to the user.
attribute.condition: A communication resume indication is sent.

attribute.name: pmSctpStatSentChunksDropped
attribute.description: Number of outgoing user messages originating from the application for this SCTP for which no problems were encountered to prevent their transmission but were discarded. User messages are discarded due to lack of M-buffer.
attribute.condition: A sent user message is discarded.

attribute.name: pmSctpStatRecChunksDropped
attribute.description: Number of received chunks dropped for the following reasons: - Invalid association state - Duplicated data - Invalid stream identity in the DATA_CHUNK - Invalid verification tag in the packet - Stale SACK_CHUNK received - Lack of receiving buffer - ULP buffer overflow.
attribute.condition: A received chunk is discarded.

attribute.name: rpuId
attribute.description:
Reference to an instance of ReliableProgramUniter MO.
There is a one to one relation between Sctp MO and ReliableProgramUniter MO instances.

attribute.name: ipAccessSctpRef
attribute.description: Reference to an instance of an IpAccessSctp MO.
attribute.dependencies: Setting of this attribute is rejected if ipAccessHostGpbId is set.

attribute.name: pmSctpInErrors
attribute.description: The number of received SCTP datagrams for which an SCTP association could not be determined.
attribute.condition: An SCTP datagram is received, but is not delivered due to inability to find the association.

attribute.name: pmSctpInNoPorts
attribute.description: The number of received SCTP datagrams for which an SCTP association and endpoint could not be determined (for example if there was no user application at the destination port).
attribute.condition: An SCTP datagram is received, but is not delivered due to inability to find the association and endpoint.

attribute.name: heartbeatMaxBurst
attribute.description:
The maximum number of heartbeats, which can be sent at the same time during the path probing procedure. If the value is set to 0, path probing is not used.
A new value of the attribute does not apply to associations that are already established.

attribute.name: heartbeatPathProbingInterval
attribute.description:
The interval between consecutive heartbeats during the path probing.
The value of this attribute has the following relationship to the values of other attributes: maximumRto <= heartbeatPathProbingInterval <= heartbeatInterval.
A new value of the attribute applies to both existing and new associations.

attribute.name: pathSelection
attribute.description: The type of path selection algorithm.

attribute.name: sctpAssocDeleteTimeout
attribute.description:
The number of hours an SctpAssociation MO is allowed to stay in the operational state DISABLED before it is automatically deleted.
If the association is re-established later, a new SctpAssociation MO is created.
A new value of the attribute applies to both existing and new associations.

attribute.name: switchbackMode
attribute.description: The type of switchback behavior.

attribute.name: potentiallyFailedMaxRtx
attribute.description:
This attribute specifies the maximum number of consecutive retransmissions over the IP path that is used for data transmission, before this path is considered likely to fail.
If the number of retransmissions becomes greater than this value, the path used for data transmission is changed.
The value of this attribute has the following relationship to the value of pathMaxRtx: potentiallyFailedMaxRtx <= pathMaxRtx.
Applicable for the IP_PATHS selection scheme only.
A new value of the attribute applies to both existing and new associations.

attribute.name: switchbackMinThreshold
attribute.description:
The minimum and initial values for the number of consecutive successful heartbeats that must be sent over the preferred primary path before switchback can be performed.
The value of this attribute has the following relationship to the value of switchbackMaxThreshold: switchbackMinThreshold <= switchbackMaxThreshold.
A new value of the attribute applies to both existing and new associations.
The attribute is used for the EXPONENTIAL_BACKOFF switchback mode only.
If this value is greater than 1, it can take longer to switch back to the preferred primary path.

attribute.name: switchbackMaxThreshold
attribute.description:
The maximum value of the number of consecutive successful heartbeats that must be sent over the preferred primary path before switchback can be performed.
The value of this attribute has the following relationship to the value of switchbackMinThreshold: switchbackMaxThreshold >= switchbackMinThreshold.
A new value of the attribute applies to both existing and new associations.
The attribute is used for the EXPONENTIAL_BACKOFF switchback mode only.
If this value is greater than 1, it can take longer to switch back to the preferred primary path.

class.name: SctpProfile
class.description: This MO represents an SCTP profile. SCTP profiles can be used to set specific attribute values for a certain external SCTP association.

attribute.name: SctpProfileId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains an MO instance that reserves this MO instance.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: associationMaxRtx
attribute.description:
The maximum number of consecutive retransmissions to a remote peer (on all the remote transport addresses of the peer). If the number of retransmissions becomes greater than this value, the remote peer is considered to be unreachable and the association is closed down.
Set the value of this attribute within the following limits:
- If the selection algorithm is set to SCTP_PATHS: pathMaxRtx <= associationMaxRtx <= number of remote transport addresses * pathMaxRtx, - If the selection algorithm is set to IP_PATHS: pathMaxRtx <= associationMaxRtx <= number of IP paths * pathMaxRtx.
The value might need to be increased to avoid frequently lost associations in an unstable network.
A new value of this attribute applies to both existing and new associations.

attribute.name: pathMaxRtx
attribute.description:
If the path selection algorithm is SCTP_PATHS, this attribute specifies the maximum number of consecutive retransmissions to a remote transport address. For other path selection algorithms, this attribute specifies the maximum number of consecutive retransmissions over an IP path.
If the number of retransmissions becomes greater than this value, the remote transport address or the IP path is considered to be "inactive" and no data is sent to it. If all the remote transport addresses or all IP paths become "inactive", the association will be closed down.
The value of this attribute has the following relationships to the values of other attributes: - one attempt <= pathMaxRtx <= associationMaxRtx - pathMaxRtx >= potentiallyFailedMaxRtx
Adapt the value to the network quality. A low value reduces the time for fault detection, but it is recommended only for stable networks.
The value might need to be increased to avoid frequently lost associations in an unstable network.
If multi-homed SCTP is used and when tests for insertion and removal of the Ethernet cable are performed, wait 60 seconds between inserting the first cable and removing the second cable. That is: remove cable, insert cable, wait 60 seconds, remove second cable, insert second cable.
A new value of this attribute applies to both existing and new associations.
The recommended value for pathMaxRtx is as follows: - If the selection algorithm is set to SCTP_PATHS, set the value to associationMaxRtx / number of remote transport addresses. - If the selection algorithm is set to IP_PATHS, set the value to associationMaxRtx / number of IP paths.

attribute.name: sctpAssociationRef
attribute.description: References to SCTP associations tied to the profile.

attribute.name: potentiallyFailedMaxRtx
attribute.description:
This attribute specifies the maximum number of consecutive retransmissions over the IP path that is used for data transmission, before this path is considered likely to fail.
If the number of retransmissions becomes greater than this value, the path used for data transmission is changed.
The value of this attribute has the following relationship to the value of pathMaxRtx: potentiallyFailedMaxRtx <= pathMaxRtx.
Applicable for the IP_PATHS selection scheme only.
A new value of the attribute applies to both existing and new associations.

class.name: SctpAssociation
class.description:
This MO represents an SCTP association, defined by a combination of local and remote SCTP endpoints.
SCTP associations are unique in the scope of a node.
The SctpAssociation MO is created automatically when the SCTP association is established and if there is no matching SctpAssociation MO.
If the SCTP association is disabled for a longer period of time than is specified by the attribute sctpAssocDeleteTimeout in the Sctp MO, the SctpAssociation MO is deleted automatically.

attribute.name: clientRef
attribute.description: Reference to corresponding client’s MO.

attribute.name: creationTimeStamp
attribute.description:
The timestamp when the SctpAssociation MO instance was created.
Format example: "Date: 2012-02-20, Time: 20:52:11"

attribute.name: lastCommLostOrigin
attribute.description:
The originator of the last transition from the ENABLED to the DISABLED operational state.
Specifies whether local or remote node has caused the last closure of the association.

attribute.name: lastCommLostReason
attribute.description: The reason for the last transition from the ENABLED to the DISABLED operational state.

attribute.name: lastCommLostTimeStamp
attribute.description:
The timestamp of the last transition from the ENABLED to the DISABLED operational state.
Format example: "Date: 2012-02-20, Time: 10:52:11" Initial value: "No value"

attribute.name: localIpAddress1
attribute.description: The first IP address of the local endpoint.

attribute.name: localIpAddress2
attribute.description:
The second IP address of the local endpoint.
The value "" means that the local endpoint of the association is single-homed.

attribute.name: localPortNumber
attribute.description: The port number of the local endpoint of the association.

attribute.name: localPrimaryIpAddress
attribute.description: The local IP address of the active primary path. The active primary path is the path which is used for outgoing traffic.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description:
The operational state.
The operational state is ENABLED if the association is established, and DISABLED if the association is closed.

attribute.name: remoteIpAddress1
attribute.description: The first IP address of the remote endpoint.

attribute.name: remoteIpAddress2
attribute.description:
The second IP address of the remote endpoint.
The value "" means that the remote endpoint of the association is single-homed.

attribute.name: remotePortNumber
attribute.description: The port number of the remote endpoint of the association.

attribute.name: remotePrimaryIpAddress
attribute.description: The remote IP address of the active primary path. The active primary path is the path which is used for outgoing traffic.

attribute.name: SctpAssociationId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: sctpProfileRef
attribute.description: Reference to an SctpProfile instance.

attribute.name: pmInControlChunks
attribute.description:
Number of received control chunks.
The counter includes abnormal and discarded chunks.
attribute.condition: A control chunk is received.

attribute.name: pmInDataChunks
attribute.description:
Number of received DATA chunks.
The counter does NOT include abnormal or discarded chunks.
attribute.condition: A DATA chunk is received.

attribute.name: pmInPacks
attribute.description: Number of received packets for this association, including duplicates and those received in error.
attribute.condition: An SCTP packet is received.

attribute.name: pmOutControlChunks
attribute.description: Number of transmitted control chunks.
attribute.condition: A control chunk is transmitted.

attribute.name: pmOutDataChunks
