attribute.name: funcId
attribute.description: Specifies the functionality identity given in the UCF file.

class.name: PiuType
class.description:
Plug-In Unit (PIU) Type
This MO specifies the product information of a plug-in-unit, and its execution resources. It is created or deleted during a software upgrade.
The PiuType is used when: - execution MOs connected to a PlugInUnit are created, and - software to this resource are allocated.
Instances of this MO are created automatically during system upgrade. It is also possible to create instances manually, but this is not recommended.

attribute.name: PiuTypeId
attribute.description:
The value component of the RDN.
It is set automatically during system upgrade.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: productData
attribute.description:
Specifies the product number, short product revision, product name and product information of the plug-in-unit. The production date is not used.
Recommended: Exclude the trailing letters in the revision of the PiuType.
Example:
- R2B = R2 without trailing letter - R2B/3 = R2B/3 in the PiuType - R2B/A = R2 in the PiuType.

attribute.name: boardWidth
attribute.description:
The width of the plug-in-unit board in steps of 5 mm. A plug-in-unit can use more space than the slot that it occupies.
Example: boardWidth=3 corresponds to 3*5 = 15 mm.

attribute.name: role
attribute.description:
This value is:
- MP if a board has the role of a Main processor - BP if a board has the role of a device board, or - CMXB if a board has the role of a CMXB board, or - OTHERS, otherwise.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

attribute.name: defAllowedSeqRestarts
attribute.description: Default value for the PlugInUnit attribute, allowedSeqRestarts.

attribute.name: lmFilesInstallState
attribute.description:
Specifies the "sum" of the file states for all load modules required for this PiuType.
Example: If all required load modules are installed, then this attribute = INSTALLED. If no required load modules are installed, then this attribute = NOT_INSTALLED. Otherwise, if partly installed, this attribute = PARTLY_INSTALLED.

action.name: numberOfMoConfigurations
action.description: Returns the number of entries in the structure PiuTypeMOConfiguration.

action.name: getMoConfiguration
action.description: Returns a structure of a specific MO configuration at a given index. The MO configuration has information to create the subordinate objects for a specific Piu type.

class.name: ReliableProgramUniter
class.description:
Reliable Program Uniter (RPU)
This is a controlling and addressing entity with one common addressing unit for parts of two Reliable Programs. Each part is called a Resource Suite Handler (RSH). The RSH is implemented and owned by the application. It is not a function or concept within CPP.
Instances of this MO are created automatically during system upgrade. It is also possible to create instances manually, but this is not recommended.

attribute.name: ReliableProgramUniterId
attribute.description:
The value component of the RDN.
It is set automatically during system upgrade.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: reliableProgramLabel
attribute.description: Compare this label to the reliableProgramLabel in the LoadModule MO.

attribute.name: admActiveSlot
attribute.description: Reference to a Slot, contains the running "Normal" relation to a slot. If the reference is set to the passive slot, the passive slot is cleared and only one relation is set.

attribute.name: admPassiveSlot
attribute.description: Reference to a Slot, contains the running "Stand-by" relation to a slot. If the reference is set to the active slot or a NULL value, the passive slot will be cleared.

attribute.name: switchOver
attribute.description: Controls when to switch the RPU if a certain error occurs.

attribute.name: normalisation
attribute.description:
Controls when to switch back the RPU after error recovery has been done.
Normalisation at PIU unlock is always done, regardless of the value of this attribute.

attribute.name: replication
attribute.description: Specifies the level of data replication that is associated with the RPU.

attribute.name: operationalMode
attribute.description: Specifies if the RSH execution mode (active/passive) in the two Reliable Programs, matches the normal/stand-by relations set on the corresponding RPU.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

attribute.name: rpuId
attribute.description: The ReilableProgramUniter identity on the resource layer.

action.name: switch
action.description: Forces the two corresponding RSHs to change their execution mode (active/passive). This results in either a switch-over, or a switch-back, depending on the value of the operational Mode attribute.

class.name: Repertoire
class.description:
This is an abstraction of a function represented by a plug-in-unit type (PiuType MO) and one or more load modules (LoadModule MO).
The repertoire provides rules for PiuType-LoadModule combinations valid for a specific function, where one function can be provided by one or many PiuType-LoadModule combinations.
These rules are used to load the correct software (Load Modules) to a PlugInUnit. This information is used as configuration support and/or in situations where automatic re-configuration is required (hot repair).
Instances of this MO are created automatically during system upgrade. It is also possible to create instances manually, but this is not recommended.

attribute.name: RepertoireId
attribute.description:
The value component of the RDN.
It is set automatically during system upgrade.
If this MO is manually created (not reccomended) the value for this attribute has to be set.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: A function friendly name associated to the repertoire. The value must be unique with respect to all repertoires with the same install state.

attribute.name: info
attribute.description: Information regarding the function.

attribute.name: piuTypeList
attribute.description: A list containing all PiuType references that has been added to this repertoire.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

class.name: SwAllocation
class.description:
Software Allocation (SWA)
This MO defines a role for a PIU inserted in a Slot. An SWA groups one or more repertoires together to form the role.
It is possible to completely configure the PIU without instructions from the operator, that is, determine which load module runs on which processor and FPGA, in the following cases:
- multi-purpose boards, for example, MPs - boards with processor and FPGA programs, for example, SPBs.
In these cases, another SWA is designed so that it can be manually configured.
Instances of this MO are normally created by Ericsson and are not meant to be changed by the operator.

attribute.name: SwAllocationId
attribute.description:
The value component of the RDN.
It is set automatically during system upgrade.
If this MO is manually created (not recommended), the value for this attribute has to be set.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: role
attribute.description:
Specifies the role of a slot or plug-in-unit. The role must be unique with respect to other SwAllocation MOs in the node.
This is a preparation to introduce pre-defined SwAllocation in future upgrade packages.

attribute.name: repertoireList
attribute.description: A list of references to repertoires.

attribute.name: slotList
attribute.description: A list of references to mainly slots in a subrack, for example, Slot MO, Fan MO, Webserver MO, Jvm MO, ActiveOtherLMs MO. It may also refer to other objects that handle auxiliary units, for example, XPIU and RBS FAN.

action.name: addRepertoire
action.description: Adds the specifed repertoire to this list.

action.name: deleteRepertoire
action.description: Removes the first occurrence of the specified repertoire from this list.

action.name: addSlot
action.description:
Adds the specified slot to the slotList.
The slot is of type Slot MO, Fan MO, WebServer MO, Jvm MO, ActiveOtherLMs MO or an application MO (for example, RBS Fans). Multiple SwAllocations are allowed for Slot MO instance and Fan MO instance.

action.name: deleteSlot
action.description: Removes the first occurrence of the specified slot from this list. The slot is of type Slot MO, Fan MO, WebServer MO, Jvm MO, ActiveOtherLMs MO or an application MO (for example, RBS Fans). Transaction required: Yes

action.name: deleteAllRepertoires
action.description: Removes all repertoires from this list and sets its size to zero.

action.name: deleteAllSlots
action.description: Removes all slots from this list and sets its size to zero.

action.name: addSlots
action.description:
Adds the specified slots to the slotList.
The slot is of type Slot MO, Fan MO, WebServer MO, Jvm MO, ActiveOtherLMs MO or an application MO (for example, RBS Fans). Multiple SwAllocations are allowed for Slot MO instance and Fan MO instance.
If a slot already exists in slotList, it is ignored.

action.name: addRepertoires
action.description:
Adds the specifed repertoires to this list.
If any repertoire exists in the list, this is ignored.

class.name: ActiveOtherLMs
class.description:
This MO is a collection of LoadModule MOs with the following properties: - attribute loaderType is set to OTHER - the load module is currently active.
The RDN of this MO is ActiveOtherLMs=1.

attribute.name: ActiveOtherLMsId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

attribute.name: otherLoaderNameContents
attribute.description: References to instances of the LoadModule MO, with loaderType set to OTHER and otherLoaderName set.

attribute.name: activeLMs
attribute.description: References to active instances of the LoadModule MO, with loaderType set to OTHER.

class.name: TuSyncRef
class.description:
Timing Unit Synchronization Reference
This MO administers a synchronization reference directly connected to the board, where the Timing Unit is located. For details on which signals are supported, see the description of the relevant board.
Dependencies: It is not possible to create a TuSyncRef MO, if gpsOutEnabled in the MO TimingUnit is set to true.

attribute.name: TuSyncRefId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: The administrative state.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO instance.

class.name: TimingUnit
class.description:
Timing Unit
This MO represents a Timing Unit (reference clock) in the node.
If this MO is created automatically, as a consequence of creating the SystemClockDistribution MO, it is deleted automatically when the SystemClockDistribution MO is deleted.
For details about the position of the Timing Units in the subrack, see the attribute boardPositions in the related MO SubrackProdType.

attribute.name: TimingUnitId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: tuSystemClock
attribute.description: State of the system clock signal.

attribute.name: gpsOutEnabled
attribute.description:
Set to true means GPS out is enabled.
For details on which boards support the setting of gpsOutEnabled = true, see the description of the relevant board.
attribute.dependencies: If it is set to true it is not possible to create a TuSyncRef MO or a GpsSyncRef MO. It is not possible to set it to true if a TuSyncRef MO or a GpsSyncRef MO exists.

attribute.name: hptsiOutEnabled
attribute.description:
Set to true means GPS port is reversed to output with HPTSI protocol.
For details on which boards support the setting of hptsiOutEnabled = true, see the description of the relevant board.
attribute.dependencies: If it is set to true it is not possible to set gpsOutEnabled = true, create a TuSyncRef MO or a GpsSyncRef MO. It is not possible to set it to true if gpsOutEnabled = true or a TuSyncRef MO or a GpsSyncRef MO exists.

class.name: Synchronization
class.description:
Synchronization
This MO administers synchronization references for network synchronization and displays the system clock state of the node.
This MO is created automatically and cannot be deleted.
The RDN of this MO is Synchronization=1.

attribute.name: SynchronizationId
attribute.description:
The value component of the RDN.
It is set automatically when the MO instance is created.

attribute.name: degradationIsFault
attribute.description: Determines whether a transmission link degradation (for example, high bit-error rate) is interpreted as a synchronization reference fault or not. This attribute is applicable only for traffic carrying synchronization references.

attribute.name: syncReference
attribute.description:
List of resources for synchronization references. Possible references are: E1PhysPathTerm, E3PhysPathTerm, J1PhysPathTerm, T1PhysPathTerm, T3PhysPathTerm, Os155SpiTtp, TuSyncRef, IpSyncRef, GpsSyncRef, PacketFrequencySyncRef, PacketTimeSyncRef and HptsiSyncRef. The IpSyncRef is not supported in TUB1 nodes.
A synchronization reference is added by using the action addSyncRefResource.
If one value in this attribute is NULL, the respective values in the attributes syncRefActivity, syncRefPriority and syncStatus are not relevant.
The length of this list is 8.

attribute.name: syncRefPriority
attribute.description:
Synchronization reference priority.
1 represents the highest and 8 the lowest priority. Every synchronization reference must have a unique priority value. Value 0 means not applicable, that is, no synchronization reference with this priority is defined.
This attribute is mandatory when adding a synchronization reference (using the action addSyncRefResource). A priority value can be changed with the action changeSyncRefPriority, provided that the priority is not already assigned to some other synchronization reference.
The length of this list is 8.

attribute.name: syncRefActivity
attribute.description:
List of attributes for synchronization references, where each attribute specifies whether the respective synchronization reference is active. Zero or one reference is active.
The length of this list is 8.

attribute.name: syncRefStatus
attribute.description:
List of status attributes for synchronization references.
The length of this list is 8.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: pmHDelayVarBest1Pct
attribute.description: This counter shows the Highest Delay Variation (see ITU-T Y.1540 for definition of the delay variation) of the best 1% synchronization frames (with the lowest delay) experienced by the active IP synchronization reference during the PM interval.
attribute.condition: This counter is calculated on the basis of the 1% lowest packet delays, accumulated during 100-second windows, for the active IP reference, at the end of each granularity period. No value is written if: - there are no registered (IP) references - there are no active IP references An unreliable value is written if: - it is the first value provided after switching a reference to an IP reference - the active IP reference is not reliable, that is, there are too few time stamps available to calculate this counter

attribute.name: pmHDelayVarBest10Pct
attribute.description: This counter shows the Highest Delay Variation (see ITU-T Y.1540 for definition of the delay variation) of the best 10% synchronization frames (with the lowest delay) experienced by the active IP synchronization reference during the PM interval.
attribute.condition:
This counter is calculated on the basis of the 10% lowest packet delays, accumulated during 100-second windows, for the active IP reference, at the end of each granularity period.
No value is written if: - there are no registered (IP) references - there are no active IP references An unreliable value is written if: - it is the first value provided after switching a reference to an IP reference - the active IP reference is not reliable, that is, there are too few time stamps available to calculate this counter

attribute.name: pmHDelayVarBest50Pct
attribute.description: This counter shows the Highest Delay Variation (see ITU-T Y.1540 for definition of the delay variation) of the best 50% synchronization frames (with the lowest delay) experienced by the active IP synchronization reference during the PM interval.
attribute.condition: This counter is calculated on the basis of the 50% lowest packet delays, accumulated during 100-second windows, for the active IP reference, at the end of each granularity period. No value is written if: - there are no registered (IP) references - there are no active IP references An unreliable value is written if: - it is the first value provided after switching a reference to an IP reference - the active IP reference is not reliable, that is, there are too few time stamps available to calculate this counter

attribute.name: nodeSystemClock
attribute.description: State of the system clock on the node.

attribute.name: currentPmRegister
attribute.description: Returns the current values of all PM counters.
attribute.obsolete: Has no functional behavior and is now redundant. Read operations can return undefined values.

attribute.name: pmMaxDelayVariation
attribute.description: This counter shows the Maximum Delay Variation (see ITU-T Y.1540 for definition of the delay variation) experienced by the active IP synchronization reference during the PM interval.
attribute.condition: This counter is calculated on the basis of maximum and minimum packet delays for the active IP reference at the end of each GP, as follows: Max Delay Variation = Max Packet Delay - Min Packet Delay No value is written if: - there are no registered (IP) references - there are no active IP references An unreliable value is written if: - it is the first value provided after switching a reference to an IP reference - the active IP reference is not reliable (that is, there are too few time stamps available to calculate this counter)

attribute.name: testMode
attribute.description: Specifies if the test mode is used.

attribute.name: fixedPosition
attribute.description:
Specifies if the node has a fixed position.
If set to true, the node is operating in survey mode, until it has acquired its position. After that, the node changes to position-hold mode.
If set to false, the node is prevented from entering the position-hold mode and the GPS performance enhancements functions that require fixed position, must be disabled.

attribute.name: ptpFreqFeatureState
attribute.description: Specifies the ptp frequency feature state.

attribute.name: ptpFreqLicenseState
attribute.description: Specifies the ptp frequency license state.

attribute.name: sfnInitializationTime
attribute.description:
Specifies the time when SFN is initialized to zero.
The time is TAI given as a string with the following format: <YYYY-MM-DD>T<hh:mm:ss>

attribute.name: ptpTimeFeatureState
attribute.description: Specifies the ptp time feature state.

attribute.name: ptpTimeLicenseState
attribute.description: Specifies the ptp time license state.

action.name: addSyncRefResource
action.description:
This action adds one synchronization reference. As a result of the action, one set of values to the attributes syncReference and syncRefPriority are added to the Synchronization MO.
Description of exceptions: - AlreadyRegistered: this reference is already registered - MaxNoOfRefRegistered: maximum number (8) of synchronization references already present - PriorityAlreadyInUse: syncPriority is identical to an existing synchronization reference priority - PriorityOutOfRange: invalid syncPriority value - InvalidMoReference: invalid syncReference for registration as a synchronization reference (invalid MO type) - NotPermitted: the MO referenced by syncReference is not permitted as a synchronization reference.

parameter.name: syncReference
parameter.description: The synchronization reference to be added. See description of attribute syncReference.

parameter.name: syncPriority
parameter.description: Priority of synchronization reference. Each synchronization reference must have a unique priority value.

action.name: removeSyncRefResource
action.description:
This action removes one synchronization reference that has previously been added.
Description of exceptions: - NotRegistered: synchronization reference is not registered

parameter.name: syncReference
parameter.description: The synchronization reference to be removed. See description of attribute SyncReference.

action.name: changeSyncRefPriority
action.description:
This action changes the synchronization priority of one previously registered synchronization reference.
Description of exceptions: - PriorityAlreadyInUse: syncPriority is identical with an existing synchronization reference priority - PriorityOutOfRange: invalid syncPriority value - NotRegistered: synchronization reference is not registered

parameter.name: syncReference
parameter.description: The synchronization reference, whose priority will be changed. See description of attribute syncReference.

parameter.name: syncPriority
parameter.description: The new priority for the synchronization reference. Each synchronization reference must have a unique priority value.

action.name: resetLossOfTracking
action.description:
This action resets the detected Loss of Tracking error condition on one synchronization reference. After resetting, the synchronization reference is usable again.
Description of exceptions: - NotRegistered: synchronization reference is not registered

parameter.name: syncReference
parameter.description: The synchronization reference, for which the Loss of Tracking status is to be reset. See description of attribute SyncReference.

class.name: GpsSyncRef
class.description:
Global Positioning System (GPS) synchronization reference
For details on which boards support GPS synchronization references, see the description of the relevant board.
Dependencies: It is not possible to create a GpsSyncRef MO, if gpsOutEnabled in the MO TimingUnit is set to true.

attribute.name: GpsSyncRefId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains an MO instance that reserves this MO instance.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description:
The administrative state.
If this attribute is set to SHUTTING_DOWN, it will immediately go into the state LOCKED.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: satelliteInformation
attribute.description: Information about the satellites in view.

attribute.name: latitude
attribute.description: The latitude of the node.

attribute.name: longitude
attribute.description: The longitude of the node.

attribute.name: altitude
attribute.description:
The altitude of the node.
Unit: 1 m

attribute.name: hdop
attribute.description: The horizontal dilution of precision.

attribute.name: vdop
attribute.description: The vertical dilution of precision.

attribute.name: observationPoint
attribute.description: The observation point of the GPS receiver.

attribute.name: gpsRefState
attribute.description: Indicates the status of the GPS receiver/data.

attribute.name: noOfSatellitesInView
attribute.description: The number of satellites in view.

attribute.name: gpsCompensationDelay
attribute.description: The delay of the GPS.

class.name: SystemClockDistribution
class.description:
System Clock Distribution
This MO is used by NSS to propagate the system clock distribution path alarms issued from the specific SCXB boards.

attribute.name: SystemClockDistributionId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains an MO instance that reserves this MO instance.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

class.name: PacketTimeSyncRef
class.description:
Packet Time Synchronization Reference
Administers Time/Phase synchronization.
Only support multicast and E2E.

attribute.name: transportLayerRef
attribute.description: Reference to an instance of GigaBitEthernet MO.

attribute.name: asymmetryCompensation
attribute.description: Set in steps of 1 ns. The +/- sign is relative to the downlink.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: The administrative state.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: PacketTimeSyncRefId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: ptpDomain
attribute.description:
Specifies the PTP domain.
Has to be a unique number among the configured packetTimeSyncRef and packetFrequencySyncRef objects.

attribute.name: ptpGrandMasterIdentity
attribute.description: The grand master port that sends synchronization messages.

attribute.name: ptpQualityLevel
attribute.description: The master clock quality level.

attribute.name: ptpOwnPortIdentity
attribute.description: The own port identity.

attribute.name: ptpParentPortIdentity
attribute.description: The parent port that sends synchronization messages.

attribute.name: pBit
attribute.description: The pBit value used for transmitted frames, if value 0 is used then an untagged frame is used. If any other value than 0 is used the a priority tagged frame is used (VlanID=0).

attribute.name: reservedBy
attribute.description: Contains a list of MO instances that reserve this MO.

attribute.name: packetSyncStatus
attribute.description:
Packet synchronization status.
The value is a bitmap, displayed as a decimal value. If there are several faults, the value is the sum of the individual values for each fault, as specified below:
0 NO_FAULT: The reference can be selected as a synchronization reference.
1 NO_ANNOUNCE: No Announce messages have been received from the PTP server within the past 8 seconds.
2 CLOCK_CLASS: The clockClass of the grandMaster clock, reported by the PTP server in Announce messages, is not less than or equal to 7 (PacketTimeSyncRef) or 14 (PacketFrequencySyncRef).
4 CLOCK_ACCURACY: The clockAccuracy of the grandMaster clock, reported by the PTP server in Announce messages, is not less than or equal to hexadecimal 22 (that is, 34 in decimal).
8 NO_SYNC: No Sync messages have been received from the PTP server within the past 8 seconds.
16 ERRATIC_SYNC: Sync messages are arriving irregularly but are not totally missing. This could indicate packet loss in the network.
32 LOW_SYNC_RATE: The PTP server states that the intended interval between Sync messages is too long to meet the needs of the ordinary clock slave.
64 NO_DELAY_RESP: There has been no Delay_Resp from the PTP server for the last 8 Delay_Req messages sent to it. For the first Delay_Req, this indication is set after only 2 missed responses (with initial request interval 8 seconds).
128 LOW_DELAY_REQ_RATE: The PTP server in its Delay_Resp messages states a minimum allowed interval between Delay_Req messages that is too long to meet the needs of ordinary clock slave.
256 UC_NEG_NO_REPLY: There has been no reply to some (or all) of the messages sent to the PTP server requesting unicast transmission of message types: Sync, Announce and Delay_Resp.
512 UC_NEG_NO_AGREE: In unicast negotiation with the PTP server, the server will either not comply with the message intervals requested for unicast transmission of message types: Sync, Announce and Delay_Resp, or it will not provide a duration of at least 60 seconds for these requests.
1024 UC_NEG_MC_NOK: In the phase of unicast negotiations, the clockClass is not less than or equal to 7 (PacketTimeSyncRef) or 14 (PacketFrequencySyncRef) and/or clockAccuracy is not less than or equal to hexadecimal 22 of the grandMaster clock reported in the first Announce message.
2048 UC_NEG_CANCELED: The PTP server has canceled previously granted unicast transmission of one or more of the message types: Sync, Announce and Delay_resp.
Example: 17 means ERRATIC_SYNC + NO_ANNOUNCE (16+1)

class.name: PacketFrequencySyncRef
class.description:
Packet Frequency Synchronization Reference
Administers frequency synchronization for PTP.

attribute.name: ipAccessHostEtRef
attribute.description: Reference to an instance of a IpAccessHostEt MO.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: The administrative state.

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description: The operational state.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus

The availability status.
It contains details about operationalState.

attribute.name: cachedIpAddress
attribute.description: Indicates the latest IP address received from the DNS server with the specified domain name. If domain name is not valid or no value yet received from the DNS server this will be a null string.

attribute.name: PacketFrequencySyncRefId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: serverAddress
attribute.description:
Specifies the domain or IP address of the server can be either IPv4 or IPv6.
The input format for an IPv4 address is four fields of digits, separated by a dot. Each field consists of one to three digits.
The input format for an IPv6 address is as defined in specification RFC4291, chapter 2.2, bullet 1 and 2.
A valid domain name: - has characters of type letters, numbers and a hyphen "-", where hyphens can be anywhere in the middle of a name, but cannot be located at the end or beginning of a name - cannot have spaces - is case insensitive - can include dots for the use of sub domains.
If this MO refers to an IpAccessHostEt MO, the IP address in this attribute must be of same format as the referenced IpAccessHostEt MO.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: Label for free use.

attribute.name: packetSyncStatus
attribute.description:
Packet synchronization status.
The value is a bitmap, displayed as a decimal value. If there are several faults, the value is the sum of the individual values for each fault, as specified below:
0 NO_FAULT: The reference can be selected as a synchronization reference.
1 NO_ANNOUNCE: No Announce messages have been received from the PTP server within the past 8 seconds.
2 CLOCK_CLASS: The clockClass of the grandMaster clock, reported by the PTP server in Announce messages, is not less than or equal to 7 (PacketTimeSyncRef) or 14 (PacketFrequencySyncRef).
4 CLOCK_ACCURACY: The clockAccuracy of the grandMaster clock, reported by the PTP server in Announce messages, is not less than or equal to hexadecimal 22 (that is, 34 in decimal).
8 NO_SYNC: No Sync messages have been received from the PTP server within the past 8 seconds.
16 ERRATIC_SYNC: Sync messages are arriving irregularly but are not totally missing. This could indicate packet loss in the network.
32 LOW_SYNC_RATE: The PTP server states that the intended interval between Sync messages is too long to meet the needs of the ordinary clock slave.
64 NO_DELAY_RESP: There has been no Delay_Resp from the PTP server for the last 8 Delay_Req messages sent to it. For the first Delay_Req, this indication is set after only 2 missed responses (with initial request interval 8 seconds).
128 LOW_DELAY_REQ_RATE: The PTP server in its Delay_Resp messages states a minimum allowed interval between Delay_Req messages that is too long to meet the needs of ordinary clock slave.
256 UC_NEG_NO_REPLY: There has been no reply to some (or all) of the messages sent to the PTP server requesting unicast transmission of message types: Sync, Announce and Delay_Resp.
512 UC_NEG_NO_AGREE: In unicast negotiation with the PTP server, the server will either not comply with the message intervals requested for unicast transmission of message types: Sync, Announce and Delay_Resp, or it will not provide a duration of at least 60 seconds for these requests.
1024 UC_NEG_MC_NOK: In the phase of unicast negotiations, the clockClass is not less than or equal to 7 (PacketTimeSyncRef) or 14 (PacketFrequencySyncRef) and/or clockAccuracy is not less than or equal to hexadecimal 22 of the grandMaster clock reported in the first Announce message.
2048 UC_NEG_CANCELED: The PTP server has canceled previously granted unicast transmission of one or more of the message types: Sync, Announce and Delay_resp.
Example: 17 means ERRATIC_SYNC + NO_ANNOUNCE (16+1)

attribute.description:
The HTPSI monitor alarm.
The value is a bitmap, displayed as a decimal value. If there are several faults, the value is the sum of the individual values for each fault, according to the list below.
0 Not used 1 Antenna open 2 Antenna shorted 4 Not tracking satellites 8 Not used 16 Survey-in progress 32 No stored position 64 Leap second pending 128 In test mode 256 Position is questionable 512 Not used 1024 Almanac not complete 2048 Not used
Example: 17 means Survey-in progress + Antenna open (16+1)

class.name: NodeBLocalCell
class.description:
This MO models a cell, that is, a geographical area that can be identified by a UE from a (cell) identification broadcast from one UTRAN Access Point.
Precondition: When deleting this MO the cell must not be setup by the RNC (availabilityStatus must be OFF_LINE). Persistent: Yes Ref. [Local Cell Configuration]

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status of the cell.
Possible values: • NOT_INSTALLED • POWER_OFF • IN_TEST • DEPENDENCY_LOCKED • DEPENDENCY_FAILED • FAILED • OFF_LINE • DEGRADED • OFF_DUTY • LOG_FULL • NO STATUS = Full availability.
Ref. [Fault and Recovery Handling], [Local Cell Configuration]

attribute.name: cellRange
attribute.description:
Defines the maximum range (in meters) for random access detection (random access distance). For soft handover the RBS adds a soft handover margin internally.
Note that the actual cell range resolution is 3 chips, that is, around 234 m.
Requirement: CELL_RBS_OM:2, CELL_RBS_FU:11, CELL_RBS_FU:9, EXRNG_FU_RBS_5302:07619
Ref. [Common Channel Handling]
attribute.dependencies: If a license key for the features 'Extended Range up to 80 km' or 'Extended Range up to 200 km' exists, this range must not be exceeded, otherwise the default value must not be exceeded.
attribute.precondition: Cell not setup by the RNC (availabilityStatus=OFF_LINE).

attribute.name: localCellId
attribute.description:
The identity of the RBS local cell.
Requirement: CELL_RBS_OM:2, CELL_RBS_FU:11
Ref. [Local Cell Configuration]
attribute.dependencies: Value must be the same as in the corresponding RNC MO UtranCell.
attribute.specification: 3GPP TS 25.433, NBAP, UTRAN Iub interface NBAP signalling
attribute.precondition: Cell not setup by the RNC (availabilityStatus=OFF_LINE).

attribute.name: maxDlPowerCapability
attribute.description:
The maximum downlink power capability for the cell. The attribute is calculated and reported to the RNC.
Requirement: BCM_FU_RBS_6011:00854 Rev:A
Ref. [Local Cell Configuration]
attribute.specification: 3GPP TS 25.433, NBAP, UTRAN Iub interface NBAP signalling

attribute.description:
The minimum downlink power capability for the cell. The attribute is calculated and reported to the RNC.
Requirement: BCM_FU_RBS_6011:00855 Rev:A
Ref. [Local Cell Configuration]
attribute.specification: 3GPP TS 25.433, NBAP, UTRAN Iub interface NBAP signalling

attribute.name: minSpreadingFactor
attribute.description:
Indicates the minimum spreading factor supported by the cell.
Specification: 3GPP TS 25.433, NBAP, UTRAN Iub interface NBAP signalling
Ref. [Local Cell Configuration]

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description:
Defines the operational state.
Possible values: • DISABLED • ENABLED
Requirement: CELL_RBS_FU:9
Ref. [Fault and Recovery Handling], [Local Cell Configuration]

attribute.name: NodeBLocalCellId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: coherenceMode
attribute.description:
Specifies how large part of the preamble that is accumulated coherently.
When coherenceMode is 4, the parameter Rach::preambleThreshold (RNC MOM) is recommended to be reduced 3 steps (1.5 dB) from 35 to 32.
Possible values: • 2 = Accumulate ¼ of the preamble coherently and the rest non-coherently. • 4 = Accumulate the whole preamble coherently.
Requirement: EXRNG_FU_RBS_5302:07741 User category: Ericsson personnel
Ref. [Common Channel Handling]
attribute.precondition: Cell not setup by the RNC (availabilityStatus=OFF_LINE).

attribute.name: operatingBand
attribute.description: Operating frequency band according to 3GPP.

attribute.name: numOfRxAntennas
attribute.description: The number of antennas that can be used for uplink beamforming/MIMO.

attribute.name: numOfTxAntennas
attribute.description: The number of antennas that can be used for downlink beamforming/MIMO.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description:
The administrative state. Possible values: - LOCKED - UNLOCKED
Ref. [Local Cell Configuration]

attribute.name: usageState
attribute.description:
Indicates the usage state of the NodeBLocalCell.
Possible values: - IDLE - BUSY
The NodeBLocalCell becomes BUSY when the cell has been setup by the RNC.
Ref. [RNC Ordered Cell Configuration]

attribute.name: uarfcnDl
attribute.description: Downlink UTRA Absolute Radio Frequency Channel Number. Specifies the channel number for the central downlink frequency. The mapping from channel number to physical frequency is described in 3GPP specification TS 25.104.
attribute.dependencies: An intra-frequency relation has the same channel number in the uplink for both cells, and the same number in the downlink for both cells. Otherwise it is considered an inter-frequency relation. The channel number may not be changed in such a way that the maximum number of intra-frequency relations (31) or inter-frequency relations (32) under this cell is violated. The same restriction applies for all UtranCells having this cell as the target cell in a relation. If more than one channel number needs to be changed in order to fulfill the restrictions, all changes need to be made in the same transaction. The channel number may also not be changed in such a way that any of the UtranRelations marked as load sharing candidates becomes an intra-frequency relation.
attribute.disturbances: Changing this attribute may affect ongoing traffic.

attribute.name: uarfcnUl
attribute.description: Uplink UTRA Absolute Radio Frequency Channel Number. Specifies the channel number for the central uplink frequency. The mapping from channel number to physical frequency is described in 3GPP specification TS 25.104.
attribute.dependencies: An intra-frequency relation has the same channel number in the uplink for both cells, and the same number in the downlink for both cells. Otherwise it is considered an inter-frequency relation. The channel number may not be changed in such a way that the maximum number of intra-frequency relations (31) or inter-frequency relations (32) under this cell is violated. The same restriction applies for all cells having this cell as the target cell in a relation. If more than one channel number needs to be changed in order to fulfill the restrictions, all changes need to be made in the same transaction. The channel number may also not be changed in such a way that any of the UtranRelations marked as load sharing candidates becomes an intra-frequency relation.
attribute.disturbances: Changing this attribute may affect ongoing traffic.

attribute.name: bandwidthDl
attribute.description:
Denotes the carrier bandwidth in downlink.
Example: 50 = 5.0 MHz
Ref. [Local Cell Configuration]
attribute.dependencies: Can only be set to another value than default in case a valid license key for the feature is installed, that is if NodeBFunction::licenseStateConfigurableCarrierBandwidth = ENABLED. If the value is other than default when the license state changes from ENABLED to DISABLED, a corresponding Carrier_ConfigurableCarrierBandwidthLicenseNotValid alarm is generated.
attribute.precondition: Cell must not be setup by the RNC. If corresponding sector is initialized the TR devices used by the carrier must be capable of setting DL bandwidth.

attribute.name: bandwidthUl
attribute.description:
Denotes the carrier bandwidth in uplink.
Example: 50 = 5.0 MHz
Ref. [Local Cell Configuration]
attribute.dependencies: Can only be set to another value than default in case a valid license key for the feature is installed, that is if NodeBFunction::licenseStateConfigurableCarrierBandwidth = ENABLED. If the value is other than default when the license state changes from ENABLED to DISABLED, a corresponding Carrier_ConfigurableCarrierBandwidthLicenseNotValid alarm is generated.
attribute.precondition: Cell must not be setup by the RNC. If corresponding sector is initialized the TR devices used by the carrier must be capable of setting DL bandwidth.

attribute.name: partOfSectorPower
attribute.description: The requested part of the total power in the Sector that should be allocated for the cell. The output power is evenly distributed over the antenna connectors used for TX transmission that are allocated for the cell. If the total amount of power per antenna connector is over 100% when the cell is unlocked, an alarm will be generated.

attribute.name: sectorEquipmentFunctionRef
attribute.description: Reference to an instance of SectorEquipmentFunction MO.

class.name: NodeBLocalCellGroup
class.description: This MO models a group of NodeBLocalCells that share common baseband equipment cluster. Within the NodeBLocalCellGroup you can do softer handover. TBD.

attribute.name: administrativeState
attribute.description: The administrative state. Valid values: - UNLOCKED - LOCKED

class.name: CellResources
class.description:
This MO models all basic physical and transport channels related to the cell. Basic physical channels: PCPICH, SCPICH, PSCH, SSCH and PCCPCH. Transport channels: BCH.
The RDN of this MO is CellResources=1.
Persistent: No Ref. [RNC Ordered Cell Configuration]

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status of the cell resources.
Possible values: ??? • NOT_INSTALLED • POWER_OFF • IN_TEST • DEPENDENCY_LOCKED • DEPENDENCY_FAILED • FAILED • OFF_LINE • DEGRADED • OFF_DUTY • LOG_FULL • NO STATUS = Full availability.
Ref. [Fault and Recovery Handling], [RNC Ordered Cell Configuration]

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description:
Defines the operational state.
Possible values: • DISABLED • ENABLED
Ref. [Fault and Recovery Handling], [RNC Ordered Cell Configuration]

attribute.name: CellResourcesId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: numOfBch
attribute.description:
The number of BCH, Broadcast CHannel in the cell. The BCH is a fixed rate point to multi point downlink channel, used to convey system information in the whole coverage area of the cell.
Persistent: No Ref. [RNC Ordered Cell Configuration]

attribute.name: numOfPccpch
attribute.description:
The number of PCCPCH, Primary Common Control Physical CHannel in the cell. This downlink physical channel carries the transport channel BCH.
Persistent: No Ref. [RNC Ordered Cell Configuration]

attribute.name: numOfPcpich
attribute.description:
The number of PCPICH, Primary Common Pilot CHannel in the cell. This is a fixed rate downlink physical channel that carries a predefined symbol sequence. PCPICH is used as phase reference for other downlink physical channels. No transport channel is carried on PCPICH.
Persistent: No Ref. [RNC Ordered Cell Configuration]

attribute.name: numOfPsch
attribute.description:
The number of physical channel PSCH, Primary Synchronization CHannel in the cell. This is a downlink physical channel used to find the scrambling code of the cell. The PSCH transmits the Primary Synchronization Code, which is the same for every cell in the system and known by each UE. It is sent simultaneously with the transmission on the SSCH. No transport channel is carried on PSCH.
Persistent: No Ref. [RNC Ordered Cell Configuration]

attribute.name: numOfScpich
attribute.description:
The number of SCPICH, Secondary Common Pilot CHannel in the cell. This is a fixed rate downlink physical channel that carries a predefined symbol sequence. SCPICH is used as phase reference for other downlink physical channels on a second antenna branch in certain MIMO configurations. No transport channel is carried on SCPICH.
Persistent: No Ref. [RNC Ordered Cell Configuration]

attribute.name: numOfSsch
attribute.description:
The number of physical channel SSCH, Secondary Synchronization CHannel in the cell. This is a downlink physical channel used to find the scrambling code of the cell. SSCH transmits a sequence of 15 codes, simultaneously with transmission on the PSCH. By identifying the sequence the UE can derive the primary scrambling code of the cell. No transport channel is carried on SSCH.
Persistent: No Ref. [RNC Ordered Cell Configuration]

class.name: CommonChannelResources
class.description:
This MO models all physical and transport channels related to the common channels. Physical channels: SCCPCH, PRACH, PICH and AICH. Transport channel: FACH, PCH and RACH.
The RDN of this MO is CommonChannelResources=1.
Persistent: No Ref. [Common Channel Handling]

attribute.name: operationalState
attribute.description:
Defines the operational state.
Possible values: • DISABLED • ENABLED
Ref. [Fault and Recovery Handling], [Common Channel Handling]

attribute.name: numOfAich
attribute.description:
The number of setup AICH, Acquisition Indication CHannel, channels in the cell. AICH is a fixed rate downlink physical channel that carries the acquisition indications for reception of preambles on RACH. No transport channel is carried on AICH.
Persistent: No Ref. [Common Channel Handling]

attribute.name: numOfFach
attribute.description:
The number of setup FACH, Forward Access link CHannel, channels in the cell. FACH is a downlink common transport channel is used by the network to send messages to a specific UE when no dedicated channels have been established.
Persistent: No Ref. [Common Channel Handling]

attribute.name: numOfPch
attribute.description:
The number of setup PCH, Paging CHannel, channels in the cell. PCH is a downlink common control channel used by the network to broadcast paging messages to find a UE when no dedicated channels have been established.
Persistent: No Ref. [Common Channel Handling]

attribute.name: numOfPich
attribute.description:
The number of setup PICH, Paging Indication CHannel, channels in the cell. PICH is a downlink physical channel used to notify UEs that they must listen for paging messages on the PCH. No transport channel is carried on PICH.
Persistent: No Ref. [Common Channel Handling]

attribute.name: numOfPrach
attribute.description:
The number of setup PRACH, Physical Random Access CHannel, channels in the cell. PRACH is an uplink physical channel used to carry RACH.
Persistent: No Ref. [Common Channel Handling]

attribute.name: numOfRach
attribute.description:
The number of RACH, Random Access CHannel, channels in the cell. RACH is an uplink common control channel used by any UE to send messages to the network when no dedicated channels have been established.
Persistent: No Ref. [Common Channel Handling]

attribute.name: numOfSccpch
attribute.description:
The number of setup SCCPCH, Secondary Common Control Physical CHannel, channels in the cell. SCCPCH is a downlink physical channel that carries the transport channels FACH or PCH.
Persistent: No Ref. [Common Channel Handling]

attribute.name: CommonChannelResourcesId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: availabilityStatus
attribute.description:
The availability status of the cell resources.
Possible values: ??? • NOT_INSTALLED • POWER_OFF • IN_TEST • DEPENDENCY_LOCKED • DEPENDENCY_FAILED • FAILED • OFF_LINE • DEGRADED • OFF_DUTY • LOG_FULL • NO STATUS = Full availability.
Ref. [Fault and Recovery Handling], [Common Channel Handling]
